ICT398 - FrankEngine  0.1
Custom Game Engine
imgui_widgets.cpp
Go to the documentation of this file.

55 // Visual Studio warnings
56 #ifdef _MSC_VER
57 #pragma warning (disable: 4127) // condition expression is constant
58 #pragma warning (disable: 4996) // 'This function or variable may be unsafe': strcpy, strdup, sprintf, vsnprintf, sscanf, fopen
59 #if defined(_MSC_VER) && _MSC_VER >= 1922 // MSVC 2019 16.2 or later
60 #pragma warning (disable: 5054) // operator '|': deprecated between enumerations of different types
61 #endif
62 #pragma warning (disable: 26451) // [Static Analyzer] Arithmetic overflow : Using operator 'xxx' on a 4 byte value and then casting the result to a 8 byte value. Cast the value to the wider type before calling operator 'xxx' to avoid overflow(io.2).
63 #pragma warning (disable: 26812) // [Static Analyzer] The enum type 'xxx' is unscoped. Prefer 'enum class' over 'enum' (Enum.3).
64 #endif
65 
66 // Clang/GCC warnings with -Weverything
67 #if defined(__clang__)
68 #if __has_warning("-Wunknown-warning-option")
69 #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wunknown-warning-option" // warning: unknown warning group 'xxx' // not all warnings are known by all Clang versions and they tend to be rename-happy.. so ignoring warnings triggers new warnings on some configuration. Great!
70 #endif
71 #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wunknown-pragmas" // warning: unknown warning group 'xxx'
72 #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wold-style-cast" // warning: use of old-style cast // yes, they are more terse.
73 #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wfloat-equal" // warning: comparing floating point with == or != is unsafe // storing and comparing against same constants (typically 0.0f) is ok.
74 #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wformat-nonliteral" // warning: format string is not a string literal // passing non-literal to vsnformat(). yes, user passing incorrect format strings can crash the code.
75 #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wsign-conversion" // warning: implicit conversion changes signedness
76 #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wzero-as-null-pointer-constant" // warning: zero as null pointer constant // some standard header variations use #define NULL 0
77 #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wdouble-promotion" // warning: implicit conversion from 'float' to 'double' when passing argument to function // using printf() is a misery with this as C++ va_arg ellipsis changes float to double.
78 #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wenum-enum-conversion" // warning: bitwise operation between different enumeration types ('XXXFlags_' and 'XXXFlagsPrivate_')
79 #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wdeprecated-enum-enum-conversion"// warning: bitwise operation between different enumeration types ('XXXFlags_' and 'XXXFlagsPrivate_') is deprecated
80 #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wimplicit-int-float-conversion" // warning: implicit conversion from 'xxx' to 'float' may lose precision
81 #elif defined(__GNUC__)
82 #pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wpragmas" // warning: unknown option after '#pragma GCC diagnostic' kind
83 #pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wformat-nonliteral" // warning: format not a string literal, format string not checked
84 #pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wclass-memaccess" // [__GNUC__ >= 8] warning: 'memset/memcpy' clearing/writing an object of type 'xxxx' with no trivial copy-assignment; use assignment or value-initialization instead
85 #endif

91 // Widgets
92 static const float DRAGDROP_HOLD_TO_OPEN_TIMER = 0.70f; // Time for drag-hold to activate items accepting the ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnDragDropHold button behavior.
93 static const float DRAG_MOUSE_THRESHOLD_FACTOR = 0.50f; // Multiplier for the default value of io.MouseDragThreshold to make DragFloat/DragInt react faster to mouse drags.
94 
95 // Those MIN/MAX values are not define because we need to point to them
96 static const signed char IM_S8_MIN = -128;
97 static const signed char IM_S8_MAX = 127;
98 static const unsigned char IM_U8_MIN = 0;
99 static const unsigned char IM_U8_MAX = 0xFF;
100 static const signed short IM_S16_MIN = -32768;
101 static const signed short IM_S16_MAX = 32767;
102 static const unsigned short IM_U16_MIN = 0;
103 static const unsigned short IM_U16_MAX = 0xFFFF;
104 static const ImS32 IM_S32_MIN = INT_MIN; // (-2147483647 - 1), (0x80000000);
105 static const ImS32 IM_S32_MAX = INT_MAX; // (2147483647), (0x7FFFFFFF)
106 static const ImU32 IM_U32_MIN = 0;
107 static const ImU32 IM_U32_MAX = UINT_MAX; // (0xFFFFFFFF)
108 #ifdef LLONG_MIN
109 static const ImS64 IM_S64_MIN = LLONG_MIN; // (-9223372036854775807ll - 1ll);
110 static const ImS64 IM_S64_MAX = LLONG_MAX; // (9223372036854775807ll);
111 #else
112 static const ImS64 IM_S64_MIN = -9223372036854775807LL - 1;
113 static const ImS64 IM_S64_MAX = 9223372036854775807LL;
114 #endif
115 static const ImU64 IM_U64_MIN = 0;
116 #ifdef ULLONG_MAX
117 static const ImU64 IM_U64_MAX = ULLONG_MAX; // (0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFull);
118 #else
119 static const ImU64 IM_U64_MAX = (2ULL * 9223372036854775807LL + 1);
120 #endif

126 // For InputTextEx()
127 static bool InputTextFilterCharacter(unsigned int *p_char, ImGuiInputTextFlags flags, ImGuiInputTextCallback callback, void *user_data, ImGuiInputSource input_source);
128 static int InputTextCalcTextLenAndLineCount(const char *text_begin, const char **out_text_end);
129 static ImVec2 InputTextCalcTextSizeW(const ImWchar *text_begin, const ImWchar *text_end, const ImWchar **remaining = NULL, ImVec2 *out_offset = NULL, bool stop_on_new_line = false);

131 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
132 // [SECTION] Widgets: Text, etc.
133 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
134 // - TextEx() [Internal]
135 // - TextUnformatted()
136 // - Text()
137 // - TextV()
138 // - TextColored()
139 // - TextColoredV()
140 // - TextDisabled()
141 // - TextDisabledV()
142 // - TextWrapped()
143 // - TextWrappedV()
144 // - LabelText()
145 // - LabelTextV()
146 // - BulletText()
147 // - BulletTextV()
148 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
149 
150 void ImGui::TextEx(const char *text, const char *text_end, ImGuiTextFlags flags)
151 {
152  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
153  if (window->SkipItems)
154  return;
155 
156  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
157  IM_ASSERT(text != NULL);
158  const char *text_begin = text;
159  if (text_end == NULL)
160  text_end = text + strlen(text); // FIXME-OPT
161 
162  const ImVec2 text_pos(window->DC.CursorPos.x, window->DC.CursorPos.y + window->DC.CurrLineTextBaseOffset);
163  const float wrap_pos_x = window->DC.TextWrapPos;
164  const bool wrap_enabled = (wrap_pos_x >= 0.0f);
165  if (text_end - text > 2000 && !wrap_enabled)
166  {
167  // Long text!
168  // Perform manual coarse clipping to optimize for long multi-line text
169  // - From this point we will only compute the width of lines that are visible. Optimization only available when word-wrapping is disabled.
170  // - We also don't vertically center the text within the line full height, which is unlikely to matter because we are likely the biggest and only item on the line.
171  // - We use memchr(), pay attention that well optimized versions of those str/mem functions are much faster than a casually written loop.
172  const char *line = text;
173  const float line_height = GetTextLineHeight();
174  ImVec2 text_size(0, 0);
175 
176  // Lines to skip (can't skip when logging text)
177  ImVec2 pos = text_pos;
178  if (!g.LogEnabled)
179  {
180  int lines_skippable = (int)((window->ClipRect.Min.y - text_pos.y) / line_height);
181  if (lines_skippable > 0)
182  {
183  int lines_skipped = 0;
184  while (line < text_end && lines_skipped < lines_skippable)
185  {
186  const char *line_end = (const char *)memchr(line, '\n', text_end - line);
187  if (!line_end)
188  line_end = text_end;
189  if ((flags & ImGuiTextFlags_NoWidthForLargeClippedText) == 0)
190  text_size.x = ImMax(text_size.x, CalcTextSize(line, line_end).x);
191  line = line_end + 1;
192  lines_skipped++;
193  }
194  pos.y += lines_skipped * line_height;
195  }
196  }
197 
198  // Lines to render
199  if (line < text_end)
200  {
201  ImRect line_rect(pos, pos + ImVec2(FLT_MAX, line_height));
202  while (line < text_end)
203  {
204  if (IsClippedEx(line_rect, 0, false))
205  break;
206 
207  const char *line_end = (const char *)memchr(line, '\n', text_end - line);
208  if (!line_end)
209  line_end = text_end;
210  text_size.x = ImMax(text_size.x, CalcTextSize(line, line_end).x);
211  RenderText(pos, line, line_end, false);
212  line = line_end + 1;
213  line_rect.Min.y += line_height;
214  line_rect.Max.y += line_height;
215  pos.y += line_height;
216  }
217 
218  // Count remaining lines
219  int lines_skipped = 0;
220  while (line < text_end)
221  {
222  const char *line_end = (const char *)memchr(line, '\n', text_end - line);
223  if (!line_end)
224  line_end = text_end;
225  if ((flags & ImGuiTextFlags_NoWidthForLargeClippedText) == 0)
226  text_size.x = ImMax(text_size.x, CalcTextSize(line, line_end).x);
227  line = line_end + 1;
228  lines_skipped++;
229  }
230  pos.y += lines_skipped * line_height;
231  }
232  text_size.y = (pos - text_pos).y;
233 
234  ImRect bb(text_pos, text_pos + text_size);
235  ItemSize(text_size, 0.0f);
236  ItemAdd(bb, 0);
237  }
238  else
239  {
240  const float wrap_width = wrap_enabled ? CalcWrapWidthForPos(window->DC.CursorPos, wrap_pos_x) : 0.0f;
241  const ImVec2 text_size = CalcTextSize(text_begin, text_end, false, wrap_width);
242 
243  ImRect bb(text_pos, text_pos + text_size);
244  ItemSize(text_size, 0.0f);
245  if (!ItemAdd(bb, 0))
246  return;
247 
248  // Render (we don't hide text after ## in this end-user function)
249  RenderTextWrapped(bb.Min, text_begin, text_end, wrap_width);
250  }
251 }
252 
253 void ImGui::TextUnformatted(const char *text, const char *text_end)
254 {
255  TextEx(text, text_end, ImGuiTextFlags_NoWidthForLargeClippedText);
256 }
257 
258 void ImGui::Text(const char *fmt, ...)
259 {
260  va_list args;
261  va_start(args, fmt);
262  TextV(fmt, args);
263  va_end(args);
264 }
265 
266 void ImGui::TextV(const char *fmt, va_list args)
267 {
268  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
269  if (window->SkipItems)
270  return;
271 
272  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
273  const char *text_end = g.TempBuffer + ImFormatStringV(g.TempBuffer, IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.TempBuffer), fmt, args);
274  TextEx(g.TempBuffer, text_end, ImGuiTextFlags_NoWidthForLargeClippedText);
275 }
276 
277 void ImGui::TextColored(const ImVec4 &col, const char *fmt, ...)
278 {
279  va_list args;
280  va_start(args, fmt);
281  TextColoredV(col, fmt, args);
282  va_end(args);
283 }
284 
285 void ImGui::TextColoredV(const ImVec4 &col, const char *fmt, va_list args)
286 {
287  PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_Text, col);
288  if (fmt[0] == '%' && fmt[1] == 's' && fmt[2] == 0)
289  TextEx(va_arg(args, const char *), NULL, ImGuiTextFlags_NoWidthForLargeClippedText); // Skip formatting
290  else
291  TextV(fmt, args);
292  PopStyleColor();
293 }
294 
295 void ImGui::TextDisabled(const char *fmt, ...)
296 {
297  va_list args;
298  va_start(args, fmt);
299  TextDisabledV(fmt, args);
300  va_end(args);
301 }
302 
303 void ImGui::TextDisabledV(const char *fmt, va_list args)
304 {
305  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
306  PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_Text, g.Style.Colors[ImGuiCol_TextDisabled]);
307  if (fmt[0] == '%' && fmt[1] == 's' && fmt[2] == 0)
308  TextEx(va_arg(args, const char *), NULL, ImGuiTextFlags_NoWidthForLargeClippedText); // Skip formatting
309  else
310  TextV(fmt, args);
311  PopStyleColor();
312 }
313 
314 void ImGui::TextWrapped(const char *fmt, ...)
315 {
316  va_list args;
317  va_start(args, fmt);
318  TextWrappedV(fmt, args);
319  va_end(args);
320 }
321 
322 void ImGui::TextWrappedV(const char *fmt, va_list args)
323 {
324  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
325  bool need_backup = (g.CurrentWindow->DC.TextWrapPos < 0.0f); // Keep existing wrap position if one is already set
326  if (need_backup)
327  PushTextWrapPos(0.0f);
328  if (fmt[0] == '%' && fmt[1] == 's' && fmt[2] == 0)
329  TextEx(va_arg(args, const char *), NULL, ImGuiTextFlags_NoWidthForLargeClippedText); // Skip formatting
330  else
331  TextV(fmt, args);
332  if (need_backup)
333  PopTextWrapPos();
334 }
335 
336 void ImGui::LabelText(const char *label, const char *fmt, ...)
337 {
338  va_list args;
339  va_start(args, fmt);
340  LabelTextV(label, fmt, args);
341  va_end(args);
342 }
343 
344 // Add a label+text combo aligned to other label+value widgets
345 void ImGui::LabelTextV(const char *label, const char *fmt, va_list args)
346 {
347  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
348  if (window->SkipItems)
349  return;
350 
351  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
352  const ImGuiStyle &style = g.Style;
353  const float w = CalcItemWidth();
354 
355  const char *value_text_begin = &g.TempBuffer[0];
356  const char *value_text_end = value_text_begin + ImFormatStringV(g.TempBuffer, IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.TempBuffer), fmt, args);
357  const ImVec2 value_size = CalcTextSize(value_text_begin, value_text_end, false);
358  const ImVec2 label_size = CalcTextSize(label, NULL, true);
359 
360  const ImVec2 pos = window->DC.CursorPos;
361  const ImRect value_bb(pos, pos + ImVec2(w, value_size.y + style.FramePadding.y * 2));
362  const ImRect total_bb(pos, pos + ImVec2(w + (label_size.x > 0.0f ? style.ItemInnerSpacing.x + label_size.x : 0.0f), ImMax(value_size.y, label_size.y) + style.FramePadding.y * 2));
363  ItemSize(total_bb, style.FramePadding.y);
364  if (!ItemAdd(total_bb, 0))
365  return;
366 
367  // Render
368  RenderTextClipped(value_bb.Min + style.FramePadding, value_bb.Max, value_text_begin, value_text_end, &value_size, ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f));
369  if (label_size.x > 0.0f)
370  RenderText(ImVec2(value_bb.Max.x + style.ItemInnerSpacing.x, value_bb.Min.y + style.FramePadding.y), label);
371 }
372 
373 void ImGui::BulletText(const char *fmt, ...)
374 {
375  va_list args;
376  va_start(args, fmt);
377  BulletTextV(fmt, args);
378  va_end(args);
379 }
380 
381 // Text with a little bullet aligned to the typical tree node.
382 void ImGui::BulletTextV(const char *fmt, va_list args)
383 {
384  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
385  if (window->SkipItems)
386  return;
387 
388  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
389  const ImGuiStyle &style = g.Style;
390 
391  const char *text_begin = g.TempBuffer;
392  const char *text_end = text_begin + ImFormatStringV(g.TempBuffer, IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.TempBuffer), fmt, args);
393  const ImVec2 label_size = CalcTextSize(text_begin, text_end, false);
394  const ImVec2 total_size = ImVec2(g.FontSize + (label_size.x > 0.0f ? (label_size.x + style.FramePadding.x * 2) : 0.0f), label_size.y); // Empty text doesn't add padding
395  ImVec2 pos = window->DC.CursorPos;
396  pos.y += window->DC.CurrLineTextBaseOffset;
397  ItemSize(total_size, 0.0f);
398  const ImRect bb(pos, pos + total_size);
399  if (!ItemAdd(bb, 0))
400  return;
401 
402  // Render
403  ImU32 text_col = GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Text);
404  RenderBullet(window->DrawList, bb.Min + ImVec2(style.FramePadding.x + g.FontSize * 0.5f, g.FontSize * 0.5f), text_col);
405  RenderText(bb.Min + ImVec2(g.FontSize + style.FramePadding.x * 2, 0.0f), text_begin, text_end, false);
406 }
407 
408 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
409 // [SECTION] Widgets: Main
410 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
411 // - ButtonBehavior() [Internal]
412 // - Button()
413 // - SmallButton()
414 // - InvisibleButton()
415 // - ArrowButton()
416 // - CloseButton() [Internal]
417 // - CollapseButton() [Internal]
418 // - GetWindowScrollbarID() [Internal]
419 // - GetWindowScrollbarRect() [Internal]
420 // - Scrollbar() [Internal]
421 // - ScrollbarEx() [Internal]
422 // - Image()
423 // - ImageButton()
424 // - Checkbox()
425 // - CheckboxFlagsT() [Internal]
426 // - CheckboxFlags()
427 // - RadioButton()
428 // - ProgressBar()
429 // - Bullet()
430 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
431 
432 // The ButtonBehavior() function is key to many interactions and used by many/most widgets.
433 // Because we handle so many cases (keyboard/gamepad navigation, drag and drop) and many specific behavior (via ImGuiButtonFlags_),
434 // this code is a little complex.
435 // By far the most common path is interacting with the Mouse using the default ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnClickRelease button behavior.
436 // See the series of events below and the corresponding state reported by dear imgui:
437 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
438 // with PressedOnClickRelease: return-value IsItemHovered() IsItemActive() IsItemActivated() IsItemDeactivated() IsItemClicked()
439 // Frame N+0 (mouse is outside bb) - - - - - -
440 // Frame N+1 (mouse moves inside bb) - true - - - -
441 // Frame N+2 (mouse button is down) - true true true - true
442 // Frame N+3 (mouse button is down) - true true - - -
443 // Frame N+4 (mouse moves outside bb) - - true - - -
444 // Frame N+5 (mouse moves inside bb) - true true - - -
445 // Frame N+6 (mouse button is released) true true - - true -
446 // Frame N+7 (mouse button is released) - true - - - -
447 // Frame N+8 (mouse moves outside bb) - - - - - -
448 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
449 // with PressedOnClick: return-value IsItemHovered() IsItemActive() IsItemActivated() IsItemDeactivated() IsItemClicked()
450 // Frame N+2 (mouse button is down) true true true true - true
451 // Frame N+3 (mouse button is down) - true true - - -
452 // Frame N+6 (mouse button is released) - true - - true -
453 // Frame N+7 (mouse button is released) - true - - - -
454 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
455 // with PressedOnRelease: return-value IsItemHovered() IsItemActive() IsItemActivated() IsItemDeactivated() IsItemClicked()
456 // Frame N+2 (mouse button is down) - true - - - true
457 // Frame N+3 (mouse button is down) - true - - - -
458 // Frame N+6 (mouse button is released) true true - - - -
459 // Frame N+7 (mouse button is released) - true - - - -
460 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
461 // with PressedOnDoubleClick: return-value IsItemHovered() IsItemActive() IsItemActivated() IsItemDeactivated() IsItemClicked()
462 // Frame N+0 (mouse button is down) - true - - - true
463 // Frame N+1 (mouse button is down) - true - - - -
464 // Frame N+2 (mouse button is released) - true - - - -
465 // Frame N+3 (mouse button is released) - true - - - -
466 // Frame N+4 (mouse button is down) true true true true - true
467 // Frame N+5 (mouse button is down) - true true - - -
468 // Frame N+6 (mouse button is released) - true - - true -
469 // Frame N+7 (mouse button is released) - true - - - -
470 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
471 // Note that some combinations are supported,
472 // - PressedOnDragDropHold can generally be associated with any flag.
473 // - PressedOnDoubleClick can be associated by PressedOnClickRelease/PressedOnRelease, in which case the second release event won't be reported.
474 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
475 // The behavior of the return-value changes when ImGuiButtonFlags_Repeat is set:
476 // Repeat+ Repeat+ Repeat+ Repeat+
477 // PressedOnClickRelease PressedOnClick PressedOnRelease PressedOnDoubleClick
478 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
479 // Frame N+0 (mouse button is down) - true - true
480 // ... - - - -
481 // Frame N + RepeatDelay true true - true
482 // ... - - - -
483 // Frame N + RepeatDelay + RepeatRate*N true true - true
484 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
485 
486 bool ImGui::ButtonBehavior(const ImRect &bb, ImGuiID id, bool *out_hovered, bool *out_held, ImGuiButtonFlags flags)
487 {
488  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
489  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
490 
491  // Default only reacts to left mouse button
492  if ((flags & ImGuiButtonFlags_MouseButtonMask_) == 0)
493  flags |= ImGuiButtonFlags_MouseButtonDefault_;
494 
495  // Default behavior requires click + release inside bounding box
496  if ((flags & ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnMask_) == 0)
497  flags |= ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnDefault_;
498 
499  ImGuiWindow *backup_hovered_window = g.HoveredWindow;
500  const bool flatten_hovered_children = (flags & ImGuiButtonFlags_FlattenChildren) && g.HoveredWindow && g.HoveredWindow->RootWindow == window;
501  if (flatten_hovered_children)
502  g.HoveredWindow = window;
503 
504 #ifdef IMGUI_ENABLE_TEST_ENGINE
505  if (id != 0 && g.LastItemData.ID != id)
506  IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ITEM_ADD(bb, id);
507 #endif
508 
509  bool pressed = false;
510  bool hovered = ItemHoverable(bb, id);
511 
512  // Drag source doesn't report as hovered
513  if (hovered && g.DragDropActive && g.DragDropPayload.SourceId == id && !(g.DragDropSourceFlags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceNoDisableHover))
514  hovered = false;
515 
516  // Special mode for Drag and Drop where holding button pressed for a long time while dragging another item triggers the button
517  if (g.DragDropActive && (flags & ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnDragDropHold) && !(g.DragDropSourceFlags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceNoHoldToOpenOthers))
518  if (IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByActiveItem))
519  {
520  hovered = true;
521  SetHoveredID(id);
522  if (g.HoveredIdTimer - g.IO.Time <= DRAGDROP_HOLD_TO_OPEN_TIMER && g.HoveredIdTimer >= DRAGDROP_HOLD_TO_OPEN_TIMER)
523  {
524  pressed = true;
525  g.DragDropHoldJustPressedId = id;
526  FocusWindow(window);
527  }
528  }
529 
530  if (flatten_hovered_children)
531  g.HoveredWindow = backup_hovered_window;
532 
533  // AllowOverlap mode (rarely used) requires previous frame HoveredId to be null or to match. This allows using patterns where a later submitted widget overlaps a previous one.
534  if (hovered && (flags & ImGuiButtonFlags_AllowItemOverlap) && (g.HoveredIdPreviousFrame != id && g.HoveredIdPreviousFrame != 0))
535  hovered = false;
536 
537  // Mouse handling
538  if (hovered)
539  {
540  if (!(flags & ImGuiButtonFlags_NoKeyModifiers) || (!g.IO.KeyCtrl && !g.IO.KeyShift && !g.IO.KeyAlt))
541  {
542  // Poll buttons
543  int mouse_button_clicked = -1;
544  int mouse_button_released = -1;
545  if ((flags & ImGuiButtonFlags_MouseButtonLeft) && g.IO.MouseClicked[0])
546  {
547  mouse_button_clicked = 0;
548  }
549  else if ((flags & ImGuiButtonFlags_MouseButtonRight) && g.IO.MouseClicked[1])
550  {
551  mouse_button_clicked = 1;
552  }
553  else if ((flags & ImGuiButtonFlags_MouseButtonMiddle) && g.IO.MouseClicked[2])
554  {
555  mouse_button_clicked = 2;
556  }
557  if ((flags & ImGuiButtonFlags_MouseButtonLeft) && g.IO.MouseReleased[0])
558  {
559  mouse_button_released = 0;
560  }
561  else if ((flags & ImGuiButtonFlags_MouseButtonRight) && g.IO.MouseReleased[1])
562  {
563  mouse_button_released = 1;
564  }
565  else if ((flags & ImGuiButtonFlags_MouseButtonMiddle) && g.IO.MouseReleased[2])
566  {
567  mouse_button_released = 2;
568  }
569 
570  if (mouse_button_clicked != -1 && g.ActiveId != id)
571  {
572  if (flags & (ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnClickRelease | ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnClickReleaseAnywhere))
573  {
574  SetActiveID(id, window);
575  g.ActiveIdMouseButton = mouse_button_clicked;
576  if (!(flags & ImGuiButtonFlags_NoNavFocus))
577  SetFocusID(id, window);
578  FocusWindow(window);
579  }
580  if ((flags & ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnClick) || ((flags & ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnDoubleClick) && g.IO.MouseDoubleClicked[mouse_button_clicked]))
581  {
582  pressed = true;
583  if (flags & ImGuiButtonFlags_NoHoldingActiveId)
584  ClearActiveID();
585  else
586  SetActiveID(id, window); // Hold on ID
587  g.ActiveIdMouseButton = mouse_button_clicked;
588  FocusWindow(window);
589  }
590  }
591  if ((flags & ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnRelease) && mouse_button_released != -1)
592  {
593  // Repeat mode trumps on release behavior
594  const bool has_repeated_at_least_once = (flags & ImGuiButtonFlags_Repeat) && g.IO.MouseDownDurationPrev[mouse_button_released] >= g.IO.KeyRepeatDelay;
595  if (!has_repeated_at_least_once)
596  pressed = true;
597  ClearActiveID();
598  }
599 
600  // 'Repeat' mode acts when held regardless of _PressedOn flags (see table above).
601  // Relies on repeat logic of IsMouseClicked() but we may as well do it ourselves if we end up exposing finer RepeatDelay/RepeatRate settings.
602  if (g.ActiveId == id && (flags & ImGuiButtonFlags_Repeat))
603  if (g.IO.MouseDownDuration[g.ActiveIdMouseButton] > 0.0f && IsMouseClicked(g.ActiveIdMouseButton, true))
604  pressed = true;
605  }
606 
607  if (pressed)
608  g.NavDisableHighlight = true;
609  }
610 
611  // Gamepad/Keyboard navigation
612  // We report navigated item as hovered but we don't set g.HoveredId to not interfere with mouse.
613  if (g.NavId == id && !g.NavDisableHighlight && g.NavDisableMouseHover && (g.ActiveId == 0 || g.ActiveId == id || g.ActiveId == window->MoveId))
614  if (!(flags & ImGuiButtonFlags_NoHoveredOnFocus))
615  hovered = true;
616  if (g.NavActivateDownId == id)
617  {
618  bool nav_activated_by_code = (g.NavActivateId == id);
619  bool nav_activated_by_inputs = IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_Activate, (flags & ImGuiButtonFlags_Repeat) ? ImGuiInputReadMode_Repeat : ImGuiInputReadMode_Pressed);
620  if (nav_activated_by_code || nav_activated_by_inputs)
621  pressed = true;
622  if (nav_activated_by_code || nav_activated_by_inputs || g.ActiveId == id)
623  {
624  // Set active id so it can be queried by user via IsItemActive(), equivalent of holding the mouse button.
625  g.NavActivateId = id; // This is so SetActiveId assign a Nav source
626  SetActiveID(id, window);
627  if ((nav_activated_by_code || nav_activated_by_inputs) && !(flags & ImGuiButtonFlags_NoNavFocus))
628  SetFocusID(id, window);
629  }
630  }
631 
632  // Process while held
633  bool held = false;
634  if (g.ActiveId == id)
635  {
636  if (g.ActiveIdSource == ImGuiInputSource_Mouse)
637  {
638  if (g.ActiveIdIsJustActivated)
639  g.ActiveIdClickOffset = g.IO.MousePos - bb.Min;
640 
641  const int mouse_button = g.ActiveIdMouseButton;
642  IM_ASSERT(mouse_button >= 0 && mouse_button < ImGuiMouseButton_COUNT);
643  if (g.IO.MouseDown[mouse_button])
644  {
645  held = true;
646  }
647  else
648  {
649  bool release_in = hovered && (flags & ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnClickRelease) != 0;
650  bool release_anywhere = (flags & ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnClickReleaseAnywhere) != 0;
651  if ((release_in || release_anywhere) && !g.DragDropActive)
652  {
653  // Report as pressed when releasing the mouse (this is the most common path)
654  bool is_double_click_release = (flags & ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnDoubleClick) && g.IO.MouseDownWasDoubleClick[mouse_button];
655  bool is_repeating_already = (flags & ImGuiButtonFlags_Repeat) && g.IO.MouseDownDurationPrev[mouse_button] >= g.IO.KeyRepeatDelay; // Repeat mode trumps <on release>
656  if (!is_double_click_release && !is_repeating_already)
657  pressed = true;
658  }
659  ClearActiveID();
660  }
661  if (!(flags & ImGuiButtonFlags_NoNavFocus))
662  g.NavDisableHighlight = true;
663  }
664  else if (g.ActiveIdSource == ImGuiInputSource_Nav)
665  {
666  // When activated using Nav, we hold on the ActiveID until activation button is released
667  if (g.NavActivateDownId != id)
668  ClearActiveID();
669  }
670  if (pressed)
671  g.ActiveIdHasBeenPressedBefore = true;
672  }
673 
674  if (out_hovered) *out_hovered = hovered;
675  if (out_held) *out_held = held;
676 
677  return pressed;
678 }
679 
680 bool ImGui::ButtonEx(const char *label, const ImVec2 &size_arg, ImGuiButtonFlags flags)
681 {
682  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
683  if (window->SkipItems)
684  return false;
685 
686  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
687  const ImGuiStyle &style = g.Style;
688  const ImGuiID id = window->GetID(label);
689  const ImVec2 label_size = CalcTextSize(label, NULL, true);
690 
691  ImVec2 pos = window->DC.CursorPos;
692  if ((flags & ImGuiButtonFlags_AlignTextBaseLine) && style.FramePadding.y < window->DC.CurrLineTextBaseOffset) // Try to vertically align buttons that are smaller/have no padding so that text baseline matches (bit hacky, since it shouldn't be a flag)
693  pos.y += window->DC.CurrLineTextBaseOffset - style.FramePadding.y;
694  ImVec2 size = CalcItemSize(size_arg, label_size.x + style.FramePadding.x * 2.0f, label_size.y + style.FramePadding.y * 2.0f);
695 
696  const ImRect bb(pos, pos + size);
697  ItemSize(size, style.FramePadding.y);
698  if (!ItemAdd(bb, id))
699  return false;
700 
701  if (g.LastItemData.InFlags & ImGuiItemFlags_ButtonRepeat)
702  flags |= ImGuiButtonFlags_Repeat;
703 
704  bool hovered, held;
705  bool pressed = ButtonBehavior(bb, id, &hovered, &held, flags);
706 
707  // Render
708  const ImU32 col = GetColorU32((held && hovered) ? ImGuiCol_ButtonActive : hovered ? ImGuiCol_ButtonHovered : ImGuiCol_Button);
709  RenderNavHighlight(bb, id);
710  RenderFrame(bb.Min, bb.Max, col, true, style.FrameRounding);
711 
712  if (g.LogEnabled)
713  LogSetNextTextDecoration("[", "]");
714  RenderTextClipped(bb.Min + style.FramePadding, bb.Max - style.FramePadding, label, NULL, &label_size, style.ButtonTextAlign, &bb);
715 
716  // Automatically close popups
717  //if (pressed && !(flags & ImGuiButtonFlags_DontClosePopups) && (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup))
718  // CloseCurrentPopup();
719 
720  IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ITEM_INFO(id, label, g.LastItemData.StatusFlags);
721  return pressed;
722 }
723 
724 bool ImGui::Button(const char *label, const ImVec2 &size_arg)
725 {
726  return ButtonEx(label, size_arg, ImGuiButtonFlags_None);
727 }
728 
729 // Small buttons fits within text without additional vertical spacing.
730 bool ImGui::SmallButton(const char *label)
731 {
732  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
733  float backup_padding_y = g.Style.FramePadding.y;
734  g.Style.FramePadding.y = 0.0f;
735  bool pressed = ButtonEx(label, ImVec2(0, 0), ImGuiButtonFlags_AlignTextBaseLine);
736  g.Style.FramePadding.y = backup_padding_y;
737  return pressed;
738 }
739 
740 // Tip: use ImGui::PushID()/PopID() to push indices or pointers in the ID stack.
741 // Then you can keep 'str_id' empty or the same for all your buttons (instead of creating a string based on a non-string id)
742 bool ImGui::InvisibleButton(const char *str_id, const ImVec2 &size_arg, ImGuiButtonFlags flags)
743 {
744  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
745  if (window->SkipItems)
746  return false;
747 
748  // Cannot use zero-size for InvisibleButton(). Unlike Button() there is not way to fallback using the label size.
749  IM_ASSERT(size_arg.x != 0.0f && size_arg.y != 0.0f);
750 
751  const ImGuiID id = window->GetID(str_id);
752  ImVec2 size = CalcItemSize(size_arg, 0.0f, 0.0f);
753  const ImRect bb(window->DC.CursorPos, window->DC.CursorPos + size);
754  ItemSize(size);
755  if (!ItemAdd(bb, id))
756  return false;
757 
758  bool hovered, held;
759  bool pressed = ButtonBehavior(bb, id, &hovered, &held, flags);
760 
761  return pressed;
762 }
763 
764 bool ImGui::ArrowButtonEx(const char *str_id, ImGuiDir dir, ImVec2 size, ImGuiButtonFlags flags)
765 {
766  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
767  if (window->SkipItems)
768  return false;
769 
770  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
771  const ImGuiID id = window->GetID(str_id);
772  const ImRect bb(window->DC.CursorPos, window->DC.CursorPos + size);
773  const float default_size = GetFrameHeight();
774  ItemSize(size, (size.y >= default_size) ? g.Style.FramePadding.y : -1.0f);
775  if (!ItemAdd(bb, id))
776  return false;
777 
778  if (g.LastItemData.InFlags & ImGuiItemFlags_ButtonRepeat)
779  flags |= ImGuiButtonFlags_Repeat;
780 
781  bool hovered, held;
782  bool pressed = ButtonBehavior(bb, id, &hovered, &held, flags);
783 
784  // Render
785  const ImU32 bg_col = GetColorU32((held && hovered) ? ImGuiCol_ButtonActive : hovered ? ImGuiCol_ButtonHovered : ImGuiCol_Button);
786  const ImU32 text_col = GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Text);
787  RenderNavHighlight(bb, id);
788  RenderFrame(bb.Min, bb.Max, bg_col, true, g.Style.FrameRounding);
789  RenderArrow(window->DrawList, bb.Min + ImVec2(ImMax(0.0f, (size.x - g.FontSize) * 0.5f), ImMax(0.0f, (size.y - g.FontSize) * 0.5f)), text_col, dir);
790 
791  return pressed;
792 }
793 
794 bool ImGui::ArrowButton(const char *str_id, ImGuiDir dir)
795 {
796  float sz = GetFrameHeight();
797  return ArrowButtonEx(str_id, dir, ImVec2(sz, sz), ImGuiButtonFlags_None);
798 }
799 
800 // Button to close a window
801 bool ImGui::CloseButton(ImGuiID id, const ImVec2 &pos)
802 {
803  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
804  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
805 
806  // Tweak 1: Shrink hit-testing area if button covers an abnormally large proportion of the visible region. That's in order to facilitate moving the window away. (#3825)
807  // This may better be applied as a general hit-rect reduction mechanism for all widgets to ensure the area to move window is always accessible?
808  const ImRect bb(pos, pos + ImVec2(g.FontSize, g.FontSize) + g.Style.FramePadding * 2.0f);
809  ImRect bb_interact = bb;
810  const float area_to_visible_ratio = window->OuterRectClipped.GetArea() / bb.GetArea();
811  if (area_to_visible_ratio < 1.5f)
812  bb_interact.Expand(ImFloor(bb_interact.GetSize() * -0.25f));
813 
814  // Tweak 2: We intentionally allow interaction when clipped so that a mechanical Alt,Right,Activate sequence can always close a window.
815  // (this isn't the regular behavior of buttons, but it doesn't affect the user much because navigation tends to keep items visible).
816  bool is_clipped = !ItemAdd(bb_interact, id);
817 
818  bool hovered, held;
819  bool pressed = ButtonBehavior(bb_interact, id, &hovered, &held);
820  if (is_clipped)
821  return pressed;
822 
823  // Render
824  // FIXME: Clarify this mess
825  ImU32 col = GetColorU32(held ? ImGuiCol_ButtonActive : ImGuiCol_ButtonHovered);
826  ImVec2 center = bb.GetCenter();
827  if (hovered)
828  window->DrawList->AddCircleFilled(center, ImMax(2.0f, g.FontSize * 0.5f + 1.0f), col, 12);
829 
830  float cross_extent = g.FontSize * 0.5f * 0.7071f - 1.0f;
831  ImU32 cross_col = GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Text);
832  center -= ImVec2(0.5f, 0.5f);
833  window->DrawList->AddLine(center + ImVec2(+cross_extent, +cross_extent), center + ImVec2(-cross_extent, -cross_extent), cross_col, 1.0f);
834  window->DrawList->AddLine(center + ImVec2(+cross_extent, -cross_extent), center + ImVec2(-cross_extent, +cross_extent), cross_col, 1.0f);
835 
836  return pressed;
837 }
838 
839 bool ImGui::CollapseButton(ImGuiID id, const ImVec2 &pos)
840 {
841  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
842  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
843 
844  ImRect bb(pos, pos + ImVec2(g.FontSize, g.FontSize) + g.Style.FramePadding * 2.0f);
845  ItemAdd(bb, id);
846  bool hovered, held;
847  bool pressed = ButtonBehavior(bb, id, &hovered, &held, ImGuiButtonFlags_None);
848 
849  // Render
850  ImU32 bg_col = GetColorU32((held && hovered) ? ImGuiCol_ButtonActive : hovered ? ImGuiCol_ButtonHovered : ImGuiCol_Button);
851  ImU32 text_col = GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Text);
852  ImVec2 center = bb.GetCenter();
853  if (hovered || held)
854  window->DrawList->AddCircleFilled(center/*+ ImVec2(0.0f, -0.5f)*/, g.FontSize * 0.5f + 1.0f, bg_col, 12);
855  RenderArrow(window->DrawList, bb.Min + g.Style.FramePadding, text_col, window->Collapsed ? ImGuiDir_Right : ImGuiDir_Down, 1.0f);
856 
857  // Switch to moving the window after mouse is moved beyond the initial drag threshold
858  if (IsItemActive() && IsMouseDragging(0))
859  StartMouseMovingWindow(window);
860 
861  return pressed;
862 }
863 
864 ImGuiID ImGui::GetWindowScrollbarID(ImGuiWindow *window, ImGuiAxis axis)
865 {
866  return window->GetIDNoKeepAlive(axis == ImGuiAxis_X ? "#SCROLLX" : "#SCROLLY");
867 }
868 
869 // Return scrollbar rectangle, must only be called for corresponding axis if window->ScrollbarX/Y is set.
870 ImRect ImGui::GetWindowScrollbarRect(ImGuiWindow *window, ImGuiAxis axis)
871 {
872  const ImRect outer_rect = window->Rect();
873  const ImRect inner_rect = window->InnerRect;
874  const float border_size = window->WindowBorderSize;
875  const float scrollbar_size = window->ScrollbarSizes[axis ^ 1]; // (ScrollbarSizes.x = width of Y scrollbar; ScrollbarSizes.y = height of X scrollbar)
876  IM_ASSERT(scrollbar_size > 0.0f);
877  if (axis == ImGuiAxis_X)
878  return ImRect(inner_rect.Min.x, ImMax(outer_rect.Min.y, outer_rect.Max.y - border_size - scrollbar_size), inner_rect.Max.x, outer_rect.Max.y);
879  else
880  return ImRect(ImMax(outer_rect.Min.x, outer_rect.Max.x - border_size - scrollbar_size), inner_rect.Min.y, outer_rect.Max.x, inner_rect.Max.y);
881 }
882 
883 void ImGui::Scrollbar(ImGuiAxis axis)
884 {
885  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
886  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
887 
888  const ImGuiID id = GetWindowScrollbarID(window, axis);
889  KeepAliveID(id);
890 
891  // Calculate scrollbar bounding box
892  ImRect bb = GetWindowScrollbarRect(window, axis);
893  ImDrawFlags rounding_corners = ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersNone;
894  if (axis == ImGuiAxis_X)
895  {
896  rounding_corners |= ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersBottomLeft;
897  if (!window->ScrollbarY)
898  rounding_corners |= ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersBottomRight;
899  }
900  else
901  {
902  if ((window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar) && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar))
903  rounding_corners |= ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersTopRight;
904  if (!window->ScrollbarX)
905  rounding_corners |= ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersBottomRight;
906  }
907  float size_avail = window->InnerRect.Max[axis] - window->InnerRect.Min[axis];
908  float size_contents = window->ContentSize[axis] + window->WindowPadding[axis] * 2.0f;
909  ScrollbarEx(bb, id, axis, &window->Scroll[axis], size_avail, size_contents, rounding_corners);
910 }
911 
912 // Vertical/Horizontal scrollbar
913 // The entire piece of code below is rather confusing because:
914 // - We handle absolute seeking (when first clicking outside the grab) and relative manipulation (afterward or when clicking inside the grab)
915 // - We store values as normalized ratio and in a form that allows the window content to change while we are holding on a scrollbar
916 // - We handle both horizontal and vertical scrollbars, which makes the terminology not ideal.
917 // Still, the code should probably be made simpler..
918 bool ImGui::ScrollbarEx(const ImRect &bb_frame, ImGuiID id, ImGuiAxis axis, float *p_scroll_v, float size_avail_v, float size_contents_v, ImDrawFlags flags)
919 {
920  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
921  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
922  if (window->SkipItems)
923  return false;
924 
925  const float bb_frame_width = bb_frame.GetWidth();
926  const float bb_frame_height = bb_frame.GetHeight();
927  if (bb_frame_width <= 0.0f || bb_frame_height <= 0.0f)
928  return false;
929 
930  // When we are too small, start hiding and disabling the grab (this reduce visual noise on very small window and facilitate using the window resize grab)
931  float alpha = 1.0f;
932  if ((axis == ImGuiAxis_Y) && bb_frame_height < g.FontSize + g.Style.FramePadding.y * 2.0f)
933  alpha = ImSaturate((bb_frame_height - g.FontSize) / (g.Style.FramePadding.y * 2.0f));
934  if (alpha <= 0.0f)
935  return false;
936 
937  const ImGuiStyle &style = g.Style;
938  const bool allow_interaction = (alpha >= 1.0f);
939 
940  ImRect bb = bb_frame;
941  bb.Expand(ImVec2(-ImClamp(IM_FLOOR((bb_frame_width - 2.0f) * 0.5f), 0.0f, 3.0f), -ImClamp(IM_FLOOR((bb_frame_height - 2.0f) * 0.5f), 0.0f, 3.0f)));
942 
943  // V denote the main, longer axis of the scrollbar (= height for a vertical scrollbar)
944  const float scrollbar_size_v = (axis == ImGuiAxis_X) ? bb.GetWidth() : bb.GetHeight();
945 
946  // Calculate the height of our grabbable box. It generally represent the amount visible (vs the total scrollable amount)
947  // But we maintain a minimum size in pixel to allow for the user to still aim inside.
948  IM_ASSERT(ImMax(size_contents_v, size_avail_v) > 0.0f); // Adding this assert to check if the ImMax(XXX,1.0f) is still needed. PLEASE CONTACT ME if this triggers.
949  const float win_size_v = ImMax(ImMax(size_contents_v, size_avail_v), 1.0f);
950  const float grab_h_pixels = ImClamp(scrollbar_size_v * (size_avail_v / win_size_v), style.GrabMinSize, scrollbar_size_v);
951  const float grab_h_norm = grab_h_pixels / scrollbar_size_v;
952 
953  // Handle input right away. None of the code of Begin() is relying on scrolling position before calling Scrollbar().
954  bool held = false;
955  bool hovered = false;
956  ButtonBehavior(bb, id, &hovered, &held, ImGuiButtonFlags_NoNavFocus);
957 
958  float scroll_max = ImMax(1.0f, size_contents_v - size_avail_v);
959  float scroll_ratio = ImSaturate(*p_scroll_v / scroll_max);
960  float grab_v_norm = scroll_ratio * (scrollbar_size_v - grab_h_pixels) / scrollbar_size_v; // Grab position in normalized space
961  if (held && allow_interaction && grab_h_norm < 1.0f)
962  {
963  float scrollbar_pos_v = bb.Min[axis];
964  float mouse_pos_v = g.IO.MousePos[axis];
965 
966  // Click position in scrollbar normalized space (0.0f->1.0f)
967  const float clicked_v_norm = ImSaturate((mouse_pos_v - scrollbar_pos_v) / scrollbar_size_v);
968  SetHoveredID(id);
969 
970  bool seek_absolute = false;
971  if (g.ActiveIdIsJustActivated)
972  {
973  // On initial click calculate the distance between mouse and the center of the grab
974  seek_absolute = (clicked_v_norm < grab_v_norm || clicked_v_norm > grab_v_norm + grab_h_norm);
975  if (seek_absolute)
976  g.ScrollbarClickDeltaToGrabCenter = 0.0f;
977  else
978  g.ScrollbarClickDeltaToGrabCenter = clicked_v_norm - grab_v_norm - grab_h_norm * 0.5f;
979  }
980 
981  // Apply scroll (p_scroll_v will generally point on one member of window->Scroll)
982  // It is ok to modify Scroll here because we are being called in Begin() after the calculation of ContentSize and before setting up our starting position
983  const float scroll_v_norm = ImSaturate((clicked_v_norm - g.ScrollbarClickDeltaToGrabCenter - grab_h_norm * 0.5f) / (1.0f - grab_h_norm));
984  *p_scroll_v = IM_ROUND(scroll_v_norm * scroll_max);//(win_size_contents_v - win_size_v));
985 
986  // Update values for rendering
987  scroll_ratio = ImSaturate(*p_scroll_v / scroll_max);
988  grab_v_norm = scroll_ratio * (scrollbar_size_v - grab_h_pixels) / scrollbar_size_v;
989 
990  // Update distance to grab now that we have seeked and saturated
991  if (seek_absolute)
992  g.ScrollbarClickDeltaToGrabCenter = clicked_v_norm - grab_v_norm - grab_h_norm * 0.5f;
993  }
994 
995  // Render
996  const ImU32 bg_col = GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_ScrollbarBg);
997  const ImU32 grab_col = GetColorU32(held ? ImGuiCol_ScrollbarGrabActive : hovered ? ImGuiCol_ScrollbarGrabHovered : ImGuiCol_ScrollbarGrab, alpha);
998  window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(bb_frame.Min, bb_frame.Max, bg_col, window->WindowRounding, flags);
999  ImRect grab_rect;
1000  if (axis == ImGuiAxis_X)
1001  grab_rect = ImRect(ImLerp(bb.Min.x, bb.Max.x, grab_v_norm), bb.Min.y, ImLerp(bb.Min.x, bb.Max.x, grab_v_norm) + grab_h_pixels, bb.Max.y);
1002  else
1003  grab_rect = ImRect(bb.Min.x, ImLerp(bb.Min.y, bb.Max.y, grab_v_norm), bb.Max.x, ImLerp(bb.Min.y, bb.Max.y, grab_v_norm) + grab_h_pixels);
1004  window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(grab_rect.Min, grab_rect.Max, grab_col, style.ScrollbarRounding);
1005 
1006  return held;
1007 }
1008 
1009 void ImGui::Image(ImTextureID user_texture_id, const ImVec2 &size, const ImVec2 &uv0, const ImVec2 &uv1, const ImVec4 &tint_col, const ImVec4 &border_col)
1010 {
1011  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
1012  if (window->SkipItems)
1013  return;
1014 
1015  ImRect bb(window->DC.CursorPos, window->DC.CursorPos + size);
1016  if (border_col.w > 0.0f)
1017  bb.Max += ImVec2(2, 2);
1018  ItemSize(bb);
1019  if (!ItemAdd(bb, 0))
1020  return;
1021 
1022  if (border_col.w > 0.0f)
1023  {
1024  window->DrawList->AddRect(bb.Min, bb.Max, GetColorU32(border_col), 0.0f);
1025  window->DrawList->AddImage(user_texture_id, bb.Min + ImVec2(1, 1), bb.Max - ImVec2(1, 1), uv0, uv1, GetColorU32(tint_col));
1026  }
1027  else
1028  {
1029  window->DrawList->AddImage(user_texture_id, bb.Min, bb.Max, uv0, uv1, GetColorU32(tint_col));
1030  }
1031 }
1032 
1033 // ImageButton() is flawed as 'id' is always derived from 'texture_id' (see #2464 #1390)
1034 // We provide this internal helper to write your own variant while we figure out how to redesign the public ImageButton() API.
1035 bool ImGui::ImageButtonEx(ImGuiID id, ImTextureID texture_id, const ImVec2 &size, const ImVec2 &uv0, const ImVec2 &uv1, const ImVec2 &padding, const ImVec4 &bg_col, const ImVec4 &tint_col)
1036 {
1037  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
1038  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
1039  if (window->SkipItems)
1040  return false;
1041 
1042  const ImRect bb(window->DC.CursorPos, window->DC.CursorPos + size + padding * 2);
1043  ItemSize(bb);
1044  if (!ItemAdd(bb, id))
1045  return false;
1046 
1047  bool hovered, held;
1048  bool pressed = ButtonBehavior(bb, id, &hovered, &held);
1049 
1050  // Render
1051  const ImU32 col = GetColorU32((held && hovered) ? ImGuiCol_ButtonActive : hovered ? ImGuiCol_ButtonHovered : ImGuiCol_Button);
1052  RenderNavHighlight(bb, id);
1053  RenderFrame(bb.Min, bb.Max, col, true, ImClamp((float)ImMin(padding.x, padding.y), 0.0f, g.Style.FrameRounding));
1054  if (bg_col.w > 0.0f)
1055  window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(bb.Min + padding, bb.Max - padding, GetColorU32(bg_col));
1056  window->DrawList->AddImage(texture_id, bb.Min + padding, bb.Max - padding, uv0, uv1, GetColorU32(tint_col));
1057 
1058  return pressed;
1059 }
1060 
1061 // frame_padding < 0: uses FramePadding from style (default)
1062 // frame_padding = 0: no framing
1063 // frame_padding > 0: set framing size
1064 bool ImGui::ImageButton(ImTextureID user_texture_id, const ImVec2 &size, const ImVec2 &uv0, const ImVec2 &uv1, int frame_padding, const ImVec4 &bg_col, const ImVec4 &tint_col)
1065 {
1066  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
1067  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
1068  if (window->SkipItems)
1069  return false;
1070 
1071  // Default to using texture ID as ID. User can still push string/integer prefixes.
1072  PushID((void *)(intptr_t)user_texture_id);
1073  const ImGuiID id = window->GetID("#image");
1074  PopID();
1075 
1076  const ImVec2 padding = (frame_padding >= 0) ? ImVec2((float)frame_padding, (float)frame_padding) : g.Style.FramePadding;
1077  return ImageButtonEx(id, user_texture_id, size, uv0, uv1, padding, bg_col, tint_col);
1078 }
1079 
1080 bool ImGui::Checkbox(const char *label, bool *v)
1081 {
1082  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
1083  if (window->SkipItems)
1084  return false;
1085 
1086  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
1087  const ImGuiStyle &style = g.Style;
1088  const ImGuiID id = window->GetID(label);
1089  const ImVec2 label_size = CalcTextSize(label, NULL, true);
1090 
1091  const float square_sz = GetFrameHeight();
1092  const ImVec2 pos = window->DC.CursorPos;
1093  const ImRect total_bb(pos, pos + ImVec2(square_sz + (label_size.x > 0.0f ? style.ItemInnerSpacing.x + label_size.x : 0.0f), label_size.y + style.FramePadding.y * 2.0f));
1094  ItemSize(total_bb, style.FramePadding.y);
1095  if (!ItemAdd(total_bb, id))
1096  {
1097  IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ITEM_INFO(id, label, g.LastItemData.StatusFlags | ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Checkable | (*v ? ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Checked : 0));
1098  return false;
1099  }
1100 
1101  bool hovered, held;
1102  bool pressed = ButtonBehavior(total_bb, id, &hovered, &held);
1103  if (pressed)
1104  {
1105  *v = !(*v);
1106  MarkItemEdited(id);
1107  }
1108 
1109  const ImRect check_bb(pos, pos + ImVec2(square_sz, square_sz));
1110  RenderNavHighlight(total_bb, id);
1111  RenderFrame(check_bb.Min, check_bb.Max, GetColorU32((held && hovered) ? ImGuiCol_FrameBgActive : hovered ? ImGuiCol_FrameBgHovered : ImGuiCol_FrameBg), true, style.FrameRounding);
1112  ImU32 check_col = GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_CheckMark);
1113  bool mixed_value = (g.LastItemData.InFlags & ImGuiItemFlags_MixedValue) != 0;
1114  if (mixed_value)
1115  {
1116  // Undocumented tristate/mixed/indeterminate checkbox (#2644)
1117  // This may seem awkwardly designed because the aim is to make ImGuiItemFlags_MixedValue supported by all widgets (not just checkbox)
1118  ImVec2 pad(ImMax(1.0f, IM_FLOOR(square_sz / 3.6f)), ImMax(1.0f, IM_FLOOR(square_sz / 3.6f)));
1119  window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(check_bb.Min + pad, check_bb.Max - pad, check_col, style.FrameRounding);
1120  }
1121  else if (*v)
1122  {
1123  const float pad = ImMax(1.0f, IM_FLOOR(square_sz / 6.0f));
1124  RenderCheckMark(window->DrawList, check_bb.Min + ImVec2(pad, pad), check_col, square_sz - pad * 2.0f);
1125  }
1126 
1127  ImVec2 label_pos = ImVec2(check_bb.Max.x + style.ItemInnerSpacing.x, check_bb.Min.y + style.FramePadding.y);
1128  if (g.LogEnabled)
1129  LogRenderedText(&label_pos, mixed_value ? "[~]" : *v ? "[x]" : "[ ]");
1130  if (label_size.x > 0.0f)
1131  RenderText(label_pos, label);
1132 
1133  IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ITEM_INFO(id, label, g.LastItemData.StatusFlags | ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Checkable | (*v ? ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Checked : 0));
1134  return pressed;
1135 }
1136 
1137 template<typename T>
1138 bool ImGui::CheckboxFlagsT(const char *label, T *flags, T flags_value)
1139 {
1140  bool all_on = (*flags & flags_value) == flags_value;
1141  bool any_on = (*flags & flags_value) != 0;
1142  bool pressed;
1143  if (!all_on && any_on)
1144  {
1145  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
1146  ImGuiItemFlags backup_item_flags = g.CurrentItemFlags;
1147  g.CurrentItemFlags |= ImGuiItemFlags_MixedValue;
1148  pressed = Checkbox(label, &all_on);
1149  g.CurrentItemFlags = backup_item_flags;
1150  }
1151  else
1152  {
1153  pressed = Checkbox(label, &all_on);
1154 
1155  }
1156  if (pressed)
1157  {
1158  if (all_on)
1159  *flags |= flags_value;
1160  else
1161  *flags &= ~flags_value;
1162  }
1163  return pressed;
1164 }
1165 
1166 bool ImGui::CheckboxFlags(const char *label, int *flags, int flags_value)
1167 {
1168  return CheckboxFlagsT(label, flags, flags_value);
1169 }
1170 
1171 bool ImGui::CheckboxFlags(const char *label, unsigned int *flags, unsigned int flags_value)
1172 {
1173  return CheckboxFlagsT(label, flags, flags_value);
1174 }
1175 
1176 bool ImGui::CheckboxFlags(const char *label, ImS64 *flags, ImS64 flags_value)
1177 {
1178  return CheckboxFlagsT(label, flags, flags_value);
1179 }
1180 
1181 bool ImGui::CheckboxFlags(const char *label, ImU64 *flags, ImU64 flags_value)
1182 {
1183  return CheckboxFlagsT(label, flags, flags_value);
1184 }
1185 
1186 bool ImGui::RadioButton(const char *label, bool active)
1187 {
1188  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
1189  if (window->SkipItems)
1190  return false;
1191 
1192  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
1193  const ImGuiStyle &style = g.Style;
1194  const ImGuiID id = window->GetID(label);
1195  const ImVec2 label_size = CalcTextSize(label, NULL, true);
1196 
1197  const float square_sz = GetFrameHeight();
1198  const ImVec2 pos = window->DC.CursorPos;
1199  const ImRect check_bb(pos, pos + ImVec2(square_sz, square_sz));
1200  const ImRect total_bb(pos, pos + ImVec2(square_sz + (label_size.x > 0.0f ? style.ItemInnerSpacing.x + label_size.x : 0.0f), label_size.y + style.FramePadding.y * 2.0f));
1201  ItemSize(total_bb, style.FramePadding.y);
1202  if (!ItemAdd(total_bb, id))
1203  return false;
1204 
1205  ImVec2 center = check_bb.GetCenter();
1206  center.x = IM_ROUND(center.x);
1207  center.y = IM_ROUND(center.y);
1208  const float radius = (square_sz - 1.0f) * 0.5f;
1209 
1210  bool hovered, held;
1211  bool pressed = ButtonBehavior(total_bb, id, &hovered, &held);
1212  if (pressed)
1213  MarkItemEdited(id);
1214 
1215  RenderNavHighlight(total_bb, id);
1216  window->DrawList->AddCircleFilled(center, radius, GetColorU32((held && hovered) ? ImGuiCol_FrameBgActive : hovered ? ImGuiCol_FrameBgHovered : ImGuiCol_FrameBg), 16);
1217  if (active)
1218  {
1219  const float pad = ImMax(1.0f, IM_FLOOR(square_sz / 6.0f));
1220  window->DrawList->AddCircleFilled(center, radius - pad, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_CheckMark), 16);
1221  }
1222 
1223  if (style.FrameBorderSize > 0.0f)
1224  {
1225  window->DrawList->AddCircle(center + ImVec2(1, 1), radius, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_BorderShadow), 16, style.FrameBorderSize);
1226  window->DrawList->AddCircle(center, radius, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Border), 16, style.FrameBorderSize);
1227  }
1228 
1229  ImVec2 label_pos = ImVec2(check_bb.Max.x + style.ItemInnerSpacing.x, check_bb.Min.y + style.FramePadding.y);
1230  if (g.LogEnabled)
1231  LogRenderedText(&label_pos, active ? "(x)" : "( )");
1232  if (label_size.x > 0.0f)
1233  RenderText(label_pos, label);
1234 
1235  IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ITEM_INFO(id, label, g.LastItemData.StatusFlags);
1236  return pressed;
1237 }
1238 
1239 // FIXME: This would work nicely if it was a public template, e.g. 'template<T> RadioButton(const char* label, T* v, T v_button)', but I'm not sure how we would expose it..
1240 bool ImGui::RadioButton(const char *label, int *v, int v_button)
1241 {
1242  const bool pressed = RadioButton(label, *v == v_button);
1243  if (pressed)
1244  *v = v_button;
1245  return pressed;
1246 }
1247 
1248 // size_arg (for each axis) < 0.0f: align to end, 0.0f: auto, > 0.0f: specified size
1249 void ImGui::ProgressBar(float fraction, const ImVec2 &size_arg, const char *overlay)
1250 {
1251  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
1252  if (window->SkipItems)
1253  return;
1254 
1255  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
1256  const ImGuiStyle &style = g.Style;
1257 
1258  ImVec2 pos = window->DC.CursorPos;
1259  ImVec2 size = CalcItemSize(size_arg, CalcItemWidth(), g.FontSize + style.FramePadding.y * 2.0f);
1260  ImRect bb(pos, pos + size);
1261  ItemSize(size, style.FramePadding.y);
1262  if (!ItemAdd(bb, 0))
1263  return;
1264 
1265  // Render
1266  fraction = ImSaturate(fraction);
1267  RenderFrame(bb.Min, bb.Max, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_FrameBg), true, style.FrameRounding);
1268  bb.Expand(ImVec2(-style.FrameBorderSize, -style.FrameBorderSize));
1269  const ImVec2 fill_br = ImVec2(ImLerp(bb.Min.x, bb.Max.x, fraction), bb.Max.y);
1270  RenderRectFilledRangeH(window->DrawList, bb, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_PlotHistogram), 0.0f, fraction, style.FrameRounding);
1271 
1272  // Default displaying the fraction as percentage string, but user can override it
1273  char overlay_buf[32];
1274  if (!overlay)
1275  {
1276  ImFormatString(overlay_buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(overlay_buf), "%.0f%%", fraction * 100 + 0.01f);
1277  overlay = overlay_buf;
1278  }
1279 
1280  ImVec2 overlay_size = CalcTextSize(overlay, NULL);
1281  if (overlay_size.x > 0.0f)
1282  RenderTextClipped(ImVec2(ImClamp(fill_br.x + style.ItemSpacing.x, bb.Min.x, bb.Max.x - overlay_size.x - style.ItemInnerSpacing.x), bb.Min.y), bb.Max, overlay, NULL, &overlay_size, ImVec2(0.0f, 0.5f), &bb);
1283 }
1284 
1285 void ImGui::Bullet()
1286 {
1287  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
1288  if (window->SkipItems)
1289  return;
1290 
1291  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
1292  const ImGuiStyle &style = g.Style;
1293  const float line_height = ImMax(ImMin(window->DC.CurrLineSize.y, g.FontSize + g.Style.FramePadding.y * 2), g.FontSize);
1294  const ImRect bb(window->DC.CursorPos, window->DC.CursorPos + ImVec2(g.FontSize, line_height));
1295  ItemSize(bb);
1296  if (!ItemAdd(bb, 0))
1297  {
1298  SameLine(0, style.FramePadding.x * 2);
1299  return;
1300  }
1301 
1302  // Render and stay on same line
1303  ImU32 text_col = GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Text);
1304  RenderBullet(window->DrawList, bb.Min + ImVec2(style.FramePadding.x + g.FontSize * 0.5f, line_height * 0.5f), text_col);
1305  SameLine(0, style.FramePadding.x * 2.0f);
1306 }
1307 
1308 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
1309 // [SECTION] Widgets: Low-level Layout helpers
1310 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
1311 // - Spacing()
1312 // - Dummy()
1313 // - NewLine()
1314 // - AlignTextToFramePadding()
1315 // - SeparatorEx() [Internal]
1316 // - Separator()
1317 // - SplitterBehavior() [Internal]
1318 // - ShrinkWidths() [Internal]
1319 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
1320 
1321 void ImGui::Spacing()
1322 {
1323  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
1324  if (window->SkipItems)
1325  return;
1326  ItemSize(ImVec2(0, 0));
1327 }
1328 
1329 void ImGui::Dummy(const ImVec2 &size)
1330 {
1331  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
1332  if (window->SkipItems)
1333  return;
1334 
1335  const ImRect bb(window->DC.CursorPos, window->DC.CursorPos + size);
1336  ItemSize(size);
1337  ItemAdd(bb, 0);
1338 }
1339 
1340 void ImGui::NewLine()
1341 {
1342  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
1343  if (window->SkipItems)
1344  return;
1345 
1346  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
1347  const ImGuiLayoutType backup_layout_type = window->DC.LayoutType;
1348  window->DC.LayoutType = ImGuiLayoutType_Vertical;
1349  if (window->DC.CurrLineSize.y > 0.0f) // In the event that we are on a line with items that is smaller that FontSize high, we will preserve its height.
1350  ItemSize(ImVec2(0, 0));
1351  else
1352  ItemSize(ImVec2(0.0f, g.FontSize));
1353  window->DC.LayoutType = backup_layout_type;
1354 }
1355 
1356 void ImGui::AlignTextToFramePadding()
1357 {
1358  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
1359  if (window->SkipItems)
1360  return;
1361 
1362  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
1363  window->DC.CurrLineSize.y = ImMax(window->DC.CurrLineSize.y, g.FontSize + g.Style.FramePadding.y * 2);
1364  window->DC.CurrLineTextBaseOffset = ImMax(window->DC.CurrLineTextBaseOffset, g.Style.FramePadding.y);
1365 }
1366 
1367 // Horizontal/vertical separating line
1368 void ImGui::SeparatorEx(ImGuiSeparatorFlags flags)
1369 {
1370  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
1371  if (window->SkipItems)
1372  return;
1373 
1374  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
1375  IM_ASSERT(ImIsPowerOfTwo(flags & (ImGuiSeparatorFlags_Horizontal | ImGuiSeparatorFlags_Vertical))); // Check that only 1 option is selected
1376 
1377  float thickness_draw = 1.0f;
1378  float thickness_layout = 0.0f;
1379  if (flags & ImGuiSeparatorFlags_Vertical)
1380  {
1381  // Vertical separator, for menu bars (use current line height). Not exposed because it is misleading and it doesn't have an effect on regular layout.
1382  float y1 = window->DC.CursorPos.y;
1383  float y2 = window->DC.CursorPos.y + window->DC.CurrLineSize.y;
1384  const ImRect bb(ImVec2(window->DC.CursorPos.x, y1), ImVec2(window->DC.CursorPos.x + thickness_draw, y2));
1385  ItemSize(ImVec2(thickness_layout, 0.0f));
1386  if (!ItemAdd(bb, 0))
1387  return;
1388 
1389  // Draw
1390  window->DrawList->AddLine(ImVec2(bb.Min.x, bb.Min.y), ImVec2(bb.Min.x, bb.Max.y), GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Separator));
1391  if (g.LogEnabled)
1392  LogText(" |");
1393  }
1394  else if (flags & ImGuiSeparatorFlags_Horizontal)
1395  {
1396  // Horizontal Separator
1397  float x1 = window->Pos.x;
1398  float x2 = window->Pos.x + window->Size.x;
1399 
1400  // FIXME-WORKRECT: old hack (#205) until we decide of consistent behavior with WorkRect/Indent and Separator
1401  if (g.GroupStack.Size > 0 && g.GroupStack.back().WindowID == window->ID)
1402  x1 += window->DC.Indent.x;
1403 
1404  ImGuiOldColumns *columns = (flags & ImGuiSeparatorFlags_SpanAllColumns) ? window->DC.CurrentColumns : NULL;
1405  if (columns)
1406  PushColumnsBackground();
1407 
1408  // We don't provide our width to the layout so that it doesn't get feed back into AutoFit
1409  const ImRect bb(ImVec2(x1, window->DC.CursorPos.y), ImVec2(x2, window->DC.CursorPos.y + thickness_draw));
1410  ItemSize(ImVec2(0.0f, thickness_layout));
1411  const bool item_visible = ItemAdd(bb, 0);
1412  if (item_visible)
1413  {
1414  // Draw
1415  window->DrawList->AddLine(bb.Min, ImVec2(bb.Max.x, bb.Min.y), GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Separator));
1416  if (g.LogEnabled)
1417  LogRenderedText(&bb.Min, "--------------------------------\n");
1418 
1419  }
1420  if (columns)
1421  {
1422  PopColumnsBackground();
1423  columns->LineMinY = window->DC.CursorPos.y;
1424  }
1425  }
1426 }
1427 
1428 void ImGui::Separator()
1429 {
1430  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
1431  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
1432  if (window->SkipItems)
1433  return;
1434 
1435  // Those flags should eventually be overridable by the user
1436  ImGuiSeparatorFlags flags = (window->DC.LayoutType == ImGuiLayoutType_Horizontal) ? ImGuiSeparatorFlags_Vertical : ImGuiSeparatorFlags_Horizontal;
1437  flags |= ImGuiSeparatorFlags_SpanAllColumns;
1438  SeparatorEx(flags);
1439 }
1440 
1441 // Using 'hover_visibility_delay' allows us to hide the highlight and mouse cursor for a short time, which can be convenient to reduce visual noise.
1442 bool ImGui::SplitterBehavior(const ImRect &bb, ImGuiID id, ImGuiAxis axis, float *size1, float *size2, float min_size1, float min_size2, float hover_extend, float hover_visibility_delay)
1443 {
1444  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
1445  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
1446 
1447  const ImGuiItemFlags item_flags_backup = g.CurrentItemFlags;
1448  g.CurrentItemFlags |= ImGuiItemFlags_NoNav | ImGuiItemFlags_NoNavDefaultFocus;
1449  bool item_add = ItemAdd(bb, id);
1450  g.CurrentItemFlags = item_flags_backup;
1451  if (!item_add)
1452  return false;
1453 
1454  bool hovered, held;
1455  ImRect bb_interact = bb;
1456  bb_interact.Expand(axis == ImGuiAxis_Y ? ImVec2(0.0f, hover_extend) : ImVec2(hover_extend, 0.0f));
1457  ButtonBehavior(bb_interact, id, &hovered, &held, ImGuiButtonFlags_FlattenChildren | ImGuiButtonFlags_AllowItemOverlap);
1458  if (hovered)
1459  g.LastItemData.StatusFlags |= ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HoveredRect; // for IsItemHovered(), because bb_interact is larger than bb
1460  if (g.ActiveId != id)
1461  SetItemAllowOverlap();
1462 
1463  if (held || (hovered && g.HoveredIdPreviousFrame == id && g.HoveredIdTimer >= hover_visibility_delay))
1464  SetMouseCursor(axis == ImGuiAxis_Y ? ImGuiMouseCursor_ResizeNS : ImGuiMouseCursor_ResizeEW);
1465 
1466  ImRect bb_render = bb;
1467  if (held)
1468  {
1469  ImVec2 mouse_delta_2d = g.IO.MousePos - g.ActiveIdClickOffset - bb_interact.Min;
1470  float mouse_delta = (axis == ImGuiAxis_Y) ? mouse_delta_2d.y : mouse_delta_2d.x;
1471 
1472  // Minimum pane size
1473  float size_1_maximum_delta = ImMax(0.0f, *size1 - min_size1);
1474  float size_2_maximum_delta = ImMax(0.0f, *size2 - min_size2);
1475  if (mouse_delta < -size_1_maximum_delta)
1476  mouse_delta = -size_1_maximum_delta;
1477  if (mouse_delta > size_2_maximum_delta)
1478  mouse_delta = size_2_maximum_delta;
1479 
1480  // Apply resize
1481  if (mouse_delta != 0.0f)
1482  {
1483  if (mouse_delta < 0.0f)
1484  IM_ASSERT(*size1 + mouse_delta >= min_size1);
1485  if (mouse_delta > 0.0f)
1486  IM_ASSERT(*size2 - mouse_delta >= min_size2);
1487  *size1 += mouse_delta;
1488  *size2 -= mouse_delta;
1489  bb_render.Translate((axis == ImGuiAxis_X) ? ImVec2(mouse_delta, 0.0f) : ImVec2(0.0f, mouse_delta));
1490  MarkItemEdited(id);
1491  }
1492  }
1493 
1494  // Render
1495  const ImU32 col = GetColorU32(held ? ImGuiCol_SeparatorActive : (hovered && g.HoveredIdTimer >= hover_visibility_delay) ? ImGuiCol_SeparatorHovered : ImGuiCol_Separator);
1496  window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(bb_render.Min, bb_render.Max, col, 0.0f);
1497 
1498  return held;
1499 }
1500 
1501 static int IMGUI_CDECL ShrinkWidthItemComparer(const void *lhs, const void *rhs)
1502 {
1503  const ImGuiShrinkWidthItem *a = (const ImGuiShrinkWidthItem *)lhs;
1504  const ImGuiShrinkWidthItem *b = (const ImGuiShrinkWidthItem *)rhs;
1505  if (int d = (int)(b->Width - a->Width))
1506  return d;
1507  return (b->Index - a->Index);
1508 }
1509 
1510 // Shrink excess width from a set of item, by removing width from the larger items first.
1511 // Set items Width to -1.0f to disable shrinking this item.
1512 void ImGui::ShrinkWidths(ImGuiShrinkWidthItem *items, int count, float width_excess)
1513 {
1514  if (count == 1)
1515  {
1516  if (items[0].Width >= 0.0f)
1517  items[0].Width = ImMax(items[0].Width - width_excess, 1.0f);
1518  return;
1519  }
1520  ImQsort(items, (size_t)count, sizeof(ImGuiShrinkWidthItem), ShrinkWidthItemComparer);
1521  int count_same_width = 1;
1522  while (width_excess > 0.0f && count_same_width < count)
1523  {
1524  while (count_same_width < count && items[0].Width <= items[count_same_width].Width)
1525  count_same_width++;
1526  float max_width_to_remove_per_item = (count_same_width < count &&items[count_same_width].Width >= 0.0f) ? (items[0].Width - items[count_same_width].Width) : (items[0].Width - 1.0f);
1527  if (max_width_to_remove_per_item <= 0.0f)
1528  break;
1529  float width_to_remove_per_item = ImMin(width_excess / count_same_width, max_width_to_remove_per_item);
1530  for (int item_n = 0; item_n < count_same_width; item_n++)
1531  items[item_n].Width -= width_to_remove_per_item;
1532  width_excess -= width_to_remove_per_item * count_same_width;
1533  }
1534 
1535  // Round width and redistribute remainder left-to-right (could make it an option of the function?)
1536  // Ensure that e.g. the right-most tab of a shrunk tab-bar always reaches exactly at the same distance from the right-most edge of the tab bar separator.
1537  width_excess = 0.0f;
1538  for (int n = 0; n < count; n++)
1539  {
1540  float width_rounded = ImFloor(items[n].Width);
1541  width_excess += items[n].Width - width_rounded;
1542  items[n].Width = width_rounded;
1543  }
1544  if (width_excess > 0.0f)
1545  for (int n = 0; n < count; n++)
1546  if (items[n].Index < (int)(width_excess + 0.01f))
1547  items[n].Width += 1.0f;
1548 }
1549 
1550 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
1551 // [SECTION] Widgets: ComboBox
1552 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
1553 // - CalcMaxPopupHeightFromItemCount() [Internal]
1554 // - BeginCombo()
1555 // - BeginComboPopup() [Internal]
1556 // - EndCombo()
1557 // - BeginComboPreview() [Internal]
1558 // - EndComboPreview() [Internal]
1559 // - Combo()
1560 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
1561 
1562 static float CalcMaxPopupHeightFromItemCount(int items_count)
1563 {
1564  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
1565  if (items_count <= 0)
1566  return FLT_MAX;
1567  return (g.FontSize + g.Style.ItemSpacing.y) * items_count - g.Style.ItemSpacing.y + (g.Style.WindowPadding.y * 2);
1568 }
1569 
1570 bool ImGui::BeginCombo(const char *label, const char *preview_value, ImGuiComboFlags flags)
1571 {
1572  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
1573  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
1574 
1575  ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags backup_next_window_data_flags = g.NextWindowData.Flags;
1576  g.NextWindowData.ClearFlags(); // We behave like Begin() and need to consume those values
1577  if (window->SkipItems)
1578  return false;
1579 
1580  const ImGuiStyle &style = g.Style;
1581  const ImGuiID id = window->GetID(label);
1582  IM_ASSERT((flags & (ImGuiComboFlags_NoArrowButton | ImGuiComboFlags_NoPreview)) != (ImGuiComboFlags_NoArrowButton | ImGuiComboFlags_NoPreview)); // Can't use both flags together
1583 
1584  const float arrow_size = (flags & ImGuiComboFlags_NoArrowButton) ? 0.0f : GetFrameHeight();
1585  const ImVec2 label_size = CalcTextSize(label, NULL, true);
1586  const float w = (flags & ImGuiComboFlags_NoPreview) ? arrow_size : CalcItemWidth();
1587  const ImRect bb(window->DC.CursorPos, window->DC.CursorPos + ImVec2(w, label_size.y + style.FramePadding.y * 2.0f));
1588  const ImRect total_bb(bb.Min, bb.Max + ImVec2(label_size.x > 0.0f ? style.ItemInnerSpacing.x + label_size.x : 0.0f, 0.0f));
1589  ItemSize(total_bb, style.FramePadding.y);
1590  if (!ItemAdd(total_bb, id, &bb))
1591  return false;
1592 
1593  // Open on click
1594  bool hovered, held;
1595  bool pressed = ButtonBehavior(bb, id, &hovered, &held);
1596  const ImGuiID popup_id = ImHashStr("##ComboPopup", 0, id);
1597  bool popup_open = IsPopupOpen(popup_id, ImGuiPopupFlags_None);
1598  if ((pressed || g.NavActivateId == id) && !popup_open)
1599  {
1600  OpenPopupEx(popup_id, ImGuiPopupFlags_None);
1601  popup_open = true;
1602  }
1603 
1604  // Render shape
1605  const ImU32 frame_col = GetColorU32(hovered ? ImGuiCol_FrameBgHovered : ImGuiCol_FrameBg);
1606  const float value_x2 = ImMax(bb.Min.x, bb.Max.x - arrow_size);
1607  RenderNavHighlight(bb, id);
1608  if (!(flags & ImGuiComboFlags_NoPreview))
1609  window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(bb.Min, ImVec2(value_x2, bb.Max.y), frame_col, style.FrameRounding, (flags & ImGuiComboFlags_NoArrowButton) ? ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersAll : ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersLeft);
1610  if (!(flags & ImGuiComboFlags_NoArrowButton))
1611  {
1612  ImU32 bg_col = GetColorU32((popup_open || hovered) ? ImGuiCol_ButtonHovered : ImGuiCol_Button);
1613  ImU32 text_col = GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Text);
1614  window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(ImVec2(value_x2, bb.Min.y), bb.Max, bg_col, style.FrameRounding, (w <= arrow_size) ? ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersAll : ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersRight);
1615  if (value_x2 + arrow_size - style.FramePadding.x <= bb.Max.x)
1616  RenderArrow(window->DrawList, ImVec2(value_x2 + style.FramePadding.y, bb.Min.y + style.FramePadding.y), text_col, ImGuiDir_Down, 1.0f);
1617  }
1618  RenderFrameBorder(bb.Min, bb.Max, style.FrameRounding);
1619 
1620  // Custom preview
1621  if (flags & ImGuiComboFlags_CustomPreview)
1622  {
1623  g.ComboPreviewData.PreviewRect = ImRect(bb.Min.x, bb.Min.y, value_x2, bb.Max.y);
1624  IM_ASSERT(preview_value == NULL || preview_value[0] == 0);
1625  preview_value = NULL;
1626  }
1627 
1628  // Render preview and label
1629  if (preview_value != NULL && !(flags & ImGuiComboFlags_NoPreview))
1630  {
1631  if (g.LogEnabled)
1632  LogSetNextTextDecoration("{", "}");
1633  RenderTextClipped(bb.Min + style.FramePadding, ImVec2(value_x2, bb.Max.y), preview_value, NULL, NULL);
1634  }
1635  if (label_size.x > 0)
1636  RenderText(ImVec2(bb.Max.x + style.ItemInnerSpacing.x, bb.Min.y + style.FramePadding.y), label);
1637 
1638  if (!popup_open)
1639  return false;
1640 
1641  g.NextWindowData.Flags = backup_next_window_data_flags;
1642  return BeginComboPopup(popup_id, bb, flags);
1643 }
1644 
1645 bool ImGui::BeginComboPopup(ImGuiID popup_id, const ImRect &bb, ImGuiComboFlags flags)
1646 {
1647  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
1648  if (!IsPopupOpen(popup_id, ImGuiPopupFlags_None))
1649  {
1650  g.NextWindowData.ClearFlags();
1651  return false;
1652  }
1653 
1654  // Set popup size
1655  float w = bb.GetWidth();
1656  if (g.NextWindowData.Flags & ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasSizeConstraint)
1657  {
1658  g.NextWindowData.SizeConstraintRect.Min.x = ImMax(g.NextWindowData.SizeConstraintRect.Min.x, w);
1659  }
1660  else
1661  {
1662  if ((flags & ImGuiComboFlags_HeightMask_) == 0)
1663  flags |= ImGuiComboFlags_HeightRegular;
1664  IM_ASSERT(ImIsPowerOfTwo(flags & ImGuiComboFlags_HeightMask_)); // Only one
1665  int popup_max_height_in_items = -1;
1666  if (flags & ImGuiComboFlags_HeightRegular) popup_max_height_in_items = 8;
1667  else if (flags & ImGuiComboFlags_HeightSmall) popup_max_height_in_items = 4;
1668  else if (flags & ImGuiComboFlags_HeightLarge) popup_max_height_in_items = 20;
1669  SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(ImVec2(w, 0.0f), ImVec2(FLT_MAX, CalcMaxPopupHeightFromItemCount(popup_max_height_in_items)));
1670  }
1671 
1672  // This is essentially a specialized version of BeginPopupEx()
1673  char name[16];
1674  ImFormatString(name, IM_ARRAYSIZE(name), "##Combo_%02d", g.BeginPopupStack.Size); // Recycle windows based on depth
1675 
1676  // Set position given a custom constraint (peak into expected window size so we can position it)
1677  // FIXME: This might be easier to express with an hypothetical SetNextWindowPosConstraints() function?
1678  // FIXME: This might be moved to Begin() or at least around the same spot where Tooltips and other Popups are calling FindBestWindowPosForPopupEx()?
1679  if (ImGuiWindow *popup_window = FindWindowByName(name))
1680  if (popup_window->WasActive)
1681  {
1682  // Always override 'AutoPosLastDirection' to not leave a chance for a past value to affect us.
1683  ImVec2 size_expected = CalcWindowNextAutoFitSize(popup_window);
1684  popup_window->AutoPosLastDirection = (flags & ImGuiComboFlags_PopupAlignLeft) ? ImGuiDir_Left : ImGuiDir_Down; // Left = "Below, Toward Left", Down = "Below, Toward Right (default)"
1685  ImRect r_outer = GetPopupAllowedExtentRect(popup_window);
1686  ImVec2 pos = FindBestWindowPosForPopupEx(bb.GetBL(), size_expected, &popup_window->AutoPosLastDirection, r_outer, bb, ImGuiPopupPositionPolicy_ComboBox);
1687  SetNextWindowPos(pos);
1688  }
1689 
1690  // We don't use BeginPopupEx() solely because we have a custom name string, which we could make an argument to BeginPopupEx()
1691  ImGuiWindowFlags window_flags = ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove;
1692  PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_WindowPadding, ImVec2(g.Style.FramePadding.x, g.Style.WindowPadding.y)); // Horizontally align ourselves with the framed text
1693  bool ret = Begin(name, NULL, window_flags);
1694  PopStyleVar();
1695  if (!ret)
1696  {
1697  EndPopup();
1698  IM_ASSERT(0); // This should never happen as we tested for IsPopupOpen() above
1699  return false;
1700  }
1701  return true;
1702 }
1703 
1704 void ImGui::EndCombo()
1705 {
1706  EndPopup();
1707 }
1708 
1709 // Call directly after the BeginCombo/EndCombo block. The preview is designed to only host non-interactive elements
1710 // (Experimental, see GitHub issues: #1658, #4168)
1711 bool ImGui::BeginComboPreview()
1712 {
1713  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
1714  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
1715  ImGuiComboPreviewData *preview_data = &g.ComboPreviewData;
1716 
1717  if (window->SkipItems || !window->ClipRect.Overlaps(g.LastItemData.Rect)) // FIXME: Because we don't have a ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Visible flag to test last ItemAdd() result
1718  return false;
1719  IM_ASSERT(g.LastItemData.Rect.Min.x == preview_data->PreviewRect.Min.x && g.LastItemData.Rect.Min.y == preview_data->PreviewRect.Min.y); // Didn't call after BeginCombo/EndCombo block or forgot to pass ImGuiComboFlags_CustomPreview flag?
1720  if (!window->ClipRect.Contains(preview_data->PreviewRect)) // Narrower test (optional)
1721  return false;
1722 
1723  // FIXME: This could be contained in a PushWorkRect() api
1724  preview_data->BackupCursorPos = window->DC.CursorPos;
1725  preview_data->BackupCursorMaxPos = window->DC.CursorMaxPos;
1726  preview_data->BackupCursorPosPrevLine = window->DC.CursorPosPrevLine;
1727  preview_data->BackupPrevLineTextBaseOffset = window->DC.PrevLineTextBaseOffset;
1728  preview_data->BackupLayout = window->DC.LayoutType;
1729  window->DC.CursorPos = preview_data->PreviewRect.Min + g.Style.FramePadding;
1730  window->DC.CursorMaxPos = window->DC.CursorPos;
1731  window->DC.LayoutType = ImGuiLayoutType_Horizontal;
1732  PushClipRect(preview_data->PreviewRect.Min, preview_data->PreviewRect.Max, true);
1733 
1734  return true;
1735 }
1736 
1737 void ImGui::EndComboPreview()
1738 {
1739  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
1740  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
1741  ImGuiComboPreviewData *preview_data = &g.ComboPreviewData;
1742 
1743  // FIXME: Using CursorMaxPos approximation instead of correct AABB which we will store in ImDrawCmd in the future
1744  ImDrawList *draw_list = window->DrawList;
1745  if (window->DC.CursorMaxPos.x < preview_data->PreviewRect.Max.x && window->DC.CursorMaxPos.y < preview_data->PreviewRect.Max.y)
1746  if (draw_list->CmdBuffer.Size > 1) // Unlikely case that the PushClipRect() didn't create a command
1747  {
1748  draw_list->_CmdHeader.ClipRect = draw_list->CmdBuffer[draw_list->CmdBuffer.Size - 1].ClipRect = draw_list->CmdBuffer[draw_list->CmdBuffer.Size - 2].ClipRect;
1749  draw_list->_TryMergeDrawCmds();
1750  }
1751  PopClipRect();
1752  window->DC.CursorPos = preview_data->BackupCursorPos;
1753  window->DC.CursorMaxPos = ImMax(window->DC.CursorMaxPos, preview_data->BackupCursorMaxPos);
1754  window->DC.CursorPosPrevLine = preview_data->BackupCursorPosPrevLine;
1755  window->DC.PrevLineTextBaseOffset = preview_data->BackupPrevLineTextBaseOffset;
1756  window->DC.LayoutType = preview_data->BackupLayout;
1757  preview_data->PreviewRect = ImRect();
1758 }
1759 
1760 // Getter for the old Combo() API: const char*[]
1761 static bool Items_ArrayGetter(void *data, int idx, const char **out_text)
1762 {
1763  const char *const *items = (const char *const *)data;
1764  if (out_text)
1765  *out_text = items[idx];
1766  return true;
1767 }
1768 
1769 // Getter for the old Combo() API: "item1\0item2\0item3\0"
1770 static bool Items_SingleStringGetter(void *data, int idx, const char **out_text)
1771 {
1772  // FIXME-OPT: we could pre-compute the indices to fasten this. But only 1 active combo means the waste is limited.
1773  const char *items_separated_by_zeros = (const char *)data;
1774  int items_count = 0;
1775  const char *p = items_separated_by_zeros;
1776  while (*p)
1777  {
1778  if (idx == items_count)
1779  break;
1780  p += strlen(p) + 1;
1781  items_count++;
1782  }
1783  if (!*p)
1784  return false;
1785  if (out_text)
1786  *out_text = p;
1787  return true;
1788 }
1789 
1790 // Old API, prefer using BeginCombo() nowadays if you can.
1791 bool ImGui::Combo(const char *label, int *current_item, bool (*items_getter)(void *, int, const char **), void *data, int items_count, int popup_max_height_in_items)
1792 {
1793  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
1794 
1795  // Call the getter to obtain the preview string which is a parameter to BeginCombo()
1796  const char *preview_value = NULL;
1797  if (*current_item >= 0 && *current_item < items_count)
1798  items_getter(data, *current_item, &preview_value);
1799 
1800  // The old Combo() API exposed "popup_max_height_in_items". The new more general BeginCombo() API doesn't have/need it, but we emulate it here.
1801  if (popup_max_height_in_items != -1 && !(g.NextWindowData.Flags & ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasSizeConstraint))
1802  SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(ImVec2(0, 0), ImVec2(FLT_MAX, CalcMaxPopupHeightFromItemCount(popup_max_height_in_items)));
1803 
1804  if (!BeginCombo(label, preview_value, ImGuiComboFlags_None))
1805  return false;
1806 
1807  // Display items
1808  // FIXME-OPT: Use clipper (but we need to disable it on the appearing frame to make sure our call to SetItemDefaultFocus() is processed)
1809  bool value_changed = false;
1810  for (int i = 0; i < items_count; i++)
1811  {
1812  PushID((void *)(intptr_t)i);
1813  const bool item_selected = (i == *current_item);
1814  const char *item_text;
1815  if (!items_getter(data, i, &item_text))
1816  item_text = "*Unknown item*";
1817  if (Selectable(item_text, item_selected))
1818  {
