1819  value_changed = true;
1820  *current_item = i;
1821  }
1822  if (item_selected)
1823  SetItemDefaultFocus();
1824  PopID();
1825  }
1826 
1827  EndCombo();
1828 
1829  if (value_changed)
1830  MarkItemEdited(g.LastItemData.ID);
1831 
1832  return value_changed;
1833 }
1834 
1835 // Combo box helper allowing to pass an array of strings.
1836 bool ImGui::Combo(const char *label, int *current_item, const char *const items[], int items_count, int height_in_items)
1837 {
1838  const bool value_changed = Combo(label, current_item, Items_ArrayGetter, (void *)items, items_count, height_in_items);
1839  return value_changed;
1840 }
1841 
1842 // Combo box helper allowing to pass all items in a single string literal holding multiple zero-terminated items "item1\0item2\0"
1843 bool ImGui::Combo(const char *label, int *current_item, const char *items_separated_by_zeros, int height_in_items)
1844 {
1845  int items_count = 0;
1846  const char *p = items_separated_by_zeros; // FIXME-OPT: Avoid computing this, or at least only when combo is open
1847  while (*p)
1848  {
1849  p += strlen(p) + 1;
1850  items_count++;
1851  }
1852  bool value_changed = Combo(label, current_item, Items_SingleStringGetter, (void *)items_separated_by_zeros, items_count, height_in_items);
1853  return value_changed;
1854 }
1855 
1856 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
1857 // [SECTION] Data Type and Data Formatting Helpers [Internal]
1858 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
1859 // - PatchFormatStringFloatToInt()
1860 // - DataTypeGetInfo()
1861 // - DataTypeFormatString()
1862 // - DataTypeApplyOp()
1863 // - DataTypeApplyOpFromText()
1864 // - DataTypeClamp()
1865 // - GetMinimumStepAtDecimalPrecision
1866 // - RoundScalarWithFormat<>()
1867 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
1868 
1869 static const ImGuiDataTypeInfo GDataTypeInfo[] =
1870 {
1871  { sizeof(char), "S8", "%d", "%d" }, // ImGuiDataType_S8
1872  { sizeof(unsigned char), "U8", "%u", "%u" },
1873  { sizeof(short), "S16", "%d", "%d" }, // ImGuiDataType_S16
1874  { sizeof(unsigned short), "U16", "%u", "%u" },
1875  { sizeof(int), "S32", "%d", "%d" }, // ImGuiDataType_S32
1876  { sizeof(unsigned int), "U32", "%u", "%u" },
1877 #ifdef _MSC_VER
1878  { sizeof(ImS64), "S64", "%I64d","%I64d" }, // ImGuiDataType_S64
1879  { sizeof(ImU64), "U64", "%I64u","%I64u" },
1880 #else
1881  { sizeof(ImS64), "S64", "%lld", "%lld" }, // ImGuiDataType_S64
1882  { sizeof(ImU64), "U64", "%llu", "%llu" },
1883 #endif
1884  { sizeof(float), "float", "%.3f","%f" }, // ImGuiDataType_Float (float are promoted to double in va_arg)
1885  { sizeof(double), "double","%f", "%lf" }, // ImGuiDataType_Double
1886 };
1887 IM_STATIC_ASSERT(IM_ARRAYSIZE(GDataTypeInfo) == ImGuiDataType_COUNT);
1888 
1889 // FIXME-LEGACY: Prior to 1.61 our DragInt() function internally used floats and because of this the compile-time default value for format was "%.0f".
1890 // Even though we changed the compile-time default, we expect users to have carried %f around, which would break the display of DragInt() calls.
1891 // To honor backward compatibility we are rewriting the format string, unless IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS is enabled. What could possibly go wrong?!
1892 static const char *PatchFormatStringFloatToInt(const char *fmt)
1893 {
1894  if (fmt[0] == '%' && fmt[1] == '.' && fmt[2] == '0' && fmt[3] == 'f' && fmt[4] == 0) // Fast legacy path for "%.0f" which is expected to be the most common case.
1895  return "%d";
1896  const char *fmt_start = ImParseFormatFindStart(fmt); // Find % (if any, and ignore %%)
1897  const char *fmt_end = ImParseFormatFindEnd(fmt_start); // Find end of format specifier, which itself is an exercise of confidence/recklessness (because snprintf is dependent on libc or user).
1898  if (fmt_end > fmt_start && fmt_end[-1] == 'f')
1899  {
1900 #ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
1901  if (fmt_start == fmt && fmt_end[0] == 0)
1902  return "%d";
1903  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
1904  ImFormatString(g.TempBuffer, IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.TempBuffer), "%.*s%%d%s", (int)(fmt_start - fmt), fmt, fmt_end); // Honor leading and trailing decorations, but lose alignment/precision.
1905  return g.TempBuffer;
1906 #else
1907  IM_ASSERT(0 && "DragInt(): Invalid format string!"); // Old versions used a default parameter of "%.0f", please replace with e.g. "%d"
1908 #endif
1909  }
1910  return fmt;
1911 }
1912 
1913 const ImGuiDataTypeInfo *ImGui::DataTypeGetInfo(ImGuiDataType data_type)
1914 {
1915  IM_ASSERT(data_type >= 0 && data_type < ImGuiDataType_COUNT);
1916  return &GDataTypeInfo[data_type];
1917 }
1918 
1919 int ImGui::DataTypeFormatString(char *buf, int buf_size, ImGuiDataType data_type, const void *p_data, const char *format)
1920 {
1921  // Signedness doesn't matter when pushing integer arguments
1922  if (data_type == ImGuiDataType_S32 || data_type == ImGuiDataType_U32)
1923  return ImFormatString(buf, buf_size, format, *(const ImU32 *)p_data);
1924  if (data_type == ImGuiDataType_S64 || data_type == ImGuiDataType_U64)
1925  return ImFormatString(buf, buf_size, format, *(const ImU64 *)p_data);
1926  if (data_type == ImGuiDataType_Float)
1927  return ImFormatString(buf, buf_size, format, *(const float *)p_data);
1928  if (data_type == ImGuiDataType_Double)
1929  return ImFormatString(buf, buf_size, format, *(const double *)p_data);
1930  if (data_type == ImGuiDataType_S8)
1931  return ImFormatString(buf, buf_size, format, *(const ImS8 *)p_data);
1932  if (data_type == ImGuiDataType_U8)
1933  return ImFormatString(buf, buf_size, format, *(const ImU8 *)p_data);
1934  if (data_type == ImGuiDataType_S16)
1935  return ImFormatString(buf, buf_size, format, *(const ImS16 *)p_data);
1936  if (data_type == ImGuiDataType_U16)
1937  return ImFormatString(buf, buf_size, format, *(const ImU16 *)p_data);
1938  IM_ASSERT(0);
1939  return 0;
1940 }
1941 
1942 void ImGui::DataTypeApplyOp(ImGuiDataType data_type, int op, void *output, const void *arg1, const void *arg2)
1943 {
1944  IM_ASSERT(op == '+' || op == '-');
1945  switch (data_type)
1946  {
1947  case ImGuiDataType_S8:
1948  if (op == '+')
1949  {
1950  *(ImS8 *)output = ImAddClampOverflow(*(const ImS8 *)arg1, *(const ImS8 *)arg2, IM_S8_MIN, IM_S8_MAX);
1951  }
1952  if (op == '-')
1953  {
1954  *(ImS8 *)output = ImSubClampOverflow(*(const ImS8 *)arg1, *(const ImS8 *)arg2, IM_S8_MIN, IM_S8_MAX);
1955  }
1956  return;
1957  case ImGuiDataType_U8:
1958  if (op == '+')
1959  {
1960  *(ImU8 *)output = ImAddClampOverflow(*(const ImU8 *)arg1, *(const ImU8 *)arg2, IM_U8_MIN, IM_U8_MAX);
1961  }
1962  if (op == '-')
1963  {
1964  *(ImU8 *)output = ImSubClampOverflow(*(const ImU8 *)arg1, *(const ImU8 *)arg2, IM_U8_MIN, IM_U8_MAX);
1965  }
1966  return;
1967  case ImGuiDataType_S16:
1968  if (op == '+')
1969  {
1970  *(ImS16 *)output = ImAddClampOverflow(*(const ImS16 *)arg1, *(const ImS16 *)arg2, IM_S16_MIN, IM_S16_MAX);
1971  }
1972  if (op == '-')
1973  {
1974  *(ImS16 *)output = ImSubClampOverflow(*(const ImS16 *)arg1, *(const ImS16 *)arg2, IM_S16_MIN, IM_S16_MAX);
1975  }
1976  return;
1977  case ImGuiDataType_U16:
1978  if (op == '+')
1979  {
1980  *(ImU16 *)output = ImAddClampOverflow(*(const ImU16 *)arg1, *(const ImU16 *)arg2, IM_U16_MIN, IM_U16_MAX);
1981  }
1982  if (op == '-')
1983  {
1984  *(ImU16 *)output = ImSubClampOverflow(*(const ImU16 *)arg1, *(const ImU16 *)arg2, IM_U16_MIN, IM_U16_MAX);
1985  }
1986  return;
1987  case ImGuiDataType_S32:
1988  if (op == '+')
1989  {
1990  *(ImS32 *)output = ImAddClampOverflow(*(const ImS32 *)arg1, *(const ImS32 *)arg2, IM_S32_MIN, IM_S32_MAX);
1991  }
1992  if (op == '-')
1993  {
1994  *(ImS32 *)output = ImSubClampOverflow(*(const ImS32 *)arg1, *(const ImS32 *)arg2, IM_S32_MIN, IM_S32_MAX);
1995  }
1996  return;
1997  case ImGuiDataType_U32:
1998  if (op == '+')
1999  {
2000  *(ImU32 *)output = ImAddClampOverflow(*(const ImU32 *)arg1, *(const ImU32 *)arg2, IM_U32_MIN, IM_U32_MAX);
2001  }
2002  if (op == '-')
2003  {
2004  *(ImU32 *)output = ImSubClampOverflow(*(const ImU32 *)arg1, *(const ImU32 *)arg2, IM_U32_MIN, IM_U32_MAX);
2005  }
2006  return;
2007  case ImGuiDataType_S64:
2008  if (op == '+')
2009  {
2010  *(ImS64 *)output = ImAddClampOverflow(*(const ImS64 *)arg1, *(const ImS64 *)arg2, IM_S64_MIN, IM_S64_MAX);
2011  }
2012  if (op == '-')
2013  {
2014  *(ImS64 *)output = ImSubClampOverflow(*(const ImS64 *)arg1, *(const ImS64 *)arg2, IM_S64_MIN, IM_S64_MAX);
2015  }
2016  return;
2017  case ImGuiDataType_U64:
2018  if (op == '+')
2019  {
2020  *(ImU64 *)output = ImAddClampOverflow(*(const ImU64 *)arg1, *(const ImU64 *)arg2, IM_U64_MIN, IM_U64_MAX);
2021  }
2022  if (op == '-')
2023  {
2024  *(ImU64 *)output = ImSubClampOverflow(*(const ImU64 *)arg1, *(const ImU64 *)arg2, IM_U64_MIN, IM_U64_MAX);
2025  }
2026  return;
2027  case ImGuiDataType_Float:
2028  if (op == '+')
2029  {
2030  *(float *)output = *(const float *)arg1 + *(const float *)arg2;
2031  }
2032  if (op == '-')
2033  {
2034  *(float *)output = *(const float *)arg1 - *(const float *)arg2;
2035  }
2036  return;
2037  case ImGuiDataType_Double:
2038  if (op == '+')
2039  {
2040  *(double *)output = *(const double *)arg1 + *(const double *)arg2;
2041  }
2042  if (op == '-')
2043  {
2044  *(double *)output = *(const double *)arg1 - *(const double *)arg2;
2045  }
2046  return;
2047  case ImGuiDataType_COUNT: break;
2048  }
2049  IM_ASSERT(0);
2050 }
2051 
2052 // User can input math operators (e.g. +100) to edit a numerical values.
2053 // NB: This is _not_ a full expression evaluator. We should probably add one and replace this dumb mess..
2054 bool ImGui::DataTypeApplyOpFromText(const char *buf, const char *initial_value_buf, ImGuiDataType data_type, void *p_data, const char *format)
2055 {
2056  while (ImCharIsBlankA(*buf))
2057  buf++;
2058 
2059  // We don't support '-' op because it would conflict with inputing negative value.
2060  // Instead you can use +-100 to subtract from an existing value
2061  char op = buf[0];
2062  if (op == '+' || op == '*' || op == '/')
2063  {
2064  buf++;
2065  while (ImCharIsBlankA(*buf))
2066  buf++;
2067  }
2068  else
2069  {
2070  op = 0;
2071  }
2072  if (!buf[0])
2073  return false;
2074 
2075  // Copy the value in an opaque buffer so we can compare at the end of the function if it changed at all.
2076  const ImGuiDataTypeInfo *type_info = DataTypeGetInfo(data_type);
2077  ImGuiDataTypeTempStorage data_backup;
2078  memcpy(&data_backup, p_data, type_info->Size);
2079 
2080  if (format == NULL)
2081  format = type_info->ScanFmt;
2082 
2083  // FIXME-LEGACY: The aim is to remove those operators and write a proper expression evaluator at some point..
2084  int arg1i = 0;
2085  if (data_type == ImGuiDataType_S32)
2086  {
2087  int *v = (int *)p_data;
2088  int arg0i = *v;
2089  float arg1f = 0.0f;
2090  if (op && sscanf(initial_value_buf, format, &arg0i) < 1)
2091  return false;
2092  // Store operand in a float so we can use fractional value for multipliers (*1.1), but constant always parsed as integer so we can fit big integers (e.g. 2000000003) past float precision
2093  if (op == '+')
2094  {
2095  if (sscanf(buf, "%d", &arg1i)) *v = (int)(arg0i + arg1i);
2096  } // Add (use "+-" to subtract)
2097  else if (op == '*')
2098  {
2099  if (sscanf(buf, "%f", &arg1f)) *v = (int)(arg0i * arg1f);
2100  } // Multiply
2101  else if (op == '/')
2102  {
2103  if (sscanf(buf, "%f", &arg1f) && arg1f != 0.0f) *v = (int)(arg0i / arg1f);
2104  } // Divide
2105  else
2106  {
2107  if (sscanf(buf, format, &arg1i) == 1) *v = arg1i;
2108  } // Assign constant
2109  }
2110  else if (data_type == ImGuiDataType_Float)
2111  {
2112  // For floats we have to ignore format with precision (e.g. "%.2f") because sscanf doesn't take them in
2113  format = "%f";
2114  float *v = (float *)p_data;
2115  float arg0f = *v, arg1f = 0.0f;
2116  if (op && sscanf(initial_value_buf, format, &arg0f) < 1)
2117  return false;
2118  if (sscanf(buf, format, &arg1f) < 1)
2119  return false;
2120  if (op == '+')
2121  {
2122  *v = arg0f + arg1f;
2123  } // Add (use "+-" to subtract)
2124  else if (op == '*')
2125  {
2126  *v = arg0f * arg1f;
2127  } // Multiply
2128  else if (op == '/')
2129  {
2130  if (arg1f != 0.0f) *v = arg0f / arg1f;
2131  } // Divide
2132  else
2133  {
2134  *v = arg1f;
2135  } // Assign constant
2136  }
2137  else if (data_type == ImGuiDataType_Double)
2138  {
2139  format = "%lf"; // scanf differentiate float/double unlike printf which forces everything to double because of ellipsis
2140  double *v = (double *)p_data;
2141  double arg0f = *v, arg1f = 0.0;
2142  if (op && sscanf(initial_value_buf, format, &arg0f) < 1)
2143  return false;
2144  if (sscanf(buf, format, &arg1f) < 1)
2145  return false;
2146  if (op == '+')
2147  {
2148  *v = arg0f + arg1f;
2149  } // Add (use "+-" to subtract)
2150  else if (op == '*')
2151  {
2152  *v = arg0f * arg1f;
2153  } // Multiply
2154  else if (op == '/')
2155  {
2156  if (arg1f != 0.0f) *v = arg0f / arg1f;
2157  } // Divide
2158  else
2159  {
2160  *v = arg1f;
2161  } // Assign constant
2162  }
2163  else if (data_type == ImGuiDataType_U32 || data_type == ImGuiDataType_S64 || data_type == ImGuiDataType_U64)
2164  {
2165  // All other types assign constant
2166  // We don't bother handling support for legacy operators since they are a little too crappy. Instead we will later implement a proper expression evaluator in the future.
2167  if (sscanf(buf, format, p_data) < 1)
2168  return false;
2169  }
2170  else
2171  {
2172  // Small types need a 32-bit buffer to receive the result from scanf()
2173  int v32;
2174  if (sscanf(buf, format, &v32) < 1)
2175  return false;
2176  if (data_type == ImGuiDataType_S8)
2177  *(ImS8 *)p_data = (ImS8)ImClamp(v32, (int)IM_S8_MIN, (int)IM_S8_MAX);
2178  else if (data_type == ImGuiDataType_U8)
2179  *(ImU8 *)p_data = (ImU8)ImClamp(v32, (int)IM_U8_MIN, (int)IM_U8_MAX);
2180  else if (data_type == ImGuiDataType_S16)
2181  *(ImS16 *)p_data = (ImS16)ImClamp(v32, (int)IM_S16_MIN, (int)IM_S16_MAX);
2182  else if (data_type == ImGuiDataType_U16)
2183  *(ImU16 *)p_data = (ImU16)ImClamp(v32, (int)IM_U16_MIN, (int)IM_U16_MAX);
2184  else
2185  IM_ASSERT(0);
2186  }
2187 
2188  return memcmp(&data_backup, p_data, type_info->Size) != 0;
2189 }
2190 
2191 template<typename T>
2192 static int DataTypeCompareT(const T *lhs, const T *rhs)
2193 {
2194  if (*lhs < *rhs) return -1;
2195  if (*lhs > *rhs) return +1;
2196  return 0;
2197 }
2198 
2199 int ImGui::DataTypeCompare(ImGuiDataType data_type, const void *arg_1, const void *arg_2)
2200 {
2201  switch (data_type)
2202  {
2203  case ImGuiDataType_S8: return DataTypeCompareT<ImS8 >((const ImS8 *)arg_1, (const ImS8 *)arg_2);
2204  case ImGuiDataType_U8: return DataTypeCompareT<ImU8 >((const ImU8 *)arg_1, (const ImU8 *)arg_2);
2205  case ImGuiDataType_S16: return DataTypeCompareT<ImS16 >((const ImS16 *)arg_1, (const ImS16 *)arg_2);
2206  case ImGuiDataType_U16: return DataTypeCompareT<ImU16 >((const ImU16 *)arg_1, (const ImU16 *)arg_2);
2207  case ImGuiDataType_S32: return DataTypeCompareT<ImS32 >((const ImS32 *)arg_1, (const ImS32 *)arg_2);
2208  case ImGuiDataType_U32: return DataTypeCompareT<ImU32 >((const ImU32 *)arg_1, (const ImU32 *)arg_2);
2209  case ImGuiDataType_S64: return DataTypeCompareT<ImS64 >((const ImS64 *)arg_1, (const ImS64 *)arg_2);
2210  case ImGuiDataType_U64: return DataTypeCompareT<ImU64 >((const ImU64 *)arg_1, (const ImU64 *)arg_2);
2211  case ImGuiDataType_Float: return DataTypeCompareT<float >((const float *)arg_1, (const float *)arg_2);
2212  case ImGuiDataType_Double: return DataTypeCompareT<double>((const double *)arg_1, (const double *)arg_2);
2213  case ImGuiDataType_COUNT: break;
2214  }
2215  IM_ASSERT(0);
2216  return 0;
2217 }
2218 
2219 template<typename T>
2220 static bool DataTypeClampT(T *v, const T *v_min, const T *v_max)
2221 {
2222  // Clamp, both sides are optional, return true if modified
2223  if (v_min && *v < *v_min)
2224  {
2225  *v = *v_min; return true;
2226  }
2227  if (v_max && *v > *v_max)
2228  {
2229  *v = *v_max; return true;
2230  }
2231  return false;
2232 }
2233 
2234 bool ImGui::DataTypeClamp(ImGuiDataType data_type, void *p_data, const void *p_min, const void *p_max)
2235 {
2236  switch (data_type)
2237  {
2238  case ImGuiDataType_S8: return DataTypeClampT<ImS8 >((ImS8 *)p_data, (const ImS8 *)p_min, (const ImS8 *)p_max);
2239  case ImGuiDataType_U8: return DataTypeClampT<ImU8 >((ImU8 *)p_data, (const ImU8 *)p_min, (const ImU8 *)p_max);
2240  case ImGuiDataType_S16: return DataTypeClampT<ImS16 >((ImS16 *)p_data, (const ImS16 *)p_min, (const ImS16 *)p_max);
2241  case ImGuiDataType_U16: return DataTypeClampT<ImU16 >((ImU16 *)p_data, (const ImU16 *)p_min, (const ImU16 *)p_max);
2242  case ImGuiDataType_S32: return DataTypeClampT<ImS32 >((ImS32 *)p_data, (const ImS32 *)p_min, (const ImS32 *)p_max);
2243  case ImGuiDataType_U32: return DataTypeClampT<ImU32 >((ImU32 *)p_data, (const ImU32 *)p_min, (const ImU32 *)p_max);
2244  case ImGuiDataType_S64: return DataTypeClampT<ImS64 >((ImS64 *)p_data, (const ImS64 *)p_min, (const ImS64 *)p_max);
2245  case ImGuiDataType_U64: return DataTypeClampT<ImU64 >((ImU64 *)p_data, (const ImU64 *)p_min, (const ImU64 *)p_max);
2246  case ImGuiDataType_Float: return DataTypeClampT<float >((float *)p_data, (const float *)p_min, (const float *)p_max);
2247  case ImGuiDataType_Double: return DataTypeClampT<double>((double *)p_data, (const double *)p_min, (const double *)p_max);
2248  case ImGuiDataType_COUNT: break;
2249  }
2250  IM_ASSERT(0);
2251  return false;
2252 }
2253 
2254 static float GetMinimumStepAtDecimalPrecision(int decimal_precision)
2255 {
2256  static const float min_steps[10] = { 1.0f, 0.1f, 0.01f, 0.001f, 0.0001f, 0.00001f, 0.000001f, 0.0000001f, 0.00000001f, 0.000000001f };
2257  if (decimal_precision < 0)
2258  return FLT_MIN;
2259  return (decimal_precision < IM_ARRAYSIZE(min_steps)) ? min_steps[decimal_precision] : ImPow(10.0f, (float)-decimal_precision);
2260 }
2261 
2262 template<typename TYPE>
2263 static const char *ImAtoi(const char *src, TYPE *output)
2264 {
2265  int negative = 0;
2266  if (*src == '-')
2267  {
2268  negative = 1; src++;
2269  }
2270  if (*src == '+')
2271  {
2272  src++;
2273  }
2274  TYPE v = 0;
2275  while (*src >= '0' && *src <= '9')
2276  v = (v * 10) + (*src++ - '0');
2277  *output = negative ? -v : v;
2278  return src;
2279 }
2280 
2281 // Sanitize format
2282 // - Zero terminate so extra characters after format (e.g. "%f123") don't confuse atof/atoi
2283 // - stb_sprintf.h supports several new modifiers which format numbers in a way that also makes them incompatible atof/atoi.
2284 static void SanitizeFormatString(const char *fmt, char *fmt_out, size_t fmt_out_size)
2285 {
2286  IM_UNUSED(fmt_out_size);
2287  const char *fmt_end = ImParseFormatFindEnd(fmt);
2288  IM_ASSERT((size_t)(fmt_end - fmt + 1) < fmt_out_size); // Format is too long, let us know if this happens to you!
2289  while (fmt < fmt_end)
2290  {
2291  char c = *(fmt++);
2292  if (c != '\'' && c != '$' && c != '_') // Custom flags provided by stb_sprintf.h. POSIX 2008 also supports '.
2293  *(fmt_out++) = c;
2294  }
2295  *fmt_out = 0; // Zero-terminate
2296 }
2297 
2298 template<typename TYPE, typename SIGNEDTYPE>
2299 TYPE ImGui::RoundScalarWithFormatT(const char *format, ImGuiDataType data_type, TYPE v)
2300 {
2301  const char *fmt_start = ImParseFormatFindStart(format);
2302  if (fmt_start[0] != '%' || fmt_start[1] == '%') // Don't apply if the value is not visible in the format string
2303  return v;
2304 
2305  // Sanitize format
2306  char fmt_sanitized[32];
2307  SanitizeFormatString(fmt_start, fmt_sanitized, IM_ARRAYSIZE(fmt_sanitized));
2308  fmt_start = fmt_sanitized;
2309 
2310  // Format value with our rounding, and read back
2311  char v_str[64];
2312  ImFormatString(v_str, IM_ARRAYSIZE(v_str), fmt_start, v);
2313  const char *p = v_str;
2314  while (*p == ' ')
2315  p++;
2316  if (data_type == ImGuiDataType_Float || data_type == ImGuiDataType_Double)
2317  v = (TYPE)ImAtof(p);
2318  else
2319  ImAtoi(p, (SIGNEDTYPE *)&v);
2320  return v;
2321 }
2322 
2323 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
2324 // [SECTION] Widgets: DragScalar, DragFloat, DragInt, etc.
2325 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
2326 // - DragBehaviorT<>() [Internal]
2327 // - DragBehavior() [Internal]
2328 // - DragScalar()
2329 // - DragScalarN()
2330 // - DragFloat()
2331 // - DragFloat2()
2332 // - DragFloat3()
2333 // - DragFloat4()
2334 // - DragFloatRange2()
2335 // - DragInt()
2336 // - DragInt2()
2337 // - DragInt3()
2338 // - DragInt4()
2339 // - DragIntRange2()
2340 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
2341 
2342 // This is called by DragBehavior() when the widget is active (held by mouse or being manipulated with Nav controls)
2343 template<typename TYPE, typename SIGNEDTYPE, typename FLOATTYPE>
2344 bool ImGui::DragBehaviorT(ImGuiDataType data_type, TYPE *v, float v_speed, const TYPE v_min, const TYPE v_max, const char *format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
2345 {
2346  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
2347  const ImGuiAxis axis = (flags & ImGuiSliderFlags_Vertical) ? ImGuiAxis_Y : ImGuiAxis_X;
2348  const bool is_clamped = (v_min < v_max);
2349  const bool is_logarithmic = (flags & ImGuiSliderFlags_Logarithmic) != 0;
2350  const bool is_floating_point = (data_type == ImGuiDataType_Float) || (data_type == ImGuiDataType_Double);
2351 
2352  // Default tweak speed
2353  if (v_speed == 0.0f && is_clamped && (v_max - v_min < FLT_MAX))
2354  v_speed = (float)((v_max - v_min) * g.DragSpeedDefaultRatio);
2355 
2356  // Inputs accumulates into g.DragCurrentAccum, which is flushed into the current value as soon as it makes a difference with our precision settings
2357  float adjust_delta = 0.0f;
2358  if (g.ActiveIdSource == ImGuiInputSource_Mouse && IsMousePosValid() && IsMouseDragPastThreshold(0, g.IO.MouseDragThreshold * DRAG_MOUSE_THRESHOLD_FACTOR))
2359  {
2360  adjust_delta = g.IO.MouseDelta[axis];
2361  if (g.IO.KeyAlt)
2362  adjust_delta *= 1.0f / 100.0f;
2363  if (g.IO.KeyShift)
2364  adjust_delta *= 10.0f;
2365  }
2366  else if (g.ActiveIdSource == ImGuiInputSource_Nav)
2367  {
2368  const int decimal_precision = is_floating_point ? ImParseFormatPrecision(format, 3) : 0;
2369  adjust_delta = GetNavInputAmount2d(ImGuiNavDirSourceFlags_Keyboard | ImGuiNavDirSourceFlags_PadDPad, ImGuiInputReadMode_RepeatFast, 1.0f / 10.0f, 10.0f)[axis];
2370  v_speed = ImMax(v_speed, GetMinimumStepAtDecimalPrecision(decimal_precision));
2371  }
2372  adjust_delta *= v_speed;
2373 
2374  // For vertical drag we currently assume that Up=higher value (like we do with vertical sliders). This may become a parameter.
2375  if (axis == ImGuiAxis_Y)
2376  adjust_delta = -adjust_delta;
2377 
2378  // For logarithmic use our range is effectively 0..1 so scale the delta into that range
2379  if (is_logarithmic && (v_max - v_min < FLT_MAX) && ((v_max - v_min) > 0.000001f)) // Epsilon to avoid /0
2380  adjust_delta /= (float)(v_max - v_min);
2381 
2382  // Clear current value on activation
2383  // Avoid altering values and clamping when we are _already_ past the limits and heading in the same direction, so e.g. if range is 0..255, current value is 300 and we are pushing to the right side, keep the 300.
2384  bool is_just_activated = g.ActiveIdIsJustActivated;
2385  bool is_already_past_limits_and_pushing_outward = is_clamped && ((*v >= v_max && adjust_delta > 0.0f) || (*v <= v_min && adjust_delta < 0.0f));
2386  if (is_just_activated || is_already_past_limits_and_pushing_outward)
2387  {
2388  g.DragCurrentAccum = 0.0f;
2389  g.DragCurrentAccumDirty = false;
2390  }
2391  else if (adjust_delta != 0.0f)
2392  {
2393  g.DragCurrentAccum += adjust_delta;
2394  g.DragCurrentAccumDirty = true;
2395  }
2396 
2397  if (!g.DragCurrentAccumDirty)
2398  return false;
2399 
2400  TYPE v_cur = *v;
2401  FLOATTYPE v_old_ref_for_accum_remainder = (FLOATTYPE)0.0f;
2402 
2403  float logarithmic_zero_epsilon = 0.0f; // Only valid when is_logarithmic is true
2404  const float zero_deadzone_halfsize = 0.0f; // Drag widgets have no deadzone (as it doesn't make sense)
2405  if (is_logarithmic)
2406  {
2407  // When using logarithmic sliders, we need to clamp to avoid hitting zero, but our choice of clamp value greatly affects slider precision. We attempt to use the specified precision to estimate a good lower bound.
2408  const int decimal_precision = is_floating_point ? ImParseFormatPrecision(format, 3) : 1;
2409  logarithmic_zero_epsilon = ImPow(0.1f, (float)decimal_precision);
2410 
2411  // Convert to parametric space, apply delta, convert back
2412  float v_old_parametric = ScaleRatioFromValueT<TYPE, SIGNEDTYPE, FLOATTYPE>(data_type, v_cur, v_min, v_max, is_logarithmic, logarithmic_zero_epsilon, zero_deadzone_halfsize);
2413  float v_new_parametric = v_old_parametric + g.DragCurrentAccum;
2414  v_cur = ScaleValueFromRatioT<TYPE, SIGNEDTYPE, FLOATTYPE>(data_type, v_new_parametric, v_min, v_max, is_logarithmic, logarithmic_zero_epsilon, zero_deadzone_halfsize);
2415  v_old_ref_for_accum_remainder = v_old_parametric;
2416  }
2417  else
2418  {
2419  v_cur += (SIGNEDTYPE)g.DragCurrentAccum;
2420  }
2421 
2422  // Round to user desired precision based on format string
2423  if (!(flags & ImGuiSliderFlags_NoRoundToFormat))
2424  v_cur = RoundScalarWithFormatT<TYPE, SIGNEDTYPE>(format, data_type, v_cur);
2425 
2426  // Preserve remainder after rounding has been applied. This also allow slow tweaking of values.
2427  g.DragCurrentAccumDirty = false;
2428  if (is_logarithmic)
2429  {
2430  // Convert to parametric space, apply delta, convert back
2431  float v_new_parametric = ScaleRatioFromValueT<TYPE, SIGNEDTYPE, FLOATTYPE>(data_type, v_cur, v_min, v_max, is_logarithmic, logarithmic_zero_epsilon, zero_deadzone_halfsize);
2432  g.DragCurrentAccum -= (float)(v_new_parametric - v_old_ref_for_accum_remainder);
2433  }
2434  else
2435  {
2436  g.DragCurrentAccum -= (float)((SIGNEDTYPE)v_cur - (SIGNEDTYPE)*v);
2437  }
2438 
2439  // Lose zero sign for float/double
2440  if (v_cur == (TYPE)-0)
2441  v_cur = (TYPE)0;
2442 
2443  // Clamp values (+ handle overflow/wrap-around for integer types)
2444  if (*v != v_cur && is_clamped)
2445  {
2446  if (v_cur < v_min || (v_cur > *v && adjust_delta < 0.0f && !is_floating_point))
2447  v_cur = v_min;
2448  if (v_cur > v_max || (v_cur < *v && adjust_delta > 0.0f && !is_floating_point))
2449  v_cur = v_max;
2450  }
2451 
2452  // Apply result
2453  if (*v == v_cur)
2454  return false;
2455  *v = v_cur;
2456  return true;
2457 }
2458 
2459 bool ImGui::DragBehavior(ImGuiID id, ImGuiDataType data_type, void *p_v, float v_speed, const void *p_min, const void *p_max, const char *format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
2460 {
2461  // Read imgui.cpp "API BREAKING CHANGES" section for 1.78 if you hit this assert.
2462  IM_ASSERT((flags == 1 || (flags & ImGuiSliderFlags_InvalidMask_) == 0) && "Invalid ImGuiSliderFlags flags! Has the 'float power' argument been mistakenly cast to flags? Call function with ImGuiSliderFlags_Logarithmic flags instead.");
2463 
2464  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
2465  if (g.ActiveId == id)
2466  {
2467  if (g.ActiveIdSource == ImGuiInputSource_Mouse && !g.IO.MouseDown[0])
2468  ClearActiveID();
2469  else if (g.ActiveIdSource == ImGuiInputSource_Nav && g.NavActivatePressedId == id && !g.ActiveIdIsJustActivated)
2470  ClearActiveID();
2471  }
2472  if (g.ActiveId != id)
2473  return false;
2474  if ((g.LastItemData.InFlags & ImGuiItemFlags_ReadOnly) || (flags & ImGuiSliderFlags_ReadOnly))
2475  return false;
2476 
2477  switch (data_type)
2478  {
2479  case ImGuiDataType_S8:
2480  {
2481  ImS32 v32 = (ImS32) * (ImS8 *)p_v; bool r = DragBehaviorT<ImS32, ImS32, float>(ImGuiDataType_S32, &v32, v_speed, p_min ? *(const ImS8 *)p_min : IM_S8_MIN, p_max ? *(const ImS8 *)p_max : IM_S8_MAX, format, flags); if (r) *(ImS8 *)p_v = (ImS8)v32; return r;
2482  }
2483  case ImGuiDataType_U8:
2484  {
2485  ImU32 v32 = (ImU32) * (ImU8 *)p_v; bool r = DragBehaviorT<ImU32, ImS32, float>(ImGuiDataType_U32, &v32, v_speed, p_min ? *(const ImU8 *)p_min : IM_U8_MIN, p_max ? *(const ImU8 *)p_max : IM_U8_MAX, format, flags); if (r) *(ImU8 *)p_v = (ImU8)v32; return r;
2486  }
2487  case ImGuiDataType_S16:
2488  {
2489  ImS32 v32 = (ImS32) * (ImS16 *)p_v; bool r = DragBehaviorT<ImS32, ImS32, float>(ImGuiDataType_S32, &v32, v_speed, p_min ? *(const ImS16 *)p_min : IM_S16_MIN, p_max ? *(const ImS16 *)p_max : IM_S16_MAX, format, flags); if (r) *(ImS16 *)p_v = (ImS16)v32; return r;
2490  }
2491  case ImGuiDataType_U16:
2492  {
2493  ImU32 v32 = (ImU32) * (ImU16 *)p_v; bool r = DragBehaviorT<ImU32, ImS32, float>(ImGuiDataType_U32, &v32, v_speed, p_min ? *(const ImU16 *)p_min : IM_U16_MIN, p_max ? *(const ImU16 *)p_max : IM_U16_MAX, format, flags); if (r) *(ImU16 *)p_v = (ImU16)v32; return r;
2494  }
2495  case ImGuiDataType_S32: return DragBehaviorT<ImS32, ImS32, float >(data_type, (ImS32 *)p_v, v_speed, p_min ? *(const ImS32 *)p_min : IM_S32_MIN, p_max ? *(const ImS32 *)p_max : IM_S32_MAX, format, flags);
2496  case ImGuiDataType_U32: return DragBehaviorT<ImU32, ImS32, float >(data_type, (ImU32 *)p_v, v_speed, p_min ? *(const ImU32 *)p_min : IM_U32_MIN, p_max ? *(const ImU32 *)p_max : IM_U32_MAX, format, flags);
2497  case ImGuiDataType_S64: return DragBehaviorT<ImS64, ImS64, double>(data_type, (ImS64 *)p_v, v_speed, p_min ? *(const ImS64 *)p_min : IM_S64_MIN, p_max ? *(const ImS64 *)p_max : IM_S64_MAX, format, flags);
2498  case ImGuiDataType_U64: return DragBehaviorT<ImU64, ImS64, double>(data_type, (ImU64 *)p_v, v_speed, p_min ? *(const ImU64 *)p_min : IM_U64_MIN, p_max ? *(const ImU64 *)p_max : IM_U64_MAX, format, flags);
2499  case ImGuiDataType_Float: return DragBehaviorT<float, float, float >(data_type, (float *)p_v, v_speed, p_min ? *(const float *)p_min : -FLT_MAX, p_max ? *(const float *)p_max : FLT_MAX, format, flags);
2500  case ImGuiDataType_Double: return DragBehaviorT<double, double, double>(data_type, (double *)p_v, v_speed, p_min ? *(const double *)p_min : -DBL_MAX, p_max ? *(const double *)p_max : DBL_MAX, format, flags);
2501  case ImGuiDataType_COUNT: break;
2502  }
2503  IM_ASSERT(0);
2504  return false;
2505 }
2506 
2507 // Note: p_data, p_min and p_max are _pointers_ to a memory address holding the data. For a Drag widget, p_min and p_max are optional.
2508 // Read code of e.g. DragFloat(), DragInt() etc. or examples in 'Demo->Widgets->Data Types' to understand how to use this function directly.
2509 bool ImGui::DragScalar(const char *label, ImGuiDataType data_type, void *p_data, float v_speed, const void *p_min, const void *p_max, const char *format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
2510 {
2511  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
2512  if (window->SkipItems)
2513  return false;
2514 
2515  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
2516  const ImGuiStyle &style = g.Style;
2517  const ImGuiID id = window->GetID(label);
2518  const float w = CalcItemWidth();
2519 
2520  const ImVec2 label_size = CalcTextSize(label, NULL, true);
2521  const ImRect frame_bb(window->DC.CursorPos, window->DC.CursorPos + ImVec2(w, label_size.y + style.FramePadding.y * 2.0f));
2522  const ImRect total_bb(frame_bb.Min, frame_bb.Max + ImVec2(label_size.x > 0.0f ? style.ItemInnerSpacing.x + label_size.x : 0.0f, 0.0f));
2523 
2524  const bool temp_input_allowed = (flags & ImGuiSliderFlags_NoInput) == 0;
2525  ItemSize(total_bb, style.FramePadding.y);
2526  if (!ItemAdd(total_bb, id, &frame_bb, temp_input_allowed ? ImGuiItemAddFlags_Focusable : 0))
2527  return false;
2528 
2529  // Default format string when passing NULL
2530  if (format == NULL)
2531  format = DataTypeGetInfo(data_type)->PrintFmt;
2532  else if (data_type == ImGuiDataType_S32 && strcmp(format, "%d") != 0) // (FIXME-LEGACY: Patch old "%.0f" format string to use "%d", read function more details.)
2533  format = PatchFormatStringFloatToInt(format);
2534 
2535  // Tabbing or CTRL-clicking on Drag turns it into an InputText
2536  const bool hovered = ItemHoverable(frame_bb, id);
2537  bool temp_input_is_active = temp_input_allowed && TempInputIsActive(id);
2538  if (!temp_input_is_active)
2539  {
2540  const bool focus_requested = temp_input_allowed && (g.LastItemData.StatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Focused) != 0;
2541  const bool clicked = (hovered && g.IO.MouseClicked[0]);
2542  const bool double_clicked = (hovered && g.IO.MouseDoubleClicked[0]);
2543  if (focus_requested || clicked || double_clicked || g.NavActivateId == id || g.NavInputId == id)
2544  {
2545  SetActiveID(id, window);
2546  SetFocusID(id, window);
2547  FocusWindow(window);
2548  g.ActiveIdUsingNavDirMask = (1 << ImGuiDir_Left) | (1 << ImGuiDir_Right);
2549  if (temp_input_allowed && (focus_requested || (clicked && g.IO.KeyCtrl) || double_clicked || g.NavInputId == id))
2550  temp_input_is_active = true;
2551  }
2552  // Experimental: simple click (without moving) turns Drag into an InputText
2553  // FIXME: Currently polling ImGuiConfigFlags_IsTouchScreen, may either poll an hypothetical ImGuiBackendFlags_HasKeyboard and/or an explicit drag settings.
2554  if (g.IO.ConfigDragClickToInputText && temp_input_allowed && !temp_input_is_active)
2555  if (g.ActiveId == id && hovered && g.IO.MouseReleased[0] && !IsMouseDragPastThreshold(0, g.IO.MouseDragThreshold * DRAG_MOUSE_THRESHOLD_FACTOR))
2556  {
2557  g.NavInputId = id;
2558  temp_input_is_active = true;
2559  }
2560  }
2561 
2562  if (temp_input_is_active)
2563  {
2564  // Only clamp CTRL+Click input when ImGuiSliderFlags_AlwaysClamp is set
2565  const bool is_clamp_input = (flags & ImGuiSliderFlags_AlwaysClamp) != 0 && (p_min == NULL || p_max == NULL || DataTypeCompare(data_type, p_min, p_max) < 0);
2566  return TempInputScalar(frame_bb, id, label, data_type, p_data, format, is_clamp_input ? p_min : NULL, is_clamp_input ? p_max : NULL);
2567  }
2568 
2569  // Draw frame
2570  const ImU32 frame_col = GetColorU32(g.ActiveId == id ? ImGuiCol_FrameBgActive : hovered ? ImGuiCol_FrameBgHovered : ImGuiCol_FrameBg);
2571  RenderNavHighlight(frame_bb, id);
2572  RenderFrame(frame_bb.Min, frame_bb.Max, frame_col, true, style.FrameRounding);
2573 
2574  // Drag behavior
2575  const bool value_changed = DragBehavior(id, data_type, p_data, v_speed, p_min, p_max, format, flags);
2576  if (value_changed)
2577  MarkItemEdited(id);
2578 
2579  // Display value using user-provided display format so user can add prefix/suffix/decorations to the value.
2580  char value_buf[64];
2581  const char *value_buf_end = value_buf + DataTypeFormatString(value_buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(value_buf), data_type, p_data, format);
2582  if (g.LogEnabled)
2583  LogSetNextTextDecoration("{", "}");
2584  RenderTextClipped(frame_bb.Min, frame_bb.Max, value_buf, value_buf_end, NULL, ImVec2(0.5f, 0.5f));
2585 
2586  if (label_size.x > 0.0f)
2587  RenderText(ImVec2(frame_bb.Max.x + style.ItemInnerSpacing.x, frame_bb.Min.y + style.FramePadding.y), label);
2588 
2589  IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ITEM_INFO(id, label, g.LastItemData.StatusFlags);
2590  return value_changed;
2591 }
2592 
2593 bool ImGui::DragScalarN(const char *label, ImGuiDataType data_type, void *p_data, int components, float v_speed, const void *p_min, const void *p_max, const char *format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
2594 {
2595  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
2596  if (window->SkipItems)
2597  return false;
2598 
2599  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
2600  bool value_changed = false;
2601  BeginGroup();
2602  PushID(label);
2603  PushMultiItemsWidths(components, CalcItemWidth());
2604  size_t type_size = GDataTypeInfo[data_type].Size;
2605  for (int i = 0; i < components; i++)
2606  {
2607  PushID(i);
2608  if (i > 0)
2609  SameLine(0, g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x);
2610  value_changed |= DragScalar("", data_type, p_data, v_speed, p_min, p_max, format, flags);
2611  PopID();
2612  PopItemWidth();
2613  p_data = (void *)((char *)p_data + type_size);
2614  }
2615  PopID();
2616 
2617  const char *label_end = FindRenderedTextEnd(label);
2618  if (label != label_end)
2619  {
2620  SameLine(0, g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x);
2621  TextEx(label, label_end);
2622  }
2623 
2624  EndGroup();
2625  return value_changed;
2626 }
2627 
2628 bool ImGui::DragFloat(const char *label, float *v, float v_speed, float v_min, float v_max, const char *format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
2629 {
2630  return DragScalar(label, ImGuiDataType_Float, v, v_speed, &v_min, &v_max, format, flags);
2631 }
2632 
2633 bool ImGui::DragFloat2(const char *label, float v[2], float v_speed, float v_min, float v_max, const char *format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
2634 {
2635  return DragScalarN(label, ImGuiDataType_Float, v, 2, v_speed, &v_min, &v_max, format, flags);
2636 }
2637 
2638 bool ImGui::DragFloat3(const char *label, float v[3], float v_speed, float v_min, float v_max, const char *format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
2639 {
2640  return DragScalarN(label, ImGuiDataType_Float, v, 3, v_speed, &v_min, &v_max, format, flags);
2641 }
2642 
2643 bool ImGui::DragFloat4(const char *label, float v[4], float v_speed, float v_min, float v_max, const char *format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
2644 {
2645  return DragScalarN(label, ImGuiDataType_Float, v, 4, v_speed, &v_min, &v_max, format, flags);
2646 }
2647 
2648 // NB: You likely want to specify the ImGuiSliderFlags_AlwaysClamp when using this.
2649 bool ImGui::DragFloatRange2(const char *label, float *v_current_min, float *v_current_max, float v_speed, float v_min, float v_max, const char *format, const char *format_max, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
2650 {
2651  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
2652  if (window->SkipItems)
2653  return false;
2654 
2655  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
2656  PushID(label);
2657  BeginGroup();
2658  PushMultiItemsWidths(2, CalcItemWidth());
2659 
2660  float min_min = (v_min >= v_max) ? -FLT_MAX : v_min;
2661  float min_max = (v_min >= v_max) ? *v_current_max : ImMin(v_max, *v_current_max);
2662  ImGuiSliderFlags min_flags = flags | ((min_min == min_max) ? ImGuiSliderFlags_ReadOnly : 0);
2663  bool value_changed = DragScalar("##min", ImGuiDataType_Float, v_current_min, v_speed, &min_min, &min_max, format, min_flags);
2664  PopItemWidth();
2665  SameLine(0, g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x);
2666 
2667  float max_min = (v_min >= v_max) ? *v_current_min : ImMax(v_min, *v_current_min);
2668  float max_max = (v_min >= v_max) ? FLT_MAX : v_max;
2669  ImGuiSliderFlags max_flags = flags | ((max_min == max_max) ? ImGuiSliderFlags_ReadOnly : 0);
2670  value_changed |= DragScalar("##max", ImGuiDataType_Float, v_current_max, v_speed, &max_min, &max_max, format_max ? format_max : format, max_flags);
2671  PopItemWidth();
2672  SameLine(0, g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x);
2673 
2674  TextEx(label, FindRenderedTextEnd(label));
2675  EndGroup();
2676  PopID();
2677 
2678  return value_changed;
2679 }
2680 
2681 // NB: v_speed is float to allow adjusting the drag speed with more precision
2682 bool ImGui::DragInt(const char *label, int *v, float v_speed, int v_min, int v_max, const char *format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
2683 {
2684  return DragScalar(label, ImGuiDataType_S32, v, v_speed, &v_min, &v_max, format, flags);
2685 }
2686 
2687 bool ImGui::DragInt2(const char *label, int v[2], float v_speed, int v_min, int v_max, const char *format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
2688 {
2689  return DragScalarN(label, ImGuiDataType_S32, v, 2, v_speed, &v_min, &v_max, format, flags);
2690 }
2691 
2692 bool ImGui::DragInt3(const char *label, int v[3], float v_speed, int v_min, int v_max, const char *format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
2693 {
2694  return DragScalarN(label, ImGuiDataType_S32, v, 3, v_speed, &v_min, &v_max, format, flags);
2695 }

2697 bool ImGui::DragInt4(const char *label, int v[4], float v_speed, int v_min, int v_max, const char *format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
2698 {

2700 }
2701 
2702 // NB: You likely want to specify the ImGuiSliderFlags_AlwaysClamp when using this.
2703 bool ImGui::DragIntRange2(const char *label, int *v_current_min, int *v_current_max, float v_speed, int v_min, int v_max, const char *format, const char *format_max, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
2704 {
2705  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
2706  if (window->SkipItems)
2707  return false;
2708 
2709  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
2710  PushID(label);
2711  BeginGroup();
2712  PushMultiItemsWidths(2, CalcItemWidth());
2713 
2714  int min_min = (v_min >= v_max) ? INT_MIN : v_min;
2715  int min_max = (v_min >= v_max) ? *v_current_max : ImMin(v_max, *v_current_max);
2716  ImGuiSliderFlags min_flags = flags | ((min_min == min_max) ? ImGuiSliderFlags_ReadOnly : 0);
2717  bool value_changed = DragInt("##min", v_current_min, v_speed, min_min, min_max, format, min_flags);
2718  PopItemWidth();
2719  SameLine(0, g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x);
2720 
2721  int max_min = (v_min >= v_max) ? *v_current_min : ImMax(v_min, *v_current_min);
2722  int max_max = (v_min >= v_max) ? INT_MAX : v_max;
2723  ImGuiSliderFlags max_flags = flags | ((max_min == max_max) ? ImGuiSliderFlags_ReadOnly : 0);
2724  value_changed |= DragInt("##max", v_current_max, v_speed, max_min, max_max, format_max ? format_max : format, max_flags);
2725  PopItemWidth();
2726  SameLine(0, g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x);
2727 
2728  TextEx(label, FindRenderedTextEnd(label));
2729  EndGroup();
2730  PopID();
2731 
2732  return value_changed;
2733 }
2734 
2735 #ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
2736 
2737 // Obsolete versions with power parameter. See https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/issues/3361 for details.
2738 bool ImGui::DragScalar(const char *label, ImGuiDataType data_type, void *p_data, float v_speed, const void *p_min, const void *p_max, const char *format, float power)
2739 {
2740  ImGuiSliderFlags drag_flags = ImGuiSliderFlags_None;
2741  if (power != 1.0f)
2742  {
2743  IM_ASSERT(power == 1.0f && "Call function with ImGuiSliderFlags_Logarithmic flags instead of using the old 'float power' function!");
2744  IM_ASSERT(p_min != NULL && p_max != NULL); // When using a power curve the drag needs to have known bounds
2745  drag_flags |= ImGuiSliderFlags_Logarithmic; // Fallback for non-asserting paths
2746  }
2747  return DragScalar(label, data_type, p_data, v_speed, p_min, p_max, format, drag_flags);
2748 }
2749 
2750 bool ImGui::DragScalarN(const char *label, ImGuiDataType data_type, void *p_data, int components, float v_speed, const void *p_min, const void *p_max, const char *format, float power)
2751 {
2752  ImGuiSliderFlags drag_flags = ImGuiSliderFlags_None;
2753  if (power != 1.0f)
2754  {
2755  IM_ASSERT(power == 1.0f && "Call function with ImGuiSliderFlags_Logarithmic flags instead of using the old 'float power' function!");
2756  IM_ASSERT(p_min != NULL && p_max != NULL); // When using a power curve the drag needs to have known bounds
2757  drag_flags |= ImGuiSliderFlags_Logarithmic; // Fallback for non-asserting paths
2758  }
2759  return DragScalarN(label, data_type, p_data, components, v_speed, p_min, p_max, format, drag_flags);
2760 }
2761 
2762 #endif // IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
2763 
2764 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
2765 // [SECTION] Widgets: SliderScalar, SliderFloat, SliderInt, etc.
2766 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
2767 // - ScaleRatioFromValueT<> [Internal]
2768 // - ScaleValueFromRatioT<> [Internal]
2769 // - SliderBehaviorT<>() [Internal]
2770 // - SliderBehavior() [Internal]
2771 // - SliderScalar()
2772 // - SliderScalarN()
2773 // - SliderFloat()
2774 // - SliderFloat2()
2775 // - SliderFloat3()
2776 // - SliderFloat4()
2777 // - SliderAngle()
2778 // - SliderInt()
2779 // - SliderInt2()
2780 // - SliderInt3()
2781 // - SliderInt4()
2782 // - VSliderScalar()
2783 // - VSliderFloat()
2784 // - VSliderInt()
2785 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
2786 
2787 // Convert a value v in the output space of a slider into a parametric position on the slider itself (the logical opposite of ScaleValueFromRatioT)
2788 template<typename TYPE, typename SIGNEDTYPE, typename FLOATTYPE>
2789 float ImGui::ScaleRatioFromValueT(ImGuiDataType data_type, TYPE v, TYPE v_min, TYPE v_max, bool is_logarithmic, float logarithmic_zero_epsilon, float zero_deadzone_halfsize)
2790 {
2791  if (v_min == v_max)
2792  return 0.0f;
2793  IM_UNUSED(data_type);
2794 
2795  const TYPE v_clamped = (v_min < v_max) ? ImClamp(v, v_min, v_max) : ImClamp(v, v_max, v_min);
2796  if (is_logarithmic)
2797  {
2798  bool flipped = v_max < v_min;
2799 
2800  if (flipped) // Handle the case where the range is backwards
2801  ImSwap(v_min, v_max);
2802 
2803  // Fudge min/max to avoid getting close to log(0)
2804  FLOATTYPE v_min_fudged = (ImAbs((FLOATTYPE)v_min) < logarithmic_zero_epsilon) ? ((v_min < 0.0f) ? -logarithmic_zero_epsilon : logarithmic_zero_epsilon) : (FLOATTYPE)v_min;
2805  FLOATTYPE v_max_fudged = (ImAbs((FLOATTYPE)v_max) < logarithmic_zero_epsilon) ? ((v_max < 0.0f) ? -logarithmic_zero_epsilon : logarithmic_zero_epsilon) : (FLOATTYPE)v_max;
2806 
2807  // Awkward special cases - we need ranges of the form (-100 .. 0) to convert to (-100 .. -epsilon), not (-100 .. epsilon)
2808  if ((v_min == 0.0f) && (v_max < 0.0f))
2809  v_min_fudged = -logarithmic_zero_epsilon;
2810  else if ((v_max == 0.0f) && (v_min < 0.0f))
2811  v_max_fudged = -logarithmic_zero_epsilon;
2812 
2813  float result;
2814 
2815  if (v_clamped <= v_min_fudged)
2816  result = 0.0f; // Workaround for values that are in-range but below our fudge
2817  else if (v_clamped >= v_max_fudged)
2818  result = 1.0f; // Workaround for values that are in-range but above our fudge
2819  else if ((v_min * v_max) < 0.0f) // Range crosses zero, so split into two portions
2820  {
2821  float zero_point_center = (-(float)v_min) / ((float)v_max - (float)v_min); // The zero point in parametric space. There's an argument we should take the logarithmic nature into account when calculating this, but for now this should do (and the most common case of a symmetrical range works fine)
2822  float zero_point_snap_L = zero_point_center - zero_deadzone_halfsize;
2823  float zero_point_snap_R = zero_point_center + zero_deadzone_halfsize;
2824  if (v == 0.0f)
2825  result = zero_point_center; // Special case for exactly zero
2826  else if (v < 0.0f)
2827  result = (1.0f - (float)(ImLog(-(FLOATTYPE)v_clamped / logarithmic_zero_epsilon) / ImLog(-v_min_fudged / logarithmic_zero_epsilon))) * zero_point_snap_L;
2828  else
2829  result = zero_point_snap_R + ((float)(ImLog((FLOATTYPE)v_clamped / logarithmic_zero_epsilon) / ImLog(v_max_fudged / logarithmic_zero_epsilon)) * (1.0f - zero_point_snap_R));
2830  }
2831  else if ((v_min < 0.0f) || (v_max < 0.0f)) // Entirely negative slider
2832  result = 1.0f - (float)(ImLog(-(FLOATTYPE)v_clamped / -v_max_fudged) / ImLog(-v_min_fudged / -v_max_fudged));
2833  else
2834  result = (float)(ImLog((FLOATTYPE)v_clamped / v_min_fudged) / ImLog(v_max_fudged / v_min_fudged));
2835 
2836  return flipped ? (1.0f - result) : result;
2837  }
2838 
2839  // Linear slider
2840  return (float)((FLOATTYPE)(SIGNEDTYPE)(v_clamped - v_min) / (FLOATTYPE)(SIGNEDTYPE)(v_max - v_min));
2841 }
2842 
2843 // Convert a parametric position on a slider into a value v in the output space (the logical opposite of ScaleRatioFromValueT)
2844 template<typename TYPE, typename SIGNEDTYPE, typename FLOATTYPE>
2845 TYPE ImGui::ScaleValueFromRatioT(ImGuiDataType data_type, float t, TYPE v_min, TYPE v_max, bool is_logarithmic, float logarithmic_zero_epsilon, float zero_deadzone_halfsize)
2846 {
2847  if (v_min == v_max)
2848  return v_min;
2849  const bool is_floating_point = (data_type == ImGuiDataType_Float) || (data_type == ImGuiDataType_Double);
2850 
2851  TYPE result;
2852  if (is_logarithmic)
2853  {
2854  // We special-case the extents because otherwise our fudging can lead to "mathematically correct" but non-intuitive behaviors like a fully-left slider not actually reaching the minimum value
2855  if (t <= 0.0f)
2856  result = v_min;
2857  else if (t >= 1.0f)
2858  result = v_max;
2859  else
2860  {
2861  bool flipped = v_max < v_min; // Check if range is "backwards"
2862 
2863  // Fudge min/max to avoid getting silly results close to zero
2864  FLOATTYPE v_min_fudged = (ImAbs((FLOATTYPE)v_min) < logarithmic_zero_epsilon) ? ((v_min < 0.0f) ? -logarithmic_zero_epsilon : logarithmic_zero_epsilon) : (FLOATTYPE)v_min;
2865  FLOATTYPE v_max_fudged = (ImAbs((FLOATTYPE)v_max) < logarithmic_zero_epsilon) ? ((v_max < 0.0f) ? -logarithmic_zero_epsilon : logarithmic_zero_epsilon) : (FLOATTYPE)v_max;
2866 
2867  if (flipped)
2868  ImSwap(v_min_fudged, v_max_fudged);
2869 
2870  // Awkward special case - we need ranges of the form (-100 .. 0) to convert to (-100 .. -epsilon), not (-100 .. epsilon)
2871  if ((v_max == 0.0f) && (v_min < 0.0f))
2872  v_max_fudged = -logarithmic_zero_epsilon;
2873 
2874  float t_with_flip = flipped ? (1.0f - t) : t; // t, but flipped if necessary to account for us flipping the range
2875 
2876  if ((v_min * v_max) < 0.0f) // Range crosses zero, so we have to do this in two parts
2877  {
2878  float zero_point_center = (-(float)ImMin(v_min, v_max)) / ImAbs((float)v_max - (float)v_min); // The zero point in parametric space
2879  float zero_point_snap_L = zero_point_center - zero_deadzone_halfsize;
2880  float zero_point_snap_R = zero_point_center + zero_deadzone_halfsize;
2881  if (t_with_flip >= zero_point_snap_L && t_with_flip <= zero_point_snap_R)
2882  result = (TYPE)0.0f; // Special case to make getting exactly zero possible (the epsilon prevents it otherwise)
2883  else if (t_with_flip < zero_point_center)
2884  result = (TYPE)-(logarithmic_zero_epsilon * ImPow(-v_min_fudged / logarithmic_zero_epsilon, (FLOATTYPE)(1.0f - (t_with_flip / zero_point_snap_L))));
2885  else
2886  result = (TYPE)(logarithmic_zero_epsilon * ImPow(v_max_fudged / logarithmic_zero_epsilon, (FLOATTYPE)((t_with_flip - zero_point_snap_R) / (1.0f - zero_point_snap_R))));
2887  }
2888  else if ((v_min < 0.0f) || (v_max < 0.0f)) // Entirely negative slider
2889  result = (TYPE)-(-v_max_fudged * ImPow(-v_min_fudged / -v_max_fudged, (FLOATTYPE)(1.0f - t_with_flip)));
2890  else
2891  result = (TYPE)(v_min_fudged * ImPow(v_max_fudged / v_min_fudged, (FLOATTYPE)t_with_flip));
2892  }
2893  }
2894  else
2895  {
2896  // Linear slider
2897  if (is_floating_point)
2898  {
2899  result = ImLerp(v_min, v_max, t);
2900  }
2901  else
2902  {
2903  // - For integer values we want the clicking position to match the grab box so we round above
2904  // This code is carefully tuned to work with large values (e.g. high ranges of U64) while preserving this property..
2905  // - Not doing a *1.0 multiply at the end of a range as it tends to be lossy. While absolute aiming at a large s64/u64
2906  // range is going to be imprecise anyway, with this check we at least make the edge values matches expected limits.
2907  if (t < 1.0)
2908  {
2909  FLOATTYPE v_new_off_f = (SIGNEDTYPE)(v_max - v_min) * t;
2910  result = (TYPE)((SIGNEDTYPE)v_min + (SIGNEDTYPE)(v_new_off_f + (FLOATTYPE)(v_min > v_max ? -0.5 : 0.5)));
2911  }
2912  else
2913  {
2914  result = v_max;
2915  }
2916  }
2917  }
2918 
2919  return result;
2920 }
2921 
2922 // FIXME: Move more of the code into SliderBehavior()
2923 template<typename TYPE, typename SIGNEDTYPE, typename FLOATTYPE>
2924 bool ImGui::SliderBehaviorT(const ImRect &bb, ImGuiID id, ImGuiDataType data_type, TYPE *v, const TYPE v_min, const TYPE v_max, const char *format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags, ImRect *out_grab_bb)
2925 {
2926  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
2927  const ImGuiStyle &style = g.Style;
2928 
2929  const ImGuiAxis axis = (flags & ImGuiSliderFlags_Vertical) ? ImGuiAxis_Y : ImGuiAxis_X;
2930  const bool is_logarithmic = (flags & ImGuiSliderFlags_Logarithmic) != 0;
2931  const bool is_floating_point = (data_type == ImGuiDataType_Float) || (data_type == ImGuiDataType_Double);
2932 
2933  const float grab_padding = 2.0f;
2934  const float slider_sz = (bb.Max[axis] - bb.Min[axis]) - grab_padding * 2.0f;
2935  float grab_sz = style.GrabMinSize;
2936  SIGNEDTYPE v_range = (v_min < v_max ? v_max - v_min : v_min - v_max);
2937  if (!is_floating_point && v_range >= 0) // v_range < 0 may happen on integer overflows
2938  grab_sz = ImMax((float)(slider_sz / (v_range + 1)), style.GrabMinSize); // For integer sliders: if possible have the grab size represent 1 unit
2939  grab_sz = ImMin(grab_sz, slider_sz);
2940  const float slider_usable_sz = slider_sz - grab_sz;
2941  const float slider_usable_pos_min = bb.Min[axis] + grab_padding + grab_sz * 0.5f;
2942  const float slider_usable_pos_max = bb.Max[axis] - grab_padding - grab_sz * 0.5f;
2943 
2944  float logarithmic_zero_epsilon = 0.0f; // Only valid when is_logarithmic is true
2945  float zero_deadzone_halfsize = 0.0f; // Only valid when is_logarithmic is true
2946  if (is_logarithmic)
2947  {
2948  // When using logarithmic sliders, we need to clamp to avoid hitting zero, but our choice of clamp value greatly affects slider precision. We attempt to use the specified precision to estimate a good lower bound.
2949  const int decimal_precision = is_floating_point ? ImParseFormatPrecision(format, 3) : 1;
2950  logarithmic_zero_epsilon = ImPow(0.1f, (float)decimal_precision);
2951  zero_deadzone_halfsize = (style.LogSliderDeadzone * 0.5f) / ImMax(slider_usable_sz, 1.0f);
2952  }
2953 
2954  // Process interacting with the slider
2955  bool value_changed = false;
2956  if (g.ActiveId == id)
2957  {
2958  bool set_new_value = false;
2959  float clicked_t = 0.0f;
2960  if (g.ActiveIdSource == ImGuiInputSource_Mouse)
2961  {
2962  if (!g.IO.MouseDown[0])
2963  {
2964  ClearActiveID();
2965  }
2966  else
2967  {
2968  const float mouse_abs_pos = g.IO.MousePos[axis];
2969  clicked_t = (slider_usable_sz > 0.0f) ? ImClamp((mouse_abs_pos - slider_usable_pos_min) / slider_usable_sz, 0.0f, 1.0f) : 0.0f;
2970  if (axis == ImGuiAxis_Y)
2971  clicked_t = 1.0f - clicked_t;
2972  set_new_value = true;
2973  }
2974  }
2975  else if (g.ActiveIdSource == ImGuiInputSource_Nav)
2976  {
2977  if (g.ActiveIdIsJustActivated)
2978  {
2979  g.SliderCurrentAccum = 0.0f; // Reset any stored nav delta upon activation
2980  g.SliderCurrentAccumDirty = false;
2981  }
2982 
2983  const ImVec2 input_delta2 = GetNavInputAmount2d(ImGuiNavDirSourceFlags_Keyboard | ImGuiNavDirSourceFlags_PadDPad, ImGuiInputReadMode_RepeatFast, 0.0f, 0.0f);
2984  float input_delta = (axis == ImGuiAxis_X) ? input_delta2.x : -input_delta2.y;
2985  if (input_delta != 0.0f)
2986  {
2987  const int decimal_precision = is_floating_point ? ImParseFormatPrecision(format, 3) : 0;
2988  if (decimal_precision > 0)
2989  {
2990  input_delta /= 100.0f; // Gamepad/keyboard tweak speeds in % of slider bounds
2991  if (IsNavInputDown(ImGuiNavInput_TweakSlow))
2992  input_delta /= 10.0f;
2993  }
2994  else
2995  {
2996  if ((v_range >= -100.0f && v_range <= 100.0f) || IsNavInputDown(ImGuiNavInput_TweakSlow))
2997  input_delta = ((input_delta < 0.0f) ? -1.0f : +1.0f) / (float)v_range; // Gamepad/keyboard tweak speeds in integer steps
2998  else
2999  input_delta /= 100.0f;
3000  }
3001  if (IsNavInputDown(ImGuiNavInput_TweakFast))
3002  input_delta *= 10.0f;
3003 
3004  g.SliderCurrentAccum += input_delta;
3005  g.SliderCurrentAccumDirty = true;
3006  }
3007 
3008  float delta = g.SliderCurrentAccum;
3009  if (g.NavActivatePressedId == id && !g.ActiveIdIsJustActivated)
3010  {
3011  ClearActiveID();
3012  }
3013  else if (g.SliderCurrentAccumDirty)
3014  {
3015  clicked_t = ScaleRatioFromValueT<TYPE, SIGNEDTYPE, FLOATTYPE>(data_type, *v, v_min, v_max, is_logarithmic, logarithmic_zero_epsilon, zero_deadzone_halfsize);
3016 
3017  if ((clicked_t >= 1.0f && delta > 0.0f) || (clicked_t <= 0.0f && delta < 0.0f)) // This is to avoid applying the saturation when already past the limits
3018  {
3019  set_new_value = false;
3020  g.SliderCurrentAccum = 0.0f; // If pushing up against the limits, don't continue to accumulate
3021  }
3022  else
3023  {
3024  set_new_value = true;
3025  float old_clicked_t = clicked_t;
3026  clicked_t = ImSaturate(clicked_t + delta);
3027 
3028  // Calculate what our "new" clicked_t will be, and thus how far we actually moved the slider, and subtract this from the accumulator
3029  TYPE v_new = ScaleValueFromRatioT<TYPE, SIGNEDTYPE, FLOATTYPE>(data_type, clicked_t, v_min, v_max, is_logarithmic, logarithmic_zero_epsilon, zero_deadzone_halfsize);
3030  if (!(flags & ImGuiSliderFlags_NoRoundToFormat))
3031  v_new = RoundScalarWithFormatT<TYPE, SIGNEDTYPE>(format, data_type, v_new);
3032  float new_clicked_t = ScaleRatioFromValueT<TYPE, SIGNEDTYPE, FLOATTYPE>(data_type, v_new, v_min, v_max, is_logarithmic, logarithmic_zero_epsilon, zero_deadzone_halfsize);
3033 
3034  if (delta > 0)
3035  g.SliderCurrentAccum -= ImMin(new_clicked_t - old_clicked_t, delta);
3036  else
3037  g.SliderCurrentAccum -= ImMax(new_clicked_t - old_clicked_t, delta);
3038  }
3039 
3040  g.SliderCurrentAccumDirty = false;
3041  }
3042  }
3043 
3044  if (set_new_value)
3045  {
3046  TYPE v_new = ScaleValueFromRatioT<TYPE, SIGNEDTYPE, FLOATTYPE>(data_type, clicked_t, v_min, v_max, is_logarithmic, logarithmic_zero_epsilon, zero_deadzone_halfsize);
3047 
3048  // Round to user desired precision based on format string
3049  if (!(flags & ImGuiSliderFlags_NoRoundToFormat))
3050  v_new = RoundScalarWithFormatT<TYPE, SIGNEDTYPE>(format, data_type, v_new);
3051 
3052  // Apply result
3053  if (*v != v_new)
3054  {
3055  *v = v_new;
3056  value_changed = true;
3057  }
3058  }
3059  }
3060 
3061  if (slider_sz < 1.0f)
3062  {
3063  *out_grab_bb = ImRect(bb.Min, bb.Min);
3064  }
3065  else
3066  {
3067  // Output grab position so it can be displayed by the caller
3068  float grab_t = ScaleRatioFromValueT<TYPE, SIGNEDTYPE, FLOATTYPE>(data_type, *v, v_min, v_max, is_logarithmic, logarithmic_zero_epsilon, zero_deadzone_halfsize);
3069  if (axis == ImGuiAxis_Y)
3070  grab_t = 1.0f - grab_t;
3071  const float grab_pos = ImLerp(slider_usable_pos_min, slider_usable_pos_max, grab_t);
3072  if (axis == ImGuiAxis_X)
3073  *out_grab_bb = ImRect(grab_pos - grab_sz * 0.5f, bb.Min.y + grab_padding, grab_pos + grab_sz * 0.5f, bb.Max.y - grab_padding);
3074  else
3075  *out_grab_bb = ImRect(bb.Min.x + grab_padding, grab_pos - grab_sz * 0.5f, bb.Max.x - grab_padding, grab_pos + grab_sz * 0.5f);
3076  }
3077 
3078  return value_changed;
3079 }
3080 
3081 // For 32-bit and larger types, slider bounds are limited to half the natural type range.
3082 // So e.g. an integer Slider between INT_MAX-10 and INT_MAX will fail, but an integer Slider between INT_MAX/2-10 and INT_MAX/2 will be ok.
3083 // It would be possible to lift that limitation with some work but it doesn't seem to be worth it for sliders.
3084 bool ImGui::SliderBehavior(const ImRect &bb, ImGuiID id, ImGuiDataType data_type, void *p_v, const void *p_min, const void *p_max, const char *format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags, ImRect *out_grab_bb)
3085 {
3086  // Read imgui.cpp "API BREAKING CHANGES" section for 1.78 if you hit this assert.
3087  IM_ASSERT((flags == 1 || (flags & ImGuiSliderFlags_InvalidMask_) == 0) && "Invalid ImGuiSliderFlags flag! Has the 'float power' argument been mistakenly cast to flags? Call function with ImGuiSliderFlags_Logarithmic flags instead.");
3088 
3089  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
3090  if ((g.LastItemData.InFlags & ImGuiItemFlags_ReadOnly) || (flags & ImGuiSliderFlags_ReadOnly))
3091  return false;
3092 
3093  switch (data_type)
3094  {
3095  case ImGuiDataType_S8:
3096  {
3097  ImS32 v32 = (ImS32) * (ImS8 *)p_v; bool r = SliderBehaviorT<ImS32, ImS32, float>(bb, id, ImGuiDataType_S32, &v32, *(const ImS8 *)p_min, *(const ImS8 *)p_max, format, flags, out_grab_bb); if (r) *(ImS8 *)p_v = (ImS8)v32; return r;
3098  }
3099  case ImGuiDataType_U8:
3100  {
3101  ImU32 v32 = (ImU32) * (ImU8 *)p_v; bool r = SliderBehaviorT<ImU32, ImS32, float>(bb, id, ImGuiDataType_U32, &v32, *(const ImU8 *)p_min, *(const ImU8 *)p_max, format, flags, out_grab_bb); if (r) *(ImU8 *)p_v = (ImU8)v32; return r;
3102  }
3103  case ImGuiDataType_S16:
3104  {
3105  ImS32 v32 = (ImS32) * (ImS16 *)p_v; bool r = SliderBehaviorT<ImS32, ImS32, float>(bb, id, ImGuiDataType_S32, &v32, *(const ImS16 *)p_min, *(const ImS16 *)p_max, format, flags, out_grab_bb); if (r) *(ImS16 *)p_v = (ImS16)v32; return r;
3106  }
3107  case ImGuiDataType_U16:
3108  {
3109  ImU32 v32 = (ImU32) * (ImU16 *)p_v; bool r = SliderBehaviorT<ImU32, ImS32, float>(bb, id, ImGuiDataType_U32, &v32, *(const ImU16 *)p_min, *(const ImU16 *)p_max, format, flags, out_grab_bb); if (r) *(ImU16 *)p_v = (ImU16)v32; return r;
3110  }
3111  case ImGuiDataType_S32:
3112  IM_ASSERT(*(const ImS32 *)p_min >= IM_S32_MIN / 2 && *(const ImS32 *)p_max <= IM_S32_MAX / 2);
3113  return SliderBehaviorT<ImS32, ImS32, float >(bb, id, data_type, (ImS32 *)p_v, *(const ImS32 *)p_min, *(const ImS32 *)p_max, format, flags, out_grab_bb);
3114  case ImGuiDataType_U32:
3115  IM_ASSERT(*(const ImU32 *)p_max <= IM_U32_MAX / 2);
3116  return SliderBehaviorT<ImU32, ImS32, float >(bb, id, data_type, (ImU32 *)p_v, *(const ImU32 *)p_min, *(const ImU32 *)p_max, format, flags, out_grab_bb);
3117  case ImGuiDataType_S64:
3118  IM_ASSERT(*(const ImS64 *)p_min >= IM_S64_MIN / 2 && *(const ImS64 *)p_max <= IM_S64_MAX / 2);
3119  return SliderBehaviorT<ImS64, ImS64, double>(bb, id, data_type, (ImS64 *)p_v, *(const ImS64 *)p_min, *(const ImS64 *)p_max, format, flags, out_grab_bb);
3120  case ImGuiDataType_U64:
3121  IM_ASSERT(*(const ImU64 *)p_max <= IM_U64_MAX / 2);
3122  return SliderBehaviorT<ImU64, ImS64, double>(bb, id, data_type, (ImU64 *)p_v, *(const ImU64 *)p_min, *(const ImU64 *)p_max, format, flags, out_grab_bb);
3123  case ImGuiDataType_Float:
3124  IM_ASSERT(*(const float *)p_min >= -FLT_MAX / 2.0f && *(const float *)p_max <= FLT_MAX / 2.0f);
3125  return SliderBehaviorT<float, float, float >(bb, id, data_type, (float *)p_v, *(const float *)p_min, *(const float *)p_max, format, flags, out_grab_bb);
3126  case ImGuiDataType_Double:
3127  IM_ASSERT(*(const double *)p_min >= -DBL_MAX / 2.0f && *(const double *)p_max <= DBL_MAX / 2.0f);
3128  return SliderBehaviorT<double, double, double>(bb, id, data_type, (double *)p_v, *(const double *)p_min, *(const double *)p_max, format, flags, out_grab_bb);
3129  case ImGuiDataType_COUNT: break;
3130  }
3131  IM_ASSERT(0);
3132  return false;
3133 }
3134 
3135 // Note: p_data, p_min and p_max are _pointers_ to a memory address holding the data. For a slider, they are all required.
3136 // Read code of e.g. SliderFloat(), SliderInt() etc. or examples in 'Demo->Widgets->Data Types' to understand how to use this function directly.
3137 bool ImGui::SliderScalar(const char *label, ImGuiDataType data_type, void *p_data, const void *p_min, const void *p_max, const char *format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
3138 {
3139  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
3140  if (window->SkipItems)
3141  return false;
3142 
3143  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
3144  const ImGuiStyle &style = g.Style;
3145  const ImGuiID id = window->GetID(label);
3146  const float w = CalcItemWidth();
3147 
3148  const ImVec2 label_size = CalcTextSize(label, NULL, true);
3149  const ImRect frame_bb(window->DC.CursorPos, window->DC.CursorPos + ImVec2(w, label_size.y + style.FramePadding.y * 2.0f));
3150  const ImRect total_bb(frame_bb.Min, frame_bb.Max + ImVec2(label_size.x > 0.0f ? style.ItemInnerSpacing.x + label_size.x : 0.0f, 0.0f));
3151 
3152  const bool temp_input_allowed = (flags & ImGuiSliderFlags_NoInput) == 0;
3153  ItemSize(total_bb, style.FramePadding.y);
3154  if (!ItemAdd(total_bb, id, &frame_bb, temp_input_allowed ? ImGuiItemAddFlags_Focusable : 0))
3155  return false;
3156 
3157  // Default format string when passing NULL
3158  if (format == NULL)
3159  format = DataTypeGetInfo(data_type)->PrintFmt;
3160  else if (data_type == ImGuiDataType_S32 && strcmp(format, "%d") != 0) // (FIXME-LEGACY: Patch old "%.0f" format string to use "%d", read function more details.)
3161  format = PatchFormatStringFloatToInt(format);
3162 
3163  // Tabbing or CTRL-clicking on Slider turns it into an input box
3164  const bool hovered = ItemHoverable(frame_bb, id);
3165  bool temp_input_is_active = temp_input_allowed && TempInputIsActive(id);
3166  if (!temp_input_is_active)
3167  {
3168  const bool focus_requested = temp_input_allowed && (g.LastItemData.StatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Focused) != 0;
3169  const bool clicked = (hovered && g.IO.MouseClicked[0]);
3170  if (focus_requested || clicked || g.NavActivateId == id || g.NavInputId == id)
3171  {
3172  SetActiveID(id, window);
3173  SetFocusID(id, window);
3174  FocusWindow(window);
3175  g.ActiveIdUsingNavDirMask |= (1 << ImGuiDir_Left) | (1 << ImGuiDir_Right);
3176  if (temp_input_allowed && (focus_requested || (clicked && g.IO.KeyCtrl) || g.NavInputId == id))
3177  temp_input_is_active = true;
3178  }
3179  }
3180 
3181  if (temp_input_is_active)
3182  {
3183  // Only clamp CTRL+Click input when ImGuiSliderFlags_AlwaysClamp is set
3184  const bool is_clamp_input = (flags & ImGuiSliderFlags_AlwaysClamp) != 0;
3185  return TempInputScalar(frame_bb, id, label, data_type, p_data, format, is_clamp_input ? p_min : NULL, is_clamp_input ? p_max : NULL);
3186  }
3187 
3188  // Draw frame
3189  const ImU32 frame_col = GetColorU32(g.ActiveId == id ? ImGuiCol_FrameBgActive : hovered ? ImGuiCol_FrameBgHovered : ImGuiCol_FrameBg);
3190  RenderNavHighlight(frame_bb, id);
3191  RenderFrame(frame_bb.Min, frame_bb.Max, frame_col, true, g.Style.FrameRounding);
3192 
3193  // Slider behavior
3194  ImRect grab_bb;
3195  const bool value_changed = SliderBehavior(frame_bb, id, data_type, p_data, p_min, p_max, format, flags, &grab_bb);
3196  if (value_changed)
3197  MarkItemEdited(id);
3198 
3199  // Render grab
3200  if (grab_bb.Max.x > grab_bb.Min.x)
3201  window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(grab_bb.Min, grab_bb.Max, GetColorU32(g.ActiveId == id ? ImGuiCol_SliderGrabActive : ImGuiCol_SliderGrab), style.GrabRounding);
3202 
3203  // Display value using user-provided display format so user can add prefix/suffix/decorations to the value.
3204  char value_buf[64];
3205  const char *value_buf_end = value_buf + DataTypeFormatString(value_buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(value_buf), data_type, p_data, format);
3206  if (g.LogEnabled)
3207  LogSetNextTextDecoration("{", "}");
3208  RenderTextClipped(frame_bb.Min, frame_bb.Max, value_buf, value_buf_end, NULL, ImVec2(0.5f, 0.5f));
3209 
3210  if (label_size.x > 0.0f)
3211  RenderText(ImVec2(frame_bb.Max.x + style.ItemInnerSpacing.x, frame_bb.Min.y + style.FramePadding.y), label);
3212 
3213  IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ITEM_INFO(id, label, g.LastItemData.StatusFlags);
3214  return value_changed;
3215 }
3216 
3217 // Add multiple sliders on 1 line for compact edition of multiple components
3218 bool ImGui::SliderScalarN(const char *label, ImGuiDataType data_type, void *v, int components, const void *v_min, const void *v_max, const char *format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
3219 {
3220  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
3221  if (window->SkipItems)
3222  return false;
3223 
3224  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
3225  bool value_changed = false;
3226  BeginGroup();
3227  PushID(label);
3228  PushMultiItemsWidths(components, CalcItemWidth());
3229  size_t type_size = GDataTypeInfo[data_type].Size;
3230  for (int i = 0; i < components; i++)
3231  {
3232  PushID(i);
3233  if (i > 0)
3234  SameLine(0, g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x);
3235  value_changed |= SliderScalar("", data_type, v, v_min, v_max, format, flags);
3236  PopID();
3237  PopItemWidth();
3238  v = (void *)((char *)v + type_size);
3239  }
3240  PopID();
3241 
3242  const char *label_end = FindRenderedTextEnd(label);
3243  if (label != label_end)
3244  {
3245  SameLine(0, g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x);
3246  TextEx(label, label_end);
3247  }
3248 
3249  EndGroup();
3250  return value_changed;
3251 }
3252 
3253 bool ImGui::SliderFloat(const char *label, float *v, float v_min, float v_max, const char *format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
3254 {
3255  return SliderScalar(label, ImGuiDataType_Float, v, &v_min, &v_max, format, flags);
3256 }

3272 
3273 bool ImGui::SliderAngle(const char *label, float *v_rad, float v_degrees_min, float v_degrees_max, const char *format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
3274 {
3275  if (format == NULL)
3276  format = "%.0f deg";
3277  float v_deg = (*v_rad) * 360.0f / (2 * IM_PI);
3278  bool value_changed = SliderFloat(label, &v_deg, v_degrees_min, v_degrees_max, format, flags);
3279  *v_rad = v_deg * (2 * IM_PI) / 360.0f;
3280  return value_changed;
3281 }

3302 
3303 bool ImGui::VSliderScalar(const char *label, const ImVec2 &size, ImGuiDataType data_type, void *p_data, const void *p_min, const void *p_max, const char *format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
3304 {
3305  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
3306  if (window->SkipItems)
3307  return false;
3308 
3309  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
3310  const ImGuiStyle &style = g.Style;
3311  const ImGuiID id = window->GetID(label);
3312 
3313  const ImVec2 label_size = CalcTextSize(label, NULL, true);
3314  const ImRect frame_bb(window->DC.CursorPos, window->DC.CursorPos + size);
3315  const ImRect bb(frame_bb.Min, frame_bb.Max + ImVec2(label_size.x > 0.0f ? style.ItemInnerSpacing.x + label_size.x : 0.0f, 0.0f));
3316 
3317  ItemSize(bb, style.FramePadding.y);
3318  if (!ItemAdd(frame_bb, id))
3319  return false;
3320 
3321  // Default format string when passing NULL
3322  if (format == NULL)
3323  format = DataTypeGetInfo(data_type)->PrintFmt;
3324  else if (data_type == ImGuiDataType_S32 && strcmp(format, "%d") != 0) // (FIXME-LEGACY: Patch old "%.0f" format string to use "%d", read function more details.)
3325  format = PatchFormatStringFloatToInt(format);
3326 
3327  const bool hovered = ItemHoverable(frame_bb, id);
3328  if ((hovered && g.IO.MouseClicked[0]) || g.NavActivateId == id || g.NavInputId == id)
3329  {
3330  SetActiveID(id, window);
3331  SetFocusID(id, window);
3332  FocusWindow(window);
3333  g.ActiveIdUsingNavDirMask |= (1 << ImGuiDir_Up) | (1 << ImGuiDir_Down);
3334  }
3335 
3336  // Draw frame
3337  const ImU32 frame_col = GetColorU32(g.ActiveId == id ? ImGuiCol_FrameBgActive : hovered ? ImGuiCol_FrameBgHovered : ImGuiCol_FrameBg);
3338  RenderNavHighlight(frame_bb, id);
3339  RenderFrame(frame_bb.Min, frame_bb.Max, frame_col, true, g.Style.FrameRounding);
3340 
3341  // Slider behavior
3342  ImRect grab_bb;
3343  const bool value_changed = SliderBehavior(frame_bb, id, data_type, p_data, p_min, p_max, format, flags | ImGuiSliderFlags_Vertical, &grab_bb);
3344  if (value_changed)
3345  MarkItemEdited(id);
3346 
3347  // Render grab
3348  if (grab_bb.Max.y > grab_bb.Min.y)
3349  window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(grab_bb.Min, grab_bb.Max, GetColorU32(g.ActiveId == id ? ImGuiCol_SliderGrabActive : ImGuiCol_SliderGrab), style.GrabRounding);
3350 
3351  // Display value using user-provided display format so user can add prefix/suffix/decorations to the value.
3352  // For the vertical slider we allow centered text to overlap the frame padding
3353  char value_buf[64];
3354  const char *value_buf_end = value_buf + DataTypeFormatString(value_buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(value_buf), data_type, p_data, format);
3355  RenderTextClipped(ImVec2(frame_bb.Min.x, frame_bb.Min.y + style.FramePadding.y), frame_bb.Max, value_buf, value_buf_end, NULL, ImVec2(0.5f, 0.0f));
3356  if (label_size.x > 0.0f)
3357  RenderText(ImVec2(frame_bb.Max.x + style.ItemInnerSpacing.x, frame_bb.Min.y + style.FramePadding.y), label);
3358 
3359  return value_changed;
3360 }
3361 
3362 bool ImGui::VSliderFloat(const char *label, const ImVec2 &size, float *v, float v_min, float v_max, const char *format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
3363 {
3364  return VSliderScalar(label, size, ImGuiDataType_Float, v, &v_min, &v_max, format, flags);
3365 }

3367 bool ImGui::VSliderInt(const char *label, const ImVec2 &size, int *v, int v_min, int v_max, const char *format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
