3370 }
3371 
3372 #ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
3373 
3374 // Obsolete versions with power parameter. See https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/issues/3361 for details.
3375 bool ImGui::SliderScalar(const char *label, ImGuiDataType data_type, void *p_data, const void *p_min, const void *p_max, const char *format, float power)
3376 {
3377  ImGuiSliderFlags slider_flags = ImGuiSliderFlags_None;
3378  if (power != 1.0f)
3379  {
3380  IM_ASSERT(power == 1.0f && "Call function with ImGuiSliderFlags_Logarithmic flags instead of using the old 'float power' function!");
3381  slider_flags |= ImGuiSliderFlags_Logarithmic; // Fallback for non-asserting paths
3382  }
3383  return SliderScalar(label, data_type, p_data, p_min, p_max, format, slider_flags);
3384 }
3385 
3386 bool ImGui::SliderScalarN(const char *label, ImGuiDataType data_type, void *v, int components, const void *v_min, const void *v_max, const char *format, float power)
3387 {
3388  ImGuiSliderFlags slider_flags = ImGuiSliderFlags_None;
3389  if (power != 1.0f)
3390  {
3391  IM_ASSERT(power == 1.0f && "Call function with ImGuiSliderFlags_Logarithmic flags instead of using the old 'float power' function!");
3392  slider_flags |= ImGuiSliderFlags_Logarithmic; // Fallback for non-asserting paths
3393  }
3394  return SliderScalarN(label, data_type, v, components, v_min, v_max, format, slider_flags);
3395 }
3396 
3397 #endif // IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
3398 
3399 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
3400 // [SECTION] Widgets: InputScalar, InputFloat, InputInt, etc.
3401 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
3402 // - ImParseFormatFindStart() [Internal]
3403 // - ImParseFormatFindEnd() [Internal]
3404 // - ImParseFormatTrimDecorations() [Internal]
3405 // - ImParseFormatPrecision() [Internal]
3406 // - TempInputTextScalar() [Internal]
3407 // - InputScalar()
3408 // - InputScalarN()
3409 // - InputFloat()
3410 // - InputFloat2()
3411 // - InputFloat3()
3412 // - InputFloat4()
3413 // - InputInt()
3414 // - InputInt2()
3415 // - InputInt3()
3416 // - InputInt4()
3417 // - InputDouble()
3418 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
3419 
3420 // We don't use strchr() because our strings are usually very short and often start with '%'
3421 const char *ImParseFormatFindStart(const char *fmt)
3422 {
3423  while (char c = fmt[0])
3424  {
3425  if (c == '%' && fmt[1] != '%')
3426  return fmt;
3427  else if (c == '%')
3428  fmt++;
3429  fmt++;
3430  }
3431  return fmt;
3432 }
3433 
3434 const char *ImParseFormatFindEnd(const char *fmt)
3435 {
3436  // Printf/scanf types modifiers: I/L/h/j/l/t/w/z. Other uppercase letters qualify as types aka end of the format.
3437  if (fmt[0] != '%')
3438  return fmt;
3439  const unsigned int ignored_uppercase_mask = (1 << ('I' - 'A')) | (1 << ('L' - 'A'));
3440  const unsigned int ignored_lowercase_mask = (1 << ('h' - 'a')) | (1 << ('j' - 'a')) | (1 << ('l' - 'a')) | (1 << ('t' - 'a')) | (1 << ('w' - 'a')) | (1 << ('z' - 'a'));
3441  for (char c; (c = *fmt) != 0; fmt++)
3442  {
3443  if (c >= 'A' && c <= 'Z' && ((1 << (c - 'A')) & ignored_uppercase_mask) == 0)
3444  return fmt + 1;
3445  if (c >= 'a' && c <= 'z' && ((1 << (c - 'a')) & ignored_lowercase_mask) == 0)
3446  return fmt + 1;
3447  }
3448  return fmt;
3449 }
3450 
3451 // Extract the format out of a format string with leading or trailing decorations
3452 // fmt = "blah blah" -> return fmt
3453 // fmt = "%.3f" -> return fmt
3454 // fmt = "hello %.3f" -> return fmt + 6
3455 // fmt = "%.3f hello" -> return buf written with "%.3f"
3456 const char *ImParseFormatTrimDecorations(const char *fmt, char *buf, size_t buf_size)
3457 {
3458  const char *fmt_start = ImParseFormatFindStart(fmt);
3459  if (fmt_start[0] != '%')
3460  return fmt;
3461  const char *fmt_end = ImParseFormatFindEnd(fmt_start);
3462  if (fmt_end[0] == 0) // If we only have leading decoration, we don't need to copy the data.
3463  return fmt_start;
3464  ImStrncpy(buf, fmt_start, ImMin((size_t)(fmt_end - fmt_start) + 1, buf_size));
3465  return buf;
3466 }
3467 
3468 // Parse display precision back from the display format string
3469 // FIXME: This is still used by some navigation code path to infer a minimum tweak step, but we should aim to rework widgets so it isn't needed.
3470 int ImParseFormatPrecision(const char *fmt, int default_precision)
3471 {
3472  fmt = ImParseFormatFindStart(fmt);
3473  if (fmt[0] != '%')
3474  return default_precision;
3475  fmt++;
3476  while (*fmt >= '0' && *fmt <= '9')
3477  fmt++;
3478  int precision = INT_MAX;
3479  if (*fmt == '.')
3480  {
3481  fmt = ImAtoi<int>(fmt + 1, &precision);
3482  if (precision < 0 || precision > 99)
3483  precision = default_precision;
3484  }
3485  if (*fmt == 'e' || *fmt == 'E') // Maximum precision with scientific notation
3486  precision = -1;
3487  if ((*fmt == 'g' || *fmt == 'G') && precision == INT_MAX)
3488  precision = -1;
3489  return (precision == INT_MAX) ? default_precision : precision;
3490 }
3491 
3492 // Create text input in place of another active widget (e.g. used when doing a CTRL+Click on drag/slider widgets)
3493 // FIXME: Facilitate using this in variety of other situations.
3494 bool ImGui::TempInputText(const ImRect &bb, ImGuiID id, const char *label, char *buf, int buf_size, ImGuiInputTextFlags flags)
3495 {
3496  // On the first frame, g.TempInputTextId == 0, then on subsequent frames it becomes == id.
3497  // We clear ActiveID on the first frame to allow the InputText() taking it back.
3498  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
3499  const bool init = (g.TempInputId != id);
3500  if (init)
3501  ClearActiveID();
3502 
3503  g.CurrentWindow->DC.CursorPos = bb.Min;
3504  bool value_changed = InputTextEx(label, NULL, buf, buf_size, bb.GetSize(), flags | ImGuiInputTextFlags_MergedItem);
3505  if (init)
3506  {
3507  // First frame we started displaying the InputText widget, we expect it to take the active id.
3508  IM_ASSERT(g.ActiveId == id);
3509  g.TempInputId = g.ActiveId;
3510  }
3511  return value_changed;
3512 }
3513 
3514 // Note that Drag/Slider functions are only forwarding the min/max values clamping values if the ImGuiSliderFlags_AlwaysClamp flag is set!
3515 // This is intended: this way we allow CTRL+Click manual input to set a value out of bounds, for maximum flexibility.
3516 // However this may not be ideal for all uses, as some user code may break on out of bound values.
3517 bool ImGui::TempInputScalar(const ImRect &bb, ImGuiID id, const char *label, ImGuiDataType data_type, void *p_data, const char *format, const void *p_clamp_min, const void *p_clamp_max)
3518 {
3519  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
3520 
3521  char fmt_buf[32];
3522  char data_buf[32];
3523  format = ImParseFormatTrimDecorations(format, fmt_buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(fmt_buf));
3524  DataTypeFormatString(data_buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(data_buf), data_type, p_data, format);
3525  ImStrTrimBlanks(data_buf);
3526 
3527  ImGuiInputTextFlags flags = ImGuiInputTextFlags_AutoSelectAll | ImGuiInputTextFlags_NoMarkEdited;
3528  flags |= ((data_type == ImGuiDataType_Float || data_type == ImGuiDataType_Double) ? ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsScientific : ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsDecimal);
3529  bool value_changed = false;
3530  if (TempInputText(bb, id, label, data_buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(data_buf), flags))
3531  {
3532  // Backup old value
3533  size_t data_type_size = DataTypeGetInfo(data_type)->Size;
3534  ImGuiDataTypeTempStorage data_backup;
3535  memcpy(&data_backup, p_data, data_type_size);
3536 
3537  // Apply new value (or operations) then clamp
3538  DataTypeApplyOpFromText(data_buf, g.InputTextState.InitialTextA.Data, data_type, p_data, NULL);
3539  if (p_clamp_min || p_clamp_max)
3540  {
3541  if (p_clamp_min && p_clamp_max && DataTypeCompare(data_type, p_clamp_min, p_clamp_max) > 0)
3542  ImSwap(p_clamp_min, p_clamp_max);
3543  DataTypeClamp(data_type, p_data, p_clamp_min, p_clamp_max);
3544  }
3545 
3546  // Only mark as edited if new value is different
3547  value_changed = memcmp(&data_backup, p_data, data_type_size) != 0;
3548  if (value_changed)
3549  MarkItemEdited(id);
3550  }
3551  return value_changed;
3552 }
3553 
3554 // Note: p_data, p_step, p_step_fast are _pointers_ to a memory address holding the data. For an Input widget, p_step and p_step_fast are optional.
3555 // Read code of e.g. InputFloat(), InputInt() etc. or examples in 'Demo->Widgets->Data Types' to understand how to use this function directly.
3556 bool ImGui::InputScalar(const char *label, ImGuiDataType data_type, void *p_data, const void *p_step, const void *p_step_fast, const char *format, ImGuiInputTextFlags flags)
3557 {
3558  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
3559  if (window->SkipItems)
3560  return false;
3561 
3562  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
3563  ImGuiStyle &style = g.Style;
3564 
3565  if (format == NULL)
3566  format = DataTypeGetInfo(data_type)->PrintFmt;
3567 
3568  char buf[64];
3569  DataTypeFormatString(buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), data_type, p_data, format);
3570 
3571  bool value_changed = false;
3572  if ((flags & (ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsHexadecimal | ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsScientific)) == 0)
3573  flags |= ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsDecimal;
3574  flags |= ImGuiInputTextFlags_AutoSelectAll;
3575  flags |= ImGuiInputTextFlags_NoMarkEdited; // We call MarkItemEdited() ourselves by comparing the actual data rather than the string.
3576 
3577  if (p_step != NULL)
3578  {
3579  const float button_size = GetFrameHeight();
3580 
3581  BeginGroup(); // The only purpose of the group here is to allow the caller to query item data e.g. IsItemActive()
3582  PushID(label);
3583  SetNextItemWidth(ImMax(1.0f, CalcItemWidth() - (button_size + style.ItemInnerSpacing.x) * 2));
3584  if (InputText("", buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), flags)) // PushId(label) + "" gives us the expected ID from outside point of view
3585  value_changed = DataTypeApplyOpFromText(buf, g.InputTextState.InitialTextA.Data, data_type, p_data, format);
3586 
3587  // Step buttons
3588  const ImVec2 backup_frame_padding = style.FramePadding;
3589  style.FramePadding.x = style.FramePadding.y;
3590  ImGuiButtonFlags button_flags = ImGuiButtonFlags_Repeat | ImGuiButtonFlags_DontClosePopups;
3591  if (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_ReadOnly)
3592  BeginDisabled(true);
3593  SameLine(0, style.ItemInnerSpacing.x);
3594  if (ButtonEx("-", ImVec2(button_size, button_size), button_flags))
3595  {
3596  DataTypeApplyOp(data_type, '-', p_data, p_data, g.IO.KeyCtrl && p_step_fast ? p_step_fast : p_step);
3597  value_changed = true;
3598  }
3599  SameLine(0, style.ItemInnerSpacing.x);
3600  if (ButtonEx("+", ImVec2(button_size, button_size), button_flags))
3601  {
3602  DataTypeApplyOp(data_type, '+', p_data, p_data, g.IO.KeyCtrl && p_step_fast ? p_step_fast : p_step);
3603  value_changed = true;
3604  }
3605  if (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_ReadOnly)
3606  EndDisabled();
3607 
3608  const char *label_end = FindRenderedTextEnd(label);
3609  if (label != label_end)
3610  {
3611  SameLine(0, style.ItemInnerSpacing.x);
3612  TextEx(label, label_end);
3613  }
3614  style.FramePadding = backup_frame_padding;
3615 
3616  PopID();
3617  EndGroup();
3618  }
3619  else
3620  {
3621  if (InputText(label, buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), flags))
3622  value_changed = DataTypeApplyOpFromText(buf, g.InputTextState.InitialTextA.Data, data_type, p_data, format);
3623  }
3624  if (value_changed)
3625  MarkItemEdited(g.LastItemData.ID);
3626 
3627  return value_changed;
3628 }
3629 
3630 bool ImGui::InputScalarN(const char *label, ImGuiDataType data_type, void *p_data, int components, const void *p_step, const void *p_step_fast, const char *format, ImGuiInputTextFlags flags)
3631 {
3632  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
3633  if (window->SkipItems)
3634  return false;
3635 
3636  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
3637  bool value_changed = false;
3638  BeginGroup();
3639  PushID(label);
3640  PushMultiItemsWidths(components, CalcItemWidth());
3641  size_t type_size = GDataTypeInfo[data_type].Size;
3642  for (int i = 0; i < components; i++)
3643  {
3644  PushID(i);
3645  if (i > 0)
3646  SameLine(0, g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x);
3647  value_changed |= InputScalar("", data_type, p_data, p_step, p_step_fast, format, flags);
3648  PopID();
3649  PopItemWidth();
3650  p_data = (void *)((char *)p_data + type_size);
3651  }
3652  PopID();
3653 
3654  const char *label_end = FindRenderedTextEnd(label);
3655  if (label != label_end)
3656  {
3657  SameLine(0.0f, g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x);
3658  TextEx(label, label_end);
3659  }
3660 
3661  EndGroup();
3662  return value_changed;
3663 }
3664 
3665 bool ImGui::InputFloat(const char *label, float *v, float step, float step_fast, const char *format, ImGuiInputTextFlags flags)
3666 {
3667  flags |= ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsScientific;
3668  return InputScalar(label, ImGuiDataType_Float, (void *)v, (void *)(step > 0.0f ? &step : NULL), (void *)(step_fast > 0.0f ? &step_fast : NULL), format, flags);
3669 }
3670 
3671 bool ImGui::InputFloat2(const char *label, float v[2], const char *format, ImGuiInputTextFlags flags)
3672 {
3673  return InputScalarN(label, ImGuiDataType_Float, v, 2, NULL, NULL, format, flags);
3674 }
3675

3685 
3686 bool ImGui::InputInt(const char *label, int *v, int step, int step_fast, ImGuiInputTextFlags flags)
3687 {
3688  // Hexadecimal input provided as a convenience but the flag name is awkward. Typically you'd use InputText() to parse your own data, if you want to handle prefixes.
3689  const char *format = (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsHexadecimal) ? "%08X" : "%d";
3690  return InputScalar(label, ImGuiDataType_S32, (void *)v, (void *)(step > 0 ? &step : NULL), (void *)(step_fast > 0 ? &step_fast : NULL), format, flags);
3691 }
3692

3694 {
3695  return InputScalarN(label, ImGuiDataType_S32, v, 2, NULL, NULL, "%d", flags);
3696 }

3699 {
3700  return InputScalarN(label, ImGuiDataType_S32, v, 3, NULL, NULL, "%d", flags);
3701 }
3702 
3703 bool ImGui::InputInt4(const char *label, int v[4], ImGuiInputTextFlags flags)
3704 {

3709 {
3710  flags |= ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsScientific;
3711  return InputScalar(label, ImGuiDataType_Double, (void *)v, (void *)(step > 0.0 ? &step : NULL), (void *)(step_fast > 0.0 ? &step_fast : NULL), format, flags);

3713 
3714 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
3715 // [SECTION] Widgets: InputText, InputTextMultiline, InputTextWithHint
3716 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
3717 // - InputText()
3718 // - InputTextWithHint()
3719 // - InputTextMultiline()
3720 // - InputTextEx() [Internal]
3721 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
3722 
3723 bool ImGui::InputText(const char *label, char *buf, size_t buf_size, ImGuiInputTextFlags flags, ImGuiInputTextCallback callback, void *user_data)
3724 {
3725  IM_ASSERT(!(flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_Multiline)); // call InputTextMultiline()
3726  return InputTextEx(label, NULL, buf, (int)buf_size, ImVec2(0, 0), flags, callback, user_data);
3727 }
3728 
3729 bool ImGui::InputTextMultiline(const char *label, char *buf, size_t buf_size, const ImVec2 &size, ImGuiInputTextFlags flags, ImGuiInputTextCallback callback, void *user_data)
3730 {
3731  return InputTextEx(label, NULL, buf, (int)buf_size, size, flags | ImGuiInputTextFlags_Multiline, callback, user_data);
3732 }
3733 
3734 bool ImGui::InputTextWithHint(const char *label, const char *hint, char *buf, size_t buf_size, ImGuiInputTextFlags flags, ImGuiInputTextCallback callback, void *user_data)
3735 {
3736  IM_ASSERT(!(flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_Multiline)); // call InputTextMultiline()
3737  return InputTextEx(label, hint, buf, (int)buf_size, ImVec2(0, 0), flags, callback, user_data);
3738 }
3739 
3740 static int InputTextCalcTextLenAndLineCount(const char *text_begin, const char **out_text_end)
3741 {
3742  int line_count = 0;
3743  const char *s = text_begin;
3744  while (char c = *s++) // We are only matching for \n so we can ignore UTF-8 decoding
3745  if (c == '\n')
3746  line_count++;
3747  s--;
3748  if (s[0] != '\n' && s[0] != '\r')
3749  line_count++;
3750  *out_text_end = s;
3751  return line_count;
3752 }
3753 
3754 static ImVec2 InputTextCalcTextSizeW(const ImWchar *text_begin, const ImWchar *text_end, const ImWchar **remaining, ImVec2 *out_offset, bool stop_on_new_line)
3755 {
3756  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
3757  ImFont *font = g.Font;
3758  const float line_height = g.FontSize;
3759  const float scale = line_height / font->FontSize;
3760 
3761  ImVec2 text_size = ImVec2(0, 0);
3762  float line_width = 0.0f;
3763 
3764  const ImWchar *s = text_begin;
3765  while (s < text_end)
3766  {
3767  unsigned int c = (unsigned int)(*s++);
3768  if (c == '\n')
3769  {
3770  text_size.x = ImMax(text_size.x, line_width);
3771  text_size.y += line_height;
3772  line_width = 0.0f;
3773  if (stop_on_new_line)
3774  break;
3775  continue;
3776  }
3777  if (c == '\r')
3778  continue;
3779 
3780  const float char_width = font->GetCharAdvance((ImWchar)c) * scale;
3781  line_width += char_width;
3782  }
3783 
3784  if (text_size.x < line_width)
3785  text_size.x = line_width;
3786 
3787  if (out_offset)
3788  *out_offset = ImVec2(line_width, text_size.y + line_height); // offset allow for the possibility of sitting after a trailing \n
3789 
3790  if (line_width > 0 || text_size.y == 0.0f) // whereas size.y will ignore the trailing \n
3791  text_size.y += line_height;
3792 
3793  if (remaining)
3794  *remaining = s;
3795 
3796  return text_size;
3797 }
3798 
3799 // Wrapper for stb_textedit.h to edit text (our wrapper is for: statically sized buffer, single-line, wchar characters. InputText converts between UTF-8 and wchar)
3800 namespace ImStb
3801 {
3802 
3803  static int STB_TEXTEDIT_STRINGLEN(const ImGuiInputTextState *obj)
3804  {
3805  return obj->CurLenW;
3806  }
3807  static ImWchar STB_TEXTEDIT_GETCHAR(const ImGuiInputTextState *obj, int idx)
3808  {
3809  return obj->TextW[idx];
3810  }
3811  static float STB_TEXTEDIT_GETWIDTH(ImGuiInputTextState *obj, int line_start_idx, int char_idx)
3812  {
3813  ImWchar c = obj->TextW[line_start_idx + char_idx]; if (c == '\n') return STB_TEXTEDIT_GETWIDTH_NEWLINE; ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui; return g.Font->GetCharAdvance(c) * (g.FontSize / g.Font->FontSize);
3814  }
3815  static int STB_TEXTEDIT_KEYTOTEXT(int key)
3816  {
3817  return key >= 0x200000 ? 0 : key;
3818  }
3819  static ImWchar STB_TEXTEDIT_NEWLINE = '\n';
3820  static void STB_TEXTEDIT_LAYOUTROW(StbTexteditRow *r, ImGuiInputTextState *obj, int line_start_idx)
3821  {
3822  const ImWchar *text = obj->TextW.Data;
3823  const ImWchar *text_remaining = NULL;
3824  const ImVec2 size = InputTextCalcTextSizeW(text + line_start_idx, text + obj->CurLenW, &text_remaining, NULL, true);
3825  r->x0 = 0.0f;
3826  r->x1 = size.x;
3827  r->baseline_y_delta = size.y;
3828  r->ymin = 0.0f;
3829  r->ymax = size.y;
3830  r->num_chars = (int)(text_remaining - (text + line_start_idx));
3831  }
3832 
3833  // When ImGuiInputTextFlags_Password is set, we don't want actions such as CTRL+Arrow to leak the fact that underlying data are blanks or separators.
3834  static bool is_separator(unsigned int c)
3835  {
3836  return ImCharIsBlankW(c) || c == ',' || c == ';' || c == '(' || c == ')' || c == '{' || c == '}' || c == '[' || c == ']' || c == '|';
3837  }
3838  static int is_word_boundary_from_right(ImGuiInputTextState *obj, int idx)
3839  {
3840  if (obj->Flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_Password) return 0; return idx > 0 ? (is_separator(obj->TextW[idx - 1]) && !is_separator(obj->TextW[idx])) : 1;
3841  }
3842  static int STB_TEXTEDIT_MOVEWORDLEFT_IMPL(ImGuiInputTextState *obj, int idx)
3843  {
3844  idx--; while (idx >= 0 && !is_word_boundary_from_right(obj, idx)) idx--; return idx < 0 ? 0 : idx;
3845  }
3846 #ifdef __APPLE__ // FIXME: Move setting to IO structure
3847  static int is_word_boundary_from_left(ImGuiInputTextState *obj, int idx)
3848  {
3849  if (obj->Flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_Password) return 0; return idx > 0 ? (!is_separator(obj->TextW[idx - 1]) && is_separator(obj->TextW[idx])) : 1;
3850  }
3851  static int STB_TEXTEDIT_MOVEWORDRIGHT_IMPL(ImGuiInputTextState *obj, int idx)
3852  {
3853  idx++; int len = obj->CurLenW; while (idx < len && !is_word_boundary_from_left(obj, idx)) idx++; return idx > len ? len : idx;
3854  }
3855 #else
3856  static int STB_TEXTEDIT_MOVEWORDRIGHT_IMPL(ImGuiInputTextState *obj, int idx)
3857  {
3858  idx++; int len = obj->CurLenW; while (idx < len && !is_word_boundary_from_right(obj, idx)) idx++; return idx > len ? len : idx;
3859  }
3860 #endif
3861 #define STB_TEXTEDIT_MOVEWORDLEFT STB_TEXTEDIT_MOVEWORDLEFT_IMPL // They need to be #define for stb_textedit.h
3862 #define STB_TEXTEDIT_MOVEWORDRIGHT STB_TEXTEDIT_MOVEWORDRIGHT_IMPL
3863 
3864  static void STB_TEXTEDIT_DELETECHARS(ImGuiInputTextState *obj, int pos, int n)
3865  {
3866  ImWchar *dst = obj->TextW.Data + pos;
3867 
3868  // We maintain our buffer length in both UTF-8 and wchar formats
3869  obj->Edited = true;
3870  obj->CurLenA -= ImTextCountUtf8BytesFromStr(dst, dst + n);
3871  obj->CurLenW -= n;
3872 
3873  // Offset remaining text (FIXME-OPT: Use memmove)
3874  const ImWchar *src = obj->TextW.Data + pos + n;
3875  while (ImWchar c = *src++)
3876  *dst++ = c;
3877  *dst = '\0';
3878  }
3879 
3880  static bool STB_TEXTEDIT_INSERTCHARS(ImGuiInputTextState *obj, int pos, const ImWchar *new_text, int new_text_len)
3881  {
3882  const bool is_resizable = (obj->Flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackResize) != 0;
3883  const int text_len = obj->CurLenW;
3884  IM_ASSERT(pos <= text_len);
3885 
3886  const int new_text_len_utf8 = ImTextCountUtf8BytesFromStr(new_text, new_text + new_text_len);
3887  if (!is_resizable && (new_text_len_utf8 + obj->CurLenA + 1 > obj->BufCapacityA))
3888  return false;
3889 
3890  // Grow internal buffer if needed
3891  if (new_text_len + text_len + 1 > obj->TextW.Size)
3892  {
3893  if (!is_resizable)
3894  return false;
3895  IM_ASSERT(text_len < obj->TextW.Size);
3896  obj->TextW.resize(text_len + ImClamp(new_text_len * 4, 32, ImMax(256, new_text_len)) + 1);
3897  }
3898 
3899  ImWchar *text = obj->TextW.Data;
3900  if (pos != text_len)
3901  memmove(text + pos + new_text_len, text + pos, (size_t)(text_len - pos) * sizeof(ImWchar));
3902  memcpy(text + pos, new_text, (size_t)new_text_len * sizeof(ImWchar));
3903 
3904  obj->Edited = true;
3905  obj->CurLenW += new_text_len;
3906  obj->CurLenA += new_text_len_utf8;
3907  obj->TextW[obj->CurLenW] = '\0';
3908 
3909  return true;
3910  }
3911 
3912  // We don't use an enum so we can build even with conflicting symbols (if another user of stb_textedit.h leak their STB_TEXTEDIT_K_* symbols)
3913 #define STB_TEXTEDIT_K_LEFT 0x200000 // keyboard input to move cursor left
3914 #define STB_TEXTEDIT_K_RIGHT 0x200001 // keyboard input to move cursor right
3915 #define STB_TEXTEDIT_K_UP 0x200002 // keyboard input to move cursor up
3916 #define STB_TEXTEDIT_K_DOWN 0x200003 // keyboard input to move cursor down
3917 #define STB_TEXTEDIT_K_LINESTART 0x200004 // keyboard input to move cursor to start of line
3918 #define STB_TEXTEDIT_K_LINEEND 0x200005 // keyboard input to move cursor to end of line
3919 #define STB_TEXTEDIT_K_TEXTSTART 0x200006 // keyboard input to move cursor to start of text
3920 #define STB_TEXTEDIT_K_TEXTEND 0x200007 // keyboard input to move cursor to end of text
3921 #define STB_TEXTEDIT_K_DELETE 0x200008 // keyboard input to delete selection or character under cursor
3922 #define STB_TEXTEDIT_K_BACKSPACE 0x200009 // keyboard input to delete selection or character left of cursor
3923 #define STB_TEXTEDIT_K_UNDO 0x20000A // keyboard input to perform undo
3924 #define STB_TEXTEDIT_K_REDO 0x20000B // keyboard input to perform redo
3925 #define STB_TEXTEDIT_K_WORDLEFT 0x20000C // keyboard input to move cursor left one word
3926 #define STB_TEXTEDIT_K_WORDRIGHT 0x20000D // keyboard input to move cursor right one word
3927 #define STB_TEXTEDIT_K_PGUP 0x20000E // keyboard input to move cursor up a page
3928 #define STB_TEXTEDIT_K_PGDOWN 0x20000F // keyboard input to move cursor down a page
3929 #define STB_TEXTEDIT_K_SHIFT 0x400000
3930 
3931 #define STB_TEXTEDIT_IMPLEMENTATION
3932 #include "imstb_textedit.h"
3933 
3934 // stb_textedit internally allows for a single undo record to do addition and deletion, but somehow, calling
3935 // the stb_textedit_paste() function creates two separate records, so we perform it manually. (FIXME: Report to nothings/stb?)
3936  static void stb_textedit_replace(ImGuiInputTextState *str, STB_TexteditState *state, const STB_TEXTEDIT_CHARTYPE *text, int text_len)
3937  {
3938  stb_text_makeundo_replace(str, state, 0, str->CurLenW, text_len);
3939  ImStb::STB_TEXTEDIT_DELETECHARS(str, 0, str->CurLenW);
3940  if (text_len <= 0)
3941  return;
3942  if (ImStb::STB_TEXTEDIT_INSERTCHARS(str, 0, text, text_len))
3943  {
3944  state->cursor = text_len;
3945  state->has_preferred_x = 0;
3946  return;
3947  }
3948  IM_ASSERT(0); // Failed to insert character, normally shouldn't happen because of how we currently use stb_textedit_replace()
3949  }
3950 
3951 } // namespace ImStb
3952 
3953 void ImGuiInputTextState::OnKeyPressed(int key)
3954 {
3955  stb_textedit_key(this, &Stb, key);
3956  CursorFollow = true;
3957  CursorAnimReset();
3958 }
3959 
3960 ImGuiInputTextCallbackData::ImGuiInputTextCallbackData()
3961 {
3962  memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this));
3963 }
3964 
3965 // Public API to manipulate UTF-8 text
3966 // We expose UTF-8 to the user (unlike the STB_TEXTEDIT_* functions which are manipulating wchar)
3967 // FIXME: The existence of this rarely exercised code path is a bit of a nuisance.
3968 void ImGuiInputTextCallbackData::DeleteChars(int pos, int bytes_count)
3969 {
3970  IM_ASSERT(pos + bytes_count <= BufTextLen);
3971  char *dst = Buf + pos;
3972  const char *src = Buf + pos + bytes_count;
3973  while (char c = *src++)
3974  *dst++ = c;
3975  *dst = '\0';
3976 
3977  if (CursorPos >= pos + bytes_count)
3978  CursorPos -= bytes_count;
3979  else if (CursorPos >= pos)
3980  CursorPos = pos;
3981  SelectionStart = SelectionEnd = CursorPos;
3982  BufDirty = true;
3983  BufTextLen -= bytes_count;
3984 }
3985 
3986 void ImGuiInputTextCallbackData::InsertChars(int pos, const char *new_text, const char *new_text_end)
3987 {
3988  const bool is_resizable = (Flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackResize) != 0;
3989  const int new_text_len = new_text_end ? (int)(new_text_end - new_text) : (int)strlen(new_text);
3990  if (new_text_len + BufTextLen >= BufSize)
3991  {
3992  if (!is_resizable)
3993  return;
3994 
3995  // Contrary to STB_TEXTEDIT_INSERTCHARS() this is working in the UTF8 buffer, hence the mildly similar code (until we remove the U16 buffer altogether!)
3996  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
3997  ImGuiInputTextState *edit_state = &g.InputTextState;
3998  IM_ASSERT(edit_state->ID != 0 && g.ActiveId == edit_state->ID);
3999  IM_ASSERT(Buf == edit_state->TextA.Data);
4000  int new_buf_size = BufTextLen + ImClamp(new_text_len * 4, 32, ImMax(256, new_text_len)) + 1;
4001  edit_state->TextA.reserve(new_buf_size + 1);
4002  Buf = edit_state->TextA.Data;
4003  BufSize = edit_state->BufCapacityA = new_buf_size;
4004  }
4005 
4006  if (BufTextLen != pos)
4007  memmove(Buf + pos + new_text_len, Buf + pos, (size_t)(BufTextLen - pos));
4008  memcpy(Buf + pos, new_text, (size_t)new_text_len * sizeof(char));
4009  Buf[BufTextLen + new_text_len] = '\0';
4010 
4011  if (CursorPos >= pos)
4012  CursorPos += new_text_len;
4013  SelectionStart = SelectionEnd = CursorPos;
4014  BufDirty = true;
4015  BufTextLen += new_text_len;
4016 }
4017 
4018 // Return false to discard a character.
4019 static bool InputTextFilterCharacter(unsigned int *p_char, ImGuiInputTextFlags flags, ImGuiInputTextCallback callback, void *user_data, ImGuiInputSource input_source)
4020 {
4021  IM_ASSERT(input_source == ImGuiInputSource_Keyboard || input_source == ImGuiInputSource_Clipboard);
4022  unsigned int c = *p_char;
4023 
4024  // Filter non-printable (NB: isprint is unreliable! see #2467)
4025  bool apply_named_filters = true;
4026  if (c < 0x20)
4027  {
4028  bool pass = false;
4029  pass |= (c == '\n' && (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_Multiline));
4030  pass |= (c == '\t' && (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_AllowTabInput));
4031  if (!pass)
4032  return false;
4033  apply_named_filters = false; // Override named filters below so newline and tabs can still be inserted.
4034  }
4035 
4036  if (input_source != ImGuiInputSource_Clipboard)
4037  {
4038  // We ignore Ascii representation of delete (emitted from Backspace on OSX, see #2578, #2817)
4039  if (c == 127)
4040  return false;
4041 
4042  // Filter private Unicode range. GLFW on OSX seems to send private characters for special keys like arrow keys (FIXME)
4043  if (c >= 0xE000 && c <= 0xF8FF)
4044  return false;
4045  }
4046 
4047  // Filter Unicode ranges we are not handling in this build
4048  if (c > IM_UNICODE_CODEPOINT_MAX)
4049  return false;
4050 
4051  // Generic named filters
4052  if (apply_named_filters && (flags & (ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsDecimal | ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsHexadecimal | ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsUppercase | ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsNoBlank | ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsScientific)))
4053  {
4054  // The libc allows overriding locale, with e.g. 'setlocale(LC_NUMERIC, "de_DE.UTF-8");' which affect the output/input of printf/scanf.
4055  // The standard mandate that programs starts in the "C" locale where the decimal point is '.'.
4056  // We don't really intend to provide widespread support for it, but out of empathy for people stuck with using odd API, we support the bare minimum aka overriding the decimal point.
4057  // Change the default decimal_point with:
4058  // ImGui::GetCurrentContext()->PlatformLocaleDecimalPoint = *localeconv()->decimal_point;
4059  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
4060  const unsigned c_decimal_point = (unsigned int)g.PlatformLocaleDecimalPoint;
4061 
4062  // Allow 0-9 . - + * /
4063  if (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsDecimal)
4064  if (!(c >= '0' && c <= '9') && (c != c_decimal_point) && (c != '-') && (c != '+') && (c != '*') && (c != '/'))
4065  return false;
4066 
4067  // Allow 0-9 . - + * / e E
4068  if (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsScientific)
4069  if (!(c >= '0' && c <= '9') && (c != c_decimal_point) && (c != '-') && (c != '+') && (c != '*') && (c != '/') && (c != 'e') && (c != 'E'))
4070  return false;
4071 
4072  // Allow 0-9 a-F A-F
4073  if (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsHexadecimal)
4074  if (!(c >= '0' && c <= '9') && !(c >= 'a' && c <= 'f') && !(c >= 'A' && c <= 'F'))
4075  return false;
4076 
4077  // Turn a-z into A-Z
4078  if (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsUppercase)
4079  if (c >= 'a' && c <= 'z')
4080  *p_char = (c += (unsigned int)('A' - 'a'));
4081 
4082  if (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsNoBlank)
4083  if (ImCharIsBlankW(c))
4084  return false;
4085  }
4086 
4087  // Custom callback filter
4088  if (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackCharFilter)
4089  {
4090  ImGuiInputTextCallbackData callback_data;
4091  memset(&callback_data, 0, sizeof(ImGuiInputTextCallbackData));
4092  callback_data.EventFlag = ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackCharFilter;
4093  callback_data.EventChar = (ImWchar)c;
4094  callback_data.Flags = flags;
4095  callback_data.UserData = user_data;
4096  if (callback(&callback_data) != 0)
4097  return false;
4098  *p_char = callback_data.EventChar;
4099  if (!callback_data.EventChar)
4100  return false;
4101  }
4102 
4103  return true;
4104 }
4105 
4106 // Edit a string of text
4107 // - buf_size account for the zero-terminator, so a buf_size of 6 can hold "Hello" but not "Hello!".
4108 // This is so we can easily call InputText() on static arrays using ARRAYSIZE() and to match
4109 // Note that in std::string world, capacity() would omit 1 byte used by the zero-terminator.
4110 // - When active, hold on a privately held copy of the text (and apply back to 'buf'). So changing 'buf' while the InputText is active has no effect.
4111 // - If you want to use ImGui::InputText() with std::string, see misc/cpp/imgui_stdlib.h
4112 // (FIXME: Rather confusing and messy function, among the worse part of our codebase, expecting to rewrite a V2 at some point.. Partly because we are
4113 // doing UTF8 > U16 > UTF8 conversions on the go to easily interface with stb_textedit. Ideally should stay in UTF-8 all the time. See https://github.com/nothings/stb/issues/188)
4114 bool ImGui::InputTextEx(const char *label, const char *hint, char *buf, int buf_size, const ImVec2 &size_arg, ImGuiInputTextFlags flags, ImGuiInputTextCallback callback, void *callback_user_data)
4115 {
4116  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
4117  if (window->SkipItems)
4118  return false;
4119 
4120  IM_ASSERT(buf != NULL && buf_size >= 0);
4121  IM_ASSERT(!((flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackHistory) && (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_Multiline))); // Can't use both together (they both use up/down keys)
4122  IM_ASSERT(!((flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackCompletion) && (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_AllowTabInput))); // Can't use both together (they both use tab key)
4123 
4124  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
4125  ImGuiIO &io = g.IO;
4126  const ImGuiStyle &style = g.Style;
4127 
4128  const bool RENDER_SELECTION_WHEN_INACTIVE = false;
4129  const bool is_multiline = (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_Multiline) != 0;
4130  const bool is_readonly = (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_ReadOnly) != 0;
4131  const bool is_password = (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_Password) != 0;
4132  const bool is_undoable = (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_NoUndoRedo) == 0;
4133  const bool is_resizable = (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackResize) != 0;
4134  if (is_resizable)
4135  IM_ASSERT(callback != NULL); // Must provide a callback if you set the ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackResize flag!
4136 
4137  if (is_multiline) // Open group before calling GetID() because groups tracks id created within their scope,
4138  BeginGroup();
4139  const ImGuiID id = window->GetID(label);
4140  const ImVec2 label_size = CalcTextSize(label, NULL, true);
4141  const ImVec2 frame_size = CalcItemSize(size_arg, CalcItemWidth(), (is_multiline ? g.FontSize * 8.0f : label_size.y) + style.FramePadding.y * 2.0f); // Arbitrary default of 8 lines high for multi-line
4142  const ImVec2 total_size = ImVec2(frame_size.x + (label_size.x > 0.0f ? style.ItemInnerSpacing.x + label_size.x : 0.0f), frame_size.y);
4143 
4144  const ImRect frame_bb(window->DC.CursorPos, window->DC.CursorPos + frame_size);
4145  const ImRect total_bb(frame_bb.Min, frame_bb.Min + total_size);
4146 
4147  ImGuiWindow *draw_window = window;
4148  ImVec2 inner_size = frame_size;
4149  ImGuiItemStatusFlags item_status_flags = 0;
4150  if (is_multiline)
4151  {
4152  if (!ItemAdd(total_bb, id, &frame_bb, ImGuiItemAddFlags_Focusable))
4153  {
4154  ItemSize(total_bb, style.FramePadding.y);
4155  EndGroup();
4156  return false;
4157  }
4158  item_status_flags = g.LastItemData.StatusFlags;
4159 
4160  // We reproduce the contents of BeginChildFrame() in order to provide 'label' so our window internal data are easier to read/debug.
4161  PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_ChildBg, style.Colors[ImGuiCol_FrameBg]);
4162  PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_ChildRounding, style.FrameRounding);
4163  PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_ChildBorderSize, style.FrameBorderSize);
4164  bool child_visible = BeginChildEx(label, id, frame_bb.GetSize(), true, ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove);
4165  PopStyleVar(2);
4166  PopStyleColor();
4167  if (!child_visible)
4168  {
4169  EndChild();
4170  EndGroup();
4171  return false;
4172  }
4173  draw_window = g.CurrentWindow; // Child window
4174  draw_window->DC.NavLayersActiveMaskNext |= (1 << draw_window->DC.NavLayerCurrent); // This is to ensure that EndChild() will display a navigation highlight so we can "enter" into it.
4175  draw_window->DC.CursorPos += style.FramePadding;
4176  inner_size.x -= draw_window->ScrollbarSizes.x;
4177  }
4178  else
4179  {
4180  // Support for internal ImGuiInputTextFlags_MergedItem flag, which could be redesigned as an ItemFlags if needed (with test performed in ItemAdd)
4181  ItemSize(total_bb, style.FramePadding.y);
4182  if (!(flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_MergedItem))
4183  if (!ItemAdd(total_bb, id, &frame_bb, ImGuiItemAddFlags_Focusable))
4184  return false;
4185  item_status_flags = g.LastItemData.StatusFlags;
4186  }
4187  const bool hovered = ItemHoverable(frame_bb, id);
4188  if (hovered)
4189  g.MouseCursor = ImGuiMouseCursor_TextInput;
4190 
4191  // We are only allowed to access the state if we are already the active widget.
4192  ImGuiInputTextState *state = GetInputTextState(id);
4193 
4194  const bool focus_requested_by_code = (item_status_flags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_FocusedByCode) != 0;
4195  const bool focus_requested_by_tabbing = (item_status_flags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_FocusedByTabbing) != 0;
4196 
4197  const bool user_clicked = hovered && io.MouseClicked[0];
4198  const bool user_nav_input_start = (g.ActiveId != id) && ((g.NavInputId == id) || (g.NavActivateId == id && g.NavInputSource == ImGuiInputSource_Keyboard));
4199  const bool user_scroll_finish = is_multiline && state != NULL && g.ActiveId == 0 && g.ActiveIdPreviousFrame == GetWindowScrollbarID(draw_window, ImGuiAxis_Y);
4200  const bool user_scroll_active = is_multiline && state != NULL && g.ActiveId == GetWindowScrollbarID(draw_window, ImGuiAxis_Y);
4201 
4202  bool clear_active_id = false;
4203  bool select_all = (g.ActiveId != id) && ((flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_AutoSelectAll) != 0 || user_nav_input_start) && (!is_multiline);
4204 
4205  float scroll_y = is_multiline ? draw_window->Scroll.y : FLT_MAX;
4206 
4207  const bool init_changed_specs = (state != NULL && state->Stb.single_line != !is_multiline);
4208  const bool init_make_active = (user_clicked || user_scroll_finish || user_nav_input_start || focus_requested_by_code || focus_requested_by_tabbing);
4209  const bool init_state = (init_make_active || user_scroll_active);
4210  if ((init_state && g.ActiveId != id) || init_changed_specs)
4211  {
4212  // Access state even if we don't own it yet.
4213  state = &g.InputTextState;
4214  state->CursorAnimReset();
4215 
4216  // Take a copy of the initial buffer value (both in original UTF-8 format and converted to wchar)
4217  // From the moment we focused we are ignoring the content of 'buf' (unless we are in read-only mode)
4218  const int buf_len = (int)strlen(buf);
4219  state->InitialTextA.resize(buf_len + 1); // UTF-8. we use +1 to make sure that .Data is always pointing to at least an empty string.
4220  memcpy(state->InitialTextA.Data, buf, buf_len + 1);
4221 
4222  // Start edition
4223  const char *buf_end = NULL;
4224  state->TextW.resize(buf_size + 1); // wchar count <= UTF-8 count. we use +1 to make sure that .Data is always pointing to at least an empty string.
4225  state->TextA.resize(0);
4226  state->TextAIsValid = false; // TextA is not valid yet (we will display buf until then)
4227  state->CurLenW = ImTextStrFromUtf8(state->TextW.Data, buf_size, buf, NULL, &buf_end);
4228  state->CurLenA = (int)(buf_end - buf); // We can't get the result from ImStrncpy() above because it is not UTF-8 aware. Here we'll cut off malformed UTF-8.
4229 
4230  // Preserve cursor position and undo/redo stack if we come back to same widget
4231  // FIXME: For non-readonly widgets we might be able to require that TextAIsValid && TextA == buf ? (untested) and discard undo stack if user buffer has changed.
4232  const bool recycle_state = (state->ID == id && !init_changed_specs);
4233  if (recycle_state)
4234  {
4235  // Recycle existing cursor/selection/undo stack but clamp position
4236  // Note a single mouse click will override the cursor/position immediately by calling stb_textedit_click handler.
4237  state->CursorClamp();
4238  }
4239  else
4240  {
4241  state->ID = id;
4242  state->ScrollX = 0.0f;
4243  stb_textedit_initialize_state(&state->Stb, !is_multiline);
4244  if (!is_multiline && focus_requested_by_code)
4245  select_all = true;
4246  }
4247  if (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_AlwaysOverwrite)
4248  state->Stb.insert_mode = 1; // stb field name is indeed incorrect (see #2863)
4249  if (!is_multiline && (focus_requested_by_tabbing || (user_clicked && io.KeyCtrl)))
4250  select_all = true;
4251  }
4252 
4253  if (g.ActiveId != id && init_make_active)
4254  {
4255  IM_ASSERT(state && state->ID == id);
4256  SetActiveID(id, window);
4257  SetFocusID(id, window);
4258  FocusWindow(window);
4259 
4260  // Declare our inputs
4261  IM_ASSERT(ImGuiNavInput_COUNT < 32);
4262  g.ActiveIdUsingNavDirMask |= (1 << ImGuiDir_Left) | (1 << ImGuiDir_Right);
4263  if (is_multiline || (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackHistory))
4264  g.ActiveIdUsingNavDirMask |= (1 << ImGuiDir_Up) | (1 << ImGuiDir_Down);
4265  g.ActiveIdUsingNavInputMask |= (1 << ImGuiNavInput_Cancel);
4266  g.ActiveIdUsingKeyInputMask |= ((ImU64)1 << ImGuiKey_Home) | ((ImU64)1 << ImGuiKey_End);
4267  if (is_multiline)
4268  g.ActiveIdUsingKeyInputMask |= ((ImU64)1 << ImGuiKey_PageUp) | ((ImU64)1 << ImGuiKey_PageDown);
4269  if (flags & (ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackCompletion | ImGuiInputTextFlags_AllowTabInput)) // Disable keyboard tabbing out as we will use the \t character.
4270  g.ActiveIdUsingKeyInputMask |= ((ImU64)1 << ImGuiKey_Tab);
4271  }
4272 
4273  // We have an edge case if ActiveId was set through another widget (e.g. widget being swapped), clear id immediately (don't wait until the end of the function)
4274  if (g.ActiveId == id && state == NULL)
4275  ClearActiveID();
4276 
4277  // Release focus when we click outside
4278  if (g.ActiveId == id && io.MouseClicked[0] && !init_state && !init_make_active) //-V560
4279  clear_active_id = true;
4280 
4281  // Lock the decision of whether we are going to take the path displaying the cursor or selection
4282  const bool render_cursor = (g.ActiveId == id) || (state && user_scroll_active);
4283  bool render_selection = state && state->HasSelection() && (RENDER_SELECTION_WHEN_INACTIVE || render_cursor);
4284  bool value_changed = false;
4285  bool enter_pressed = false;
4286 
4287  // When read-only we always use the live data passed to the function
4288  // FIXME-OPT: Because our selection/cursor code currently needs the wide text we need to convert it when active, which is not ideal :(
4289  if (is_readonly && state != NULL && (render_cursor || render_selection))
4290  {
4291  const char *buf_end = NULL;
4292  state->TextW.resize(buf_size + 1);
4293  state->CurLenW = ImTextStrFromUtf8(state->TextW.Data, state->TextW.Size, buf, NULL, &buf_end);
4294  state->CurLenA = (int)(buf_end - buf);
4295  state->CursorClamp();
4296  render_selection &= state->HasSelection();
4297  }
4298 
4299  // Select the buffer to render.
4300  const bool buf_display_from_state = (render_cursor || render_selection || g.ActiveId == id) && !is_readonly && state && state->TextAIsValid;
4301  const bool is_displaying_hint = (hint != NULL && (buf_display_from_state ? state->TextA.Data : buf)[0] == 0);
4302 
4303  // Password pushes a temporary font with only a fallback glyph
4304  if (is_password && !is_displaying_hint)
4305  {
4306  const ImFontGlyph *glyph = g.Font->FindGlyph('*');
4307  ImFont *password_font = &g.InputTextPasswordFont;
4308  password_font->FontSize = g.Font->FontSize;
4309  password_font->Scale = g.Font->Scale;
4310  password_font->Ascent = g.Font->Ascent;
4311  password_font->Descent = g.Font->Descent;
4312  password_font->ContainerAtlas = g.Font->ContainerAtlas;
4313  password_font->FallbackGlyph = glyph;
4314  password_font->FallbackAdvanceX = glyph->AdvanceX;
4315  IM_ASSERT(password_font->Glyphs.empty() && password_font->IndexAdvanceX.empty() && password_font->IndexLookup.empty());
4316  PushFont(password_font);
4317  }
4318 
4319  // Process mouse inputs and character inputs
4320  int backup_current_text_length = 0;
4321  if (g.ActiveId == id)
4322  {
4323  IM_ASSERT(state != NULL);
4324  backup_current_text_length = state->CurLenA;
4325  state->Edited = false;
4326  state->BufCapacityA = buf_size;
4327  state->Flags = flags;
4328  state->UserCallback = callback;
4329  state->UserCallbackData = callback_user_data;
4330 
4331  // Although we are active we don't prevent mouse from hovering other elements unless we are interacting right now with the widget.
4332  // Down the line we should have a cleaner library-wide concept of Selected vs Active.
4333  g.ActiveIdAllowOverlap = !io.MouseDown[0];
4334  g.WantTextInputNextFrame = 1;
4335 
4336  // Edit in progress
4337  const float mouse_x = (io.MousePos.x - frame_bb.Min.x - style.FramePadding.x) + state->ScrollX;
4338  const float mouse_y = (is_multiline ? (io.MousePos.y - draw_window->DC.CursorPos.y) : (g.FontSize * 0.5f));
4339 
4340  const bool is_osx = io.ConfigMacOSXBehaviors;
4341  if (select_all || (hovered && !is_osx && io.MouseDoubleClicked[0]))
4342  {
4343  state->SelectAll();
4344  state->SelectedAllMouseLock = true;
4345  }
4346  else if (hovered && is_osx && io.MouseDoubleClicked[0])
4347  {
4348  // Double-click select a word only, OS X style (by simulating keystrokes)
4349  state->OnKeyPressed(STB_TEXTEDIT_K_WORDLEFT);
4350  state->OnKeyPressed(STB_TEXTEDIT_K_WORDRIGHT | STB_TEXTEDIT_K_SHIFT);
4351  }
4352  else if (io.MouseClicked[0] && !state->SelectedAllMouseLock)
4353  {
4354  if (hovered)
4355  {
4356  stb_textedit_click(state, &state->Stb, mouse_x, mouse_y);
4357  state->CursorAnimReset();
4358  }
4359  }
4360  else if (io.MouseDown[0] && !state->SelectedAllMouseLock && (io.MouseDelta.x != 0.0f || io.MouseDelta.y != 0.0f))
4361  {
4362  stb_textedit_drag(state, &state->Stb, mouse_x, mouse_y);
4363  state->CursorAnimReset();
4364  state->CursorFollow = true;
4365  }
4366  if (state->SelectedAllMouseLock && !io.MouseDown[0])
4367  state->SelectedAllMouseLock = false;
4368 
4369  // It is ill-defined whether the backend needs to send a \t character when pressing the TAB keys.
4370  // Win32 and GLFW naturally do it but not SDL.
4371  const bool ignore_char_inputs = (io.KeyCtrl && !io.KeyAlt) || (is_osx && io.KeySuper);
4372  if ((flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_AllowTabInput) && IsKeyPressedMap(ImGuiKey_Tab) && !ignore_char_inputs && !io.KeyShift && !is_readonly)
4373  if (!io.InputQueueCharacters.contains('\t'))
4374  {
4375  unsigned int c = '\t'; // Insert TAB
4376  if (InputTextFilterCharacter(&c, flags, callback, callback_user_data, ImGuiInputSource_Keyboard))
4377  state->OnKeyPressed((int)c);
4378  }
4379 
4380  // Process regular text input (before we check for Return because using some IME will effectively send a Return?)
4381  // We ignore CTRL inputs, but need to allow ALT+CTRL as some keyboards (e.g. German) use AltGR (which _is_ Alt+Ctrl) to input certain characters.
4382  if (io.InputQueueCharacters.Size > 0)
4383  {
4384  if (!ignore_char_inputs && !is_readonly && !user_nav_input_start)
4385  for (int n = 0; n < io.InputQueueCharacters.Size; n++)
4386  {
4387  // Insert character if they pass filtering
4388  unsigned int c = (unsigned int)io.InputQueueCharacters[n];
4389  if (c == '\t' && io.KeyShift)
4390  continue;
4391  if (InputTextFilterCharacter(&c, flags, callback, callback_user_data, ImGuiInputSource_Keyboard))
4392  state->OnKeyPressed((int)c);
4393  }
4394 
4395  // Consume characters
4396  io.InputQueueCharacters.resize(0);
4397  }
4398  }
4399 
4400  // Process other shortcuts/key-presses
4401  bool cancel_edit = false;
4402  if (g.ActiveId == id && !g.ActiveIdIsJustActivated && !clear_active_id)
4403  {
4404  IM_ASSERT(state != NULL);
4405  IM_ASSERT(io.KeyMods == GetMergedKeyModFlags() && "Mismatching io.KeyCtrl/io.KeyShift/io.KeyAlt/io.KeySuper vs io.KeyMods"); // We rarely do this check, but if anything let's do it here.
4406 
4407  const int row_count_per_page = ImMax((int)((inner_size.y - style.FramePadding.y) / g.FontSize), 1);
4408  state->Stb.row_count_per_page = row_count_per_page;
4409 
4410  const int k_mask = (io.KeyShift ? STB_TEXTEDIT_K_SHIFT : 0);
4411  const bool is_osx = io.ConfigMacOSXBehaviors;
4412  const bool is_osx_shift_shortcut = is_osx && (io.KeyMods == (ImGuiKeyModFlags_Super | ImGuiKeyModFlags_Shift));
4413  const bool is_wordmove_key_down = is_osx ? io.KeyAlt : io.KeyCtrl; // OS X style: Text editing cursor movement using Alt instead of Ctrl
4414  const bool is_startend_key_down = is_osx && io.KeySuper && !io.KeyCtrl && !io.KeyAlt; // OS X style: Line/Text Start and End using Cmd+Arrows instead of Home/End
4415  const bool is_ctrl_key_only = (io.KeyMods == ImGuiKeyModFlags_Ctrl);
4416  const bool is_shift_key_only = (io.KeyMods == ImGuiKeyModFlags_Shift);
4417  const bool is_shortcut_key = g.IO.ConfigMacOSXBehaviors ? (io.KeyMods == ImGuiKeyModFlags_Super) : (io.KeyMods == ImGuiKeyModFlags_Ctrl);
4418 
4419  const bool is_cut = ((is_shortcut_key && IsKeyPressedMap(ImGuiKey_X)) || (is_shift_key_only && IsKeyPressedMap(ImGuiKey_Delete))) && !is_readonly && !is_password && (!is_multiline || state->HasSelection());
4420  const bool is_copy = ((is_shortcut_key && IsKeyPressedMap(ImGuiKey_C)) || (is_ctrl_key_only && IsKeyPressedMap(ImGuiKey_Insert))) && !is_password && (!is_multiline || state->HasSelection());
4421  const bool is_paste = ((is_shortcut_key && IsKeyPressedMap(ImGuiKey_V)) || (is_shift_key_only && IsKeyPressedMap(ImGuiKey_Insert))) && !is_readonly;
4422  const bool is_undo = ((is_shortcut_key && IsKeyPressedMap(ImGuiKey_Z)) && !is_readonly && is_undoable);
4423  const bool is_redo = ((is_shortcut_key && IsKeyPressedMap(ImGuiKey_Y)) || (is_osx_shift_shortcut && IsKeyPressedMap(ImGuiKey_Z))) && !is_readonly && is_undoable;
4424 
4425  if (IsKeyPressedMap(ImGuiKey_LeftArrow))
4426  {
4427  state->OnKeyPressed((is_startend_key_down ? STB_TEXTEDIT_K_LINESTART : is_wordmove_key_down ? STB_TEXTEDIT_K_WORDLEFT : STB_TEXTEDIT_K_LEFT) | k_mask);
4428  }
4429  else if (IsKeyPressedMap(ImGuiKey_RightArrow))
4430  {
4431  state->OnKeyPressed((is_startend_key_down ? STB_TEXTEDIT_K_LINEEND : is_wordmove_key_down ? STB_TEXTEDIT_K_WORDRIGHT : STB_TEXTEDIT_K_RIGHT) | k_mask);
4432  }
4433  else if (IsKeyPressedMap(ImGuiKey_UpArrow) && is_multiline)
4434  {
4435  if (io.KeyCtrl) SetScrollY(draw_window, ImMax(draw_window->Scroll.y - g.FontSize, 0.0f)); else state->OnKeyPressed((is_startend_key_down ? STB_TEXTEDIT_K_TEXTSTART : STB_TEXTEDIT_K_UP) | k_mask);
4436  }
4437  else if (IsKeyPressedMap(ImGuiKey_DownArrow) && is_multiline)
4438  {
4439  if (io.KeyCtrl) SetScrollY(draw_window, ImMin(draw_window->Scroll.y + g.FontSize, GetScrollMaxY())); else state->OnKeyPressed((is_startend_key_down ? STB_TEXTEDIT_K_TEXTEND : STB_TEXTEDIT_K_DOWN) | k_mask);
4440  }
4441  else if (IsKeyPressedMap(ImGuiKey_PageUp) && is_multiline)
4442  {
4443  state->OnKeyPressed(STB_TEXTEDIT_K_PGUP | k_mask); scroll_y -= row_count_per_page * g.FontSize;
4444  }
4445  else if (IsKeyPressedMap(ImGuiKey_PageDown) && is_multiline)
4446  {
4447  state->OnKeyPressed(STB_TEXTEDIT_K_PGDOWN | k_mask); scroll_y += row_count_per_page * g.FontSize;
4448  }
4449  else if (IsKeyPressedMap(ImGuiKey_Home))
4450  {
4451  state->OnKeyPressed(io.KeyCtrl ? STB_TEXTEDIT_K_TEXTSTART | k_mask : STB_TEXTEDIT_K_LINESTART | k_mask);
4452  }
4453  else if (IsKeyPressedMap(ImGuiKey_End))
4454  {
4455  state->OnKeyPressed(io.KeyCtrl ? STB_TEXTEDIT_K_TEXTEND | k_mask : STB_TEXTEDIT_K_LINEEND | k_mask);
4456  }
4457  else if (IsKeyPressedMap(ImGuiKey_Delete) && !is_readonly)
4458  {
4459  state->OnKeyPressed(STB_TEXTEDIT_K_DELETE | k_mask);
4460  }
4461  else if (IsKeyPressedMap(ImGuiKey_Backspace) && !is_readonly)
4462  {
4463  if (!state->HasSelection())
4464  {
4465  if (is_wordmove_key_down)
4466  state->OnKeyPressed(STB_TEXTEDIT_K_WORDLEFT | STB_TEXTEDIT_K_SHIFT);
4467  else if (is_osx && io.KeySuper && !io.KeyAlt && !io.KeyCtrl)
4468  state->OnKeyPressed(STB_TEXTEDIT_K_LINESTART | STB_TEXTEDIT_K_SHIFT);
4469  }
4470  state->OnKeyPressed(STB_TEXTEDIT_K_BACKSPACE | k_mask);
4471  }
4472  else if (IsKeyPressedMap(ImGuiKey_Enter) || IsKeyPressedMap(ImGuiKey_KeyPadEnter))
4473  {
4474  bool ctrl_enter_for_new_line = (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_CtrlEnterForNewLine) != 0;
4475  if (!is_multiline || (ctrl_enter_for_new_line && !io.KeyCtrl) || (!ctrl_enter_for_new_line && io.KeyCtrl))
4476  {
4477  enter_pressed = clear_active_id = true;
4478  }
4479  else if (!is_readonly)
4480  {
4481  unsigned int c = '\n'; // Insert new line
4482  if (InputTextFilterCharacter(&c, flags, callback, callback_user_data, ImGuiInputSource_Keyboard))
4483  state->OnKeyPressed((int)c);
4484  }
4485  }
4486  else if (IsKeyPressedMap(ImGuiKey_Escape))
4487  {
4488  clear_active_id = cancel_edit = true;
4489  }
4490  else if (is_undo || is_redo)
4491  {
4492  state->OnKeyPressed(is_undo ? STB_TEXTEDIT_K_UNDO : STB_TEXTEDIT_K_REDO);
4493  state->ClearSelection();
4494  }
4495  else if (is_shortcut_key && IsKeyPressedMap(ImGuiKey_A))
4496  {
4497  state->SelectAll();
4498  state->CursorFollow = true;
4499  }
4500  else if (is_cut || is_copy)
4501  {
4502  // Cut, Copy
4503  if (io.SetClipboardTextFn)
4504  {
4505  const int ib = state->HasSelection() ? ImMin(state->Stb.select_start, state->Stb.select_end) : 0;
4506  const int ie = state->HasSelection() ? ImMax(state->Stb.select_start, state->Stb.select_end) : state->CurLenW;
4507  const int clipboard_data_len = ImTextCountUtf8BytesFromStr(state->TextW.Data + ib, state->TextW.Data + ie) + 1;
4508  char *clipboard_data = (char *)IM_ALLOC(clipboard_data_len * sizeof(char));
4509  ImTextStrToUtf8(clipboard_data, clipboard_data_len, state->TextW.Data + ib, state->TextW.Data + ie);
4510  SetClipboardText(clipboard_data);
4511  MemFree(clipboard_data);
4512  }
4513  if (is_cut)
4514  {
4515  if (!state->HasSelection())
4516  state->SelectAll();
4517  state->CursorFollow = true;
4518  stb_textedit_cut(state, &state->Stb);
4519  }
4520  }
4521  else if (is_paste)
4522  {
4523  if (const char *clipboard = GetClipboardText())
4524  {
4525  // Filter pasted buffer
4526  const int clipboard_len = (int)strlen(clipboard);
4527  ImWchar *clipboard_filtered = (ImWchar *)IM_ALLOC((clipboard_len + 1) * sizeof(ImWchar));
4528  int clipboard_filtered_len = 0;
4529  for (const char *s = clipboard; *s; )
4530  {
4531  unsigned int c;
4532  s += ImTextCharFromUtf8(&c, s, NULL);
4533  if (c == 0)
4534  break;
4535  if (!InputTextFilterCharacter(&c, flags, callback, callback_user_data, ImGuiInputSource_Clipboard))
4536  continue;
4537  clipboard_filtered[clipboard_filtered_len++] = (ImWchar)c;
4538  }
4539  clipboard_filtered[clipboard_filtered_len] = 0;
4540  if (clipboard_filtered_len > 0) // If everything was filtered, ignore the pasting operation
4541  {
4542  stb_textedit_paste(state, &state->Stb, clipboard_filtered, clipboard_filtered_len);
4543  state->CursorFollow = true;
4544  }
4545  MemFree(clipboard_filtered);
4546  }
4547  }
4548 
4549  // Update render selection flag after events have been handled, so selection highlight can be displayed during the same frame.
4550  render_selection |= state->HasSelection() && (RENDER_SELECTION_WHEN_INACTIVE || render_cursor);
4551  }
4552 
4553  // Process callbacks and apply result back to user's buffer.
4554  if (g.ActiveId == id)
4555  {
4556  IM_ASSERT(state != NULL);
4557  const char *apply_new_text = NULL;
4558  int apply_new_text_length = 0;
4559  if (cancel_edit)
4560  {
4561  // Restore initial value. Only return true if restoring to the initial value changes the current buffer contents.
4562  if (!is_readonly && strcmp(buf, state->InitialTextA.Data) != 0)
4563  {
4564  // Push records into the undo stack so we can CTRL+Z the revert operation itself
4565  apply_new_text = state->InitialTextA.Data;
4566  apply_new_text_length = state->InitialTextA.Size - 1;
4567  ImVector<ImWchar> w_text;
4568  if (apply_new_text_length > 0)
4569  {
4570  w_text.resize(ImTextCountCharsFromUtf8(apply_new_text, apply_new_text + apply_new_text_length) + 1);
4571  ImTextStrFromUtf8(w_text.Data, w_text.Size, apply_new_text, apply_new_text + apply_new_text_length);
4572  }
4573  stb_textedit_replace(state, &state->Stb, w_text.Data, (apply_new_text_length > 0) ? (w_text.Size - 1) : 0);
4574  }
4575  }
4576 
4577  // When using 'ImGuiInputTextFlags_EnterReturnsTrue' as a special case we reapply the live buffer back to the input buffer before clearing ActiveId, even though strictly speaking it wasn't modified on this frame.
4578  // If we didn't do that, code like InputInt() with ImGuiInputTextFlags_EnterReturnsTrue would fail.
4579  // This also allows the user to use InputText() with ImGuiInputTextFlags_EnterReturnsTrue without maintaining any user-side storage (please note that if you use this property along ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackResize you can end up with your temporary string object unnecessarily allocating once a frame, either store your string data, either if you don't then don't use ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackResize).
4580  bool apply_edit_back_to_user_buffer = !cancel_edit || (enter_pressed && (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_EnterReturnsTrue) != 0);
4581  if (apply_edit_back_to_user_buffer)
4582  {
4583  // Apply new value immediately - copy modified buffer back
4584  // Note that as soon as the input box is active, the in-widget value gets priority over any underlying modification of the input buffer
4585  // FIXME: We actually always render 'buf' when calling DrawList->AddText, making the comment above incorrect.
4586  // FIXME-OPT: CPU waste to do this every time the widget is active, should mark dirty state from the stb_textedit callbacks.
4587  if (!is_readonly)
4588  {
4589  state->TextAIsValid = true;
4590  state->TextA.resize(state->TextW.Size * 4 + 1);
4591  ImTextStrToUtf8(state->TextA.Data, state->TextA.Size, state->TextW.Data, NULL);
4592  }
4593 
4594  // User callback
4595  if ((flags & (ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackCompletion | ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackHistory | ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackEdit | ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackAlways)) != 0)
4596  {
4597  IM_ASSERT(callback != NULL);
4598 
4599  // The reason we specify the usage semantic (Completion/History) is that Completion needs to disable keyboard TABBING at the moment.
4600  ImGuiInputTextFlags event_flag = 0;
4601  ImGuiKey event_key = ImGuiKey_COUNT;
4602  if ((flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackCompletion) != 0 && IsKeyPressedMap(ImGuiKey_Tab))
4603  {
4604  event_flag = ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackCompletion;
4605  event_key = ImGuiKey_Tab;
4606  }
4607  else if ((flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackHistory) != 0 && IsKeyPressedMap(ImGuiKey_UpArrow))
4608  {
4609  event_flag = ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackHistory;
4610  event_key = ImGuiKey_UpArrow;
4611  }
4612  else if ((flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackHistory) != 0 && IsKeyPressedMap(ImGuiKey_DownArrow))
4613  {
4614  event_flag = ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackHistory;
4615  event_key = ImGuiKey_DownArrow;
4616  }
4617  else if ((flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackEdit) && state->Edited)
4618  {
4619  event_flag = ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackEdit;
4620  }
4621  else if (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackAlways)
4622  {
4623  event_flag = ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackAlways;
4624  }
4625 
4626  if (event_flag)
4627  {
4628  ImGuiInputTextCallbackData callback_data;
4629  memset(&callback_data, 0, sizeof(ImGuiInputTextCallbackData));
4630  callback_data.EventFlag = event_flag;
4631  callback_data.Flags = flags;
4632  callback_data.UserData = callback_user_data;
4633 
4634  callback_data.EventKey = event_key;
4635  callback_data.Buf = state->TextA.Data;
4636  callback_data.BufTextLen = state->CurLenA;
4637  callback_data.BufSize = state->BufCapacityA;
4638  callback_data.BufDirty = false;
4639 
4640  // We have to convert from wchar-positions to UTF-8-positions, which can be pretty slow (an incentive to ditch the ImWchar buffer, see https://github.com/nothings/stb/issues/188)
4641  ImWchar *text = state->TextW.Data;
4642  const int utf8_cursor_pos = callback_data.CursorPos = ImTextCountUtf8BytesFromStr(text, text + state->Stb.cursor);
4643  const int utf8_selection_start = callback_data.SelectionStart = ImTextCountUtf8BytesFromStr(text, text + state->Stb.select_start);
4644  const int utf8_selection_end = callback_data.SelectionEnd = ImTextCountUtf8BytesFromStr(text, text + state->Stb.select_end);
4645 
4646  // Call user code
4647  callback(&callback_data);
4648 
4649  // Read back what user may have modified
4650  IM_ASSERT(callback_data.Buf == state->TextA.Data); // Invalid to modify those fields
4651  IM_ASSERT(callback_data.BufSize == state->BufCapacityA);
4652  IM_ASSERT(callback_data.Flags == flags);
4653  const bool buf_dirty = callback_data.BufDirty;
4654  if (callback_data.CursorPos != utf8_cursor_pos || buf_dirty)
4655  {
4656  state->Stb.cursor = ImTextCountCharsFromUtf8(callback_data.Buf, callback_data.Buf + callback_data.CursorPos); state->CursorFollow = true;
4657  }
4658  if (callback_data.SelectionStart != utf8_selection_start || buf_dirty)
4659  {
4660  state->Stb.select_start = (callback_data.SelectionStart == callback_data.CursorPos) ? state->Stb.cursor : ImTextCountCharsFromUtf8(callback_data.Buf, callback_data.Buf + callback_data.SelectionStart);
4661  }
4662  if (callback_data.SelectionEnd != utf8_selection_end || buf_dirty)
4663  {
4664  state->Stb.select_end = (callback_data.SelectionEnd == callback_data.SelectionStart) ? state->Stb.select_start : ImTextCountCharsFromUtf8(callback_data.Buf, callback_data.Buf + callback_data.SelectionEnd);
4665  }
4666  if (buf_dirty)
4667  {
4668  IM_ASSERT(callback_data.BufTextLen == (int)strlen(callback_data.Buf)); // You need to maintain BufTextLen if you change the text!
4669  if (callback_data.BufTextLen > backup_current_text_length && is_resizable)
4670  state->TextW.resize(state->TextW.Size + (callback_data.BufTextLen - backup_current_text_length));
4671  state->CurLenW = ImTextStrFromUtf8(state->TextW.Data, state->TextW.Size, callback_data.Buf, NULL);
4672  state->CurLenA = callback_data.BufTextLen; // Assume correct length and valid UTF-8 from user, saves us an extra strlen()
4673  state->CursorAnimReset();
4674  }
4675  }
4676  }
4677 
4678  // Will copy result string if modified
4679  if (!is_readonly && strcmp(state->TextA.Data, buf) != 0)
4680  {
4681  apply_new_text = state->TextA.Data;
4682  apply_new_text_length = state->CurLenA;
4683  }
4684  }
4685 
4686  // Copy result to user buffer
4687  if (apply_new_text)
4688  {
4689  // We cannot test for 'backup_current_text_length != apply_new_text_length' here because we have no guarantee that the size
4690  // of our owned buffer matches the size of the string object held by the user, and by design we allow InputText() to be used
4691  // without any storage on user's side.
4692  IM_ASSERT(apply_new_text_length >= 0);
4693  if (is_resizable)
4694  {
4695  ImGuiInputTextCallbackData callback_data;
4696  callback_data.EventFlag = ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackResize;
4697  callback_data.Flags = flags;
4698  callback_data.Buf = buf;
4699  callback_data.BufTextLen = apply_new_text_length;
4700  callback_data.BufSize = ImMax(buf_size, apply_new_text_length + 1);
4701  callback_data.UserData = callback_user_data;
4702  callback(&callback_data);
4703  buf = callback_data.Buf;
4704  buf_size = callback_data.BufSize;
4705  apply_new_text_length = ImMin(callback_data.BufTextLen, buf_size - 1);
4706  IM_ASSERT(apply_new_text_length <= buf_size);
4707  }
4708  //IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG("InputText(\"%s\"): apply_new_text length %d\n", label, apply_new_text_length);
4709 
4710  // If the underlying buffer resize was denied or not carried to the next frame, apply_new_text_length+1 may be >= buf_size.
4711  ImStrncpy(buf, apply_new_text, ImMin(apply_new_text_length + 1, buf_size));
4712  value_changed = true;
4713  }
4714 
4715  // Clear temporary user storage
4716  state->Flags = ImGuiInputTextFlags_None;
4717  state->UserCallback = NULL;
4718  state->UserCallbackData = NULL;
4719  }
4720 
4721  // Release active ID at the end of the function (so e.g. pressing Return still does a final application of the value)
4722  if (clear_active_id && g.ActiveId == id)
4723  ClearActiveID();
4724 
4725  // Render frame
4726  if (!is_multiline)
4727  {
4728  RenderNavHighlight(frame_bb, id);
4729  RenderFrame(frame_bb.Min, frame_bb.Max, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_FrameBg), true, style.FrameRounding);
4730  }
4731 
4732  const ImVec4 clip_rect(frame_bb.Min.x, frame_bb.Min.y, frame_bb.Min.x + inner_size.x, frame_bb.Min.y + inner_size.y); // Not using frame_bb.Max because we have adjusted size
4733  ImVec2 draw_pos = is_multiline ? draw_window->DC.CursorPos : frame_bb.Min + style.FramePadding;
4734  ImVec2 text_size(0.0f, 0.0f);
4735 
4736  // Set upper limit of single-line InputTextEx() at 2 million characters strings. The current pathological worst case is a long line
4737  // without any carriage return, which would makes ImFont::RenderText() reserve too many vertices and probably crash. Avoid it altogether.
4738  // Note that we only use this limit on single-line InputText(), so a pathologically large line on a InputTextMultiline() would still crash.
4739  const int buf_display_max_length = 2 * 1024 * 1024;
4740  const char *buf_display = buf_display_from_state ? state->TextA.Data : buf; //-V595
4741  const char *buf_display_end = NULL; // We have specialized paths below for setting the length
4742  if (is_displaying_hint)
4743  {
4744  buf_display = hint;
4745  buf_display_end = hint + strlen(hint);
4746  }
4747 
4748  // Render text. We currently only render selection when the widget is active or while scrolling.
4749  // FIXME: We could remove the '&& render_cursor' to keep rendering selection when inactive.
4750  if (render_cursor || render_selection)
4751  {
4752  IM_ASSERT(state != NULL);
4753  if (!is_displaying_hint)
4754  buf_display_end = buf_display + state->CurLenA;
4755 
4756  // Render text (with cursor and selection)
4757  // This is going to be messy. We need to:
4758  // - Display the text (this alone can be more easily clipped)
4759  // - Handle scrolling, highlight selection, display cursor (those all requires some form of 1d->2d cursor position calculation)
4760  // - Measure text height (for scrollbar)
4761  // We are attempting to do most of that in **one main pass** to minimize the computation cost (non-negligible for large amount of text) + 2nd pass for selection rendering (we could merge them by an extra refactoring effort)
4762  // FIXME: This should occur on buf_display but we'd need to maintain cursor/select_start/select_end for UTF-8.
4763  const ImWchar *text_begin = state->TextW.Data;
4764  ImVec2 cursor_offset, select_start_offset;
4765 
4766  {
4767  // Find lines numbers straddling 'cursor' (slot 0) and 'select_start' (slot 1) positions.
4768  const ImWchar *searches_input_ptr[2] = { NULL, NULL };
4769  int searches_result_line_no[2] = { -1000, -1000 };
4770  int searches_remaining = 0;
4771  if (render_cursor)
4772  {
4773  searches_input_ptr[0] = text_begin + state->Stb.cursor;
4774  searches_result_line_no[0] = -1;
4775  searches_remaining++;
4776  }
4777  if (render_selection)
4778  {
4779  searches_input_ptr[1] = text_begin + ImMin(state->Stb.select_start, state->Stb.select_end);
4780  searches_result_line_no[1] = -1;
4781  searches_remaining++;
4782  }
4783 
4784  // Iterate all lines to find our line numbers
4785  // In multi-line mode, we never exit the loop until all lines are counted, so add one extra to the searches_remaining counter.
4786  searches_remaining += is_multiline ? 1 : 0;
4787  int line_count = 0;
4788  //for (const ImWchar* s = text_begin; (s = (const ImWchar*)wcschr((const wchar_t*)s, (wchar_t)'\n')) != NULL; s++) // FIXME-OPT: Could use this when wchar_t are 16-bit
4789  for (const ImWchar *s = text_begin; *s != 0; s++)
4790  if (*s == '\n')
4791  {
4792  line_count++;
4793  if (searches_result_line_no[0] == -1 && s >= searches_input_ptr[0])
4794  {
4795  searches_result_line_no[0] = line_count; if (--searches_remaining <= 0) break;
4796  }
4797  if (searches_result_line_no[1] == -1 && s >= searches_input_ptr[1])
4798  {
4799  searches_result_line_no[1] = line_count; if (--searches_remaining <= 0) break;
4800  }
4801  }
4802  line_count++;
4803  if (searches_result_line_no[0] == -1)
4804  searches_result_line_no[0] = line_count;
4805  if (searches_result_line_no[1] == -1)
4806  searches_result_line_no[1] = line_count;
4807 
4808  // Calculate 2d position by finding the beginning of the line and measuring distance
4809  cursor_offset.x = InputTextCalcTextSizeW(ImStrbolW(searches_input_ptr[0], text_begin), searches_input_ptr[0]).x;
4810  cursor_offset.y = searches_result_line_no[0] * g.FontSize;
4811  if (searches_result_line_no[1] >= 0)
4812  {
4813  select_start_offset.x = InputTextCalcTextSizeW(ImStrbolW(searches_input_ptr[1], text_begin), searches_input_ptr[1]).x;
4814  select_start_offset.y = searches_result_line_no[1] * g.FontSize;
4815  }
4816 
4817  // Store text height (note that we haven't calculated text width at all, see GitHub issues #383, #1224)
4818  if (is_multiline)
4819  text_size = ImVec2(inner_size.x, line_count * g.FontSize);
4820  }
4821 
4822  // Scroll
4823  if (render_cursor && state->CursorFollow)
4824  {
4825  // Horizontal scroll in chunks of quarter width
4826  if (!(flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_NoHorizontalScroll))
4827  {
4828  const float scroll_increment_x = inner_size.x * 0.25f;
4829  const float visible_width = inner_size.x - style.FramePadding.x;
4830  if (cursor_offset.x < state->ScrollX)
4831  state->ScrollX = IM_FLOOR(ImMax(0.0f, cursor_offset.x - scroll_increment_x));
4832  else if (cursor_offset.x - visible_width >= state->ScrollX)
4833  state->ScrollX = IM_FLOOR(cursor_offset.x - visible_width + scroll_increment_x);
4834  }
4835  else
4836  {
4837  state->ScrollX = 0.0f;
4838  }
4839 
4840  // Vertical scroll
4841  if (is_multiline)
4842  {
4843  // Test if cursor is vertically visible
4844  if (cursor_offset.y - g.FontSize < scroll_y)
4845  scroll_y = ImMax(0.0f, cursor_offset.y - g.FontSize);
4846  else if (cursor_offset.y - inner_size.y >= scroll_y)
4847  scroll_y = cursor_offset.y - inner_size.y + style.FramePadding.y * 2.0f;
4848  const float scroll_max_y = ImMax((text_size.y + style.FramePadding.y * 2.0f) - inner_size.y, 0.0f);
4849  scroll_y = ImClamp(scroll_y, 0.0f, scroll_max_y);
4850  draw_pos.y += (draw_window->Scroll.y - scroll_y); // Manipulate cursor pos immediately avoid a frame of lag
4851  draw_window->Scroll.y = scroll_y;
4852  }
4853 
4854  state->CursorFollow = false;
4855  }
4856 
4857  // Draw selection
4858  const ImVec2 draw_scroll = ImVec2(state->ScrollX, 0.0f);
4859  if (render_selection)
4860  {
4861  const ImWchar *text_selected_begin = text_begin + ImMin(state->Stb.select_start, state->Stb.select_end);
4862  const ImWchar *text_selected_end = text_begin + ImMax(state->Stb.select_start, state->Stb.select_end);
4863 
4864  ImU32 bg_color = GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_TextSelectedBg, render_cursor ? 1.0f : 0.6f); // FIXME: current code flow mandate that render_cursor is always true here, we are leaving the transparent one for tests.
4865  float bg_offy_up = is_multiline ? 0.0f : -1.0f; // FIXME: those offsets should be part of the style? they don't play so well with multi-line selection.
4866  float bg_offy_dn = is_multiline ? 0.0f : 2.0f;
4867  ImVec2 rect_pos = draw_pos + select_start_offset - draw_scroll;
4868  for (const ImWchar *p = text_selected_begin; p < text_selected_end; )
4869  {
4870  if (rect_pos.y > clip_rect.w + g.FontSize)
4871  break;
4872  if (rect_pos.y < clip_rect.y)
4873  {
4874  //p = (const ImWchar*)wmemchr((const wchar_t*)p, '\n', text_selected_end - p); // FIXME-OPT: Could use this when wchar_t are 16-bit
4875  //p = p ? p + 1 : text_selected_end;
4876  while (p < text_selected_end)
4877  if (*p++ == '\n')
4878  break;
4879  }
4880  else
4881  {
4882  ImVec2 rect_size = InputTextCalcTextSizeW(p, text_selected_end, &p, NULL, true);
4883  if (rect_size.x <= 0.0f) rect_size.x = IM_FLOOR(g.Font->GetCharAdvance((ImWchar)' ') * 0.50f); // So we can see selected empty lines
4884  ImRect rect(rect_pos + ImVec2(0.0f, bg_offy_up - g.FontSize), rect_pos + ImVec2(rect_size.x, bg_offy_dn));
4885  rect.ClipWith(clip_rect);
4886  if (rect.Overlaps(clip_rect))
4887  draw_window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(rect.Min, rect.Max, bg_color);
4888  }
4889  rect_pos.x = draw_pos.x - draw_scroll.x;
4890  rect_pos.y += g.FontSize;
4891  }
4892  }
4893 
4894  // We test for 'buf_display_max_length' as a way to avoid some pathological cases (e.g. single-line 1 MB string) which would make ImDrawList crash.
4895  if (is_multiline || (buf_display_end - buf_display) < buf_display_max_length)
4896  {
4897  ImU32 col = GetColorU32(is_displaying_hint ? ImGuiCol_TextDisabled : ImGuiCol_Text);
4898  draw_window->DrawList->AddText(g.Font, g.FontSize, draw_pos - draw_scroll, col, buf_display, buf_display_end, 0.0f, is_multiline ? NULL : &clip_rect);
4899  }
4900 
4901  // Draw blinking cursor
4902  if (render_cursor)
4903  {
4904  state->CursorAnim += io.Time;
4905  bool cursor_is_visible = (!g.IO.ConfigInputTextCursorBlink) || (state->CursorAnim <= 0.0f) || ImFmod(state->CursorAnim, 1.20f) <= 0.80f;
4906  ImVec2 cursor_screen_pos = ImFloor(draw_pos + cursor_offset - draw_scroll);
4907  ImRect cursor_screen_rect(cursor_screen_pos.x, cursor_screen_pos.y - g.FontSize + 0.5f, cursor_screen_pos.x + 1.0f, cursor_screen_pos.y - 1.5f);
4908  if (cursor_is_visible && cursor_screen_rect.Overlaps(clip_rect))
4909  draw_window->DrawList->AddLine(cursor_screen_rect.Min, cursor_screen_rect.GetBL(), GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Text));
4910 
4911  // Notify OS of text input position for advanced IME (-1 x offset so that Windows IME can cover our cursor. Bit of an extra nicety.)
4912  if (!is_readonly)
4913  g.PlatformImePos = ImVec2(cursor_screen_pos.x - 1.0f, cursor_screen_pos.y - g.FontSize);
4914  }
4915  }
4916  else
4917  {
4918  // Render text only (no selection, no cursor)
4919  if (is_multiline)
4920  text_size = ImVec2(inner_size.x, InputTextCalcTextLenAndLineCount(buf_display, &buf_display_end) * g.FontSize); // We don't need width
4921  else if (!is_displaying_hint && g.ActiveId == id)
4922  buf_display_end = buf_display + state->CurLenA;
4923  else if (!is_displaying_hint)
4924  buf_display_end = buf_display + strlen(buf_display);
4925 
4926  if (is_multiline || (buf_display_end - buf_display) < buf_display_max_length)
4927  {
4928  ImU32 col = GetColorU32(is_displaying_hint ? ImGuiCol_TextDisabled : ImGuiCol_Text);
4929  draw_window->DrawList->AddText(g.Font, g.FontSize, draw_pos, col, buf_display, buf_display_end, 0.0f, is_multiline ? NULL : &clip_rect);
4930  }
4931  }
4932 
4933  if (is_password && !is_displaying_hint)
4934  PopFont();
4935 
4936  if (is_multiline)
4937  {
4938  Dummy(ImVec2(text_size.x, text_size.y + style.FramePadding.y));
4939  EndChild();
4940  EndGroup();
4941  }
4942 
4943  // Log as text
4944  if (g.LogEnabled && (!is_password || is_displaying_hint))
4945  {
4946  LogSetNextTextDecoration("{", "}");
4947  LogRenderedText(&draw_pos, buf_display, buf_display_end);
4948  }
4949 
4950  if (label_size.x > 0)
4951  RenderText(ImVec2(frame_bb.Max.x + style.ItemInnerSpacing.x, frame_bb.Min.y + style.FramePadding.y), label);
4952 
4953  if (value_changed && !(flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_NoMarkEdited))
4954  MarkItemEdited(id);
4955 
4956  IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ITEM_INFO(id, label, g.LastItemData.StatusFlags);
4957  if ((flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_EnterReturnsTrue) != 0)
4958  return enter_pressed;
4959  else
4960  return value_changed;
4961 }
4962 
4963 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
4964 // [SECTION] Widgets: ColorEdit, ColorPicker, ColorButton, etc.
4965 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
4966 // - ColorEdit3()
4967 // - ColorEdit4()
4968 // - ColorPicker3()
4969 // - RenderColorRectWithAlphaCheckerboard() [Internal]
4970 // - ColorPicker4()
4971 // - ColorButton()
4972 // - SetColorEditOptions()
4973 // - ColorTooltip() [Internal]
4974 // - ColorEditOptionsPopup() [Internal]
4975 // - ColorPickerOptionsPopup() [Internal]
4976 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
4977 
4978 bool ImGui::ColorEdit3(const char *label, float col[3], ImGuiColorEditFlags flags)
4979 {
4980  return ColorEdit4(label, col, flags | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha);
4981 }
4982 
4983 // Edit colors components (each component in 0.0f..1.0f range).
4984 // See enum ImGuiColorEditFlags_ for available options. e.g. Only access 3 floats if ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha flag is set.
4985 // With typical options: Left-click on color square to open color picker. Right-click to open option menu. CTRL-Click over input fields to edit them and TAB to go to next item.
4986 bool ImGui::ColorEdit4(const char *label, float col[4], ImGuiColorEditFlags flags)
4987 {
4988  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
4989  if (window->SkipItems)
4990  return false;
4991 
4992  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
4993  const ImGuiStyle &style = g.Style;
4994  const float square_sz = GetFrameHeight();
4995  const float w_full = CalcItemWidth();
4996  const float w_button = (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoSmallPreview) ? 0.0f : (square_sz + style.ItemInnerSpacing.x);
4997  const float w_inputs = w_full - w_button;
4998  const char *label_display_end = FindRenderedTextEnd(label);
4999  g.NextItemData.ClearFlags();
5000 
5001  BeginGroup();
5002  PushID(label);
5003 
5004  // If we're not showing any slider there's no point in doing any HSV conversions
5005  const ImGuiColorEditFlags flags_untouched = flags;
5006  if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoInputs)
5007  flags = (flags & (~ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayMask_)) | ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayRGB | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoOptions;
5008 
5009  // Context menu: display and modify options (before defaults are applied)
5010  if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoOptions))
5011  ColorEditOptionsPopup(col, flags);
5012 
5013  // Read stored options
5014  if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayMask_))
5015  flags |= (g.ColorEditOptions & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayMask_);
5016  if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DataTypeMask_))
5017  flags |= (g.ColorEditOptions & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DataTypeMask_);
5018  if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerMask_))
5019  flags |= (g.ColorEditOptions & ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerMask_);
5020  if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputMask_))
5021  flags |= (g.ColorEditOptions & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputMask_);
5022  flags |= (g.ColorEditOptions & ~(ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayMask_ | ImGuiColorEditFlags_DataTypeMask_ | ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerMask_ | ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputMask_));
5023  IM_ASSERT(ImIsPowerOfTwo(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayMask_)); // Check that only 1 is selected
5024  IM_ASSERT(ImIsPowerOfTwo(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputMask_)); // Check that only 1 is selected
5025 
5026  const bool alpha = (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha) == 0;
5027  const bool hdr = (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_HDR) != 0;
5028  const int components = alpha ? 4 : 3;
5029 
5030  // Convert to the formats we need
5031  float f[4] = { col[0], col[1], col[2], alpha ? col[3] : 1.0f };
5032  if ((flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputHSV) && (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayRGB))
5033  ColorConvertHSVtoRGB(f[0], f[1], f[2], f[0], f[1], f[2]);
5034  else if ((flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputRGB) && (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHSV))
5035  {
5036  // Hue is lost when converting from greyscale rgb (saturation=0). Restore it.
5037  ColorConvertRGBtoHSV(f[0], f[1], f[2], f[0], f[1], f[2]);
5038  if (memcmp(g.ColorEditLastColor, col, sizeof(float) * 3) == 0)
5039  {
