5040  if (f[1] == 0)
5041  f[0] = g.ColorEditLastHue;
5042  if (f[2] == 0)
5043  f[1] = g.ColorEditLastSat;
5044  }
5045  }
5046  int i[4] = { IM_F32_TO_INT8_UNBOUND(f[0]), IM_F32_TO_INT8_UNBOUND(f[1]), IM_F32_TO_INT8_UNBOUND(f[2]), IM_F32_TO_INT8_UNBOUND(f[3]) };
5047 
5048  bool value_changed = false;
5049  bool value_changed_as_float = false;
5050 
5051  const ImVec2 pos = window->DC.CursorPos;
5052  const float inputs_offset_x = (style.ColorButtonPosition == ImGuiDir_Left) ? w_button : 0.0f;
5053  window->DC.CursorPos.x = pos.x + inputs_offset_x;
5054 
5055  if ((flags & (ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayRGB | ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHSV)) != 0 && (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoInputs) == 0)
5056  {
5057  // RGB/HSV 0..255 Sliders
5058  const float w_item_one = ImMax(1.0f, IM_FLOOR((w_inputs - (style.ItemInnerSpacing.x) * (components - 1)) / (float)components));
5059  const float w_item_last = ImMax(1.0f, IM_FLOOR(w_inputs - (w_item_one + style.ItemInnerSpacing.x) * (components - 1)));
5060 
5061  const bool hide_prefix = (w_item_one <= CalcTextSize((flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_Float) ? "M:0.000" : "M:000").x);
5062  static const char *ids[4] = { "##X", "##Y", "##Z", "##W" };
5063  static const char *fmt_table_int[3][4] =
5064  {
5065  { "%3d", "%3d", "%3d", "%3d" }, // Short display
5066  { "R:%3d", "G:%3d", "B:%3d", "A:%3d" }, // Long display for RGBA
5067  { "H:%3d", "S:%3d", "V:%3d", "A:%3d" } // Long display for HSVA
5068  };
5069  static const char *fmt_table_float[3][4] =
5070  {
5071  { "%0.3f", "%0.3f", "%0.3f", "%0.3f" }, // Short display
5072  { "R:%0.3f", "G:%0.3f", "B:%0.3f", "A:%0.3f" }, // Long display for RGBA
5073  { "H:%0.3f", "S:%0.3f", "V:%0.3f", "A:%0.3f" } // Long display for HSVA
5074  };
5075  const int fmt_idx = hide_prefix ? 0 : (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHSV) ? 2 : 1;
5076 
5077  for (int n = 0; n < components; n++)
5078  {
5079  if (n > 0)
5080  SameLine(0, style.ItemInnerSpacing.x);
5081  SetNextItemWidth((n + 1 < components) ? w_item_one : w_item_last);
5082 
5083  // FIXME: When ImGuiColorEditFlags_HDR flag is passed HS values snap in weird ways when SV values go below 0.
5084  if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_Float)
5085  {
5086  value_changed |= DragFloat(ids[n], &f[n], 1.0f / 255.0f, 0.0f, hdr ? 0.0f : 1.0f, fmt_table_float[fmt_idx][n]);
5087  value_changed_as_float |= value_changed;
5088  }
5089  else
5090  {
5091  value_changed |= DragInt(ids[n], &i[n], 1.0f, 0, hdr ? 0 : 255, fmt_table_int[fmt_idx][n]);
5092  }
5093  if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoOptions))
5094  OpenPopupOnItemClick("context");
5095  }
5096  }
5097  else if ((flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHex) != 0 && (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoInputs) == 0)
5098  {
5099  // RGB Hexadecimal Input
5100  char buf[64];
5101  if (alpha)
5102  ImFormatString(buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), "#%02X%02X%02X%02X", ImClamp(i[0], 0, 255), ImClamp(i[1], 0, 255), ImClamp(i[2], 0, 255), ImClamp(i[3], 0, 255));
5103  else
5104  ImFormatString(buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), "#%02X%02X%02X", ImClamp(i[0], 0, 255), ImClamp(i[1], 0, 255), ImClamp(i[2], 0, 255));
5105  SetNextItemWidth(w_inputs);
5106  if (InputText("##Text", buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsHexadecimal | ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsUppercase))
5107  {
5108  value_changed = true;
5109  char *p = buf;
5110  while (*p == '#' || ImCharIsBlankA(*p))
5111  p++;
5112  i[0] = i[1] = i[2] = 0;
5113  i[3] = 0xFF; // alpha default to 255 is not parsed by scanf (e.g. inputting #FFFFFF omitting alpha)
5114  int r;
5115  if (alpha)
5116  r = sscanf(p, "%02X%02X%02X%02X", (unsigned int *)&i[0], (unsigned int *)&i[1], (unsigned int *)&i[2], (unsigned int *)&i[3]); // Treat at unsigned (%X is unsigned)
5117  else
5118  r = sscanf(p, "%02X%02X%02X", (unsigned int *)&i[0], (unsigned int *)&i[1], (unsigned int *)&i[2]);
5119  IM_UNUSED(r); // Fixes C6031: Return value ignored: 'sscanf'.
5120  }
5121  if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoOptions))
5122  OpenPopupOnItemClick("context");
5123  }
5124 
5125  ImGuiWindow *picker_active_window = NULL;
5126  if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoSmallPreview))
5127  {
5128  const float button_offset_x = ((flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoInputs) || (style.ColorButtonPosition == ImGuiDir_Left)) ? 0.0f : w_inputs + style.ItemInnerSpacing.x;
5129  window->DC.CursorPos = ImVec2(pos.x + button_offset_x, pos.y);
5130 
5131  const ImVec4 col_v4(col[0], col[1], col[2], alpha ? col[3] : 1.0f);
5132  if (ColorButton("##ColorButton", col_v4, flags))
5133  {
5134  if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoPicker))
5135  {
5136  // Store current color and open a picker
5137  g.ColorPickerRef = col_v4;
5138  OpenPopup("picker");
5139  SetNextWindowPos(g.LastItemData.Rect.GetBL() + ImVec2(-1, style.ItemSpacing.y));
5140  }
5141  }
5142  if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoOptions))
5143  OpenPopupOnItemClick("context");
5144 
5145  if (BeginPopup("picker"))
5146  {
5147  picker_active_window = g.CurrentWindow;
5148  if (label != label_display_end)
5149  {
5150  TextEx(label, label_display_end);
5151  Spacing();
5152  }
5153  ImGuiColorEditFlags picker_flags_to_forward = ImGuiColorEditFlags_DataTypeMask_ | ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerMask_ | ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputMask_ | ImGuiColorEditFlags_HDR | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha | ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaBar;
5154  ImGuiColorEditFlags picker_flags = (flags_untouched & picker_flags_to_forward) | ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayMask_ | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoLabel | ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreviewHalf;
5155  SetNextItemWidth(square_sz * 12.0f); // Use 256 + bar sizes?
5156  value_changed |= ColorPicker4("##picker", col, picker_flags, &g.ColorPickerRef.x);
5157  EndPopup();
5158  }
5159  }
5160 
5161  if (label != label_display_end && !(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoLabel))
5162  {
5163  const float text_offset_x = (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoInputs) ? w_button : w_full + style.ItemInnerSpacing.x;
5164  window->DC.CursorPos = ImVec2(pos.x + text_offset_x, pos.y + style.FramePadding.y);
5165  TextEx(label, label_display_end);
5166  }
5167 
5168  // Convert back
5169  if (value_changed && picker_active_window == NULL)
5170  {
5171  if (!value_changed_as_float)
5172  for (int n = 0; n < 4; n++)
5173  f[n] = i[n] / 255.0f;
5174  if ((flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHSV) && (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputRGB))
5175  {
5176  g.ColorEditLastHue = f[0];
5177  g.ColorEditLastSat = f[1];
5178  ColorConvertHSVtoRGB(f[0], f[1], f[2], f[0], f[1], f[2]);
5179  memcpy(g.ColorEditLastColor, f, sizeof(float) * 3);
5180  }
5181  if ((flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayRGB) && (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputHSV))
5182  ColorConvertRGBtoHSV(f[0], f[1], f[2], f[0], f[1], f[2]);
5183 
5184  col[0] = f[0];
5185  col[1] = f[1];
5186  col[2] = f[2];
5187  if (alpha)
5188  col[3] = f[3];
5189  }
5190 
5191  PopID();
5192  EndGroup();
5193 
5194  // Drag and Drop Target
5195  // NB: The flag test is merely an optional micro-optimization, BeginDragDropTarget() does the same test.
5196  if ((g.LastItemData.StatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HoveredRect) && !(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoDragDrop) && BeginDragDropTarget())
5197  {
5198  bool accepted_drag_drop = false;
5199  if (const ImGuiPayload *payload = AcceptDragDropPayload(IMGUI_PAYLOAD_TYPE_COLOR_3F))
5200  {
5201  memcpy((float *)col, payload->Data, sizeof(float) * 3); // Preserve alpha if any //-V512
5202  value_changed = accepted_drag_drop = true;
5203  }
5204  if (const ImGuiPayload *payload = AcceptDragDropPayload(IMGUI_PAYLOAD_TYPE_COLOR_4F))
5205  {
5206  memcpy((float *)col, payload->Data, sizeof(float) * components);
5207  value_changed = accepted_drag_drop = true;
5208  }
5209 
5210  // Drag-drop payloads are always RGB
5211  if (accepted_drag_drop && (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputHSV))
5212  ColorConvertRGBtoHSV(col[0], col[1], col[2], col[0], col[1], col[2]);
5213  EndDragDropTarget();
5214  }
5215 
5216  // When picker is being actively used, use its active id so IsItemActive() will function on ColorEdit4().
5217  if (picker_active_window && g.ActiveId != 0 && g.ActiveIdWindow == picker_active_window)
5218  g.LastItemData.ID = g.ActiveId;
5219 
5220  if (value_changed)
5221  MarkItemEdited(g.LastItemData.ID);
5222 
5223  return value_changed;
5224 }
5225 
5226 bool ImGui::ColorPicker3(const char *label, float col[3], ImGuiColorEditFlags flags)
5227 {
5228  float col4[4] = { col[0], col[1], col[2], 1.0f };
5229  if (!ColorPicker4(label, col4, flags | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha))
5230  return false;
5231  col[0] = col4[0]; col[1] = col4[1]; col[2] = col4[2];
5232  return true;
5233 }
5234 
5235 // Helper for ColorPicker4()
5236 static void RenderArrowsForVerticalBar(ImDrawList *draw_list, ImVec2 pos, ImVec2 half_sz, float bar_w, float alpha)
5237 {
5238  ImU32 alpha8 = IM_F32_TO_INT8_SAT(alpha);
5239  ImGui::RenderArrowPointingAt(draw_list, ImVec2(pos.x + half_sz.x + 1, pos.y), ImVec2(half_sz.x + 2, half_sz.y + 1), ImGuiDir_Right, IM_COL32(0, 0, 0, alpha8));
5240  ImGui::RenderArrowPointingAt(draw_list, ImVec2(pos.x + half_sz.x, pos.y), half_sz, ImGuiDir_Right, IM_COL32(255, 255, 255, alpha8));
5241  ImGui::RenderArrowPointingAt(draw_list, ImVec2(pos.x + bar_w - half_sz.x - 1, pos.y), ImVec2(half_sz.x + 2, half_sz.y + 1), ImGuiDir_Left, IM_COL32(0, 0, 0, alpha8));
5242  ImGui::RenderArrowPointingAt(draw_list, ImVec2(pos.x + bar_w - half_sz.x, pos.y), half_sz, ImGuiDir_Left, IM_COL32(255, 255, 255, alpha8));
5243 }
5244 
5245 // Note: ColorPicker4() only accesses 3 floats if ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha flag is set.
5246 // (In C++ the 'float col[4]' notation for a function argument is equivalent to 'float* col', we only specify a size to facilitate understanding of the code.)
5247 // FIXME: we adjust the big color square height based on item width, which may cause a flickering feedback loop (if automatic height makes a vertical scrollbar appears, affecting automatic width..)
5248 // FIXME: this is trying to be aware of style.Alpha but not fully correct. Also, the color wheel will have overlapping glitches with (style.Alpha < 1.0)
5249 bool ImGui::ColorPicker4(const char *label, float col[4], ImGuiColorEditFlags flags, const float *ref_col)
5250 {
5251  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
5252  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
5253  if (window->SkipItems)
5254  return false;
5255 
5256  ImDrawList *draw_list = window->DrawList;
5257  ImGuiStyle &style = g.Style;
5258  ImGuiIO &io = g.IO;
5259 
5260  const float width = CalcItemWidth();
5261  g.NextItemData.ClearFlags();
5262 
5263  PushID(label);
5264  BeginGroup();
5265 
5266  if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoSidePreview))
5267  flags |= ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoSmallPreview;
5268 
5269  // Context menu: display and store options.
5270  if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoOptions))
5271  ColorPickerOptionsPopup(col, flags);
5272 
5273  // Read stored options
5274  if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerMask_))
5275  flags |= ((g.ColorEditOptions & ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerMask_) ? g.ColorEditOptions : ImGuiColorEditFlags_DefaultOptions_) & ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerMask_;
5276  if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputMask_))
5277  flags |= ((g.ColorEditOptions & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputMask_) ? g.ColorEditOptions : ImGuiColorEditFlags_DefaultOptions_) & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputMask_;
5278  IM_ASSERT(ImIsPowerOfTwo(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerMask_)); // Check that only 1 is selected
5279  IM_ASSERT(ImIsPowerOfTwo(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputMask_)); // Check that only 1 is selected
5280  if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoOptions))
5281  flags |= (g.ColorEditOptions & ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaBar);
5282 
5283  // Setup
5284  int components = (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha) ? 3 : 4;
5285  bool alpha_bar = (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaBar) && !(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha);
5286  ImVec2 picker_pos = window->DC.CursorPos;
5287  float square_sz = GetFrameHeight();
5288  float bars_width = square_sz; // Arbitrary smallish width of Hue/Alpha picking bars
5289  float sv_picker_size = ImMax(bars_width * 1, width - (alpha_bar ? 2 : 1) * (bars_width + style.ItemInnerSpacing.x)); // Saturation/Value picking box
5290  float bar0_pos_x = picker_pos.x + sv_picker_size + style.ItemInnerSpacing.x;
5291  float bar1_pos_x = bar0_pos_x + bars_width + style.ItemInnerSpacing.x;
5292  float bars_triangles_half_sz = IM_FLOOR(bars_width * 0.20f);
5293 
5294  float backup_initial_col[4];
5295  memcpy(backup_initial_col, col, components * sizeof(float));
5296 
5297  float wheel_thickness = sv_picker_size * 0.08f;
5298  float wheel_r_outer = sv_picker_size * 0.50f;
5299  float wheel_r_inner = wheel_r_outer - wheel_thickness;
5300  ImVec2 wheel_center(picker_pos.x + (sv_picker_size + bars_width) * 0.5f, picker_pos.y + sv_picker_size * 0.5f);
5301 
5302  // Note: the triangle is displayed rotated with triangle_pa pointing to Hue, but most coordinates stays unrotated for logic.
5303  float triangle_r = wheel_r_inner - (int)(sv_picker_size * 0.027f);
5304  ImVec2 triangle_pa = ImVec2(triangle_r, 0.0f); // Hue point.
5305  ImVec2 triangle_pb = ImVec2(triangle_r * -0.5f, triangle_r * -0.866025f); // Black point.
5306  ImVec2 triangle_pc = ImVec2(triangle_r * -0.5f, triangle_r * +0.866025f); // White point.
5307 
5308  float H = col[0], S = col[1], V = col[2];
5309  float R = col[0], G = col[1], B = col[2];
5310  if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputRGB)
5311  {
5312  // Hue is lost when converting from greyscale rgb (saturation=0). Restore it.
5313  ColorConvertRGBtoHSV(R, G, B, H, S, V);
5314  if (memcmp(g.ColorEditLastColor, col, sizeof(float) * 3) == 0)
5315  {
5316  if (S == 0)
5317  H = g.ColorEditLastHue;
5318  if (V == 0)
5319  S = g.ColorEditLastSat;
5320  }
5321  }
5322  else if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputHSV)
5323  {
5324  ColorConvertHSVtoRGB(H, S, V, R, G, B);
5325  }
5326 
5327  bool value_changed = false, value_changed_h = false, value_changed_sv = false;
5328 
5329  PushItemFlag(ImGuiItemFlags_NoNav, true);
5330  if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueWheel)
5331  {
5332  // Hue wheel + SV triangle logic
5333  InvisibleButton("hsv", ImVec2(sv_picker_size + style.ItemInnerSpacing.x + bars_width, sv_picker_size));
5334  if (IsItemActive())
5335  {
5336  ImVec2 initial_off = g.IO.MouseClickedPos[0] - wheel_center;
5337  ImVec2 current_off = g.IO.MousePos - wheel_center;
5338  float initial_dist2 = ImLengthSqr(initial_off);
5339  if (initial_dist2 >= (wheel_r_inner - 1) * (wheel_r_inner - 1) && initial_dist2 <= (wheel_r_outer + 1) * (wheel_r_outer + 1))
5340  {
5341  // Interactive with Hue wheel
5342  H = ImAtan2(current_off.y, current_off.x) / IM_PI * 0.5f;
5343  if (H < 0.0f)
5344  H += 1.0f;
5345  value_changed = value_changed_h = true;
5346  }
5347  float cos_hue_angle = ImCos(-H * 2.0f * IM_PI);
5348  float sin_hue_angle = ImSin(-H * 2.0f * IM_PI);
5349  if (ImTriangleContainsPoint(triangle_pa, triangle_pb, triangle_pc, ImRotate(initial_off, cos_hue_angle, sin_hue_angle)))
5350  {
5351  // Interacting with SV triangle
5352  ImVec2 current_off_unrotated = ImRotate(current_off, cos_hue_angle, sin_hue_angle);
5353  if (!ImTriangleContainsPoint(triangle_pa, triangle_pb, triangle_pc, current_off_unrotated))
5354  current_off_unrotated = ImTriangleClosestPoint(triangle_pa, triangle_pb, triangle_pc, current_off_unrotated);
5355  float uu, vv, ww;
5356  ImTriangleBarycentricCoords(triangle_pa, triangle_pb, triangle_pc, current_off_unrotated, uu, vv, ww);
5357  V = ImClamp(1.0f - vv, 0.0001f, 1.0f);
5358  S = ImClamp(uu / V, 0.0001f, 1.0f);
5359  value_changed = value_changed_sv = true;
5360  }
5361  }
5362  if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoOptions))
5363  OpenPopupOnItemClick("context");
5364  }
5365  else if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueBar)
5366  {
5367  // SV rectangle logic
5368  InvisibleButton("sv", ImVec2(sv_picker_size, sv_picker_size));
5369  if (IsItemActive())
5370  {
5371  S = ImSaturate((io.MousePos.x - picker_pos.x) / (sv_picker_size - 1));
5372  V = 1.0f - ImSaturate((io.MousePos.y - picker_pos.y) / (sv_picker_size - 1));
5373  value_changed = value_changed_sv = true;
5374  }
5375  if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoOptions))
5376  OpenPopupOnItemClick("context");
5377 
5378  // Hue bar logic
5379  SetCursorScreenPos(ImVec2(bar0_pos_x, picker_pos.y));
5380  InvisibleButton("hue", ImVec2(bars_width, sv_picker_size));
5381  if (IsItemActive())
5382  {
5383  H = ImSaturate((io.MousePos.y - picker_pos.y) / (sv_picker_size - 1));
5384  value_changed = value_changed_h = true;
5385  }
5386  }
5387 
5388  // Alpha bar logic
5389  if (alpha_bar)
5390  {
5391  SetCursorScreenPos(ImVec2(bar1_pos_x, picker_pos.y));
5392  InvisibleButton("alpha", ImVec2(bars_width, sv_picker_size));
5393  if (IsItemActive())
5394  {
5395  col[3] = 1.0f - ImSaturate((io.MousePos.y - picker_pos.y) / (sv_picker_size - 1));
5396  value_changed = true;
5397  }
5398  }
5399  PopItemFlag(); // ImGuiItemFlags_NoNav
5400 
5401  if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoSidePreview))
5402  {
5403  SameLine(0, style.ItemInnerSpacing.x);
5404  BeginGroup();
5405  }
5406 
5407  if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoLabel))
5408  {
5409  const char *label_display_end = FindRenderedTextEnd(label);
5410  if (label != label_display_end)
5411  {
5412  if ((flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoSidePreview))
5413  SameLine(0, style.ItemInnerSpacing.x);
5414  TextEx(label, label_display_end);
5415  }
5416  }
5417 
5418  if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoSidePreview))
5419  {
5420  PushItemFlag(ImGuiItemFlags_NoNavDefaultFocus, true);
5421  ImVec4 col_v4(col[0], col[1], col[2], (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha) ? 1.0f : col[3]);
5422  if ((flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoLabel))
5423  Text("Current");
5424 
5425  ImGuiColorEditFlags sub_flags_to_forward = ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputMask_ | ImGuiColorEditFlags_HDR | ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreview | ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreviewHalf | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoTooltip;
5426  ColorButton("##current", col_v4, (flags & sub_flags_to_forward), ImVec2(square_sz * 3, square_sz * 2));
5427  if (ref_col != NULL)
5428  {
5429  Text("Original");
5430  ImVec4 ref_col_v4(ref_col[0], ref_col[1], ref_col[2], (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha) ? 1.0f : ref_col[3]);
5431  if (ColorButton("##original", ref_col_v4, (flags & sub_flags_to_forward), ImVec2(square_sz * 3, square_sz * 2)))
5432  {
5433  memcpy(col, ref_col, components * sizeof(float));
5434  value_changed = true;
5435  }
5436  }
5437  PopItemFlag();
5438  EndGroup();
5439  }
5440 
5441  // Convert back color to RGB
5442  if (value_changed_h || value_changed_sv)
5443  {
5444  if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputRGB)
5445  {
5446  ColorConvertHSVtoRGB(H >= 1.0f ? H - 10 * 1e-6f : H, S > 0.0f ? S : 10 * 1e-6f, V > 0.0f ? V : 1e-6f, col[0], col[1], col[2]);
5447  g.ColorEditLastHue = H;
5448  g.ColorEditLastSat = S;
5449  memcpy(g.ColorEditLastColor, col, sizeof(float) * 3);
5450  }
5451  else if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputHSV)
5452  {
5453  col[0] = H;
5454  col[1] = S;
5455  col[2] = V;
5456  }
5457  }
5458 
5459  // R,G,B and H,S,V slider color editor
5460  bool value_changed_fix_hue_wrap = false;
5461  if ((flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoInputs) == 0)
5462  {
5463  PushItemWidth((alpha_bar ? bar1_pos_x : bar0_pos_x) + bars_width - picker_pos.x);
5464  ImGuiColorEditFlags sub_flags_to_forward = ImGuiColorEditFlags_DataTypeMask_ | ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputMask_ | ImGuiColorEditFlags_HDR | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoOptions | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoSmallPreview | ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreview | ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreviewHalf;
5465  ImGuiColorEditFlags sub_flags = (flags & sub_flags_to_forward) | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoPicker;
5466  if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayRGB || (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayMask_) == 0)
5467  if (ColorEdit4("##rgb", col, sub_flags | ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayRGB))
5468  {
5469  // FIXME: Hackily differentiating using the DragInt (ActiveId != 0 && !ActiveIdAllowOverlap) vs. using the InputText or DropTarget.
5470  // For the later we don't want to run the hue-wrap canceling code. If you are well versed in HSV picker please provide your input! (See #2050)
5471  value_changed_fix_hue_wrap = (g.ActiveId != 0 && !g.ActiveIdAllowOverlap);
5472  value_changed = true;
5473  }
5474  if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHSV || (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayMask_) == 0)
5475  value_changed |= ColorEdit4("##hsv", col, sub_flags | ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHSV);
5476  if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHex || (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayMask_) == 0)
5477  value_changed |= ColorEdit4("##hex", col, sub_flags | ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHex);
5478  PopItemWidth();
5479  }
5480 
5481  // Try to cancel hue wrap (after ColorEdit4 call), if any
5482  if (value_changed_fix_hue_wrap && (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputRGB))
5483  {
5484  float new_H, new_S, new_V;
5485  ColorConvertRGBtoHSV(col[0], col[1], col[2], new_H, new_S, new_V);
5486  if (new_H <= 0 && H > 0)
5487  {
5488  if (new_V <= 0 && V != new_V)
5489  ColorConvertHSVtoRGB(H, S, new_V <= 0 ? V * 0.5f : new_V, col[0], col[1], col[2]);
5490  else if (new_S <= 0)
5491  ColorConvertHSVtoRGB(H, new_S <= 0 ? S * 0.5f : new_S, new_V, col[0], col[1], col[2]);
5492  }
5493  }
5494 
5495  if (value_changed)
5496  {
5497  if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputRGB)
5498  {
5499  R = col[0];
5500  G = col[1];
5501  B = col[2];
5502  ColorConvertRGBtoHSV(R, G, B, H, S, V);
5503  if (memcmp(g.ColorEditLastColor, col, sizeof(float) * 3) == 0) // Fix local Hue as display below will use it immediately.
5504  {
5505  if (S == 0)
5506  H = g.ColorEditLastHue;
5507  if (V == 0)
5508  S = g.ColorEditLastSat;
5509  }
5510  }
5511  else if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputHSV)
5512  {
5513  H = col[0];
5514  S = col[1];
5515  V = col[2];
5516  ColorConvertHSVtoRGB(H, S, V, R, G, B);
5517  }
5518  }
5519 
5520  const int style_alpha8 = IM_F32_TO_INT8_SAT(style.Alpha);
5521  const ImU32 col_black = IM_COL32(0, 0, 0, style_alpha8);
5522  const ImU32 col_white = IM_COL32(255, 255, 255, style_alpha8);
5523  const ImU32 col_midgrey = IM_COL32(128, 128, 128, style_alpha8);
5524  const ImU32 col_hues[6 + 1] = { IM_COL32(255,0,0,style_alpha8), IM_COL32(255,255,0,style_alpha8), IM_COL32(0,255,0,style_alpha8), IM_COL32(0,255,255,style_alpha8), IM_COL32(0,0,255,style_alpha8), IM_COL32(255,0,255,style_alpha8), IM_COL32(255,0,0,style_alpha8) };
5525 
5526  ImVec4 hue_color_f(1, 1, 1, style.Alpha); ColorConvertHSVtoRGB(H, 1, 1, hue_color_f.x, hue_color_f.y, hue_color_f.z);
5527  ImU32 hue_color32 = ColorConvertFloat4ToU32(hue_color_f);
5528  ImU32 user_col32_striped_of_alpha = ColorConvertFloat4ToU32(ImVec4(R, G, B, style.Alpha)); // Important: this is still including the main rendering/style alpha!!
5529 
5530  ImVec2 sv_cursor_pos;
5531 
5532  if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueWheel)
5533  {
5534  // Render Hue Wheel
5535  const float aeps = 0.5f / wheel_r_outer; // Half a pixel arc length in radians (2pi cancels out).
5536  const int segment_per_arc = ImMax(4, (int)wheel_r_outer / 12);
5537  for (int n = 0; n < 6; n++)
5538  {
5539  const float a0 = (n) / 6.0f * 2.0f * IM_PI - aeps;
5540  const float a1 = (n + 1.0f) / 6.0f * 2.0f * IM_PI + aeps;
5541  const int vert_start_idx = draw_list->VtxBuffer.Size;
5542  draw_list->PathArcTo(wheel_center, (wheel_r_inner + wheel_r_outer) * 0.5f, a0, a1, segment_per_arc);
5543  draw_list->PathStroke(col_white, 0, wheel_thickness);
5544  const int vert_end_idx = draw_list->VtxBuffer.Size;
5545 
5546  // Paint colors over existing vertices
5547  ImVec2 gradient_p0(wheel_center.x + ImCos(a0) * wheel_r_inner, wheel_center.y + ImSin(a0) * wheel_r_inner);
5548  ImVec2 gradient_p1(wheel_center.x + ImCos(a1) * wheel_r_inner, wheel_center.y + ImSin(a1) * wheel_r_inner);
5549  ShadeVertsLinearColorGradientKeepAlpha(draw_list, vert_start_idx, vert_end_idx, gradient_p0, gradient_p1, col_hues[n], col_hues[n + 1]);
5550  }
5551 
5552  // Render Cursor + preview on Hue Wheel
5553  float cos_hue_angle = ImCos(H * 2.0f * IM_PI);
5554  float sin_hue_angle = ImSin(H * 2.0f * IM_PI);
5555  ImVec2 hue_cursor_pos(wheel_center.x + cos_hue_angle * (wheel_r_inner + wheel_r_outer) * 0.5f, wheel_center.y + sin_hue_angle * (wheel_r_inner + wheel_r_outer) * 0.5f);
5556  float hue_cursor_rad = value_changed_h ? wheel_thickness * 0.65f : wheel_thickness * 0.55f;
5557  int hue_cursor_segments = ImClamp((int)(hue_cursor_rad / 1.4f), 9, 32);
5558  draw_list->AddCircleFilled(hue_cursor_pos, hue_cursor_rad, hue_color32, hue_cursor_segments);
5559  draw_list->AddCircle(hue_cursor_pos, hue_cursor_rad + 1, col_midgrey, hue_cursor_segments);
5560  draw_list->AddCircle(hue_cursor_pos, hue_cursor_rad, col_white, hue_cursor_segments);
5561 
5562  // Render SV triangle (rotated according to hue)
5563  ImVec2 tra = wheel_center + ImRotate(triangle_pa, cos_hue_angle, sin_hue_angle);
5564  ImVec2 trb = wheel_center + ImRotate(triangle_pb, cos_hue_angle, sin_hue_angle);
5565  ImVec2 trc = wheel_center + ImRotate(triangle_pc, cos_hue_angle, sin_hue_angle);
5566  ImVec2 uv_white = GetFontTexUvWhitePixel();
5567  draw_list->PrimReserve(6, 6);
5568  draw_list->PrimVtx(tra, uv_white, hue_color32);
5569  draw_list->PrimVtx(trb, uv_white, hue_color32);
5570  draw_list->PrimVtx(trc, uv_white, col_white);
5571  draw_list->PrimVtx(tra, uv_white, 0);
5572  draw_list->PrimVtx(trb, uv_white, col_black);
5573  draw_list->PrimVtx(trc, uv_white, 0);
5574  draw_list->AddTriangle(tra, trb, trc, col_midgrey, 1.5f);
5575  sv_cursor_pos = ImLerp(ImLerp(trc, tra, ImSaturate(S)), trb, ImSaturate(1 - V));
5576  }
5577  else if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueBar)
5578  {
5579  // Render SV Square
5580  draw_list->AddRectFilledMultiColor(picker_pos, picker_pos + ImVec2(sv_picker_size, sv_picker_size), col_white, hue_color32, hue_color32, col_white);
5581  draw_list->AddRectFilledMultiColor(picker_pos, picker_pos + ImVec2(sv_picker_size, sv_picker_size), 0, 0, col_black, col_black);
5582  RenderFrameBorder(picker_pos, picker_pos + ImVec2(sv_picker_size, sv_picker_size), 0.0f);
5583  sv_cursor_pos.x = ImClamp(IM_ROUND(picker_pos.x + ImSaturate(S) * sv_picker_size), picker_pos.x + 2, picker_pos.x + sv_picker_size - 2); // Sneakily prevent the circle to stick out too much
5584  sv_cursor_pos.y = ImClamp(IM_ROUND(picker_pos.y + ImSaturate(1 - V) * sv_picker_size), picker_pos.y + 2, picker_pos.y + sv_picker_size - 2);
5585 
5586  // Render Hue Bar
5587  for (int i = 0; i < 6; ++i)
5588  draw_list->AddRectFilledMultiColor(ImVec2(bar0_pos_x, picker_pos.y + i * (sv_picker_size / 6)), ImVec2(bar0_pos_x + bars_width, picker_pos.y + (i + 1) * (sv_picker_size / 6)), col_hues[i], col_hues[i], col_hues[i + 1], col_hues[i + 1]);
5589  float bar0_line_y = IM_ROUND(picker_pos.y + H * sv_picker_size);
5590  RenderFrameBorder(ImVec2(bar0_pos_x, picker_pos.y), ImVec2(bar0_pos_x + bars_width, picker_pos.y + sv_picker_size), 0.0f);
5591  RenderArrowsForVerticalBar(draw_list, ImVec2(bar0_pos_x - 1, bar0_line_y), ImVec2(bars_triangles_half_sz + 1, bars_triangles_half_sz), bars_width + 2.0f, style.Alpha);
5592  }
5593 
5594  // Render cursor/preview circle (clamp S/V within 0..1 range because floating points colors may lead HSV values to be out of range)
5595  float sv_cursor_rad = value_changed_sv ? 10.0f : 6.0f;
5596  draw_list->AddCircleFilled(sv_cursor_pos, sv_cursor_rad, user_col32_striped_of_alpha, 12);
5597  draw_list->AddCircle(sv_cursor_pos, sv_cursor_rad + 1, col_midgrey, 12);
5598  draw_list->AddCircle(sv_cursor_pos, sv_cursor_rad, col_white, 12);
5599 
5600  // Render alpha bar
5601  if (alpha_bar)
5602  {
5603  float alpha = ImSaturate(col[3]);
5604  ImRect bar1_bb(bar1_pos_x, picker_pos.y, bar1_pos_x + bars_width, picker_pos.y + sv_picker_size);
5605  RenderColorRectWithAlphaCheckerboard(draw_list, bar1_bb.Min, bar1_bb.Max, 0, bar1_bb.GetWidth() / 2.0f, ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f));
5606  draw_list->AddRectFilledMultiColor(bar1_bb.Min, bar1_bb.Max, user_col32_striped_of_alpha, user_col32_striped_of_alpha, user_col32_striped_of_alpha & ~IM_COL32_A_MASK, user_col32_striped_of_alpha & ~IM_COL32_A_MASK);
5607  float bar1_line_y = IM_ROUND(picker_pos.y + (1.0f - alpha) * sv_picker_size);
5608  RenderFrameBorder(bar1_bb.Min, bar1_bb.Max, 0.0f);
5609  RenderArrowsForVerticalBar(draw_list, ImVec2(bar1_pos_x - 1, bar1_line_y), ImVec2(bars_triangles_half_sz + 1, bars_triangles_half_sz), bars_width + 2.0f, style.Alpha);
5610  }
5611 
5612  EndGroup();
5613 
5614  if (value_changed && memcmp(backup_initial_col, col, components * sizeof(float)) == 0)
5615  value_changed = false;
5616  if (value_changed)
5617  MarkItemEdited(g.LastItemData.ID);
5618 
5619  PopID();
5620 
5621  return value_changed;
5622 }
5623 
5624 // A little color square. Return true when clicked.
5625 // FIXME: May want to display/ignore the alpha component in the color display? Yet show it in the tooltip.
5626 // 'desc_id' is not called 'label' because we don't display it next to the button, but only in the tooltip.
5627 // Note that 'col' may be encoded in HSV if ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputHSV is set.
5628 bool ImGui::ColorButton(const char *desc_id, const ImVec4 &col, ImGuiColorEditFlags flags, ImVec2 size)
5629 {
5630  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
5631  if (window->SkipItems)
5632  return false;
5633 
5634  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
5635  const ImGuiID id = window->GetID(desc_id);
5636  float default_size = GetFrameHeight();
5637  if (size.x == 0.0f)
5638  size.x = default_size;
5639  if (size.y == 0.0f)
5640  size.y = default_size;
5641  const ImRect bb(window->DC.CursorPos, window->DC.CursorPos + size);
5642  ItemSize(bb, (size.y >= default_size) ? g.Style.FramePadding.y : 0.0f);
5643  if (!ItemAdd(bb, id))
5644  return false;
5645 
5646  bool hovered, held;
5647  bool pressed = ButtonBehavior(bb, id, &hovered, &held);
5648 
5649  if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha)
5650  flags &= ~(ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreview | ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreviewHalf);
5651 
5652  ImVec4 col_rgb = col;
5653  if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputHSV)
5654  ColorConvertHSVtoRGB(col_rgb.x, col_rgb.y, col_rgb.z, col_rgb.x, col_rgb.y, col_rgb.z);
5655 
5656  ImVec4 col_rgb_without_alpha(col_rgb.x, col_rgb.y, col_rgb.z, 1.0f);
5657  float grid_step = ImMin(size.x, size.y) / 2.99f;
5658  float rounding = ImMin(g.Style.FrameRounding, grid_step * 0.5f);
5659  ImRect bb_inner = bb;
5660  float off = 0.0f;
5661  if ((flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoBorder) == 0)
5662  {
5663  off = -0.75f; // The border (using Col_FrameBg) tends to look off when color is near-opaque and rounding is enabled. This offset seemed like a good middle ground to reduce those artifacts.
5664  bb_inner.Expand(off);
5665  }
5666  if ((flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreviewHalf) && col_rgb.w < 1.0f)
5667  {
5668  float mid_x = IM_ROUND((bb_inner.Min.x + bb_inner.Max.x) * 0.5f);
5669  RenderColorRectWithAlphaCheckerboard(window->DrawList, ImVec2(bb_inner.Min.x + grid_step, bb_inner.Min.y), bb_inner.Max, GetColorU32(col_rgb), grid_step, ImVec2(-grid_step + off, off), rounding, ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersRight);
5670  window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(bb_inner.Min, ImVec2(mid_x, bb_inner.Max.y), GetColorU32(col_rgb_without_alpha), rounding, ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersLeft);
5671  }
5672  else
5673  {
5674  // Because GetColorU32() multiplies by the global style Alpha and we don't want to display a checkerboard if the source code had no alpha
5675  ImVec4 col_source = (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreview) ? col_rgb : col_rgb_without_alpha;
5676  if (col_source.w < 1.0f)
5677  RenderColorRectWithAlphaCheckerboard(window->DrawList, bb_inner.Min, bb_inner.Max, GetColorU32(col_source), grid_step, ImVec2(off, off), rounding);
5678  else
5679  window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(bb_inner.Min, bb_inner.Max, GetColorU32(col_source), rounding);
5680  }
5681  RenderNavHighlight(bb, id);
5682  if ((flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoBorder) == 0)
5683  {
5684  if (g.Style.FrameBorderSize > 0.0f)
5685  RenderFrameBorder(bb.Min, bb.Max, rounding);
5686  else
5687  window->DrawList->AddRect(bb.Min, bb.Max, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_FrameBg), rounding); // Color button are often in need of some sort of border
5688  }
5689 
5690  // Drag and Drop Source
5691  // NB: The ActiveId test is merely an optional micro-optimization, BeginDragDropSource() does the same test.
5692  if (g.ActiveId == id && !(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoDragDrop) && BeginDragDropSource())
5693  {
5694  if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha)
5695  SetDragDropPayload(IMGUI_PAYLOAD_TYPE_COLOR_3F, &col_rgb, sizeof(float) * 3, ImGuiCond_Once);
5696  else
5697  SetDragDropPayload(IMGUI_PAYLOAD_TYPE_COLOR_4F, &col_rgb, sizeof(float) * 4, ImGuiCond_Once);
5698  ColorButton(desc_id, col, flags);
5699  SameLine();
5700  TextEx("Color");
5701  EndDragDropSource();
5702  }
5703 
5704  // Tooltip
5705  if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoTooltip) && hovered)
5706  ColorTooltip(desc_id, &col.x, flags & (ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputMask_ | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha | ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreview | ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreviewHalf));
5707 
5708  return pressed;
5709 }
5710 
5711 // Initialize/override default color options
5712 void ImGui::SetColorEditOptions(ImGuiColorEditFlags flags)
5713 {
5714  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
5715  if ((flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayMask_) == 0)
5716  flags |= ImGuiColorEditFlags_DefaultOptions_ & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayMask_;
5717  if ((flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DataTypeMask_) == 0)
5718  flags |= ImGuiColorEditFlags_DefaultOptions_ & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DataTypeMask_;
5719  if ((flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerMask_) == 0)
5720  flags |= ImGuiColorEditFlags_DefaultOptions_ & ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerMask_;
5721  if ((flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputMask_) == 0)
5722  flags |= ImGuiColorEditFlags_DefaultOptions_ & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputMask_;
5723  IM_ASSERT(ImIsPowerOfTwo(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayMask_)); // Check only 1 option is selected
5724  IM_ASSERT(ImIsPowerOfTwo(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DataTypeMask_)); // Check only 1 option is selected
5725  IM_ASSERT(ImIsPowerOfTwo(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerMask_)); // Check only 1 option is selected
5726  IM_ASSERT(ImIsPowerOfTwo(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputMask_)); // Check only 1 option is selected
5727  g.ColorEditOptions = flags;
5728 }
5729 
5730 // Note: only access 3 floats if ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha flag is set.
5731 void ImGui::ColorTooltip(const char *text, const float *col, ImGuiColorEditFlags flags)
5732 {
5733  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
5734 
5735  BeginTooltipEx(0, ImGuiTooltipFlags_OverridePreviousTooltip);
5736  const char *text_end = text ? FindRenderedTextEnd(text, NULL) : text;
5737  if (text_end > text)
5738  {
5739  TextEx(text, text_end);
5740  Separator();
5741  }
5742 
5743  ImVec2 sz(g.FontSize * 3 + g.Style.FramePadding.y * 2, g.FontSize * 3 + g.Style.FramePadding.y * 2);
5744  ImVec4 cf(col[0], col[1], col[2], (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha) ? 1.0f : col[3]);
5745  int cr = IM_F32_TO_INT8_SAT(col[0]), cg = IM_F32_TO_INT8_SAT(col[1]), cb = IM_F32_TO_INT8_SAT(col[2]), ca = (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha) ? 255 : IM_F32_TO_INT8_SAT(col[3]);
5746  ColorButton("##preview", cf, (flags & (ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputMask_ | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha | ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreview | ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreviewHalf)) | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoTooltip, sz);
5747  SameLine();
5748  if ((flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputRGB) || !(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputMask_))
5749  {
5750  if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha)
5751  Text("#%02X%02X%02X\nR: %d, G: %d, B: %d\n(%.3f, %.3f, %.3f)", cr, cg, cb, cr, cg, cb, col[0], col[1], col[2]);
5752  else
5753  Text("#%02X%02X%02X%02X\nR:%d, G:%d, B:%d, A:%d\n(%.3f, %.3f, %.3f, %.3f)", cr, cg, cb, ca, cr, cg, cb, ca, col[0], col[1], col[2], col[3]);
5754  }
5755  else if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputHSV)
5756  {
5757  if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha)
5758  Text("H: %.3f, S: %.3f, V: %.3f", col[0], col[1], col[2]);
5759  else
5760  Text("H: %.3f, S: %.3f, V: %.3f, A: %.3f", col[0], col[1], col[2], col[3]);
5761  }
5762  EndTooltip();
5763 }
5764 
5765 void ImGui::ColorEditOptionsPopup(const float *col, ImGuiColorEditFlags flags)
5766 {
5767  bool allow_opt_inputs = !(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayMask_);
5768  bool allow_opt_datatype = !(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DataTypeMask_);
5769  if ((!allow_opt_inputs && !allow_opt_datatype) || !BeginPopup("context"))
5770  return;
5771  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
5772  ImGuiColorEditFlags opts = g.ColorEditOptions;
5773  if (allow_opt_inputs)
5774  {
5775  if (RadioButton("RGB", (opts & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayRGB) != 0)) opts = (opts & ~ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayMask_) | ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayRGB;
5776  if (RadioButton("HSV", (opts & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHSV) != 0)) opts = (opts & ~ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayMask_) | ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHSV;
5777  if (RadioButton("Hex", (opts & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHex) != 0)) opts = (opts & ~ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayMask_) | ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHex;
5778  }
5779  if (allow_opt_datatype)
5780  {
5781  if (allow_opt_inputs) Separator();
5782  if (RadioButton("0..255", (opts & ImGuiColorEditFlags_Uint8) != 0)) opts = (opts & ~ImGuiColorEditFlags_DataTypeMask_) | ImGuiColorEditFlags_Uint8;
5783  if (RadioButton("0.00..1.00", (opts & ImGuiColorEditFlags_Float) != 0)) opts = (opts & ~ImGuiColorEditFlags_DataTypeMask_) | ImGuiColorEditFlags_Float;
5784  }
5785 
5786  if (allow_opt_inputs || allow_opt_datatype)
5787  Separator();
5788  if (Button("Copy as..", ImVec2(-1, 0)))
5789  OpenPopup("Copy");
5790  if (BeginPopup("Copy"))
5791  {
5792  int cr = IM_F32_TO_INT8_SAT(col[0]), cg = IM_F32_TO_INT8_SAT(col[1]), cb = IM_F32_TO_INT8_SAT(col[2]), ca = (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha) ? 255 : IM_F32_TO_INT8_SAT(col[3]);
5793  char buf[64];
5794  ImFormatString(buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), "(%.3ff, %.3ff, %.3ff, %.3ff)", col[0], col[1], col[2], (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha) ? 1.0f : col[3]);
5795  if (Selectable(buf))
5796  SetClipboardText(buf);
5797  ImFormatString(buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), "(%d,%d,%d,%d)", cr, cg, cb, ca);
5798  if (Selectable(buf))
5799  SetClipboardText(buf);
5800  ImFormatString(buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), "#%02X%02X%02X", cr, cg, cb);
5801  if (Selectable(buf))
5802  SetClipboardText(buf);
5803  if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha))
5804  {
5805  ImFormatString(buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), "#%02X%02X%02X%02X", cr, cg, cb, ca);
5806  if (Selectable(buf))
5807  SetClipboardText(buf);
5808  }
5809  EndPopup();
5810  }
5811 
5812  g.ColorEditOptions = opts;
5813  EndPopup();
5814 }
5815 
5816 void ImGui::ColorPickerOptionsPopup(const float *ref_col, ImGuiColorEditFlags flags)
5817 {
5818  bool allow_opt_picker = !(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerMask_);
5819  bool allow_opt_alpha_bar = !(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha) && !(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaBar);
5820  if ((!allow_opt_picker && !allow_opt_alpha_bar) || !BeginPopup("context"))
5821  return;
5822  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
5823  if (allow_opt_picker)
5824  {
5825  ImVec2 picker_size(g.FontSize * 8, ImMax(g.FontSize * 8 - (GetFrameHeight() + g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x), 1.0f)); // FIXME: Picker size copied from main picker function
5826  PushItemWidth(picker_size.x);
5827  for (int picker_type = 0; picker_type < 2; picker_type++)
5828  {
5829  // Draw small/thumbnail version of each picker type (over an invisible button for selection)
5830  if (picker_type > 0) Separator();
5831  PushID(picker_type);
5832  ImGuiColorEditFlags picker_flags = ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoInputs | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoOptions | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoLabel | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoSidePreview | (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha);
5833  if (picker_type == 0) picker_flags |= ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueBar;
5834  if (picker_type == 1) picker_flags |= ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueWheel;
5835  ImVec2 backup_pos = GetCursorScreenPos();
5836  if (Selectable("##selectable", false, 0, picker_size)) // By default, Selectable() is closing popup
5837  g.ColorEditOptions = (g.ColorEditOptions & ~ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerMask_) | (picker_flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerMask_);
5838  SetCursorScreenPos(backup_pos);
5839  ImVec4 previewing_ref_col;
5840  memcpy(&previewing_ref_col, ref_col, sizeof(float) * ((picker_flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha) ? 3 : 4));
5841  ColorPicker4("##previewing_picker", &previewing_ref_col.x, picker_flags);
5842  PopID();
5843  }
5844  PopItemWidth();
5845  }
5846  if (allow_opt_alpha_bar)
5847  {
5848  if (allow_opt_picker) Separator();
5849  CheckboxFlags("Alpha Bar", &g.ColorEditOptions, ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaBar);
5850  }
5851  EndPopup();
5852 }
5853 
5854 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
5855 // [SECTION] Widgets: TreeNode, CollapsingHeader, etc.
5856 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
5857 // - TreeNode()
5858 // - TreeNodeV()
5859 // - TreeNodeEx()
5860 // - TreeNodeExV()
5861 // - TreeNodeBehavior() [Internal]
5862 // - TreePush()
5863 // - TreePop()
5864 // - GetTreeNodeToLabelSpacing()
5865 // - SetNextItemOpen()
5866 // - CollapsingHeader()
5867 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
5868 
5869 bool ImGui::TreeNode(const char *str_id, const char *fmt, ...)
5870 {
5871  va_list args;
5872  va_start(args, fmt);
5873  bool is_open = TreeNodeExV(str_id, 0, fmt, args);
5874  va_end(args);
5875  return is_open;
5876 }
5877 
5878 bool ImGui::TreeNode(const void *ptr_id, const char *fmt, ...)
5879 {
5880  va_list args;
5881  va_start(args, fmt);
5882  bool is_open = TreeNodeExV(ptr_id, 0, fmt, args);
5883  va_end(args);
5884  return is_open;
5885 }
5886 
5887 bool ImGui::TreeNode(const char *label)
5888 {
5889  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
5890  if (window->SkipItems)
5891  return false;
5892  return TreeNodeBehavior(window->GetID(label), 0, label, NULL);
5893 }
5894 
5895 bool ImGui::TreeNodeV(const char *str_id, const char *fmt, va_list args)
5896 {
5897  return TreeNodeExV(str_id, 0, fmt, args);
5898 }
5899 
5900 bool ImGui::TreeNodeV(const void *ptr_id, const char *fmt, va_list args)
5901 {
5902  return TreeNodeExV(ptr_id, 0, fmt, args);
5903 }
5904 
5905 bool ImGui::TreeNodeEx(const char *label, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags flags)
5906 {
5907  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
5908  if (window->SkipItems)
5909  return false;
5910 
5911  return TreeNodeBehavior(window->GetID(label), flags, label, NULL);
5912 }
5913 
5914 bool ImGui::TreeNodeEx(const char *str_id, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags flags, const char *fmt, ...)
5915 {
5916  va_list args;
5917  va_start(args, fmt);
5918  bool is_open = TreeNodeExV(str_id, flags, fmt, args);
5919  va_end(args);
5920  return is_open;
5921 }
5922 
5923 bool ImGui::TreeNodeEx(const void *ptr_id, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags flags, const char *fmt, ...)
5924 {
5925  va_list args;
5926  va_start(args, fmt);
5927  bool is_open = TreeNodeExV(ptr_id, flags, fmt, args);
5928  va_end(args);
5929  return is_open;
5930 }
5931 
5932 bool ImGui::TreeNodeExV(const char *str_id, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags flags, const char *fmt, va_list args)
5933 {
5934  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
5935  if (window->SkipItems)
5936  return false;
5937 
5938  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
5939  const char *label_end = g.TempBuffer + ImFormatStringV(g.TempBuffer, IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.TempBuffer), fmt, args);
5940  return TreeNodeBehavior(window->GetID(str_id), flags, g.TempBuffer, label_end);
5941 }
5942 
5943 bool ImGui::TreeNodeExV(const void *ptr_id, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags flags, const char *fmt, va_list args)
5944 {
5945  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
5946  if (window->SkipItems)
5947  return false;
5948 
5949  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
5950  const char *label_end = g.TempBuffer + ImFormatStringV(g.TempBuffer, IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.TempBuffer), fmt, args);
5951  return TreeNodeBehavior(window->GetID(ptr_id), flags, g.TempBuffer, label_end);
5952 }
5953 
5954 bool ImGui::TreeNodeBehaviorIsOpen(ImGuiID id, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags flags)
5955 {
5956  if (flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Leaf)
5957  return true;
5958 
5959  // We only write to the tree storage if the user clicks (or explicitly use the SetNextItemOpen function)
5960  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
5961  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
5962  ImGuiStorage *storage = window->DC.StateStorage;
5963 
5964  bool is_open;
5965  if (g.NextItemData.Flags & ImGuiNextItemDataFlags_HasOpen)
5966  {
5967  if (g.NextItemData.OpenCond & ImGuiCond_Always)
5968  {
5969  is_open = g.NextItemData.OpenVal;
5970  storage->SetIntUniform(id, is_open);
5971  }
5972  else
5973  {
5974  // We treat ImGuiCond_Once and ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver the same because tree node state are not saved persistently.
5975  const int stored_value = storage->GetInt(id, -1);
5976  if (stored_value == -1)
5977  {
5978  is_open = g.NextItemData.OpenVal;
5979  storage->SetIntUniform(id, is_open);
5980  }
5981  else
5982  {
5983  is_open = stored_value != 0;
5984  }
5985  }
5986  }
5987  else
5988  {
5989  is_open = storage->GetInt(id, (flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DefaultOpen) ? 1 : 0) != 0;
5990  }
5991 
5992  // When logging is enabled, we automatically expand tree nodes (but *NOT* collapsing headers.. seems like sensible behavior).
5993  // NB- If we are above max depth we still allow manually opened nodes to be logged.
5994  if (g.LogEnabled && !(flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NoAutoOpenOnLog) && (window->DC.TreeDepth - g.LogDepthRef) < g.LogDepthToExpand)
5995  is_open = true;
5996 
5997  return is_open;
5998 }
5999 
6000 bool ImGui::TreeNodeBehavior(ImGuiID id, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags flags, const char *label, const char *label_end)
6001 {
6002  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
6003  if (window->SkipItems)
6004  return false;
6005 
6006  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
6007  const ImGuiStyle &style = g.Style;
6008  const bool display_frame = (flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Framed) != 0;
6009  const ImVec2 padding = (display_frame || (flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_FramePadding)) ? style.FramePadding : ImVec2(style.FramePadding.x, ImMin(window->DC.CurrLineTextBaseOffset, style.FramePadding.y));
6010 
6011  if (!label_end)
6012  label_end = FindRenderedTextEnd(label);
6013  const ImVec2 label_size = CalcTextSize(label, label_end, false);
6014 
6015  // We vertically grow up to current line height up the typical widget height.
6016  const float frame_height = ImMax(ImMin(window->DC.CurrLineSize.y, g.FontSize + style.FramePadding.y * 2), label_size.y + padding.y * 2);
6017  ImRect frame_bb;
6018  frame_bb.Min.x = (flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_SpanFullWidth) ? window->WorkRect.Min.x : window->DC.CursorPos.x;
6019  frame_bb.Min.y = window->DC.CursorPos.y;
6020  frame_bb.Max.x = window->WorkRect.Max.x;
6021  frame_bb.Max.y = window->DC.CursorPos.y + frame_height;
6022  if (display_frame)
6023  {
6024  // Framed header expand a little outside the default padding, to the edge of InnerClipRect
6025  // (FIXME: May remove this at some point and make InnerClipRect align with WindowPadding.x instead of WindowPadding.x*0.5f)
6026  frame_bb.Min.x -= IM_FLOOR(window->WindowPadding.x * 0.5f - 1.0f);
6027  frame_bb.Max.x += IM_FLOOR(window->WindowPadding.x * 0.5f);
6028  }
6029 
6030  const float text_offset_x = g.FontSize + (display_frame ? padding.x * 3 : padding.x * 2); // Collapser arrow width + Spacing
6031  const float text_offset_y = ImMax(padding.y, window->DC.CurrLineTextBaseOffset); // Latch before ItemSize changes it
6032  const float text_width = g.FontSize + (label_size.x > 0.0f ? label_size.x + padding.x * 2 : 0.0f); // Include collapser
6033  ImVec2 text_pos(window->DC.CursorPos.x + text_offset_x, window->DC.CursorPos.y + text_offset_y);
6034  ItemSize(ImVec2(text_width, frame_height), padding.y);
6035 
6036  // For regular tree nodes, we arbitrary allow to click past 2 worth of ItemSpacing
6037  ImRect interact_bb = frame_bb;
6038  if (!display_frame && (flags & (ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_SpanAvailWidth | ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_SpanFullWidth)) == 0)
6039  interact_bb.Max.x = frame_bb.Min.x + text_width + style.ItemSpacing.x * 2.0f;
6040 
6041  // Store a flag for the current depth to tell if we will allow closing this node when navigating one of its child.
6042  // For this purpose we essentially compare if g.NavIdIsAlive went from 0 to 1 between TreeNode() and TreePop().
6043  // This is currently only support 32 level deep and we are fine with (1 << Depth) overflowing into a zero.
6044  const bool is_leaf = (flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Leaf) != 0;
6045  bool is_open = TreeNodeBehaviorIsOpen(id, flags);
6046  if (is_open && !g.NavIdIsAlive && (flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NavLeftJumpsBackHere) && !(flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NoTreePushOnOpen))
6047  window->DC.TreeJumpToParentOnPopMask |= (1 << window->DC.TreeDepth);
6048 
6049  bool item_add = ItemAdd(interact_bb, id);
6050  g.LastItemData.StatusFlags |= ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HasDisplayRect;
6051  g.LastItemData.DisplayRect = frame_bb;
6052 
6053  if (!item_add)
6054  {
6055  if (is_open && !(flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NoTreePushOnOpen))
6056  TreePushOverrideID(id);
6057  IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ITEM_INFO(g.LastItemData.ID, label, g.LastItemData.StatusFlags | (is_leaf ? 0 : ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Openable) | (is_open ? ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Opened : 0));
6058  return is_open;
6059  }
6060 
6061  ImGuiButtonFlags button_flags = ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_None;
6062  if (flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_AllowItemOverlap)
6063  button_flags |= ImGuiButtonFlags_AllowItemOverlap;
6064  if (!is_leaf)
6065  button_flags |= ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnDragDropHold;
6066 
6067  // We allow clicking on the arrow section with keyboard modifiers held, in order to easily
6068  // allow browsing a tree while preserving selection with code implementing multi-selection patterns.
6069  // When clicking on the rest of the tree node we always disallow keyboard modifiers.
6070  const float arrow_hit_x1 = (text_pos.x - text_offset_x) - style.TouchExtraPadding.x;
6071  const float arrow_hit_x2 = (text_pos.x - text_offset_x) + (g.FontSize + padding.x * 2.0f) + style.TouchExtraPadding.x;
6072  const bool is_mouse_x_over_arrow = (g.IO.MousePos.x >= arrow_hit_x1 && g.IO.MousePos.x < arrow_hit_x2);
6073  if (window != g.HoveredWindow || !is_mouse_x_over_arrow)
6074  button_flags |= ImGuiButtonFlags_NoKeyModifiers;
6075 
6076  // Open behaviors can be altered with the _OpenOnArrow and _OnOnDoubleClick flags.
6077  // Some alteration have subtle effects (e.g. toggle on MouseUp vs MouseDown events) due to requirements for multi-selection and drag and drop support.
6078  // - Single-click on label = Toggle on MouseUp (default, when _OpenOnArrow=0)
6079  // - Single-click on arrow = Toggle on MouseDown (when _OpenOnArrow=0)
6080  // - Single-click on arrow = Toggle on MouseDown (when _OpenOnArrow=1)
6081  // - Double-click on label = Toggle on MouseDoubleClick (when _OpenOnDoubleClick=1)
6082  // - Double-click on arrow = Toggle on MouseDoubleClick (when _OpenOnDoubleClick=1 and _OpenOnArrow=0)
6083  // It is rather standard that arrow click react on Down rather than Up.
6084  // We set ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnClickRelease on OpenOnDoubleClick because we want the item to be active on the initial MouseDown in order for drag and drop to work.
6085  if (is_mouse_x_over_arrow)
6086  button_flags |= ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnClick;
6087  else if (flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_OpenOnDoubleClick)
6088  button_flags |= ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnClickRelease | ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnDoubleClick;
6089  else
6090  button_flags |= ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnClickRelease;
6091 
6092  bool selected = (flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Selected) != 0;
6093  const bool was_selected = selected;
6094 
6095  bool hovered, held;
6096  bool pressed = ButtonBehavior(interact_bb, id, &hovered, &held, button_flags);
6097  bool toggled = false;
6098  if (!is_leaf)
6099  {
6100  if (pressed && g.DragDropHoldJustPressedId != id)
6101  {
6102  if ((flags & (ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_OpenOnArrow | ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_OpenOnDoubleClick)) == 0 || (g.NavActivateId == id))
6103  toggled = true;
6104  if (flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_OpenOnArrow)
6105  toggled |= is_mouse_x_over_arrow && !g.NavDisableMouseHover; // Lightweight equivalent of IsMouseHoveringRect() since ButtonBehavior() already did the job
6106  if ((flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_OpenOnDoubleClick) && g.IO.MouseDoubleClicked[0])
6107  toggled = true;
6108  }
6109  else if (pressed && g.DragDropHoldJustPressedId == id)
6110  {
6111  IM_ASSERT(button_flags & ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnDragDropHold);
6112  if (!is_open) // When using Drag and Drop "hold to open" we keep the node highlighted after opening, but never close it again.
6113  toggled = true;
6114  }
6115 
6116  if (g.NavId == id && g.NavMoveRequest && g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Left && is_open)
6117  {
6118  toggled = true;
6119  NavMoveRequestCancel();
6120  }
6121  if (g.NavId == id && g.NavMoveRequest && g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Right && !is_open) // If there's something upcoming on the line we may want to give it the priority?
6122  {
6123  toggled = true;
6124  NavMoveRequestCancel();
6125  }
6126 
6127  if (toggled)
6128  {
6129  is_open = !is_open;
6130  window->DC.StateStorage->SetIntUniform(id, is_open);
6131  g.LastItemData.StatusFlags |= ImGuiItemStatusFlags_ToggledOpen;
6132  }
6133  }
6134  if (flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_AllowItemOverlap)
6135  SetItemAllowOverlap();
6136 
6137  // In this branch, TreeNodeBehavior() cannot toggle the selection so this will never trigger.
6138  if (selected != was_selected) //-V547
6139  g.LastItemData.StatusFlags |= ImGuiItemStatusFlags_ToggledSelection;
6140 
6141  // Render
6142  const ImU32 text_col = GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Text);
6143  ImGuiNavHighlightFlags nav_highlight_flags = ImGuiNavHighlightFlags_TypeThin;
6144  if (display_frame)
6145  {
6146  // Framed type
6147  const ImU32 bg_col = GetColorU32((held && hovered) ? ImGuiCol_HeaderActive : hovered ? ImGuiCol_HeaderHovered : ImGuiCol_Header);
6148  RenderFrame(frame_bb.Min, frame_bb.Max, bg_col, true, style.FrameRounding);
6149  RenderNavHighlight(frame_bb, id, nav_highlight_flags);
6150  if (flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Bullet)
6151  RenderBullet(window->DrawList, ImVec2(text_pos.x - text_offset_x * 0.60f, text_pos.y + g.FontSize * 0.5f), text_col);
6152  else if (!is_leaf)
6153  RenderArrow(window->DrawList, ImVec2(text_pos.x - text_offset_x + padding.x, text_pos.y), text_col, is_open ? ImGuiDir_Down : ImGuiDir_Right, 1.0f);
6154  else // Leaf without bullet, left-adjusted text
6155  text_pos.x -= text_offset_x;
6156  if (flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_ClipLabelForTrailingButton)
6157  frame_bb.Max.x -= g.FontSize + style.FramePadding.x;
6158 
6159  if (g.LogEnabled)
6160  LogSetNextTextDecoration("###", "###");
6161  RenderTextClipped(text_pos, frame_bb.Max, label, label_end, &label_size);
6162  }
6163  else
6164  {
6165  // Unframed typed for tree nodes
6166  if (hovered || selected)
6167  {
6168  const ImU32 bg_col = GetColorU32((held && hovered) ? ImGuiCol_HeaderActive : hovered ? ImGuiCol_HeaderHovered : ImGuiCol_Header);
6169  RenderFrame(frame_bb.Min, frame_bb.Max, bg_col, false);
6170  }
6171  RenderNavHighlight(frame_bb, id, nav_highlight_flags);
6172  if (flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Bullet)
6173  RenderBullet(window->DrawList, ImVec2(text_pos.x - text_offset_x * 0.5f, text_pos.y + g.FontSize * 0.5f), text_col);
6174  else if (!is_leaf)
6175  RenderArrow(window->DrawList, ImVec2(text_pos.x - text_offset_x + padding.x, text_pos.y + g.FontSize * 0.15f), text_col, is_open ? ImGuiDir_Down : ImGuiDir_Right, 0.70f);
6176  if (g.LogEnabled)
6177  LogSetNextTextDecoration(">", NULL);
6178  RenderText(text_pos, label, label_end, false);
6179  }
6180 
6181  if (is_open && !(flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NoTreePushOnOpen))
6182  TreePushOverrideID(id);
6183  IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ITEM_INFO(id, label, g.LastItemData.StatusFlags | (is_leaf ? 0 : ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Openable) | (is_open ? ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Opened : 0));
6184  return is_open;
6185 }
6186 
6187 void ImGui::TreePush(const char *str_id)
6188 {
6189  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
6190  Indent();
6191  window->DC.TreeDepth++;
6192  PushID(str_id ? str_id : "#TreePush");
6193 }
6194 
6195 void ImGui::TreePush(const void *ptr_id)
6196 {
6197  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
6198  Indent();
6199  window->DC.TreeDepth++;
6200  PushID(ptr_id ? ptr_id : (const void *)"#TreePush");
6201 }
6202 
6203 void ImGui::TreePushOverrideID(ImGuiID id)
6204 {
6205  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
6206  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
6207  Indent();
6208  window->DC.TreeDepth++;
6209  window->IDStack.push_back(id);
6210 }
6211 
6212 void ImGui::TreePop()
6213 {
6214  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
6215  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
6216  Unindent();
6217 
6218  window->DC.TreeDepth--;
6219  ImU32 tree_depth_mask = (1 << window->DC.TreeDepth);
6220 
6221  // Handle Left arrow to move to parent tree node (when ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NavLeftJumpsBackHere is enabled)
6222  if (g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Left && g.NavWindow == window && NavMoveRequestButNoResultYet())
6223  if (g.NavIdIsAlive && (window->DC.TreeJumpToParentOnPopMask & tree_depth_mask))
6224  {
6225  SetNavID(window->IDStack.back(), g.NavLayer, 0, ImRect());
6226  NavMoveRequestCancel();
6227  }
6228  window->DC.TreeJumpToParentOnPopMask &= tree_depth_mask - 1;
6229 
6230  IM_ASSERT(window->IDStack.Size > 1); // There should always be 1 element in the IDStack (pushed during window creation). If this triggers you called TreePop/PopID too much.
6231  PopID();
6232 }
6233 
6234 // Horizontal distance preceding label when using TreeNode() or Bullet()
6235 float ImGui::GetTreeNodeToLabelSpacing()
6236 {
6237  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
6238  return g.FontSize + (g.Style.FramePadding.x * 2.0f);
6239 }
6240 
6241 // Set next TreeNode/CollapsingHeader open state.
6242 void ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(bool is_open, ImGuiCond cond)
6243 {
6244  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
6245  if (g.CurrentWindow->SkipItems)
6246  return;
6247  g.NextItemData.Flags |= ImGuiNextItemDataFlags_HasOpen;
6248  g.NextItemData.OpenVal = is_open;
6249  g.NextItemData.OpenCond = cond ? cond : ImGuiCond_Always;
6250 }
6251 
6252 // CollapsingHeader returns true when opened but do not indent nor push into the ID stack (because of the ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NoTreePushOnOpen flag).
6253 // This is basically the same as calling TreeNodeEx(label, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_CollapsingHeader). You can remove the _NoTreePushOnOpen flag if you want behavior closer to normal TreeNode().
6254 bool ImGui::CollapsingHeader(const char *label, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags flags)
6255 {
6256  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
6257  if (window->SkipItems)
6258  return false;
6259 
6260  return TreeNodeBehavior(window->GetID(label), flags | ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_CollapsingHeader, label);
6261 }
6262 
6263 // p_visible == NULL : regular collapsing header
6264 // p_visible != NULL && *p_visible == true : show a small close button on the corner of the header, clicking the button will set *p_visible = false
6265 // p_visible != NULL && *p_visible == false : do not show the header at all
6266 // Do not mistake this with the Open state of the header itself, which you can adjust with SetNextItemOpen() or ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DefaultOpen.
6267 bool ImGui::CollapsingHeader(const char *label, bool *p_visible, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags flags)
6268 {
6269  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
6270  if (window->SkipItems)
6271  return false;
6272 
6273  if (p_visible && !*p_visible)
6274  return false;
6275 
6276  ImGuiID id = window->GetID(label);
6277  flags |= ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_CollapsingHeader;
6278  if (p_visible)
6279  flags |= ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_AllowItemOverlap | ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_ClipLabelForTrailingButton;
6280  bool is_open = TreeNodeBehavior(id, flags, label);
6281  if (p_visible != NULL)
6282  {
6283  // Create a small overlapping close button
6284  // FIXME: We can evolve this into user accessible helpers to add extra buttons on title bars, headers, etc.
6285  // FIXME: CloseButton can overlap into text, need find a way to clip the text somehow.
6286  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
6287  ImGuiLastItemData last_item_backup = g.LastItemData;
6288  float button_size = g.FontSize;
6289  float button_x = ImMax(g.LastItemData.Rect.Min.x, g.LastItemData.Rect.Max.x - g.Style.FramePadding.x * 2.0f - button_size);
6290  float button_y = g.LastItemData.Rect.Min.y;
6291  ImGuiID close_button_id = GetIDWithSeed("#CLOSE", NULL, id);
6292  if (CloseButton(close_button_id, ImVec2(button_x, button_y)))
6293  *p_visible = false;
6294  g.LastItemData = last_item_backup;
6295  }
6296 
6297  return is_open;
6298 }
6299 
6300 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
6301 // [SECTION] Widgets: Selectable
6302 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
6303 // - Selectable()
6304 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
6305 
6306 // Tip: pass a non-visible label (e.g. "##hello") then you can use the space to draw other text or image.
6307 // But you need to make sure the ID is unique, e.g. enclose calls in PushID/PopID or use ##unique_id.
6308 // With this scheme, ImGuiSelectableFlags_SpanAllColumns and ImGuiSelectableFlags_AllowItemOverlap are also frequently used flags.
6309 // FIXME: Selectable() with (size.x == 0.0f) and (SelectableTextAlign.x > 0.0f) followed by SameLine() is currently not supported.
6310 bool ImGui::Selectable(const char *label, bool selected, ImGuiSelectableFlags flags, const ImVec2 &size_arg)
6311 {
6312  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
6313  if (window->SkipItems)
6314  return false;
6315 
6316  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
6317  const ImGuiStyle &style = g.Style;
6318 
6319  // Submit label or explicit size to ItemSize(), whereas ItemAdd() will submit a larger/spanning rectangle.
6320  ImGuiID id = window->GetID(label);
6321  ImVec2 label_size = CalcTextSize(label, NULL, true);
6322  ImVec2 size(size_arg.x != 0.0f ? size_arg.x : label_size.x, size_arg.y != 0.0f ? size_arg.y : label_size.y);
6323  ImVec2 pos = window->DC.CursorPos;
6324  pos.y += window->DC.CurrLineTextBaseOffset;
6325  ItemSize(size, 0.0f);
6326 
6327  // Fill horizontal space
6328  // We don't support (size < 0.0f) in Selectable() because the ItemSpacing extension would make explicitly right-aligned sizes not visibly match other widgets.
6329  const bool span_all_columns = (flags & ImGuiSelectableFlags_SpanAllColumns) != 0;
6330  const float min_x = span_all_columns ? window->ParentWorkRect.Min.x : pos.x;
6331  const float max_x = span_all_columns ? window->ParentWorkRect.Max.x : window->WorkRect.Max.x;
6332  if (size_arg.x == 0.0f || (flags & ImGuiSelectableFlags_SpanAvailWidth))
6333  size.x = ImMax(label_size.x, max_x - min_x);
6334 
6335  // Text stays at the submission position, but bounding box may be extended on both sides
6336  const ImVec2 text_min = pos;
6337  const ImVec2 text_max(min_x + size.x, pos.y + size.y);
6338 
6339  // Selectables are meant to be tightly packed together with no click-gap, so we extend their box to cover spacing between selectable.
6340  ImRect bb(min_x, pos.y, text_max.x, text_max.y);
6341  if ((flags & ImGuiSelectableFlags_NoPadWithHalfSpacing) == 0)
6342  {
6343  const float spacing_x = span_all_columns ? 0.0f : style.ItemSpacing.x;
6344  const float spacing_y = style.ItemSpacing.y;
6345  const float spacing_L = IM_FLOOR(spacing_x * 0.50f);
6346  const float spacing_U = IM_FLOOR(spacing_y * 0.50f);
6347  bb.Min.x -= spacing_L;
6348  bb.Min.y -= spacing_U;
6349  bb.Max.x += (spacing_x - spacing_L);
6350  bb.Max.y += (spacing_y - spacing_U);
6351  }
6352  //if (g.IO.KeyCtrl) { GetForegroundDrawList()->AddRect(bb.Min, bb.Max, IM_COL32(0, 255, 0, 255)); }
6353 
6354  // Modify ClipRect for the ItemAdd(), faster than doing a PushColumnsBackground/PushTableBackground for every Selectable..
6355  const float backup_clip_rect_min_x = window->ClipRect.Min.x;
6356  const float backup_clip_rect_max_x = window->ClipRect.Max.x;
6357  if (span_all_columns)
6358  {
6359  window->ClipRect.Min.x = window->ParentWorkRect.Min.x;
6360  window->ClipRect.Max.x = window->ParentWorkRect.Max.x;
6361  }
6362 
6363  bool item_add;
6364  const bool disabled_item = (flags & ImGuiSelectableFlags_Disabled) != 0;
6365  if (disabled_item)
6366  {
6367  ImGuiItemFlags backup_item_flags = g.CurrentItemFlags;
6368  g.CurrentItemFlags |= ImGuiItemFlags_Disabled;
6369  item_add = ItemAdd(bb, id);
6370  g.CurrentItemFlags = backup_item_flags;
6371  }
6372  else
6373  {
6374  item_add = ItemAdd(bb, id);
6375  }
6376 
6377  if (span_all_columns)
6378  {
6379  window->ClipRect.Min.x = backup_clip_rect_min_x;
6380  window->ClipRect.Max.x = backup_clip_rect_max_x;
6381  }
6382 
6383  if (!item_add)
6384  return false;
6385 
6386  const bool disabled_global = (g.CurrentItemFlags & ImGuiItemFlags_Disabled) != 0;
6387  if (disabled_item && !disabled_global) // Only testing this as an optimization
6388  BeginDisabled(true);
6389 
6390  // FIXME: We can standardize the behavior of those two, we could also keep the fast path of override ClipRect + full push on render only,
6391  // which would be advantageous since most selectable are not selected.
6392  if (span_all_columns && window->DC.CurrentColumns)
6393  PushColumnsBackground();
6394  else if (span_all_columns && g.CurrentTable)
6395  TablePushBackgroundChannel();
6396 
6397  // We use NoHoldingActiveID on menus so user can click and _hold_ on a menu then drag to browse child entries
6398  ImGuiButtonFlags button_flags = 0;
6399  if (flags & ImGuiSelectableFlags_NoHoldingActiveID)
6400  {
6401  button_flags |= ImGuiButtonFlags_NoHoldingActiveId;
6402  }
6403  if (flags & ImGuiSelectableFlags_SelectOnClick)
6404  {
6405  button_flags |= ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnClick;
6406  }
6407  if (flags & ImGuiSelectableFlags_SelectOnRelease)
6408  {
6409  button_flags |= ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnRelease;
6410  }
6411  if (flags & ImGuiSelectableFlags_AllowDoubleClick)
6412  {
6413  button_flags |= ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnClickRelease | ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnDoubleClick;
6414  }
6415  if (flags & ImGuiSelectableFlags_AllowItemOverlap)
6416  {
6417  button_flags |= ImGuiButtonFlags_AllowItemOverlap;
6418  }
6419 
6420  const bool was_selected = selected;
6421  bool hovered, held;
6422  bool pressed = ButtonBehavior(bb, id, &hovered, &held, button_flags);
6423 
6424  // Auto-select when moved into
6425  // - This will be more fully fleshed in the range-select branch
6426  // - This is not exposed as it won't nicely work with some user side handling of shift/control
6427  // - We cannot do 'if (g.NavJustMovedToId != id) { selected = false; pressed = was_selected; }' for two reasons
6428  // - (1) it would require focus scope to be set, need exposing PushFocusScope() or equivalent (e.g. BeginSelection() calling PushFocusScope())
6429  // - (2) usage will fail with clipped items
6430  // The multi-select API aim to fix those issues, e.g. may be replaced with a BeginSelection() API.
6431  if ((flags & ImGuiSelectableFlags_SelectOnNav) && g.NavJustMovedToId != 0 && g.NavJustMovedToFocusScopeId == window->DC.NavFocusScopeIdCurrent)
6432  if (g.NavJustMovedToId == id)
6433  selected = pressed = true;
6434 
6435  // Update NavId when clicking or when Hovering (this doesn't happen on most widgets), so navigation can be resumed with gamepad/keyboard
6436  if (pressed || (hovered && (flags & ImGuiSelectableFlags_SetNavIdOnHover)))
6437  {
6438  if (!g.NavDisableMouseHover && g.NavWindow == window && g.NavLayer == window->DC.NavLayerCurrent)
6439  {
6440  SetNavID(id, window->DC.NavLayerCurrent, window->DC.NavFocusScopeIdCurrent, ImRect(bb.Min - window->Pos, bb.Max - window->Pos));
6441  g.NavDisableHighlight = true;
6442  }
6443  }
6444  if (pressed)
6445  MarkItemEdited(id);
6446 
6447  if (flags & ImGuiSelectableFlags_AllowItemOverlap)
6448  SetItemAllowOverlap();
6449 
6450  // In this branch, Selectable() cannot toggle the selection so this will never trigger.
6451  if (selected != was_selected) //-V547
6452  g.LastItemData.StatusFlags |= ImGuiItemStatusFlags_ToggledSelection;
6453 
6454  // Render
6455  if (held && (flags & ImGuiSelectableFlags_DrawHoveredWhenHeld))
6456  hovered = true;
6457  if (hovered || selected)
6458  {
6459  const ImU32 col = GetColorU32((held && hovered) ? ImGuiCol_HeaderActive : hovered ? ImGuiCol_HeaderHovered : ImGuiCol_Header);
6460  RenderFrame(bb.Min, bb.Max, col, false, 0.0f);
6461  }
6462  RenderNavHighlight(bb, id, ImGuiNavHighlightFlags_TypeThin | ImGuiNavHighlightFlags_NoRounding);
6463 
6464  if (span_all_columns && window->DC.CurrentColumns)
6465  PopColumnsBackground();
6466  else if (span_all_columns && g.CurrentTable)
6467  TablePopBackgroundChannel();
6468 
6469  RenderTextClipped(text_min, text_max, label, NULL, &label_size, style.SelectableTextAlign, &bb);
6470 
6471  // Automatically close popups
6472  if (pressed && (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) && !(flags & ImGuiSelectableFlags_DontClosePopups) && !(g.LastItemData.InFlags & ImGuiItemFlags_SelectableDontClosePopup))
6473  CloseCurrentPopup();
6474 
6475  if (disabled_item && !disabled_global)
6476  EndDisabled();
6477 
6478  IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ITEM_INFO(id, label, g.LastItemData.StatusFlags);
6479  return pressed; //-V1020
6480 }
6481 
6482 bool ImGui::Selectable(const char *label, bool *p_selected, ImGuiSelectableFlags flags, const ImVec2 &size_arg)
6483 {
6484  if (Selectable(label, *p_selected, flags, size_arg))
6485  {
6486  *p_selected = !*p_selected;
6487  return true;
6488  }
6489  return false;
6490 }
6491 
6492 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
6493 // [SECTION] Widgets: ListBox
6494 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
6495 // - BeginListBox()
6496 // - EndListBox()
6497 // - ListBox()
6498 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
6499 
6500 // Tip: To have a list filling the entire window width, use size.x = -FLT_MIN and pass an non-visible label e.g. "##empty"
6501 // Tip: If your vertical size is calculated from an item count (e.g. 10 * item_height) consider adding a fractional part to facilitate seeing scrolling boundaries (e.g. 10.25 * item_height).
6502 bool ImGui::BeginListBox(const char *label, const ImVec2 &size_arg)
6503 {
6504  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
6505  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
6506  if (window->SkipItems)
6507  return false;
6508 
6509  const ImGuiStyle &style = g.Style;
6510  const ImGuiID id = GetID(label);
6511  const ImVec2 label_size = CalcTextSize(label, NULL, true);
6512 
6513  // Size default to hold ~7.25 items.
6514  // Fractional number of items helps seeing that we can scroll down/up without looking at scrollbar.
6515  ImVec2 size = ImFloor(CalcItemSize(size_arg, CalcItemWidth(), GetTextLineHeightWithSpacing() * 7.25f + style.FramePadding.y * 2.0f));
6516  ImVec2 frame_size = ImVec2(size.x, ImMax(size.y, label_size.y));
6517  ImRect frame_bb(window->DC.CursorPos, window->DC.CursorPos + frame_size);
6518  ImRect bb(frame_bb.Min, frame_bb.Max + ImVec2(label_size.x > 0.0f ? style.ItemInnerSpacing.x + label_size.x : 0.0f, 0.0f));
6519  g.NextItemData.ClearFlags();
6520 
6521  if (!IsRectVisible(bb.Min, bb.Max))
6522  {
6523  ItemSize(bb.GetSize(), style.FramePadding.y);
6524  ItemAdd(bb, 0, &frame_bb);
6525  return false;
6526  }
6527 
6528  // FIXME-OPT: We could omit the BeginGroup() if label_size.x but would need to omit the EndGroup() as well.
6529  BeginGroup();
6530  if (label_size.x > 0.0f)
6531  {
6532  ImVec2 label_pos = ImVec2(frame_bb.Max.x + style.ItemInnerSpacing.x, frame_bb.Min.y + style.FramePadding.y);
6533  RenderText(label_pos, label);
6534  window->DC.CursorMaxPos = ImMax(window->DC.CursorMaxPos, label_pos + label_size);
6535  }
6536 
6537  BeginChildFrame(id, frame_bb.GetSize());
6538  return true;
6539 }
6540 
6541 #ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
6542 // OBSOLETED in 1.81 (from February 2021)
6543 bool ImGui::ListBoxHeader(const char *label, int items_count, int height_in_items)
6544 {
6545  // If height_in_items == -1, default height is maximum 7.
6546  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
6547  float height_in_items_f = (height_in_items < 0 ? ImMin(items_count, 7) : height_in_items) + 0.25f;
6548  ImVec2 size;
6549  size.x = 0.0f;
6550  size.y = GetTextLineHeightWithSpacing() * height_in_items_f + g.Style.FramePadding.y * 2.0f;
6551  return BeginListBox(label, size);
6552 }
6553 #endif
6554 
6555 void ImGui::EndListBox()
6556 {
6557  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
6558  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
6559  IM_ASSERT((window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) && "Mismatched BeginListBox/EndListBox calls. Did you test the return value of BeginListBox?");
6560  IM_UNUSED(window);
6561 
6562  EndChildFrame();
6563  EndGroup(); // This is only required to be able to do IsItemXXX query on the whole ListBox including label
6564 }
6565 
6566 bool ImGui::ListBox(const char *label, int *current_item, const char *const items[], int items_count, int height_items)
6567 {
6568  const bool value_changed = ListBox(label, current_item, Items_ArrayGetter, (void *)items, items_count, height_items);
6569  return value_changed;
6570 }
6571 
6572 // This is merely a helper around BeginListBox(), EndListBox().
6573 // Considering using those directly to submit custom data or store selection differently.
6574 bool ImGui::ListBox(const char *label, int *current_item, bool (*items_getter)(void *, int, const char **), void *data, int items_count, int height_in_items)
6575 {
6576  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
6577 
6578  // Calculate size from "height_in_items"
6579  if (height_in_items < 0)
6580  height_in_items = ImMin(items_count, 7);
6581  float height_in_items_f = height_in_items + 0.25f;
6582  ImVec2 size(0.0f, ImFloor(GetTextLineHeightWithSpacing() * height_in_items_f + g.Style.FramePadding.y * 2.0f));
6583 
6584  if (!BeginListBox(label, size))
6585  return false;
6586 
6587  // Assume all items have even height (= 1 line of text). If you need items of different height,
6588  // you can create a custom version of ListBox() in your code without using the clipper.
6589  bool value_changed = false;
6590  ImGuiListClipper clipper;
6591  clipper.Begin(items_count, GetTextLineHeightWithSpacing()); // We know exactly our line height here so we pass it as a minor optimization, but generally you don't need to.
6592  while (clipper.Step())
6593  for (int i = clipper.DisplayStart; i < clipper.DisplayEnd; i++)
6594  {
6595  const char *item_text;
6596  if (!items_getter(data, i, &item_text))
6597  item_text = "*Unknown item*";
6598 
6599  PushID(i);
6600  const bool item_selected = (i == *current_item);
6601  if (Selectable(item_text, item_selected))
6602  {
6603  *current_item = i;
6604  value_changed = true;
6605  }
6606  if (item_selected)
6607  SetItemDefaultFocus();
6608  PopID();
6609  }
6610  EndListBox();
6611 
6612  if (value_changed)
6613  MarkItemEdited(g.LastItemData.ID);
6614 
6615  return value_changed;
6616 }
6617 
6618 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
6619 // [SECTION] Widgets: PlotLines, PlotHistogram
6620 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
6621 // - PlotEx() [Internal]
6622 // - PlotLines()
6623 // - PlotHistogram()
6624 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
6625 // Plot/Graph widgets are not very good.
6626 // Consider writing your own, or using a third-party one, see:
6627 // - ImPlot https://github.com/epezent/implot
6628 // - others https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/wiki/Useful-Extensions
6629 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
6630 
6631 int ImGui::PlotEx(ImGuiPlotType plot_type, const char *label, float (*values_getter)(void *data, int idx), void *data, int values_count, int values_offset, const char *overlay_text, float scale_min, float scale_max, ImVec2 frame_size)
6632 {
6633  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
6634  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
6635  if (window->SkipItems)
6636  return -1;
6637 
6638  const ImGuiStyle &style = g.Style;
6639  const ImGuiID id = window->GetID(label);
6640 
6641  const ImVec2 label_size = CalcTextSize(label, NULL, true);
6642  if (frame_size.x == 0.0f)
6643  frame_size.x = CalcItemWidth();
6644  if (frame_size.y == 0.0f)
6645  frame_size.y = label_size.y + (style.FramePadding.y * 2);
6646 
6647  const ImRect frame_bb(window->DC.CursorPos, window->DC.CursorPos + frame_size);
6648  const ImRect inner_bb(frame_bb.Min + style.FramePadding, frame_bb.Max - style.FramePadding);
6649  const ImRect total_bb(frame_bb.Min, frame_bb.Max + ImVec2(label_size.x > 0.0f ? style.ItemInnerSpacing.x + label_size.x : 0.0f, 0));
6650  ItemSize(total_bb, style.FramePadding.y);
6651  if (!ItemAdd(total_bb, 0, &frame_bb))
6652  return -1;
6653  const bool hovered = ItemHoverable(frame_bb, id);
6654 
6655  // Determine scale from values if not specified
6656  if (scale_min == FLT_MAX || scale_max == FLT_MAX)
6657  {
6658  float v_min = FLT_MAX;
6659  float v_max = -FLT_MAX;
6660  for (int i = 0; i < values_count; i++)
6661  {
6662  const float v = values_getter(data, i);
6663  if (v != v) // Ignore NaN values
6664  continue;
6665  v_min = ImMin(v_min, v);
6666  v_max = ImMax(v_max, v);
6667  }
6668  if (scale_min == FLT_MAX)
6669  scale_min = v_min;
6670  if (scale_max == FLT_MAX)
6671  scale_max = v_max;
6672  }
6673 
6674  RenderFrame(frame_bb.Min, frame_bb.Max, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_FrameBg), true, style.FrameRounding);
6675 
6676  const int values_count_min = (plot_type == ImGuiPlotType_Lines) ? 2 : 1;
6677  int idx_hovered = -1;
6678  if (values_count >= values_count_min)
6679  {
6680  int res_w = ImMin((int)frame_size.x, values_count) + ((plot_type == ImGuiPlotType_Lines) ? -1 : 0);
6681  int item_count = values_count + ((plot_type == ImGuiPlotType_Lines) ? -1 : 0);
6682 
6683  // Tooltip on hover
6684  if (hovered && inner_bb.Contains(g.IO.MousePos))
6685  {
6686  const float t = ImClamp((g.IO.MousePos.x - inner_bb.Min.x) / (inner_bb.Max.x - inner_bb.Min.x), 0.0f, 0.9999f);
6687  const int v_idx = (int)(t * item_count);
6688  IM_ASSERT(v_idx >= 0 && v_idx < values_count);
6689 
6690  const float v0 = values_getter(data, (v_idx + values_offset) % values_count);
6691  const float v1 = values_getter(data, (v_idx + 1 + values_offset) % values_count);
6692  if (plot_type == ImGuiPlotType_Lines)
6693  SetTooltip("%d: %8.4g\n%d: %8.4g", v_idx, v0, v_idx + 1, v1);
6694  else if (plot_type == ImGuiPlotType_Histogram)
6695  SetTooltip("%d: %8.4g", v_idx, v0);
6696  idx_hovered = v_idx;
6697  }
6698 
6699  const float t_step = 1.0f / (float)res_w;
6700  const float inv_scale = (scale_min == scale_max) ? 0.0f : (1.0f / (scale_max - scale_min));
6701 
6702  float v0 = values_getter(data, (0 + values_offset) % values_count);
6703  float t0 = 0.0f;
6704  ImVec2 tp0 = ImVec2(t0, 1.0f - ImSaturate((v0 - scale_min) * inv_scale)); // Point in the normalized space of our target rectangle
6705  float histogram_zero_line_t = (scale_min * scale_max < 0.0f) ? (-scale_min * inv_scale) : (scale_min < 0.0f ? 0.0f : 1.0f); // Where does the zero line stands
6706 
6707  const ImU32 col_base = GetColorU32((plot_type == ImGuiPlotType_Lines) ? ImGuiCol_PlotLines : ImGuiCol_PlotHistogram);
6708  const ImU32 col_hovered = GetColorU32((plot_type == ImGuiPlotType_Lines) ? ImGuiCol_PlotLinesHovered : ImGuiCol_PlotHistogramHovered);
6709 
6710  for (int n = 0; n < res_w; n++)
6711  {
6712  const float t1 = t0 + t_step;
6713  const int v1_idx = (int)(t0 * item_count + 0.5f);
