6714  IM_ASSERT(v1_idx >= 0 && v1_idx < values_count);
6715  const float v1 = values_getter(data, (v1_idx + values_offset + 1) % values_count);
6716  const ImVec2 tp1 = ImVec2(t1, 1.0f - ImSaturate((v1 - scale_min) * inv_scale));
6717 
6718  // NB: Draw calls are merged together by the DrawList system. Still, we should render our batch are lower level to save a bit of CPU.
6719  ImVec2 pos0 = ImLerp(inner_bb.Min, inner_bb.Max, tp0);
6720  ImVec2 pos1 = ImLerp(inner_bb.Min, inner_bb.Max, (plot_type == ImGuiPlotType_Lines) ? tp1 : ImVec2(tp1.x, histogram_zero_line_t));
6721  if (plot_type == ImGuiPlotType_Lines)
6722  {
6723  window->DrawList->AddLine(pos0, pos1, idx_hovered == v1_idx ? col_hovered : col_base);
6724  }
6725  else if (plot_type == ImGuiPlotType_Histogram)
6726  {
6727  if (pos1.x >= pos0.x + 2.0f)
6728  pos1.x -= 1.0f;
6729  window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(pos0, pos1, idx_hovered == v1_idx ? col_hovered : col_base);
6730  }
6731 
6732  t0 = t1;
6733  tp0 = tp1;
6734  }
6735  }
6736 
6737  // Text overlay
6738  if (overlay_text)
6739  RenderTextClipped(ImVec2(frame_bb.Min.x, frame_bb.Min.y + style.FramePadding.y), frame_bb.Max, overlay_text, NULL, NULL, ImVec2(0.5f, 0.0f));
6740 
6741  if (label_size.x > 0.0f)
6742  RenderText(ImVec2(frame_bb.Max.x + style.ItemInnerSpacing.x, inner_bb.Min.y), label);
6743 
6744  // Return hovered index or -1 if none are hovered.
6745  // This is currently not exposed in the public API because we need a larger redesign of the whole thing, but in the short-term we are making it available in PlotEx().
6746  return idx_hovered;
6747 }
6748 
6749 struct ImGuiPlotArrayGetterData
6750 {
6751  const float *Values;
6752  int Stride;
6753 
6754  ImGuiPlotArrayGetterData(const float *values, int stride)
6755  {
6756  Values = values; Stride = stride;
6757  }
6758 };
6759 
6760 static float Plot_ArrayGetter(void *data, int idx)
6761 {
6762  ImGuiPlotArrayGetterData *plot_data = (ImGuiPlotArrayGetterData *)data;
6763  const float v = *(const float *)(const void *)((const unsigned char *)plot_data->Values + (size_t)idx * plot_data->Stride);
6764  return v;
6765 }
6766 
6767 void ImGui::PlotLines(const char *label, const float *values, int values_count, int values_offset, const char *overlay_text, float scale_min, float scale_max, ImVec2 graph_size, int stride)
6768 {
6769  ImGuiPlotArrayGetterData data(values, stride);
6770  PlotEx(ImGuiPlotType_Lines, label, &Plot_ArrayGetter, (void *)&data, values_count, values_offset, overlay_text, scale_min, scale_max, graph_size);
6771 }
6772 
6773 void ImGui::PlotLines(const char *label, float (*values_getter)(void *data, int idx), void *data, int values_count, int values_offset, const char *overlay_text, float scale_min, float scale_max, ImVec2 graph_size)
6774 {
6775  PlotEx(ImGuiPlotType_Lines, label, values_getter, data, values_count, values_offset, overlay_text, scale_min, scale_max, graph_size);
6776 }
6777 
6778 void ImGui::PlotHistogram(const char *label, const float *values, int values_count, int values_offset, const char *overlay_text, float scale_min, float scale_max, ImVec2 graph_size, int stride)
6779 {
6780  ImGuiPlotArrayGetterData data(values, stride);
6781  PlotEx(ImGuiPlotType_Histogram, label, &Plot_ArrayGetter, (void *)&data, values_count, values_offset, overlay_text, scale_min, scale_max, graph_size);
6782 }
6783 
6784 void ImGui::PlotHistogram(const char *label, float (*values_getter)(void *data, int idx), void *data, int values_count, int values_offset, const char *overlay_text, float scale_min, float scale_max, ImVec2 graph_size)
6785 {
6786  PlotEx(ImGuiPlotType_Histogram, label, values_getter, data, values_count, values_offset, overlay_text, scale_min, scale_max, graph_size);
6787 }
6788 
6789 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
6790 // [SECTION] Widgets: Value helpers
6791 // Those is not very useful, legacy API.
6792 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
6793 // - Value()
6794 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
6795 
6796 void ImGui::Value(const char *prefix, bool b)
6797 {
6798  Text("%s: %s", prefix, (b ? "true" : "false"));
6799 }
6800 
6801 void ImGui::Value(const char *prefix, int v)
6802 {
6803  Text("%s: %d", prefix, v);
6804 }
6805 
6806 void ImGui::Value(const char *prefix, unsigned int v)
6807 {
6808  Text("%s: %d", prefix, v);
6809 }
6810 
6811 void ImGui::Value(const char *prefix, float v, const char *float_format)
6812 {
6813  if (float_format)
6814  {
6815  char fmt[64];
6816  ImFormatString(fmt, IM_ARRAYSIZE(fmt), "%%s: %s", float_format);
6817  Text(fmt, prefix, v);
6818  }
6819  else
6820  {
6821  Text("%s: %.3f", prefix, v);
6822  }
6823 }
6824 
6825 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
6826 // [SECTION] MenuItem, BeginMenu, EndMenu, etc.
6827 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
6828 // - ImGuiMenuColumns [Internal]
6829 // - BeginMenuBar()
6830 // - EndMenuBar()
6831 // - BeginMainMenuBar()
6832 // - EndMainMenuBar()
6833 // - BeginMenu()
6834 // - EndMenu()
6835 // - MenuItemEx() [Internal]
6836 // - MenuItem()
6837 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
6838 
6839 // Helpers for internal use
6840 void ImGuiMenuColumns::Update(float spacing, bool window_reappearing)
6841 {
6842  if (window_reappearing)
6843  memset(Widths, 0, sizeof(Widths));
6844  Spacing = (ImU16)spacing;
6845  CalcNextTotalWidth(true);
6846  memset(Widths, 0, sizeof(Widths));
6847  TotalWidth = NextTotalWidth;
6848  NextTotalWidth = 0;
6849 }
6850 
6851 void ImGuiMenuColumns::CalcNextTotalWidth(bool update_offsets)
6852 {
6853  ImU16 offset = 0;
6854  bool want_spacing = false;
6855  for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(Widths); i++)
6856  {
6857  ImU16 width = Widths[i];
6858  if (want_spacing && width > 0)
6859  offset += Spacing;
6860  want_spacing |= (width > 0);
6861  if (update_offsets)
6862  {
6863  if (i == 1)
6864  {
6865  OffsetLabel = offset;
6866  }
6867  if (i == 2)
6868  {
6869  OffsetShortcut = offset;
6870  }
6871  if (i == 3)
6872  {
6873  OffsetMark = offset;
6874  }
6875  }
6876  offset += width;
6877  }
6878  NextTotalWidth = offset;
6879 }
6880 
6881 float ImGuiMenuColumns::DeclColumns(float w_icon, float w_label, float w_shortcut, float w_mark)
6882 {
6883  Widths[0] = ImMax(Widths[0], (ImU16)w_icon);
6884  Widths[1] = ImMax(Widths[1], (ImU16)w_label);
6885  Widths[2] = ImMax(Widths[2], (ImU16)w_shortcut);
6886  Widths[3] = ImMax(Widths[3], (ImU16)w_mark);
6887  CalcNextTotalWidth(false);
6888  return (float)ImMax(TotalWidth, NextTotalWidth);
6889 }
6890 
6891 // FIXME: Provided a rectangle perhaps e.g. a BeginMenuBarEx() could be used anywhere..
6892 // Currently the main responsibility of this function being to setup clip-rect + horizontal layout + menu navigation layer.
6893 // Ideally we also want this to be responsible for claiming space out of the main window scrolling rectangle, in which case ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar will become unnecessary.
6894 // Then later the same system could be used for multiple menu-bars, scrollbars, side-bars.
6895 bool ImGui::BeginMenuBar()
6896 {
6897  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
6898  if (window->SkipItems)
6899  return false;
6900  if (!(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar))
6901  return false;
6902 
6903  IM_ASSERT(!window->DC.MenuBarAppending);
6904  BeginGroup(); // Backup position on layer 0 // FIXME: Misleading to use a group for that backup/restore
6905  PushID("##menubar");
6906 
6907  // We don't clip with current window clipping rectangle as it is already set to the area below. However we clip with window full rect.
6908  // We remove 1 worth of rounding to Max.x to that text in long menus and small windows don't tend to display over the lower-right rounded area, which looks particularly glitchy.
6909  ImRect bar_rect = window->MenuBarRect();
6910  ImRect clip_rect(IM_ROUND(bar_rect.Min.x + window->WindowBorderSize), IM_ROUND(bar_rect.Min.y + window->WindowBorderSize), IM_ROUND(ImMax(bar_rect.Min.x, bar_rect.Max.x - ImMax(window->WindowRounding, window->WindowBorderSize))), IM_ROUND(bar_rect.Max.y));
6911  clip_rect.ClipWith(window->OuterRectClipped);
6912  PushClipRect(clip_rect.Min, clip_rect.Max, false);
6913 
6914  // We overwrite CursorMaxPos because BeginGroup sets it to CursorPos (essentially the .EmitItem hack in EndMenuBar() would need something analogous here, maybe a BeginGroupEx() with flags).
6915  window->DC.CursorPos = window->DC.CursorMaxPos = ImVec2(bar_rect.Min.x + window->DC.MenuBarOffset.x, bar_rect.Min.y + window->DC.MenuBarOffset.y);
6916  window->DC.LayoutType = ImGuiLayoutType_Horizontal;
6917  window->DC.NavLayerCurrent = ImGuiNavLayer_Menu;
6918  window->DC.MenuBarAppending = true;
6919  AlignTextToFramePadding();
6920  return true;
6921 }
6922 
6923 void ImGui::EndMenuBar()
6924 {
6925  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
6926  if (window->SkipItems)
6927  return;
6928  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
6929 
6930  // Nav: When a move request within one of our child menu failed, capture the request to navigate among our siblings.
6931  if (NavMoveRequestButNoResultYet() && (g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Left || g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Right) && (g.NavWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu))
6932  {
6933  ImGuiWindow *nav_earliest_child = g.NavWindow;
6934  while (nav_earliest_child->ParentWindow && (nav_earliest_child->ParentWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu))
6935  nav_earliest_child = nav_earliest_child->ParentWindow;
6936  if (nav_earliest_child->ParentWindow == window && nav_earliest_child->DC.ParentLayoutType == ImGuiLayoutType_Horizontal && g.NavMoveRequestForward == ImGuiNavForward_None)
6937  {
6938  // To do so we claim focus back, restore NavId and then process the movement request for yet another frame.
6939  // This involve a one-frame delay which isn't very problematic in this situation. We could remove it by scoring in advance for multiple window (probably not worth the hassle/cost)
6940  const ImGuiNavLayer layer = ImGuiNavLayer_Menu;
6941  IM_ASSERT(window->DC.NavLayersActiveMaskNext & (1 << layer)); // Sanity check
6942  FocusWindow(window);
6943  SetNavID(window->NavLastIds[layer], layer, 0, window->NavRectRel[layer]);
6944  g.NavDisableHighlight = true; // Hide highlight for the current frame so we don't see the intermediary selection.
6945  g.NavDisableMouseHover = g.NavMousePosDirty = true;
6946  g.NavMoveRequestForward = ImGuiNavForward_ForwardQueued;
6947  NavMoveRequestCancel();
6948  }
6949  }
6950 
6951  IM_MSVC_WARNING_SUPPRESS(6011); // Static Analysis false positive "warning C6011: Dereferencing NULL pointer 'window'"
6952  IM_ASSERT(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar);
6953  IM_ASSERT(window->DC.MenuBarAppending);
6954  PopClipRect();
6955  PopID();
6956  window->DC.MenuBarOffset.x = window->DC.CursorPos.x - window->Pos.x; // Save horizontal position so next append can reuse it. This is kinda equivalent to a per-layer CursorPos.
6957  g.GroupStack.back().EmitItem = false;
6958  EndGroup(); // Restore position on layer 0
6959  window->DC.LayoutType = ImGuiLayoutType_Vertical;
6960  window->DC.NavLayerCurrent = ImGuiNavLayer_Main;
6961  window->DC.MenuBarAppending = false;
6962 }
6963 
6964 // Important: calling order matters!
6965 // FIXME: Somehow overlapping with docking tech.
6966 // FIXME: The "rect-cut" aspect of this could be formalized into a lower-level helper (rect-cut: https://halt.software/dead-simple-layouts)
6967 bool ImGui::BeginViewportSideBar(const char *name, ImGuiViewport *viewport_p, ImGuiDir dir, float axis_size, ImGuiWindowFlags window_flags)
6968 {
6969  IM_ASSERT(dir != ImGuiDir_None);
6970 
6971  ImGuiWindow *bar_window = FindWindowByName(name);
6972  if (bar_window == NULL || bar_window->BeginCount == 0)
6973  {
6974  // Calculate and set window size/position
6975  ImGuiViewportP *viewport = (ImGuiViewportP *)(void *)(viewport_p ? viewport_p : GetMainViewport());
6976  ImRect avail_rect = viewport->GetBuildWorkRect();
6977  ImGuiAxis axis = (dir == ImGuiDir_Up || dir == ImGuiDir_Down) ? ImGuiAxis_Y : ImGuiAxis_X;
6978  ImVec2 pos = avail_rect.Min;
6979  if (dir == ImGuiDir_Right || dir == ImGuiDir_Down)
6980  pos[axis] = avail_rect.Max[axis] - axis_size;
6981  ImVec2 size = avail_rect.GetSize();
6982  size[axis] = axis_size;
6983  SetNextWindowPos(pos);
6984  SetNextWindowSize(size);
6985 
6986  // Report our size into work area (for next frame) using actual window size
6987  if (dir == ImGuiDir_Up || dir == ImGuiDir_Left)
6988  viewport->BuildWorkOffsetMin[axis] += axis_size;
6989  else if (dir == ImGuiDir_Down || dir == ImGuiDir_Right)
6990  viewport->BuildWorkOffsetMax[axis] -= axis_size;
6991  }
6992 
6993  window_flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove;
6994  PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_WindowRounding, 0.0f);
6995  PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_WindowMinSize, ImVec2(0, 0)); // Lift normal size constraint
6996  bool is_open = Begin(name, NULL, window_flags);
6997  PopStyleVar(2);
6998 
6999  return is_open;
7000 }
7001 
7002 bool ImGui::BeginMainMenuBar()
7003 {
7004  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
7005  ImGuiViewportP *viewport = (ImGuiViewportP *)(void *)GetMainViewport();
7006 
7007  // For the main menu bar, which cannot be moved, we honor g.Style.DisplaySafeAreaPadding to ensure text can be visible on a TV set.
7008  // FIXME: This could be generalized as an opt-in way to clamp window->DC.CursorStartPos to avoid SafeArea?
7009  // FIXME: Consider removing support for safe area down the line... it's messy. Nowadays consoles have support for TV calibration in OS settings.
7010  g.NextWindowData.MenuBarOffsetMinVal = ImVec2(g.Style.DisplaySafeAreaPadding.x, ImMax(g.Style.DisplaySafeAreaPadding.y - g.Style.FramePadding.y, 0.0f));
7011  ImGuiWindowFlags window_flags = ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollbar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings | ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar;
7012  float height = GetFrameHeight();
7013  bool is_open = BeginViewportSideBar("##MainMenuBar", viewport, ImGuiDir_Up, height, window_flags);
7014  g.NextWindowData.MenuBarOffsetMinVal = ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f);
7015 
7016  if (is_open)
7017  BeginMenuBar();
7018  else
7019  End();
7020  return is_open;
7021 }
7022 
7023 void ImGui::EndMainMenuBar()
7024 {
7025  EndMenuBar();
7026 
7027  // When the user has left the menu layer (typically: closed menus through activation of an item), we restore focus to the previous window
7028  // FIXME: With this strategy we won't be able to restore a NULL focus.
7029  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
7030  if (g.CurrentWindow == g.NavWindow && g.NavLayer == ImGuiNavLayer_Main && !g.NavAnyRequest)
7031  FocusTopMostWindowUnderOne(g.NavWindow, NULL);
7032 
7033  End();
7034 }
7035 
7036 bool ImGui::BeginMenu(const char *label, bool enabled)
7037 {
7038  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
7039  if (window->SkipItems)
7040  return false;
7041 
7042  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
7043  const ImGuiStyle &style = g.Style;
7044  const ImGuiID id = window->GetID(label);
7045  bool menu_is_open = IsPopupOpen(id, ImGuiPopupFlags_None);
7046 
7047  // Sub-menus are ChildWindow so that mouse can be hovering across them (otherwise top-most popup menu would steal focus and not allow hovering on parent menu)
7048  ImGuiWindowFlags flags = ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu | ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavFocus;
7049  if (window->Flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup | ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu))
7050  flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow;
7051 
7052  // If a menu with same the ID was already submitted, we will append to it, matching the behavior of Begin().
7053  // We are relying on a O(N) search - so O(N log N) over the frame - which seems like the most efficient for the expected small amount of BeginMenu() calls per frame.
7054  // If somehow this is ever becoming a problem we can switch to use e.g. ImGuiStorage mapping key to last frame used.
7055  if (g.MenusIdSubmittedThisFrame.contains(id))
7056  {
7057  if (menu_is_open)
7058  menu_is_open = BeginPopupEx(id, flags); // menu_is_open can be 'false' when the popup is completely clipped (e.g. zero size display)
7059  else
7060  g.NextWindowData.ClearFlags(); // we behave like Begin() and need to consume those values
7061  return menu_is_open;
7062  }
7063 
7064  // Tag menu as used. Next time BeginMenu() with same ID is called it will append to existing menu
7065  g.MenusIdSubmittedThisFrame.push_back(id);
7066 
7067  ImVec2 label_size = CalcTextSize(label, NULL, true);
7068  bool pressed;
7069  bool menuset_is_open = !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) && (g.OpenPopupStack.Size > g.BeginPopupStack.Size && g.OpenPopupStack[g.BeginPopupStack.Size].OpenParentId == window->IDStack.back());
7070  ImGuiWindow *backed_nav_window = g.NavWindow;
7071  if (menuset_is_open)
7072  g.NavWindow = window; // Odd hack to allow hovering across menus of a same menu-set (otherwise we wouldn't be able to hover parent)
7073 
7074  // The reference position stored in popup_pos will be used by Begin() to find a suitable position for the child menu,
7075  // However the final position is going to be different! It is chosen by FindBestWindowPosForPopup().
7076  // e.g. Menus tend to overlap each other horizontally to amplify relative Z-ordering.
7077  ImVec2 popup_pos, pos = window->DC.CursorPos;
7078  PushID(label);
7079  if (!enabled)
7080  BeginDisabled();
7081  const ImGuiMenuColumns *offsets = &window->DC.MenuColumns;
7082  if (window->DC.LayoutType == ImGuiLayoutType_Horizontal)
7083  {
7084  // Menu inside an horizontal menu bar
7085  // Selectable extend their highlight by half ItemSpacing in each direction.
7086  // For ChildMenu, the popup position will be overwritten by the call to FindBestWindowPosForPopup() in Begin()
7087  popup_pos = ImVec2(pos.x - 1.0f - IM_FLOOR(style.ItemSpacing.x * 0.5f), pos.y - style.FramePadding.y + window->MenuBarHeight());
7088  window->DC.CursorPos.x += IM_FLOOR(style.ItemSpacing.x * 0.5f);
7089  PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_ItemSpacing, ImVec2(style.ItemSpacing.x * 2.0f, style.ItemSpacing.y));
7090  float w = label_size.x;
7091  ImVec2 text_pos(window->DC.CursorPos.x + offsets->OffsetLabel, window->DC.CursorPos.y + window->DC.CurrLineTextBaseOffset);
7092  pressed = Selectable("", menu_is_open, ImGuiSelectableFlags_NoHoldingActiveID | ImGuiSelectableFlags_SelectOnClick | ImGuiSelectableFlags_DontClosePopups, ImVec2(w, 0.0f));
7093  RenderText(text_pos, label);
7094  PopStyleVar();
7095  window->DC.CursorPos.x += IM_FLOOR(style.ItemSpacing.x * (-1.0f + 0.5f)); // -1 spacing to compensate the spacing added when Selectable() did a SameLine(). It would also work to call SameLine() ourselves after the PopStyleVar().
7096  }
7097  else
7098  {
7099  // Menu inside a menu
7100  // (In a typical menu window where all items are BeginMenu() or MenuItem() calls, extra_w will always be 0.0f.
7101  // Only when they are other items sticking out we're going to add spacing, yet only register minimum width into the layout system.
7102  popup_pos = ImVec2(pos.x, pos.y - style.WindowPadding.y);
7103  float icon_w = 0.0f; // FIXME: This not currently exposed for BeginMenu() however you can call window->DC.MenuColumns.DeclColumns(w, 0, 0, 0) yourself
7104  float checkmark_w = IM_FLOOR(g.FontSize * 1.20f);
7105  float min_w = window->DC.MenuColumns.DeclColumns(icon_w, label_size.x, 0.0f, checkmark_w); // Feedback to next frame
7106  float extra_w = ImMax(0.0f, GetContentRegionAvail().x - min_w);
7107  ImVec2 text_pos(window->DC.CursorPos.x + offsets->OffsetLabel, window->DC.CursorPos.y + window->DC.CurrLineTextBaseOffset);
7108  pressed = Selectable("", menu_is_open, ImGuiSelectableFlags_NoHoldingActiveID | ImGuiSelectableFlags_SelectOnClick | ImGuiSelectableFlags_DontClosePopups | ImGuiSelectableFlags_SpanAvailWidth, ImVec2(min_w, 0.0f));
7109  RenderText(text_pos, label);
7110  RenderArrow(window->DrawList, pos + ImVec2(offsets->OffsetMark + extra_w + g.FontSize * 0.30f, 0.0f), GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Text), ImGuiDir_Right);
7111  }
7112  if (!enabled)
7113  EndDisabled();
7114 
7115  const bool hovered = (g.HoveredId == id) && enabled;
7116  if (menuset_is_open)
7117  g.NavWindow = backed_nav_window;
7118 
7119  bool want_open = false;
7120  bool want_close = false;
7121  if (window->DC.LayoutType == ImGuiLayoutType_Vertical) // (window->Flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup|ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu))
7122  {
7123  // Close menu when not hovering it anymore unless we are moving roughly in the direction of the menu
7124  // Implement http://bjk5.com/post/44698559168/breaking-down-amazons-mega-dropdown to avoid using timers, so menus feels more reactive.
7125  bool moving_toward_other_child_menu = false;
7126 
7127  ImGuiWindow *child_menu_window = (g.BeginPopupStack.Size < g.OpenPopupStack.Size &&g.OpenPopupStack[g.BeginPopupStack.Size].SourceWindow == window) ? g.OpenPopupStack[g.BeginPopupStack.Size].Window : NULL;
7128  if (g.HoveredWindow == window && child_menu_window != NULL && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar))
7129  {
7130  // FIXME-DPI: Values should be derived from a master "scale" factor.
7131  ImRect next_window_rect = child_menu_window->Rect();
7132  ImVec2 ta = g.IO.MousePos - g.IO.MouseDelta;
7133  ImVec2 tb = (window->Pos.x < child_menu_window->Pos.x) ? next_window_rect.GetTL() : next_window_rect.GetTR();
7134  ImVec2 tc = (window->Pos.x < child_menu_window->Pos.x) ? next_window_rect.GetBL() : next_window_rect.GetBR();
7135  float extra = ImClamp(ImFabs(ta.x - tb.x) * 0.30f, 5.0f, 30.0f); // add a bit of extra slack.
7136  ta.x += (window->Pos.x < child_menu_window->Pos.x) ? -0.5f : +0.5f; // to avoid numerical issues
7137  tb.y = ta.y + ImMax((tb.y - extra) - ta.y, -100.0f); // triangle is maximum 200 high to limit the slope and the bias toward large sub-menus // FIXME: Multiply by fb_scale?
7138  tc.y = ta.y + ImMin((tc.y + extra) - ta.y, +100.0f);
7139  moving_toward_other_child_menu = ImTriangleContainsPoint(ta, tb, tc, g.IO.MousePos);
7140  //GetForegroundDrawList()->AddTriangleFilled(ta, tb, tc, moving_within_opened_triangle ? IM_COL32(0,128,0,128) : IM_COL32(128,0,0,128)); // [DEBUG]
7141  }
7142 
7143  // FIXME: Hovering a disabled BeginMenu or MenuItem won't close us
7144  if (menu_is_open && !hovered && g.HoveredWindow == window && g.HoveredIdPreviousFrame != 0 && g.HoveredIdPreviousFrame != id && !moving_toward_other_child_menu)
7145  want_close = true;
7146 
7147  if (!menu_is_open && hovered && pressed) // Click to open
7148  want_open = true;
7149  else if (!menu_is_open && hovered && !moving_toward_other_child_menu) // Hover to open
7150  want_open = true;
7151 
7152  if (g.NavActivateId == id)
7153  {
7154  want_close = menu_is_open;
7155  want_open = !menu_is_open;
7156  }
7157  if (g.NavId == id && g.NavMoveRequest && g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Right) // Nav-Right to open
7158  {
7159  want_open = true;
7160  NavMoveRequestCancel();
7161  }
7162  }
7163  else
7164  {
7165  // Menu bar
7166  if (menu_is_open && pressed && menuset_is_open) // Click an open menu again to close it
7167  {
7168  want_close = true;
7169  want_open = menu_is_open = false;
7170  }
7171  else if (pressed || (hovered && menuset_is_open && !menu_is_open)) // First click to open, then hover to open others
7172  {
7173  want_open = true;
7174  }
7175  else if (g.NavId == id && g.NavMoveRequest && g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Down) // Nav-Down to open
7176  {
7177  want_open = true;
7178  NavMoveRequestCancel();
7179  }
7180  }
7181 
7182  if (!enabled) // explicitly close if an open menu becomes disabled, facilitate users code a lot in pattern such as 'if (BeginMenu("options", has_object)) { ..use object.. }'
7183  want_close = true;
7184  if (want_close && IsPopupOpen(id, ImGuiPopupFlags_None))
7185  ClosePopupToLevel(g.BeginPopupStack.Size, true);
7186 
7187  IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ITEM_INFO(id, label, g.LastItemData.StatusFlags | ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Openable | (menu_is_open ? ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Opened : 0));
7188  PopID();
7189 
7190  if (!menu_is_open && want_open && g.OpenPopupStack.Size > g.BeginPopupStack.Size)
7191  {
7192  // Don't recycle same menu level in the same frame, first close the other menu and yield for a frame.
7193  OpenPopup(label);
7194  return false;
7195  }
7196 
7197  menu_is_open |= want_open;
7198  if (want_open)
7199  OpenPopup(label);
7200 
7201  if (menu_is_open)
7202  {
7203  SetNextWindowPos(popup_pos, ImGuiCond_Always); // Note: this is super misleading! The value will serve as reference for FindBestWindowPosForPopup(), not actual pos.
7204  menu_is_open = BeginPopupEx(id, flags); // menu_is_open can be 'false' when the popup is completely clipped (e.g. zero size display)
7205  }
7206  else
7207  {
7208  g.NextWindowData.ClearFlags(); // We behave like Begin() and need to consume those values
7209  }
7210 
7211  return menu_is_open;
7212 }
7213 
7214 void ImGui::EndMenu()
7215 {
7216  // Nav: When a left move request _within our child menu_ failed, close ourselves (the _parent_ menu).
7217  // A menu doesn't close itself because EndMenuBar() wants the catch the last Left<>Right inputs.
7218  // However, it means that with the current code, a BeginMenu() from outside another menu or a menu-bar won't be closable with the Left direction.
7219  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
7220  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
7221  if (g.NavWindow && g.NavWindow->ParentWindow == window && g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Left && NavMoveRequestButNoResultYet() && window->DC.LayoutType == ImGuiLayoutType_Vertical)
7222  {
7223  ClosePopupToLevel(g.BeginPopupStack.Size, true);
7224  NavMoveRequestCancel();
7225  }
7226 
7227  EndPopup();
7228 }
7229 
7230 bool ImGui::MenuItemEx(const char *label, const char *icon, const char *shortcut, bool selected, bool enabled)
7231 {
7232  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
7233  if (window->SkipItems)
7234  return false;
7235 
7236  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
7237  ImGuiStyle &style = g.Style;
7238  ImVec2 pos = window->DC.CursorPos;
7239  ImVec2 label_size = CalcTextSize(label, NULL, true);
7240 
7241  // We've been using the equivalent of ImGuiSelectableFlags_SetNavIdOnHover on all Selectable() since early Nav system days (commit 43ee5d73),
7242  // but I am unsure whether this should be kept at all. For now moved it to be an opt-in feature used by menus only.
7243  bool pressed;
7244  PushID(label);
7245  if (!enabled)
7246  BeginDisabled(true);
7247  const ImGuiSelectableFlags flags = ImGuiSelectableFlags_SelectOnRelease | ImGuiSelectableFlags_SetNavIdOnHover;
7248  const ImGuiMenuColumns *offsets = &window->DC.MenuColumns;
7249  if (window->DC.LayoutType == ImGuiLayoutType_Horizontal)
7250  {
7251  // Mimic the exact layout spacing of BeginMenu() to allow MenuItem() inside a menu bar, which is a little misleading but may be useful
7252  // Note that in this situation: we don't render the shortcut, we render a highlight instead of the selected tick mark.
7253  float w = label_size.x;
7254  window->DC.CursorPos.x += IM_FLOOR(style.ItemSpacing.x * 0.5f);
7255  PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_ItemSpacing, ImVec2(style.ItemSpacing.x * 2.0f, style.ItemSpacing.y));
7256  pressed = Selectable("", selected, flags, ImVec2(w, 0.0f));
7257  PopStyleVar();
7258  RenderText(pos + ImVec2(offsets->OffsetLabel, 0.0f), label);
7259  window->DC.CursorPos.x += IM_FLOOR(style.ItemSpacing.x * (-1.0f + 0.5f)); // -1 spacing to compensate the spacing added when Selectable() did a SameLine(). It would also work to call SameLine() ourselves after the PopStyleVar().
7260  }
7261  else
7262  {
7263  // Menu item inside a vertical menu
7264  // (In a typical menu window where all items are BeginMenu() or MenuItem() calls, extra_w will always be 0.0f.
7265  // Only when they are other items sticking out we're going to add spacing, yet only register minimum width into the layout system.
7266  float icon_w = (icon && icon[0]) ? CalcTextSize(icon, NULL).x : 0.0f;
7267  float shortcut_w = (shortcut && shortcut[0]) ? CalcTextSize(shortcut, NULL).x : 0.0f;
7268  float checkmark_w = IM_FLOOR(g.FontSize * 1.20f);
7269  float min_w = window->DC.MenuColumns.DeclColumns(icon_w, label_size.x, shortcut_w, checkmark_w); // Feedback for next frame
7270  float stretch_w = ImMax(0.0f, GetContentRegionAvail().x - min_w);
7271  pressed = Selectable("", false, flags | ImGuiSelectableFlags_SpanAvailWidth, ImVec2(min_w, 0.0f));
7272  RenderText(pos + ImVec2(offsets->OffsetLabel, 0.0f), label);
7273  if (icon_w > 0.0f)
7274  RenderText(pos + ImVec2(offsets->OffsetIcon, 0.0f), icon);
7275  if (shortcut_w > 0.0f)
7276  {
7277  PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_Text, style.Colors[ImGuiCol_TextDisabled]);
7278  RenderText(pos + ImVec2(offsets->OffsetShortcut + stretch_w, 0.0f), shortcut, NULL, false);
7279  PopStyleColor();
7280  }
7281  if (selected)
7282  RenderCheckMark(window->DrawList, pos + ImVec2(offsets->OffsetMark + stretch_w + g.FontSize * 0.40f, g.FontSize * 0.134f * 0.5f), GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Text), g.FontSize * 0.866f);
7283  }
7284  IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ITEM_INFO(g.LastItemData.ID, label, g.LastItemData.StatusFlags | ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Checkable | (selected ? ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Checked : 0));
7285  if (!enabled)
7286  EndDisabled();
7287  PopID();
7288 
7289  return pressed;
7290 }
7291 
7292 bool ImGui::MenuItem(const char *label, const char *shortcut, bool selected, bool enabled)
7293 {
7294  return MenuItemEx(label, NULL, shortcut, selected, enabled);
7295 }
7296 
7297 bool ImGui::MenuItem(const char *label, const char *shortcut, bool *p_selected, bool enabled)
7298 {
7299  if (MenuItemEx(label, NULL, shortcut, p_selected ? *p_selected : false, enabled))
7300  {
7301  if (p_selected)
7302  *p_selected = !*p_selected;
7303  return true;
7304  }
7305  return false;
7306 }
7307 
7308 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
7309 // [SECTION] Widgets: BeginTabBar, EndTabBar, etc.
7310 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
7311 // - BeginTabBar()
7312 // - BeginTabBarEx() [Internal]
7313 // - EndTabBar()
7314 // - TabBarLayout() [Internal]
7315 // - TabBarCalcTabID() [Internal]
7316 // - TabBarCalcMaxTabWidth() [Internal]
7317 // - TabBarFindTabById() [Internal]
7318 // - TabBarRemoveTab() [Internal]
7319 // - TabBarCloseTab() [Internal]
7320 // - TabBarScrollClamp() [Internal]
7321 // - TabBarScrollToTab() [Internal]
7322 // - TabBarQueueChangeTabOrder() [Internal]
7323 // - TabBarScrollingButtons() [Internal]
7324 // - TabBarTabListPopupButton() [Internal]
7325 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
7326 
7327 struct ImGuiTabBarSection
7328 {
7329  int TabCount; // Number of tabs in this section.
7330  float Width; // Sum of width of tabs in this section (after shrinking down)
7331  float Spacing; // Horizontal spacing at the end of the section.
7332 
7333  ImGuiTabBarSection()
7334  {
7335  memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this));
7336  }
7337 };
7338 
7339 namespace ImGui
7340 {
7341  static void TabBarLayout(ImGuiTabBar *tab_bar);
7342  static ImU32 TabBarCalcTabID(ImGuiTabBar *tab_bar, const char *label);
7343  static float TabBarCalcMaxTabWidth();
7344  static float TabBarScrollClamp(ImGuiTabBar *tab_bar, float scrolling);
7345  static void TabBarScrollToTab(ImGuiTabBar *tab_bar, ImGuiID tab_id, ImGuiTabBarSection *sections);
7346  static ImGuiTabItem *TabBarScrollingButtons(ImGuiTabBar *tab_bar);
7347  static ImGuiTabItem *TabBarTabListPopupButton(ImGuiTabBar *tab_bar);
7348 }
7349 
7350 ImGuiTabBar::ImGuiTabBar()
7351 {
7352  memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this));
7353  CurrFrameVisible = PrevFrameVisible = -1;
7354  LastTabItemIdx = -1;
7355 }
7356 
7357 static inline int TabItemGetSectionIdx(const ImGuiTabItem *tab)
7358 {
7359  return (tab->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_Leading) ? 0 : (tab->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_Trailing) ? 2 : 1;
7360 }
7361 
7362 static int IMGUI_CDECL TabItemComparerBySection(const void *lhs, const void *rhs)
7363 {
7364  const ImGuiTabItem *a = (const ImGuiTabItem *)lhs;
7365  const ImGuiTabItem *b = (const ImGuiTabItem *)rhs;
7366  const int a_section = TabItemGetSectionIdx(a);
7367  const int b_section = TabItemGetSectionIdx(b);
7368  if (a_section != b_section)
7369  return a_section - b_section;
7370  return (int)(a->IndexDuringLayout - b->IndexDuringLayout);
7371 }
7372 
7373 static int IMGUI_CDECL TabItemComparerByBeginOrder(const void *lhs, const void *rhs)
7374 {
7375  const ImGuiTabItem *a = (const ImGuiTabItem *)lhs;
7376  const ImGuiTabItem *b = (const ImGuiTabItem *)rhs;
7377  return (int)(a->BeginOrder - b->BeginOrder);
7378 }
7379 
7380 static ImGuiTabBar *GetTabBarFromTabBarRef(const ImGuiPtrOrIndex &ref)
7381 {
7382  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
7383  return ref.Ptr ? (ImGuiTabBar *)ref.Ptr : g.TabBars.GetByIndex(ref.Index);
7384 }
7385 
7386 static ImGuiPtrOrIndex GetTabBarRefFromTabBar(ImGuiTabBar *tab_bar)
7387 {
7388  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
7389  if (g.TabBars.Contains(tab_bar))
7390  return ImGuiPtrOrIndex(g.TabBars.GetIndex(tab_bar));
7391  return ImGuiPtrOrIndex(tab_bar);
7392 }
7393 
7394 bool ImGui::BeginTabBar(const char *str_id, ImGuiTabBarFlags flags)
7395 {
7396  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
7397  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
7398  if (window->SkipItems)
7399  return false;
7400 
7401  ImGuiID id = window->GetID(str_id);
7402  ImGuiTabBar *tab_bar = g.TabBars.GetOrAddByKey(id);
7403  ImRect tab_bar_bb = ImRect(window->DC.CursorPos.x, window->DC.CursorPos.y, window->WorkRect.Max.x, window->DC.CursorPos.y + g.FontSize + g.Style.FramePadding.y * 2);
7404  tab_bar->ID = id;
7405  return BeginTabBarEx(tab_bar, tab_bar_bb, flags | ImGuiTabBarFlags_IsFocused);
7406 }
7407 
7408 bool ImGui::BeginTabBarEx(ImGuiTabBar *tab_bar, const ImRect &tab_bar_bb, ImGuiTabBarFlags flags)
7409 {
7410  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
7411  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
7412  if (window->SkipItems)
7413  return false;
7414 
7415  if ((flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_DockNode) == 0)
7416  PushOverrideID(tab_bar->ID);
7417 
7418  // Add to stack
7419  g.CurrentTabBarStack.push_back(GetTabBarRefFromTabBar(tab_bar));
7420  g.CurrentTabBar = tab_bar;
7421 
7422  // Append with multiple BeginTabBar()/EndTabBar() pairs.
7423  tab_bar->BackupCursorPos = window->DC.CursorPos;
7424  if (tab_bar->CurrFrameVisible == g.FrameCount)
7425  {
7426  window->DC.CursorPos = ImVec2(tab_bar->BarRect.Min.x, tab_bar->BarRect.Max.y + tab_bar->ItemSpacingY);
7427  tab_bar->BeginCount++;
7428  return true;
7429  }
7430 
7431  // Ensure correct ordering when toggling ImGuiTabBarFlags_Reorderable flag, or when a new tab was added while being not reorderable
7432  if ((flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_Reorderable) != (tab_bar->Flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_Reorderable) || (tab_bar->TabsAddedNew && !(flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_Reorderable)))
7433  if (tab_bar->Tabs.Size > 1)
7434  ImQsort(tab_bar->Tabs.Data, tab_bar->Tabs.Size, sizeof(ImGuiTabItem), TabItemComparerByBeginOrder);
7435  tab_bar->TabsAddedNew = false;
7436 
7437  // Flags
7438  if ((flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyMask_) == 0)
7439  flags |= ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyDefault_;
7440 
7441  tab_bar->Flags = flags;
7442  tab_bar->BarRect = tab_bar_bb;
7443  tab_bar->WantLayout = true; // Layout will be done on the first call to ItemTab()
7444  tab_bar->PrevFrameVisible = tab_bar->CurrFrameVisible;
7445  tab_bar->CurrFrameVisible = g.FrameCount;
7446  tab_bar->PrevTabsContentsHeight = tab_bar->CurrTabsContentsHeight;
7447  tab_bar->CurrTabsContentsHeight = 0.0f;
7448  tab_bar->ItemSpacingY = g.Style.ItemSpacing.y;
7449  tab_bar->FramePadding = g.Style.FramePadding;
7450  tab_bar->TabsActiveCount = 0;
7451  tab_bar->BeginCount = 1;
7452 
7453  // Set cursor pos in a way which only be used in the off-chance the user erroneously submits item before BeginTabItem(): items will overlap
7454  window->DC.CursorPos = ImVec2(tab_bar->BarRect.Min.x, tab_bar->BarRect.Max.y + tab_bar->ItemSpacingY);
7455 
7456  // Draw separator
7457  const ImU32 col = GetColorU32((flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_IsFocused) ? ImGuiCol_TabActive : ImGuiCol_TabUnfocusedActive);
7458  const float y = tab_bar->BarRect.Max.y - 1.0f;
7459  {
7460  const float separator_min_x = tab_bar->BarRect.Min.x - IM_FLOOR(window->WindowPadding.x * 0.5f);
7461  const float separator_max_x = tab_bar->BarRect.Max.x + IM_FLOOR(window->WindowPadding.x * 0.5f);
7462  window->DrawList->AddLine(ImVec2(separator_min_x, y), ImVec2(separator_max_x, y), col, 1.0f);
7463  }
7464  return true;
7465 }
7466 
7467 void ImGui::EndTabBar()
7468 {
7469  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
7470  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
7471  if (window->SkipItems)
7472  return;
7473 
7474  ImGuiTabBar *tab_bar = g.CurrentTabBar;
7475  if (tab_bar == NULL)
7476  {
7477  IM_ASSERT_USER_ERROR(tab_bar != NULL, "Mismatched BeginTabBar()/EndTabBar()!");
7478  return;
7479  }
7480 
7481  // Fallback in case no TabItem have been submitted
7482  if (tab_bar->WantLayout)
7483  TabBarLayout(tab_bar);
7484 
7485  // Restore the last visible height if no tab is visible, this reduce vertical flicker/movement when a tabs gets removed without calling SetTabItemClosed().
7486  const bool tab_bar_appearing = (tab_bar->PrevFrameVisible + 1 < g.FrameCount);
7487  if (tab_bar->VisibleTabWasSubmitted || tab_bar->VisibleTabId == 0 || tab_bar_appearing)
7488  {
7489  tab_bar->CurrTabsContentsHeight = ImMax(window->DC.CursorPos.y - tab_bar->BarRect.Max.y, tab_bar->CurrTabsContentsHeight);
7490  window->DC.CursorPos.y = tab_bar->BarRect.Max.y + tab_bar->CurrTabsContentsHeight;
7491  }
7492  else
7493  {
7494  window->DC.CursorPos.y = tab_bar->BarRect.Max.y + tab_bar->PrevTabsContentsHeight;
7495  }
7496  if (tab_bar->BeginCount > 1)
7497  window->DC.CursorPos = tab_bar->BackupCursorPos;
7498 
7499  if ((tab_bar->Flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_DockNode) == 0)
7500  PopID();
7501 
7502  g.CurrentTabBarStack.pop_back();
7503  g.CurrentTabBar = g.CurrentTabBarStack.empty() ? NULL : GetTabBarFromTabBarRef(g.CurrentTabBarStack.back());
7504 }
7505 
7506 // This is called only once a frame before by the first call to ItemTab()
7507 // The reason we're not calling it in BeginTabBar() is to leave a chance to the user to call the SetTabItemClosed() functions.
7508 static void ImGui::TabBarLayout(ImGuiTabBar *tab_bar)
7509 {
7510  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
7511  tab_bar->WantLayout = false;
7512 
7513  // Garbage collect by compacting list
7514  // Detect if we need to sort out tab list (e.g. in rare case where a tab changed section)
7515  int tab_dst_n = 0;
7516  bool need_sort_by_section = false;
7517  ImGuiTabBarSection sections[3]; // Layout sections: Leading, Central, Trailing
7518  for (int tab_src_n = 0; tab_src_n < tab_bar->Tabs.Size; tab_src_n++)
7519  {
7520  ImGuiTabItem *tab = &tab_bar->Tabs[tab_src_n];
7521  if (tab->LastFrameVisible < tab_bar->PrevFrameVisible || tab->WantClose)
7522  {
7523  // Remove tab
7524  if (tab_bar->VisibleTabId == tab->ID)
7525  {
7526  tab_bar->VisibleTabId = 0;
7527  }
7528  if (tab_bar->SelectedTabId == tab->ID)
7529  {
7530  tab_bar->SelectedTabId = 0;
7531  }
7532  if (tab_bar->NextSelectedTabId == tab->ID)
7533  {
7534  tab_bar->NextSelectedTabId = 0;
7535  }
7536  continue;
7537  }
7538  if (tab_dst_n != tab_src_n)
7539  tab_bar->Tabs[tab_dst_n] = tab_bar->Tabs[tab_src_n];
7540 
7541  tab = &tab_bar->Tabs[tab_dst_n];
7542  tab->IndexDuringLayout = (ImS16)tab_dst_n;
7543 
7544  // We will need sorting if tabs have changed section (e.g. moved from one of Leading/Central/Trailing to another)
7545  int curr_tab_section_n = TabItemGetSectionIdx(tab);
7546  if (tab_dst_n > 0)
7547  {
7548  ImGuiTabItem *prev_tab = &tab_bar->Tabs[tab_dst_n - 1];
7549  int prev_tab_section_n = TabItemGetSectionIdx(prev_tab);
7550  if (curr_tab_section_n == 0 && prev_tab_section_n != 0)
7551  need_sort_by_section = true;
7552  if (prev_tab_section_n == 2 && curr_tab_section_n != 2)
7553  need_sort_by_section = true;
7554  }
7555 
7556  sections[curr_tab_section_n].TabCount++;
7557  tab_dst_n++;
7558  }
7559  if (tab_bar->Tabs.Size != tab_dst_n)
7560  tab_bar->Tabs.resize(tab_dst_n);
7561 
7562  if (need_sort_by_section)
7563  ImQsort(tab_bar->Tabs.Data, tab_bar->Tabs.Size, sizeof(ImGuiTabItem), TabItemComparerBySection);
7564 
7565  // Calculate spacing between sections
7566  sections[0].Spacing = sections[0].TabCount > 0 && (sections[1].TabCount + sections[2].TabCount) > 0 ? g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x : 0.0f;
7567  sections[1].Spacing = sections[1].TabCount > 0 && sections[2].TabCount > 0 ? g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x : 0.0f;
7568 
7569  // Setup next selected tab
7570  ImGuiID scroll_to_tab_id = 0;
7571  if (tab_bar->NextSelectedTabId)
7572  {
7573  tab_bar->SelectedTabId = tab_bar->NextSelectedTabId;
7574  tab_bar->NextSelectedTabId = 0;
7575  scroll_to_tab_id = tab_bar->SelectedTabId;
7576  }
7577 
7578  // Process order change request (we could probably process it when requested but it's just saner to do it in a single spot).
7579  if (tab_bar->ReorderRequestTabId != 0)
7580  {
7581  if (TabBarProcessReorder(tab_bar))
7582  if (tab_bar->ReorderRequestTabId == tab_bar->SelectedTabId)
7583  scroll_to_tab_id = tab_bar->ReorderRequestTabId;
7584  tab_bar->ReorderRequestTabId = 0;
7585  }
7586 
7587  // Tab List Popup (will alter tab_bar->BarRect and therefore the available width!)
7588  const bool tab_list_popup_button = (tab_bar->Flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_TabListPopupButton) != 0;
7589  if (tab_list_popup_button)
7590  if (ImGuiTabItem *tab_to_select = TabBarTabListPopupButton(tab_bar)) // NB: Will alter BarRect.Min.x!
7591  scroll_to_tab_id = tab_bar->SelectedTabId = tab_to_select->ID;
7592 
7593  // Leading/Trailing tabs will be shrink only if central one aren't visible anymore, so layout the shrink data as: leading, trailing, central
7594  // (whereas our tabs are stored as: leading, central, trailing)
7595  int shrink_buffer_indexes[3] = { 0, sections[0].TabCount + sections[2].TabCount, sections[0].TabCount };
7596  g.ShrinkWidthBuffer.resize(tab_bar->Tabs.Size);
7597 
7598  // Compute ideal tabs widths + store them into shrink buffer
7599  ImGuiTabItem *most_recently_selected_tab = NULL;
7600  int curr_section_n = -1;
7601  bool found_selected_tab_id = false;
7602  for (int tab_n = 0; tab_n < tab_bar->Tabs.Size; tab_n++)
7603  {
7604  ImGuiTabItem *tab = &tab_bar->Tabs[tab_n];
7605  IM_ASSERT(tab->LastFrameVisible >= tab_bar->PrevFrameVisible);
7606 
7607  if ((most_recently_selected_tab == NULL || most_recently_selected_tab->LastFrameSelected < tab->LastFrameSelected) && !(tab->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_Button))
7608  most_recently_selected_tab = tab;
7609  if (tab->ID == tab_bar->SelectedTabId)
7610  found_selected_tab_id = true;
7611  if (scroll_to_tab_id == 0 && g.NavJustMovedToId == tab->ID)
7612  scroll_to_tab_id = tab->ID;
7613 
7614  // Refresh tab width immediately, otherwise changes of style e.g. style.FramePadding.x would noticeably lag in the tab bar.
7615  // Additionally, when using TabBarAddTab() to manipulate tab bar order we occasionally insert new tabs that don't have a width yet,
7616  // and we cannot wait for the next BeginTabItem() call. We cannot compute this width within TabBarAddTab() because font size depends on the active window.
7617  const char *tab_name = tab_bar->GetTabName(tab);
7618  const bool has_close_button = (tab->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoCloseButton) ? false : true;
7619  tab->ContentWidth = TabItemCalcSize(tab_name, has_close_button).x;
7620 
7621  int section_n = TabItemGetSectionIdx(tab);
7622  ImGuiTabBarSection *section = &sections[section_n];
7623  section->Width += tab->ContentWidth + (section_n == curr_section_n ? g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x : 0.0f);
7624  curr_section_n = section_n;
7625 
7626  // Store data so we can build an array sorted by width if we need to shrink tabs down
7627  IM_MSVC_WARNING_SUPPRESS(6385);
7628  int shrink_buffer_index = shrink_buffer_indexes[section_n]++;
7629  g.ShrinkWidthBuffer[shrink_buffer_index].Index = tab_n;
7630  g.ShrinkWidthBuffer[shrink_buffer_index].Width = tab->ContentWidth;
7631 
7632  IM_ASSERT(tab->ContentWidth > 0.0f);
7633  tab->Width = tab->ContentWidth;
7634  }
7635 
7636  // Compute total ideal width (used for e.g. auto-resizing a window)
7637  tab_bar->WidthAllTabsIdeal = 0.0f;
7638  for (int section_n = 0; section_n < 3; section_n++)
7639  tab_bar->WidthAllTabsIdeal += sections[section_n].Width + sections[section_n].Spacing;
7640 
7641  // Horizontal scrolling buttons
7642  // (note that TabBarScrollButtons() will alter BarRect.Max.x)
7643  if ((tab_bar->WidthAllTabsIdeal > tab_bar->BarRect.GetWidth() && tab_bar->Tabs.Size > 1) && !(tab_bar->Flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_NoTabListScrollingButtons) && (tab_bar->Flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyScroll))
7644  if (ImGuiTabItem *scroll_and_select_tab = TabBarScrollingButtons(tab_bar))
7645  {
7646  scroll_to_tab_id = scroll_and_select_tab->ID;
7647  if ((scroll_and_select_tab->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_Button) == 0)
7648  tab_bar->SelectedTabId = scroll_to_tab_id;
7649  }
7650 
7651  // Shrink widths if full tabs don't fit in their allocated space
7652  float section_0_w = sections[0].Width + sections[0].Spacing;
7653  float section_1_w = sections[1].Width + sections[1].Spacing;
7654  float section_2_w = sections[2].Width + sections[2].Spacing;
7655  bool central_section_is_visible = (section_0_w + section_2_w) < tab_bar->BarRect.GetWidth();
7656  float width_excess;
7657  if (central_section_is_visible)
7658  width_excess = ImMax(section_1_w - (tab_bar->BarRect.GetWidth() - section_0_w - section_2_w), 0.0f); // Excess used to shrink central section
7659  else
7660  width_excess = (section_0_w + section_2_w) - tab_bar->BarRect.GetWidth(); // Excess used to shrink leading/trailing section
7661 
7662  // With ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyScroll policy, we will only shrink leading/trailing if the central section is not visible anymore
7663  if (width_excess > 0.0f && ((tab_bar->Flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyResizeDown) || !central_section_is_visible))
7664  {
7665  int shrink_data_count = (central_section_is_visible ? sections[1].TabCount : sections[0].TabCount + sections[2].TabCount);
7666  int shrink_data_offset = (central_section_is_visible ? sections[0].TabCount + sections[2].TabCount : 0);
7667  ShrinkWidths(g.ShrinkWidthBuffer.Data + shrink_data_offset, shrink_data_count, width_excess);
7668 
7669  // Apply shrunk values into tabs and sections
7670  for (int tab_n = shrink_data_offset; tab_n < shrink_data_offset + shrink_data_count; tab_n++)
7671  {
7672  ImGuiTabItem *tab = &tab_bar->Tabs[g.ShrinkWidthBuffer[tab_n].Index];
7673  float shrinked_width = IM_FLOOR(g.ShrinkWidthBuffer[tab_n].Width);
7674  if (shrinked_width < 0.0f)
7675  continue;
7676 
7677  int section_n = TabItemGetSectionIdx(tab);
7678  sections[section_n].Width -= (tab->Width - shrinked_width);
7679  tab->Width = shrinked_width;
7680  }
7681  }
7682 
7683  // Layout all active tabs
7684  int section_tab_index = 0;
7685  float tab_offset = 0.0f;
7686  tab_bar->WidthAllTabs = 0.0f;
7687  for (int section_n = 0; section_n < 3; section_n++)
7688  {
7689  ImGuiTabBarSection *section = &sections[section_n];
7690  if (section_n == 2)
7691  tab_offset = ImMin(ImMax(0.0f, tab_bar->BarRect.GetWidth() - section->Width), tab_offset);
7692 
7693  for (int tab_n = 0; tab_n < section->TabCount; tab_n++)
7694  {
7695  ImGuiTabItem *tab = &tab_bar->Tabs[section_tab_index + tab_n];
7696  tab->Offset = tab_offset;
7697  tab_offset += tab->Width + (tab_n < section->TabCount - 1 ? g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x : 0.0f);
7698  }
7699  tab_bar->WidthAllTabs += ImMax(section->Width + section->Spacing, 0.0f);
7700  tab_offset += section->Spacing;
7701  section_tab_index += section->TabCount;
7702  }
7703 
7704  // If we have lost the selected tab, select the next most recently active one
7705  if (found_selected_tab_id == false)
7706  tab_bar->SelectedTabId = 0;
7707  if (tab_bar->SelectedTabId == 0 && tab_bar->NextSelectedTabId == 0 && most_recently_selected_tab != NULL)
7708  scroll_to_tab_id = tab_bar->SelectedTabId = most_recently_selected_tab->ID;
7709 
7710  // Lock in visible tab
7711  tab_bar->VisibleTabId = tab_bar->SelectedTabId;
7712  tab_bar->VisibleTabWasSubmitted = false;
7713 
7714  // Update scrolling
7715  if (scroll_to_tab_id != 0)
7716  TabBarScrollToTab(tab_bar, scroll_to_tab_id, sections);
7717  tab_bar->ScrollingAnim = TabBarScrollClamp(tab_bar, tab_bar->ScrollingAnim);
7718  tab_bar->ScrollingTarget = TabBarScrollClamp(tab_bar, tab_bar->ScrollingTarget);
7719  if (tab_bar->ScrollingAnim != tab_bar->ScrollingTarget)
7720  {
7721  // Scrolling speed adjust itself so we can always reach our target in 1/3 seconds.
7722  // Teleport if we are aiming far off the visible line
7723  tab_bar->ScrollingSpeed = ImMax(tab_bar->ScrollingSpeed, 70.0f * g.FontSize);
7724  tab_bar->ScrollingSpeed = ImMax(tab_bar->ScrollingSpeed, ImFabs(tab_bar->ScrollingTarget - tab_bar->ScrollingAnim) / 0.3f);
7725  const bool teleport = (tab_bar->PrevFrameVisible + 1 < g.FrameCount) || (tab_bar->ScrollingTargetDistToVisibility > 10.0f * g.FontSize);
7726  tab_bar->ScrollingAnim = teleport ? tab_bar->ScrollingTarget : ImLinearSweep(tab_bar->ScrollingAnim, tab_bar->ScrollingTarget, g.IO.Time * tab_bar->ScrollingSpeed);
7727  }
7728  else
7729  {
7730  tab_bar->ScrollingSpeed = 0.0f;
7731  }
7732  tab_bar->ScrollingRectMinX = tab_bar->BarRect.Min.x + sections[0].Width + sections[0].Spacing;
7733  tab_bar->ScrollingRectMaxX = tab_bar->BarRect.Max.x - sections[2].Width - sections[1].Spacing;
7734 
7735  // Clear name buffers
7736  if ((tab_bar->Flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_DockNode) == 0)
7737  tab_bar->TabsNames.Buf.resize(0);
7738 
7739  // Actual layout in host window (we don't do it in BeginTabBar() so as not to waste an extra frame)
7740  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
7741  window->DC.CursorPos = tab_bar->BarRect.Min;
7742  ItemSize(ImVec2(tab_bar->WidthAllTabs, tab_bar->BarRect.GetHeight()), tab_bar->FramePadding.y);
7743  window->DC.IdealMaxPos.x = ImMax(window->DC.IdealMaxPos.x, tab_bar->BarRect.Min.x + tab_bar->WidthAllTabsIdeal);
7744 }
7745 
7746 // Dockables uses Name/ID in the global namespace. Non-dockable items use the ID stack.
7747 static ImU32 ImGui::TabBarCalcTabID(ImGuiTabBar *tab_bar, const char *label)
7748 {
7749  if (tab_bar->Flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_DockNode)
7750  {
7751  ImGuiID id = ImHashStr(label);
7752  KeepAliveID(id);
7753  return id;
7754  }
7755  else
7756  {
7757  ImGuiWindow *window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
7758  return window->GetID(label);
7759  }
7760 }
7761 
7762 static float ImGui::TabBarCalcMaxTabWidth()
7763 {
7764  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
7765  return g.FontSize * 20.0f;
7766 }
7767 
7768 ImGuiTabItem *ImGui::TabBarFindTabByID(ImGuiTabBar *tab_bar, ImGuiID tab_id)
7769 {
7770  if (tab_id != 0)
7771  for (int n = 0; n < tab_bar->Tabs.Size; n++)
7772  if (tab_bar->Tabs[n].ID == tab_id)
7773  return &tab_bar->Tabs[n];
7774  return NULL;
7775 }
7776 
7777 // The *TabId fields be already set by the docking system _before_ the actual TabItem was created, so we clear them regardless.
7778 void ImGui::TabBarRemoveTab(ImGuiTabBar *tab_bar, ImGuiID tab_id)
7779 {
7780  if (ImGuiTabItem *tab = TabBarFindTabByID(tab_bar, tab_id))
7781  tab_bar->Tabs.erase(tab);
7782  if (tab_bar->VisibleTabId == tab_id)
7783  {
7784  tab_bar->VisibleTabId = 0;
7785  }
7786  if (tab_bar->SelectedTabId == tab_id)
7787  {
7788  tab_bar->SelectedTabId = 0;
7789  }
7790  if (tab_bar->NextSelectedTabId == tab_id)
7791  {
7792  tab_bar->NextSelectedTabId = 0;
7793  }
7794 }
7795 
7796 // Called on manual closure attempt
7797 void ImGui::TabBarCloseTab(ImGuiTabBar *tab_bar, ImGuiTabItem *tab)
7798 {
7799  IM_ASSERT(!(tab->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_Button));
7800  if (!(tab->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_UnsavedDocument))
7801  {
7802  // This will remove a frame of lag for selecting another tab on closure.
7803  // However we don't run it in the case where the 'Unsaved' flag is set, so user gets a chance to fully undo the closure
7804  tab->WantClose = true;
7805  if (tab_bar->VisibleTabId == tab->ID)
7806  {
7807  tab->LastFrameVisible = -1;
7808  tab_bar->SelectedTabId = tab_bar->NextSelectedTabId = 0;
7809  }
7810  }
7811  else
7812  {
7813  // Actually select before expecting closure attempt (on an UnsavedDocument tab user is expect to e.g. show a popup)
7814  if (tab_bar->VisibleTabId != tab->ID)
7815  tab_bar->NextSelectedTabId = tab->ID;
7816  }
7817 }
7818 
7819 static float ImGui::TabBarScrollClamp(ImGuiTabBar *tab_bar, float scrolling)
7820 {
7821  scrolling = ImMin(scrolling, tab_bar->WidthAllTabs - tab_bar->BarRect.GetWidth());
7822  return ImMax(scrolling, 0.0f);
7823 }
7824 
7825 // Note: we may scroll to tab that are not selected! e.g. using keyboard arrow keys
7826 static void ImGui::TabBarScrollToTab(ImGuiTabBar *tab_bar, ImGuiID tab_id, ImGuiTabBarSection *sections)
7827 {
7828  ImGuiTabItem *tab = TabBarFindTabByID(tab_bar, tab_id);
7829  if (tab == NULL)
7830  return;
7831  if (tab->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_SectionMask_)
7832  return;
7833 
7834  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
7835  float margin = g.FontSize * 1.0f; // When to scroll to make Tab N+1 visible always make a bit of N visible to suggest more scrolling area (since we don't have a scrollbar)
7836  int order = tab_bar->GetTabOrder(tab);
7837 
7838  // Scrolling happens only in the central section (leading/trailing sections are not scrolling)
7839  // FIXME: This is all confusing.
7840  float scrollable_width = tab_bar->BarRect.GetWidth() - sections[0].Width - sections[2].Width - sections[1].Spacing;
7841 
7842  // We make all tabs positions all relative Sections[0].Width to make code simpler
7843  float tab_x1 = tab->Offset - sections[0].Width + (order > sections[0].TabCount - 1 ? -margin : 0.0f);
7844  float tab_x2 = tab->Offset - sections[0].Width + tab->Width + (order + 1 < tab_bar->Tabs.Size - sections[2].TabCount ? margin : 1.0f);
7845  tab_bar->ScrollingTargetDistToVisibility = 0.0f;
7846  if (tab_bar->ScrollingTarget > tab_x1 || (tab_x2 - tab_x1 >= scrollable_width))
7847  {
7848  // Scroll to the left
7849  tab_bar->ScrollingTargetDistToVisibility = ImMax(tab_bar->ScrollingAnim - tab_x2, 0.0f);
7850  tab_bar->ScrollingTarget = tab_x1;
7851  }
7852  else if (tab_bar->ScrollingTarget < tab_x2 - scrollable_width)
7853  {
7854  // Scroll to the right
7855  tab_bar->ScrollingTargetDistToVisibility = ImMax((tab_x1 - scrollable_width) - tab_bar->ScrollingAnim, 0.0f);
7856  tab_bar->ScrollingTarget = tab_x2 - scrollable_width;
7857  }
7858 }
7859 
7860 void ImGui::TabBarQueueReorder(ImGuiTabBar *tab_bar, const ImGuiTabItem *tab, int offset)
7861 {
7862  IM_ASSERT(offset != 0);
7863  IM_ASSERT(tab_bar->ReorderRequestTabId == 0);
7864  tab_bar->ReorderRequestTabId = tab->ID;
7865  tab_bar->ReorderRequestOffset = (ImS16)offset;
7866 }
7867 
7868 void ImGui::TabBarQueueReorderFromMousePos(ImGuiTabBar *tab_bar, const ImGuiTabItem *src_tab, ImVec2 mouse_pos)
7869 {
7870  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
7871  IM_ASSERT(tab_bar->ReorderRequestTabId == 0);
7872  if ((tab_bar->Flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_Reorderable) == 0)
7873  return;
7874 
7875  const bool is_central_section = (src_tab->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_SectionMask_) == 0;
7876  const float bar_offset = tab_bar->BarRect.Min.x - (is_central_section ? tab_bar->ScrollingTarget : 0);
7877 
7878  // Count number of contiguous tabs we are crossing over
7879  const int dir = (bar_offset + src_tab->Offset) > mouse_pos.x ? -1 : +1;
7880  const int src_idx = tab_bar->Tabs.index_from_ptr(src_tab);
7881  int dst_idx = src_idx;
7882  for (int i = src_idx; i >= 0 && i < tab_bar->Tabs.Size; i += dir)
7883  {
7884  // Reordered tabs must share the same section
7885  const ImGuiTabItem *dst_tab = &tab_bar->Tabs[i];
7886  if (dst_tab->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoReorder)
7887  break;
7888  if ((dst_tab->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_SectionMask_) != (src_tab->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_SectionMask_))
7889  break;
7890  dst_idx = i;
7891 
7892  // Include spacing after tab, so when mouse cursor is between tabs we would not continue checking further tabs that are not hovered.
7893  const float x1 = bar_offset + dst_tab->Offset - g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x;
7894  const float x2 = bar_offset + dst_tab->Offset + dst_tab->Width + g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x;
7895  //GetForegroundDrawList()->AddRect(ImVec2(x1, tab_bar->BarRect.Min.y), ImVec2(x2, tab_bar->BarRect.Max.y), IM_COL32(255, 0, 0, 255));
7896  if ((dir < 0 && mouse_pos.x > x1) || (dir > 0 && mouse_pos.x < x2))
7897  break;
7898  }
7899 
7900  if (dst_idx != src_idx)
7901  TabBarQueueReorder(tab_bar, src_tab, dst_idx - src_idx);
7902 }
7903 
7904 bool ImGui::TabBarProcessReorder(ImGuiTabBar *tab_bar)
7905 {
7906  ImGuiTabItem *tab1 = TabBarFindTabByID(tab_bar, tab_bar->ReorderRequestTabId);
7907  if (tab1 == NULL || (tab1->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoReorder))
7908  return false;
7909 
7910  //IM_ASSERT(tab_bar->Flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_Reorderable); // <- this may happen when using debug tools
7911  int tab2_order = tab_bar->GetTabOrder(tab1) + tab_bar->ReorderRequestOffset;
7912  if (tab2_order < 0 || tab2_order >= tab_bar->Tabs.Size)
7913  return false;
7914 
7915  // Reordered tabs must share the same section
7916  // (Note: TabBarQueueReorderFromMousePos() also has a similar test but since we allow direct calls to TabBarQueueReorder() we do it here too)
7917  ImGuiTabItem *tab2 = &tab_bar->Tabs[tab2_order];
7918  if (tab2->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoReorder)
7919  return false;
7920  if ((tab1->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_SectionMask_) != (tab2->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_SectionMask_))
7921  return false;
7922 
7923  ImGuiTabItem item_tmp = *tab1;
7924  ImGuiTabItem *src_tab = (tab_bar->ReorderRequestOffset > 0) ? tab1 + 1 : tab2;
7925  ImGuiTabItem *dst_tab = (tab_bar->ReorderRequestOffset > 0) ? tab1 : tab2 + 1;
7926  const int move_count = (tab_bar->ReorderRequestOffset > 0) ? tab_bar->ReorderRequestOffset : -tab_bar->ReorderRequestOffset;
7927  memmove(dst_tab, src_tab, move_count * sizeof(ImGuiTabItem));
7928  *tab2 = item_tmp;
7929 
7930  if (tab_bar->Flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_SaveSettings)
7931  MarkIniSettingsDirty();
7932  return true;
7933 }
7934 
7935 static ImGuiTabItem *ImGui::TabBarScrollingButtons(ImGuiTabBar *tab_bar)
7936 {
7937  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
7938  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
7939 
7940  const ImVec2 arrow_button_size(g.FontSize - 2.0f, g.FontSize + g.Style.FramePadding.y * 2.0f);
7941  const float scrolling_buttons_width = arrow_button_size.x * 2.0f;
7942 
7943  const ImVec2 backup_cursor_pos = window->DC.CursorPos;
7944  //window->DrawList->AddRect(ImVec2(tab_bar->BarRect.Max.x - scrolling_buttons_width, tab_bar->BarRect.Min.y), ImVec2(tab_bar->BarRect.Max.x, tab_bar->BarRect.Max.y), IM_COL32(255,0,0,255));
7945 
7946  int select_dir = 0;
7947  ImVec4 arrow_col = g.Style.Colors[ImGuiCol_Text];
7948  arrow_col.w *= 0.5f;
7949 
7950  PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_Text, arrow_col);
7951  PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_Button, ImVec4(0, 0, 0, 0));
7952  const float backup_repeat_delay = g.IO.KeyRepeatDelay;
7953  const float backup_repeat_rate = g.IO.KeyRepeatRate;
7954  g.IO.KeyRepeatDelay = 0.250f;
7955  g.IO.KeyRepeatRate = 0.200f;
7956  float x = ImMax(tab_bar->BarRect.Min.x, tab_bar->BarRect.Max.x - scrolling_buttons_width);
7957  window->DC.CursorPos = ImVec2(x, tab_bar->BarRect.Min.y);
7958  if (ArrowButtonEx("##<", ImGuiDir_Left, arrow_button_size, ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnClick | ImGuiButtonFlags_Repeat))
7959  select_dir = -1;
7960  window->DC.CursorPos = ImVec2(x + arrow_button_size.x, tab_bar->BarRect.Min.y);
7961  if (ArrowButtonEx("##>", ImGuiDir_Right, arrow_button_size, ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnClick | ImGuiButtonFlags_Repeat))
7962  select_dir = +1;
7963  PopStyleColor(2);
7964  g.IO.KeyRepeatRate = backup_repeat_rate;
7965  g.IO.KeyRepeatDelay = backup_repeat_delay;
7966 
7967  ImGuiTabItem *tab_to_scroll_to = NULL;
7968  if (select_dir != 0)
7969  if (ImGuiTabItem *tab_item = TabBarFindTabByID(tab_bar, tab_bar->SelectedTabId))
7970  {
7971  int selected_order = tab_bar->GetTabOrder(tab_item);
7972  int target_order = selected_order + select_dir;
7973 
7974  // Skip tab item buttons until another tab item is found or end is reached
7975  while (tab_to_scroll_to == NULL)
7976  {
7977  // If we are at the end of the list, still scroll to make our tab visible
7978  tab_to_scroll_to = &tab_bar->Tabs[(target_order >= 0 && target_order < tab_bar->Tabs.Size) ? target_order : selected_order];
7979 
7980  // Cross through buttons
7981  // (even if first/last item is a button, return it so we can update the scroll)
7982  if (tab_to_scroll_to->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_Button)
7983  {
7984  target_order += select_dir;
7985  selected_order += select_dir;
7986  tab_to_scroll_to = (target_order < 0 || target_order >= tab_bar->Tabs.Size) ? tab_to_scroll_to : NULL;
7987  }
7988  }
7989  }
7990  window->DC.CursorPos = backup_cursor_pos;
7991  tab_bar->BarRect.Max.x -= scrolling_buttons_width + 1.0f;
7992 
7993  return tab_to_scroll_to;
7994 }
7995 
7996 static ImGuiTabItem *ImGui::TabBarTabListPopupButton(ImGuiTabBar *tab_bar)
7997 {
7998  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
7999  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
8000 
8001  // We use g.Style.FramePadding.y to match the square ArrowButton size
8002  const float tab_list_popup_button_width = g.FontSize + g.Style.FramePadding.y;
8003  const ImVec2 backup_cursor_pos = window->DC.CursorPos;
8004  window->DC.CursorPos = ImVec2(tab_bar->BarRect.Min.x - g.Style.FramePadding.y, tab_bar->BarRect.Min.y);
8005  tab_bar->BarRect.Min.x += tab_list_popup_button_width;
8006 
8007  ImVec4 arrow_col = g.Style.Colors[ImGuiCol_Text];
8008  arrow_col.w *= 0.5f;
8009  PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_Text, arrow_col);
8010  PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_Button, ImVec4(0, 0, 0, 0));
8011  bool open = BeginCombo("##v", NULL, ImGuiComboFlags_NoPreview | ImGuiComboFlags_HeightLargest);
8012  PopStyleColor(2);
8013 
8014  ImGuiTabItem *tab_to_select = NULL;
8015  if (open)
8016  {
8017  for (int tab_n = 0; tab_n < tab_bar->Tabs.Size; tab_n++)
8018  {
8019  ImGuiTabItem *tab = &tab_bar->Tabs[tab_n];
8020  if (tab->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_Button)
8021  continue;
8022 
8023  const char *tab_name = tab_bar->GetTabName(tab);
8024  if (Selectable(tab_name, tab_bar->SelectedTabId == tab->ID))
8025  tab_to_select = tab;
8026  }
8027  EndCombo();
8028  }
8029 
8030  window->DC.CursorPos = backup_cursor_pos;
8031  return tab_to_select;
8032 }
8033 
8034 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
8035 // [SECTION] Widgets: BeginTabItem, EndTabItem, etc.
8036 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
8037 // - BeginTabItem()
8038 // - EndTabItem()
8039 // - TabItemButton()
8040 // - TabItemEx() [Internal]
8041 // - SetTabItemClosed()
8042 // - TabItemCalcSize() [Internal]
8043 // - TabItemBackground() [Internal]
8044 // - TabItemLabelAndCloseButton() [Internal]
8045 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
8046 
8047 bool ImGui::BeginTabItem(const char *label, bool *p_open, ImGuiTabItemFlags flags)
8048 {
8049  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
8050  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
8051  if (window->SkipItems)
8052  return false;
8053 
8054  ImGuiTabBar *tab_bar = g.CurrentTabBar;
8055  if (tab_bar == NULL)
8056  {
8057  IM_ASSERT_USER_ERROR(tab_bar, "Needs to be called between BeginTabBar() and EndTabBar()!");
8058  return false;
8059  }
8060  IM_ASSERT(!(flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_Button)); // BeginTabItem() Can't be used with button flags, use TabItemButton() instead!
8061 
8062  bool ret = TabItemEx(tab_bar, label, p_open, flags);
8063  if (ret && !(flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoPushId))
8064  {
8065  ImGuiTabItem *tab = &tab_bar->Tabs[tab_bar->LastTabItemIdx];
8066  PushOverrideID(tab->ID); // We already hashed 'label' so push into the ID stack directly instead of doing another hash through PushID(label)
8067  }
8068  return ret;
8069 }
8070 
8071 void ImGui::EndTabItem()
8072 {
8073  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
8074  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
8075  if (window->SkipItems)
8076  return;
8077 
8078  ImGuiTabBar *tab_bar = g.CurrentTabBar;
8079  if (tab_bar == NULL)
8080  {
8081  IM_ASSERT_USER_ERROR(tab_bar != NULL, "Needs to be called between BeginTabBar() and EndTabBar()!");
8082  return;
8083  }
8084  IM_ASSERT(tab_bar->LastTabItemIdx >= 0);
8085  ImGuiTabItem *tab = &tab_bar->Tabs[tab_bar->LastTabItemIdx];
8086  if (!(tab->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoPushId))
8087  PopID();
8088 }
8089 
8090 bool ImGui::TabItemButton(const char *label, ImGuiTabItemFlags flags)
8091 {
8092  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
8093  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
8094  if (window->SkipItems)
8095  return false;
8096 
8097  ImGuiTabBar *tab_bar = g.CurrentTabBar;
8098  if (tab_bar == NULL)
8099  {
8100  IM_ASSERT_USER_ERROR(tab_bar != NULL, "Needs to be called between BeginTabBar() and EndTabBar()!");
8101  return false;
8102  }
8103  return TabItemEx(tab_bar, label, NULL, flags | ImGuiTabItemFlags_Button | ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoReorder);
8104 }
8105 
8106 bool ImGui::TabItemEx(ImGuiTabBar *tab_bar, const char *label, bool *p_open, ImGuiTabItemFlags flags)
8107 {
8108  // Layout whole tab bar if not already done
8109  if (tab_bar->WantLayout)
8110  TabBarLayout(tab_bar);
8111 
8112  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
8113  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
8114  if (window->SkipItems)
8115  return false;
8116 
8117  const ImGuiStyle &style = g.Style;
8118  const ImGuiID id = TabBarCalcTabID(tab_bar, label);
8119 
8120  // If the user called us with *p_open == false, we early out and don't render.
8121  // We make a call to ItemAdd() so that attempts to use a contextual popup menu with an implicit ID won't use an older ID.
8122  IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ITEM_INFO(id, label, g.LastItemData.StatusFlags);
8123  if (p_open && !*p_open)
8124  {
8125  PushItemFlag(ImGuiItemFlags_NoNav | ImGuiItemFlags_NoNavDefaultFocus, true);
8126  ItemAdd(ImRect(), id);
8127  PopItemFlag();
8128  return false;
8129  }
8130 
8131  IM_ASSERT(!p_open || !(flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_Button));
8132  IM_ASSERT((flags & (ImGuiTabItemFlags_Leading | ImGuiTabItemFlags_Trailing)) != (ImGuiTabItemFlags_Leading | ImGuiTabItemFlags_Trailing)); // Can't use both Leading and Trailing
8133 
8134  // Store into ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoCloseButton, also honor ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoCloseButton passed by user (although not documented)
8135  if (flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoCloseButton)
8136  p_open = NULL;
8137  else if (p_open == NULL)
8138  flags |= ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoCloseButton;
8139 
8140  // Calculate tab contents size
8141  ImVec2 size = TabItemCalcSize(label, p_open != NULL);
8142 
8143  // Acquire tab data
8144  ImGuiTabItem *tab = TabBarFindTabByID(tab_bar, id);
8145  bool tab_is_new = false;
8146  if (tab == NULL)
8147  {
8148  tab_bar->Tabs.push_back(ImGuiTabItem());
8149  tab = &tab_bar->Tabs.back();
8150  tab->ID = id;
8151  tab->Width = size.x;
8152  tab_bar->TabsAddedNew = true;
8153  tab_is_new = true;
8154  }
8155  tab_bar->LastTabItemIdx = (ImS16)tab_bar->Tabs.index_from_ptr(tab);
8156  tab->ContentWidth = size.x;
8157  tab->BeginOrder = tab_bar->TabsActiveCount++;
8158 
8159  const bool tab_bar_appearing = (tab_bar->PrevFrameVisible + 1 < g.FrameCount);
8160  const bool tab_bar_focused = (tab_bar->Flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_IsFocused) != 0;
8161  const bool tab_appearing = (tab->LastFrameVisible + 1 < g.FrameCount);
8162  const bool is_tab_button = (flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_Button) != 0;
8163  tab->LastFrameVisible = g.FrameCount;
8164  tab->Flags = flags;
8165 
8166  // Append name with zero-terminator
8167  tab->NameOffset = (ImS32)tab_bar->TabsNames.size();
8168  tab_bar->TabsNames.append(label, label + strlen(label) + 1);
8169 
8170  // Update selected tab
8171  if (tab_appearing && (tab_bar->Flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_AutoSelectNewTabs) && tab_bar->NextSelectedTabId == 0)
8172  if (!tab_bar_appearing || tab_bar->SelectedTabId == 0)
8173  if (!is_tab_button)
8174  tab_bar->NextSelectedTabId = id; // New tabs gets activated
8175  if ((flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_SetSelected) && (tab_bar->SelectedTabId != id)) // SetSelected can only be passed on explicit tab bar
8176  if (!is_tab_button)
8177  tab_bar->NextSelectedTabId = id;
8178 
8179  // Lock visibility
8180  // (Note: tab_contents_visible != tab_selected... because CTRL+TAB operations may preview some tabs without selecting them!)
8181  bool tab_contents_visible = (tab_bar->VisibleTabId == id);
8182  if (tab_contents_visible)
8183  tab_bar->VisibleTabWasSubmitted = true;
8184 
8185  // On the very first frame of a tab bar we let first tab contents be visible to minimize appearing glitches
8186  if (!tab_contents_visible && tab_bar->SelectedTabId == 0 && tab_bar_appearing)
8187  if (tab_bar->Tabs.Size == 1 && !(tab_bar->Flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_AutoSelectNewTabs))
8188  tab_contents_visible = true;
8189 
8190  // Note that tab_is_new is not necessarily the same as tab_appearing! When a tab bar stops being submitted
8191  // and then gets submitted again, the tabs will have 'tab_appearing=true' but 'tab_is_new=false'.
8192  if (tab_appearing && (!tab_bar_appearing || tab_is_new))
8193  {
8194  PushItemFlag(ImGuiItemFlags_NoNav | ImGuiItemFlags_NoNavDefaultFocus, true);
8195  ItemAdd(ImRect(), id);
8196  PopItemFlag();
8197  if (is_tab_button)
8198  return false;
8199  return tab_contents_visible;
8200  }
8201 
8202  if (tab_bar->SelectedTabId == id)
8203  tab->LastFrameSelected = g.FrameCount;
8204 
8205  // Backup current layout position
8206  const ImVec2 backup_main_cursor_pos = window->DC.CursorPos;
8207 
8208  // Layout
8209  const bool is_central_section = (tab->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_SectionMask_) == 0;
8210  size.x = tab->Width;
8211  if (is_central_section)
8212  window->DC.CursorPos = tab_bar->BarRect.Min + ImVec2(IM_FLOOR(tab->Offset - tab_bar->ScrollingAnim), 0.0f);
8213  else
8214  window->DC.CursorPos = tab_bar->BarRect.Min + ImVec2(tab->Offset, 0.0f);
8215  ImVec2 pos = window->DC.CursorPos;
8216  ImRect bb(pos, pos + size);
8217 
8218  // We don't have CPU clipping primitives to clip the CloseButton (until it becomes a texture), so need to add an extra draw call (temporary in the case of vertical animation)
8219  const bool want_clip_rect = is_central_section && (bb.Min.x < tab_bar->ScrollingRectMinX || bb.Max.x > tab_bar->ScrollingRectMaxX);
8220  if (want_clip_rect)
8221  PushClipRect(ImVec2(ImMax(bb.Min.x, tab_bar->ScrollingRectMinX), bb.Min.y - 1), ImVec2(tab_bar->ScrollingRectMaxX, bb.Max.y), true);
8222 
8223  ImVec2 backup_cursor_max_pos = window->DC.CursorMaxPos;
8224  ItemSize(bb.GetSize(), style.FramePadding.y);
8225  window->DC.CursorMaxPos = backup_cursor_max_pos;
8226 
8227  if (!ItemAdd(bb, id))
8228  {
8229  if (want_clip_rect)
8230  PopClipRect();
8231  window->DC.CursorPos = backup_main_cursor_pos;
8232  return tab_contents_visible;
8233  }
8234 
8235  // Click to Select a tab
8236  ImGuiButtonFlags button_flags = ((is_tab_button ? ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnClickRelease : ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnClick) | ImGuiButtonFlags_AllowItemOverlap);
8237  if (g.DragDropActive)
8238  button_flags |= ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnDragDropHold;
8239  bool hovered, held;
8240  bool pressed = ButtonBehavior(bb, id, &hovered, &held, button_flags);
8241  if (pressed && !is_tab_button)
8242  tab_bar->NextSelectedTabId = id;
8243 
8244  // Allow the close button to overlap unless we are dragging (in which case we don't want any overlapping tabs to be hovered)
8245  if (g.ActiveId != id)
8246  SetItemAllowOverlap();
8247 
8248  // Drag and drop: re-order tabs
8249  if (held && !tab_appearing && IsMouseDragging(0))
8250  {
8251  if (!g.DragDropActive && (tab_bar->Flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_Reorderable))
8252  {
8253  // While moving a tab it will jump on the other side of the mouse, so we also test for MouseDelta.x
8254  if (g.IO.MouseDelta.x < 0.0f && g.IO.MousePos.x < bb.Min.x)
8255  {
8256  TabBarQueueReorderFromMousePos(tab_bar, tab, g.IO.MousePos);
8257  }
8258  else if (g.IO.MouseDelta.x > 0.0f && g.IO.MousePos.x > bb.Max.x)
8259  {
8260  TabBarQueueReorderFromMousePos(tab_bar, tab, g.IO.MousePos);
8261  }
8262  }
8263  }
8264 
8265 #if 0
8266  if (hovered && g.HoveredIdNotActiveTimer > TOOLTIP_DELAY && bb.GetWidth() < tab->ContentWidth)
8267  {
8268  // Enlarge tab display when hovering
8269  bb.Max.x = bb.Min.x + IM_FLOOR(ImLerp(bb.GetWidth(), tab->ContentWidth, ImSaturate((g.HoveredIdNotActiveTimer - 0.40f) * 6.0f)));
8270  display_draw_list = GetForegroundDrawList(window);
8271  TabItemBackground(display_draw_list, bb, flags, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_TitleBgActive));
8272  }
8273 #endif
8274 
8275  // Render tab shape
8276  ImDrawList *display_draw_list = window->DrawList;
8277  const ImU32 tab_col = GetColorU32((held || hovered) ? ImGuiCol_TabHovered : tab_contents_visible ? (tab_bar_focused ? ImGuiCol_TabActive : ImGuiCol_TabUnfocusedActive) : (tab_bar_focused ? ImGuiCol_Tab : ImGuiCol_TabUnfocused));
8278  TabItemBackground(display_draw_list, bb, flags, tab_col);
8279  RenderNavHighlight(bb, id);
8280 
8281  // Select with right mouse button. This is so the common idiom for context menu automatically highlight the current widget.
8282  const bool hovered_unblocked = IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup);
8283  if (hovered_unblocked && (IsMouseClicked(1) || IsMouseReleased(1)))
8284  if (!is_tab_button)
8285  tab_bar->NextSelectedTabId = id;
8286 
8287  if (tab_bar->Flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_NoCloseWithMiddleMouseButton)
8288  flags |= ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoCloseWithMiddleMouseButton;
8289 
8290  // Render tab label, process close button
8291  const ImGuiID close_button_id = p_open ? GetIDWithSeed("#CLOSE", NULL, id) : 0;
8292  bool just_closed;
8293  bool text_clipped;
8294  TabItemLabelAndCloseButton(display_draw_list, bb, flags, tab_bar->FramePadding, label, id, close_button_id, tab_contents_visible, &just_closed, &text_clipped);
8295  if (just_closed && p_open != NULL)
8296  {
8297  *p_open = false;
8298  TabBarCloseTab(tab_bar, tab);
8299  }
8300 
8301  // Restore main window position so user can draw there
8302  if (want_clip_rect)
8303  PopClipRect();
8304  window->DC.CursorPos = backup_main_cursor_pos;
8305 
8306  // Tooltip
8307  // (Won't work over the close button because ItemOverlap systems messes up with HoveredIdTimer-> seems ok)
8308  // (We test IsItemHovered() to discard e.g. when another item is active or drag and drop over the tab bar, which g.HoveredId ignores)
8309  // FIXME: This is a mess.
8310  // FIXME: We may want disabled tab to still display the tooltip?
8311  if (text_clipped && g.HoveredId == id && !held && g.HoveredIdNotActiveTimer > g.TooltipSlowDelay && IsItemHovered())
8312  if (!(tab_bar->Flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_NoTooltip) && !(tab->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoTooltip))
8313  SetTooltip("%.*s", (int)(FindRenderedTextEnd(label) - label), label);
8314 
8315  IM_ASSERT(!is_tab_button || !(tab_bar->SelectedTabId == tab->ID && is_tab_button)); // TabItemButton should not be selected
8316  if (is_tab_button)
8317  return pressed;
8318  return tab_contents_visible;
8319 }
8320 
8321 // [Public] This is call is 100% optional but it allows to remove some one-frame glitches when a tab has been unexpectedly removed.
8322 // To use it to need to call the function SetTabItemClosed() between BeginTabBar() and EndTabBar().
8323 // Tabs closed by the close button will automatically be flagged to avoid this issue.
8324 void ImGui::SetTabItemClosed(const char *label)
8325 {
8326  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
8327  bool is_within_manual_tab_bar = g.CurrentTabBar && !(g.CurrentTabBar->Flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_DockNode);
8328  if (is_within_manual_tab_bar)
8329  {
8330  ImGuiTabBar *tab_bar = g.CurrentTabBar;
8331  ImGuiID tab_id = TabBarCalcTabID(tab_bar, label);
8332  if (ImGuiTabItem *tab = TabBarFindTabByID(tab_bar, tab_id))
8333  tab->WantClose = true; // Will be processed by next call to TabBarLayout()
8334  }
8335 }
8336 
8337 ImVec2 ImGui::TabItemCalcSize(const char *label, bool has_close_button)
8338 {
8339  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
8340  ImVec2 label_size = CalcTextSize(label, NULL, true);
8341  ImVec2 size = ImVec2(label_size.x + g.Style.FramePadding.x, label_size.y + g.Style.FramePadding.y * 2.0f);
8342  if (has_close_button)
8343  size.x += g.Style.FramePadding.x + (g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x + g.FontSize); // We use Y intentionally to fit the close button circle.
8344  else
8345  size.x += g.Style.FramePadding.x + 1.0f;
8346  return ImVec2(ImMin(size.x, TabBarCalcMaxTabWidth()), size.y);
8347 }
8348 
8349 void ImGui::TabItemBackground(ImDrawList *draw_list, const ImRect &bb, ImGuiTabItemFlags flags, ImU32 col)
8350 {
8351  // While rendering tabs, we trim 1 pixel off the top of our bounding box so they can fit within a regular frame height while looking "detached" from it.
8352  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
8353  const float width = bb.GetWidth();
8354  IM_UNUSED(flags);
8355  IM_ASSERT(width > 0.0f);
8356  const float rounding = ImMax(0.0f, ImMin((flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_Button) ? g.Style.FrameRounding : g.Style.TabRounding, width * 0.5f - 1.0f));
8357  const float y1 = bb.Min.y + 1.0f;
8358  const float y2 = bb.Max.y - 1.0f;
8359  draw_list->PathLineTo(ImVec2(bb.Min.x, y2));
8360  draw_list->PathArcToFast(ImVec2(bb.Min.x + rounding, y1 + rounding), rounding, 6, 9);
8361  draw_list->PathArcToFast(ImVec2(bb.Max.x - rounding, y1 + rounding), rounding, 9, 12);
8362  draw_list->PathLineTo(ImVec2(bb.Max.x, y2));
8363  draw_list->PathFillConvex(col);
8364  if (g.Style.TabBorderSize > 0.0f)
8365  {
8366  draw_list->PathLineTo(ImVec2(bb.Min.x + 0.5f, y2));
8367  draw_list->PathArcToFast(ImVec2(bb.Min.x + rounding + 0.5f, y1 + rounding + 0.5f), rounding, 6, 9);
8368  draw_list->PathArcToFast(ImVec2(bb.Max.x - rounding - 0.5f, y1 + rounding + 0.5f), rounding, 9, 12);
8369  draw_list->PathLineTo(ImVec2(bb.Max.x - 0.5f, y2));
8370  draw_list->PathStroke(GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Border), 0, g.Style.TabBorderSize);
8371  }
8372 }
8373 
8374 // Render text label (with custom clipping) + Unsaved Document marker + Close Button logic
8375 // We tend to lock style.FramePadding for a given tab-bar, hence the 'frame_padding' parameter.
8376 void ImGui::TabItemLabelAndCloseButton(ImDrawList *draw_list, const ImRect &bb, ImGuiTabItemFlags flags, ImVec2 frame_padding, const char *label, ImGuiID tab_id, ImGuiID close_button_id, bool is_contents_visible, bool *out_just_closed, bool *out_text_clipped)
8377 {
8378  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
8379  ImVec2 label_size = CalcTextSize(label, NULL, true);
8380 
8381  if (out_just_closed)
8382  *out_just_closed = false;
8383  if (out_text_clipped)
8384  *out_text_clipped = false;
8385 
8386  if (bb.GetWidth() <= 1.0f)
8387  return;
8388 
8389  // In Style V2 we'll have full override of all colors per state (e.g. focused, selected)
8390  // But right now if you want to alter text color of tabs this is what you need to do.
8391 #if 0
8392  const float backup_alpha = g.Style.Alpha;
8393  if (!is_contents_visible)
8394  g.Style.Alpha *= 0.7f;
8395 #endif
8396 
8397  // Render text label (with clipping + alpha gradient) + unsaved marker
8398  ImRect text_pixel_clip_bb(bb.Min.x + frame_padding.x, bb.Min.y + frame_padding.y, bb.Max.x - frame_padding.x, bb.Max.y);
8399  ImRect text_ellipsis_clip_bb = text_pixel_clip_bb;
8400 
8401  // Return clipped state ignoring the close button
8402  if (out_text_clipped)
8403  {
8404  *out_text_clipped = (text_ellipsis_clip_bb.Min.x + label_size.x) > text_pixel_clip_bb.Max.x;
8405  //draw_list->AddCircle(text_ellipsis_clip_bb.Min, 3.0f, *out_text_clipped ? IM_COL32(255, 0, 0, 255) : IM_COL32(0, 255, 0, 255));
8406  }
8407 
8408  const float button_sz = g.FontSize;
8409  const ImVec2 button_pos(ImMax(bb.Min.x, bb.Max.x - frame_padding.x * 2.0f - button_sz), bb.Min.y);
8410 
8411  // Close Button & Unsaved Marker
8412  // We are relying on a subtle and confusing distinction between 'hovered' and 'g.HoveredId' which happens because we are using ImGuiButtonFlags_AllowOverlapMode + SetItemAllowOverlap()
8413  // 'hovered' will be true when hovering the Tab but NOT when hovering the close button
8414  // 'g.HoveredId==id' will be true when hovering the Tab including when hovering the close button
8415  // 'g.ActiveId==close_button_id' will be true when we are holding on the close button, in which case both hovered booleans are false
8416  bool close_button_pressed = false;
8417  bool close_button_visible = false;
8418  if (close_button_id != 0)
8419  if (is_contents_visible || bb.GetWidth() >= ImMax(button_sz, g.Style.TabMinWidthForCloseButton))
8420  if (g.HoveredId == tab_id || g.HoveredId == close_button_id || g.ActiveId == tab_id || g.ActiveId == close_button_id)
8421  close_button_visible = true;
8422  bool unsaved_marker_visible = (flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_UnsavedDocument) != 0 && (button_pos.x + button_sz <= bb.Max.x);
8423 
8424  if (close_button_visible)
8425  {
8426  ImGuiLastItemData last_item_backup = g.LastItemData;
8427  PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_FramePadding, frame_padding);
8428  if (CloseButton(close_button_id, button_pos))
8429  close_button_pressed = true;
8430  PopStyleVar();
8431  g.LastItemData = last_item_backup;
8432 
8433  // Close with middle mouse button
8434  if (!(flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoCloseWithMiddleMouseButton) && IsMouseClicked(2))
8435  close_button_pressed = true;
8436  }
8437  else if (unsaved_marker_visible)
8438  {
8439  const ImRect bullet_bb(button_pos, button_pos + ImVec2(button_sz, button_sz) + g.Style.FramePadding * 2.0f);
8440  RenderBullet(draw_list, bullet_bb.GetCenter(), GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Text));
8441  }
8442 
8443  // This is all rather complicated
8444  // (the main idea is that because the close button only appears on hover, we don't want it to alter the ellipsis position)
8445  // FIXME: if FramePadding is noticeably large, ellipsis_max_x will be wrong here (e.g. #3497), maybe for consistency that parameter of RenderTextEllipsis() shouldn't exist..
8446  float ellipsis_max_x = close_button_visible ? text_pixel_clip_bb.Max.x : bb.Max.x - 1.0f;
8447  if (close_button_visible || unsaved_marker_visible)
8448  {
8449  text_pixel_clip_bb.Max.x -= close_button_visible ? (button_sz) : (button_sz * 0.80f);
8450  text_ellipsis_clip_bb.Max.x -= unsaved_marker_visible ? (button_sz * 0.80f) : 0.0f;
8451  ellipsis_max_x = text_pixel_clip_bb.Max.x;
8452  }
8453  RenderTextEllipsis(draw_list, text_ellipsis_clip_bb.Min, text_ellipsis_clip_bb.Max, text_pixel_clip_bb.Max.x, ellipsis_max_x, label, NULL, &label_size);
8454 
8455 #if 0
8456  if (!is_contents_visible)
8457  g.Style.Alpha = backup_alpha;
8458 #endif
8459 
8460  if (out_just_closed)
8461  *out_just_closed = close_button_pressed;
8462 }
8463 
8464 
8465 #endif // #ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE
UINT_MAX
#define UINT_MAX
Definition: Defines.h:55
KeyCode::S
@ S
enabled
GLenum GLenum GLsizei const GLuint GLboolean enabled
Definition: SDL_opengl_glext.h:2482
obj
GLhandleARB obj
Definition: SDL_opengl_glext.h:3622
offsets
GLuint GLsizei const GLuint const GLintptr * offsets
Definition: SDL_opengl_glext.h:2564
c
const GLubyte * c
Definition: SDL_opengl_glext.h:11096
scale
GLenum GLenum GLenum GLenum GLenum scale
Definition: SDL_opengl_glext.h:9378
components
GLenum GLenum GLuint components
